hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: ProsGreat location(center of Waikiki) in front of the beach, feels like a historic hotel, room was clean, quiet, comfy, nice. Beach club was nice and the breakfast was good .ConsThe price is not cheap, rooms are small and perfect for just 1 person, could hear noises from the hallway and doors shutting, the parking is not good because there is a lot of Japanese weddings and parking are full.Overall the westin is great hotel but the rooms are small and comfortable

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place is my vision of Paradise! Total first class service at the Moana. Outdoor dining. Pool and clean beach with frozen drinks from the pool bar! Hawaiian Weather. Gorgeous scenery... Diamond Head and Waikiki Beach from our outdoor balcony. Can’t wait to return. For couples or Families this has it all! Well worth the flying time.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After reading reviews that were all over the place, we eventually trusted our travel agent who has similar tastes as ours and obtained a reservation at the Moana Surfrider. In the booking of our room some 9 months before this our first ever trip to Hawaii, a request was made for a corner room in the historic Banyan Wing. Knowing this was “the” original hotel admittedly carried a certain attractive allure. Yes, upon arrival from the airport, the entryway was crazy busy with guests, valets, bellmen, and street-walking passersby swarming about the hotel entrance. There was equal chaos leading to the check-in desk as we maneuvered our own luggage around hotel employees and other guests—with no one offering assistance. The stone-faced front desk clerk that eventually waved us forward seemed inordinately brusque—perhaps it was the end of her shift and ready to head home. Speaking very hurriedly with an obviously tired memorized greeting, she seemed annoyed by our request for clarification of one of the points she made—promptly pushing a mass produced handout toward us along with our keycard, indicating “this would answer all our questions” before briskly turning away from us to signal that was the end of our encounter. Stumbling toward an elevator, once again dragging our bags behind, we were lucky that this lift carried us to our assigned floor—crossing our fingers the entire way that our room would be acceptable. Opening the door, indeed a corner room as we had requested greeted us with a lovely beachside view draped by the landmark banyan tree. While the room was smaller than we typically are accustomed in Texas, it was certainly adequate particularly since there was room to open our luggage and still navigate the room without tripping. The flower-themed colors & decor did provide a certain Old World Hawaiian charm to the room!The double bed was comfortable and the room clean although definitely of “vintage construction”. Our bathroom was relatively small but bearably ample for our modest needs. While it quickly fogged up while taking a shower, our sleeping quarters did not seem to be particularly muggy or humid in comparison. There was a beach party outside on our first night, spirited by throbbing music with heavy bass lasting past midnight; however, with ear plugs and travel weary bodies we finally drifted off to sleep. Upon awakening the next morning as the morning sun peaked through the window shutters, my wife turned and asked me what did I think about Hawaii and the Moana Surfrider so far? My reply was simply: “This ain’t Texas!”

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We travel to Waikiki a few times a year. Always stay at the Moana Surfrider. They have the best location on the beach if you love to surf, standup paddle, snorkel or just swim in the crystal clear water. On top of all that, the staff at the pool side towel desk are the most friendly people we have ever met at any hotel. Gloria is always smiling, Moe is alway friendly and Lee is always ready to tell a joke and gives the best local restaurant recommendations any traveler could ask for. Take my advice and don’t bother looking for anywhere else to stay if you are planning a trip to Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel opened on March 11, 1901, and was the first hotel built in Waikiki. This is an hour-long free historical tour and is offered every Monday and Wednesday beginning at 11 a.m. No booking required and the meeting area is on the second-floor lobby of the Moana’s Banyan Wing.We really enjoyed this tour run by the very knowlegeable Ms Kehaulani Kam.This tour coincided with the hotel's 119th birthday. After the tour we went downstairs for the hotels birthday celebration and indulged in free champagne and cupcakes ansd a speach by the hotel manager.We also met one of the surfboard manufacturers of the original timber surfboards.Its a great free activity to do in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Dating back to 1901 this is a classy hotel very smartly presented. Right on the famous beach with a beautiful garden bar with a stunning Banyan Tree at its heart. The beach overlooks the beach offering great drinks and snacks. The restaurant is exquisite offering fabulous outside dining as well as inside.Don’t stay anywhere else!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a Bonvoy member and was upgraded to the original tower erected 1901. The first hotel in Waikiki. We loved the service and cleanliness and sheer beauty of this space. I would highly recommend this if you have to stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was an amazing hotel. I’m a bonvoy Marriott platinum member and I received an ocean view upgrade and had access to the lounge every day. The location is great. It’s right on the beach and there are a ton of restaurants and stores within walking distance. If you get hot on the beach and don’t feel like going in the ocean the pool is right there. At night after a nice dinner come back to the hotel and sit on the rocking chairs on either the front or back porch for a relaxing time. The room was a decent size and the bathroom had your standard tub/shower combo. Also the toilet seats were heated which was different. The gym was very nice for being a hotel gym. Had plenty of equipment and was a decent size. There is a $37 per day resort fee which sucks but it does come with some amenities that I didn’t really look into. The parking is also very expensive so I recommend parking at the banyan condominiums where parking is only $80 for the week. The staff were all very friendly. They were willing to help with bags and greeted me and my fiancée with Hawaiian leis which I didn’t think they did anymore but they do. I had an issue with the delivery of a specialty proposal cake (they lost my order) but the man I talked to on the phone was very apologetic and took care of the issue right away. There’s plenty of ABC stores around if you want to save a few bucks and stock up on snacks and drinks for your room.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we arrived by Uber from airport, the bell person greeted us with Lei (the Hawaiian flower necklace). Super friendly and welcoming! Front desk staff who checked us in was great. (I asked her name, but sorry I can't remember.) Warm welcome with nice smile, calm and friendly. She also gave us a voucher for free pineapple soft serve! I never had pineapple soft serve before,and it was delicious! Thank you!She also got us room upgrade with amazing Waikiki beach view to wish my happy birthday (it was my birthday trip), and the view was unreal. The hotel have the old building, which is the original, and a new building. We got the old building, which seemed out dated, and room was small with no patio, but I was aware of that it is the 'first lady' hotel with history. The location can't be any better if you want to experience the Waikiki beach. It's right at the center of the beach, and it's only few steps from your room. The provide beach towels (they charge for the resort fee, and it's part of the service I believe. Totally worth it!) So you can be at the beach day and night. We actually went out few times a day to enjoy the beach. We also had breakfast there, and it was fantastic. Everything was fresh, and staff was so friendly. The beach bar at night was great too. Live music and the ocean wave sound, great good and service. The banyan tree in the center is beautiful to look. We really enjoyed the time at this hotel, and I highly recommend! They have a great concierge desk for all tourists needs as well. Lots of shopping and food options surrounding. If you want to be in urban environment in Hawaii, and need all convenience with you, stay in Waikiki, and this beautiful hotel!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We took out one year old and three year old to this hotel for a holiday on the way through to Australia from California. My husband has platinum elite status with bonvoy so we were able to access the lounge which was open form breakfast and wine and appetizers in the evening and you could pop in for snacks and drinks during the day. It was good to have a place to take the kids when they needed a snack. Most people have noted the pool was small but it suited our needs and the beach access was invaluable with little kids. We actually managed to pick up some pool floats for the kids from the pool attendants who said that people leave them behind all the time and they are always throwing them out, another group gave us sand toys and a boogie board which we later passed to another group with kids at the end. We were upgraded to the top floor and had a partial ocean view. The room was spacious and quiet and we were able to put the 1 year old in the bathroom. There were lots of tours that could be arranged within the hotel but we decided to just enjoy the beach and took the kids to the aquarium which we could walk to from the hotel. Overall we had a great time and would go again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here before and was excited to return and so came back for our wedding and unfortunately we were slightly disappointed. Although the hotel is wonderfully situated and highly convenient in Waikiki from the moment we arrived everything was a little off - our check in staff were not great - we had a room in The Tower side of the hotel and the elevators here were never monitored to the extent that we caught a homeless man in the elevator one night and when we told the hotel they said security was very busy elsewhere! Our room smelled terribly when we arrived thankfully I had a candle and had to have housekeeping come and re-clean the room. Housekeeping was an ongoing issue and we had to ask several times for the room to be cleaned and to get turn down service they kept blaming the do not disturb sign which we hung on the door once.The beach bar is great and the position on the beach lovely, but crowded and busy and many screaming children. We ate in the dining room one night and the food was average and overpriced and there was an issue with the billing - still being resolved. Our saving grace was Shawn the concierge who was amazing and helpful and always super positive and helped us with several reservations. We ended up doing amazing trips around the island to be out of the hotelIn short, not entirely sure that this hotel is worth the expense it is charging and we found alternatives we would stay in next time

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you want old class, book a room at this hotel, or just visit. It’s old Hawaii at its finest. The decor and historical items alone are worth a visit. We spent a lovely afternoon at the Banyan Court with several relatives. While the young ones played in the sand and swam in the ocean, we sat at tables watching them, drinking Mai Tais and eating the most delicious snacks. Highly recommend

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for the 3rd time. I booked a large ocean front room in the new wing. Splurging for our anniversary! When we checked in, we were informed that we were upgraded to a suite in the old wing. It was a very nice room and overlooked the banyan tree. Great view but.......you had to listen to the loud music every night until 10:00. We're morning people so don't stay up late. Other than that, we loved the hotel and all the staff. Hey Patricia!! You made our breakfasts fun! Mahalo!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place is just gorgeous, we loved it. The outdoor area where the restaurant is so pretty with a lovely view of the beach and ocean. The service at the restaurant was exceptional and the food was very good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is big for a city hotel, located along Kalakaua Avenue and close to branded shopping and premium restaurants in Honolulu. Being beach front, guests view the ocean and just step into the biggest swimming pool in the world. The breakfast is good and the staff friendly. Hawaii being Hawaii, the hotels captures the breeze of the Pacific all round and helps the hotel to be well ventilated although the hotel is old but very well maintained.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were there for 4 nights. Right on the beach. Great to rent lounge chairs and umbrellas right out of the doorstep of the hotel. Staff were friendly and always went out of their way to see we were having a good time. Most especially, Lee at the Beach and Pool area was AWESOME not just in catering to our needs, but in getting to know us and sharing local history and information. Moe was great there as well.  In fact, almost all the staff was! Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying there at the moment, so far nothing to rave about, old and dated and smelly. Prices are ridiculous. I am very concerned about paying the ludicrous resort fee, I don't need wi fi, have my own bottled water, don't do yoga or have children basically haven't used 1 item in the resort fee at all.I'm hoping this will be waived at the end of our stay.Hotel is also very noisy and staff are not friendly.. We stay in Marriott's all over Asia and can not speak more highly of them compared to here.Extremely disappointed to say the least.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It does not get any better than this beautiful hotel. The setting is spectacular.Our visit was significantly upgraded by Lee who was part of the pool staff. Lee went out of his way to make us feel welcome and to find lounge chairs and a cabana.Views are fantastic, but you can only get this type of epic personal service at the Surf Rider with Lee. Look him up and let him know that Bob sent you from Oregon. Lee offers the most person service I have seen anywhere in years.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The spa scene was crowded and chaotic with cranky employees herding groups of ladies around. It was not very relaxing. Too many people. I would wait and spend your spa money at home where your local spa is likely less crowded and way more relaxing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed at Westin hotels all over the country. This one was a HUGE disappointment!! The guy at the desk at check in wasn’t friendly, definitely did not give the “aloha” welcome we experienced at our previous hotel in Maui. The rooms are teeny, tiny postage stamps. My husband and I couldn’t even fit in the bathroom at the same time unless he got in the shower. No counter space to set anything. The hotel is old but that wasn’t the worst part. There were people EVERYWHERE! It was insanely loud in our room. Then to the beach. You pay a ridiculous amount for this hotel and then you have to pay to rent the chairs at the beach!!! There are very few chairs at the pool so if you don’t get there by 7am you won’t get a chair. We were supposed to stay 5 nights but checked out after 1 and moved to another hotel. Don’t waist your money!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very old and some of the amenities show it. The pool is tiny with no hot tub. This hotel is listed as luxury and the prices certainly are. You need to pay extra for beach chairs and line up at 7AM to get them. The air conditioning is inadequate and we needed a fan to sleep. When I asked for late check out I was told by the afternoon manager Joseph that there were 800 guests and I certainly was the least important so no to the request. n genearal I would never stay here again.
user_name:
photonutny
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Currently staying at the Moana Westin hotel, Waikiki. The location is very central, but as soon as we got into our room we found that there was still rubbish in our bin and our bathroom was not cleaned properly. I thought we would let it go and just get it cleaned tomorrow but got a shock when I got into bed and found hairs!! Really scary...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is unparalleled property in Waikiki. In fact it is the first hotel ever bill in Hawaii completed in 1901. Back then it opened with 75 rooms and it was $1.50 a night to stay there. Today there have been additions to the original structure but it is still a beautiful hotel referred to as Waikiki‘s first lady. For years and years it was a Starwood property and then Marriott Bonvoy bought Starwood. I was a big fan of Starwood not so much of a fan of Bonvoy. In fact I don’t like Bonvoy at all, even though I have almost 700 stays with what is now Marriott Bonvoy Marriott and roughly 300 at the Moana Surfrider itself. The first time I ever went to the Moana Surfrider was in 1975 when my parents took me. If you like to go to the beach @ Waikiki this is the best property to do so. It has a pool but it’s a small pool and there’s not enough seats for all the people that are staying at the hotel. Although the pool staff is very well-versed and I forget her name but she’s been there for almost 30 years and she runs a really tight ship. And there’s Nancy who makes the frozen drinks and the sandwiches I know that she has been there for about 29 years and she is a class act, pretty lady, funny with humor and very professional. Then you move on to the beach bar that is where you will find where the hard-core long-term employees are.. Peter, they main bartender has been there for at least 32 to 34 years as far as I can remember and there are several others that have been there 20 years plus & I think the least tenured bartenders has been there for eight years. TIP: There are two different mai tais available at the beach bar. One cost around $16.50 and is a wonderful mai tai don’t get me wrong. But there is a another one for $20 it has the premium liquor and will knock your socks off. What you do is you asked for the $20 mai tai minus the commemorative cup which is a plastic piece of junk anyways that you’re never going to want to keep. Declining the commemorative cup brings your cost down to $16.75 and Wala you have the best Mia tai for $.25 more but tip extra so they keep doing it. The property itself is simply a masterpiece. Do you feel like you’re in the last century and a plantation bill just for you. The rooms are incredibly appointed and the service staff leaves Notice Details on touched. Upon arrival at the valet you’ll be greeted with a flower lay and smells really nice. The valet staff is wonderful it’s simply cost to park anywhere in Waikiki it’s kind a like Manhattan New York so expect to add $40 a day to your hotel bill. Even if you parked in the public lot it would be $40So it doesn’t really matter you might as well valet. Budget a few minutes to get the car because it’s parked across the street and down the way in a multi deck parking lot tucked away so it doesn’t ruin the view. For yours and yours a gentleman and Kelly Sanders read this and for other properties are owned by Koyoa out of Japan. When Maria took over he move Don for one reason or another and there’s a new gentleman named Chad Harris I think and I left him a message that I was returning and didn’t hear back for 24 hours. But then I found out why he was off island traveling and the general manager of the Moana itself called my cell phone and told me the room that I wanted wasn’t available. He went on to say we found you a better room it’s a sweet you’re gonna like it so when you arrive just asked for the front desk manager and their recognize your name. There are 42,000 hotel rooms you could walk to you within 25 minutes of this one that I have to tell you whenever I come to Waikiki and in fact I actually live here now I always stay at the Moana Surfrider. The Bobway program sucks but the staff is incredible the property is unbeatable the views of Diamondhead and the beach in freight is the best that could be had in Waikiki which is the most iconic beach and most recognize beach in the world. I’ll post a few pictures but if you come to Hawaii stay here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider Westin was an excellent place to stay in Hawaii. We went for my daughter's birthday and we loved the ocean view. It was so nice to listen to the waves and watch the sun set. The restaurant's food was good along with the services provided.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the few hotels actually on the ocean. Some rooms in Banyan wing are beyond small so be careful. Restaurant on site is great and lots of doing options all around there! The hotel has chairs for rent out front which is nice and you can sign up for things like catamaran rides right there in front. Great location;) Manager is awesome at the hotel! Club guests have an entire area to themselves overlooking the beach with snacks and drinks.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The moana surf rider definitely looks like a 4 star hotel from the outside. But when you look inside its a different story. It is so run down cant believe their star rating. Elevator to their walls are so worn out. But when you go into their rooms it will shock you and make you mad at the same time. The rooms are so old and small it’s shocking. Their location is great but all surrounding hoyel has great location. It was a worst choice for our vacation. Im a gold elite Marriott member and this is worse than a courtyard. I do not recommend this hotel especially for the price they charge you

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were here for a couple days and loved it. We had one of the suites. We could not ask for a better location or facility. We will be back. The hotel staff were all friendly and very accommodating. Also, we had access to the Beach Club, which is where you can get breakfast, snacks and drinks through out the day. I highly recommend that.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic trip to Hawaii, made all the better by the excellent room on the Penthouse Floor. Views were amazing. The Bonvoy lounge was the best Marriott lounge we have experienced and the service was great.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had all the amenities you could ask for. The beach was a bit small and it is definitely a little pricey but that is to be expected in Honolulu. Over all good in every aspect but nothing mind blowing. The food was just ok in comparison to other high end place I have stayed.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Fernbizz
New York, New York, United States

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The older section is where to stay. Rooms are smaller but it’s the history and beauty. We had our wedding night there many yrs ago. Whenever we go to island we try to have a few nights here. From the Banyon trees, beautiful bars, amazing food and being right on the beach- this has everything. The high tea with exclusive Moana Surfrider tea cups and tea is a very special event. I just love sitting on the rocking chairs on the balcony wAtching the world go by- or listen to the piano player on certain nights. Check out the history and you’ll find out why it’s known as the First Lady of Waikiki

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the. Moana for 4 nights recently and had a wonderful time. We had a beautiful room with views of the Pacific as well as Diamond head on the 12th floor in the Tower Building. Our lovely balcony was quite private and you could see the entire beach and even the pool area. So fun watching the early morning surfers and just the crowds of people. Our room was well kept by the excellent housekeeping staff who were always pleasant and willing to do anything requested including delivering extra water bottles and towels. The front desk personnel were quite helpful and friendly. Our favorite staff were the fun people who ran and organized the "towel hut" and so graciously put out our towels on reserved chais loungers at the beach. Big thing to remember, reserve your chairs at least 24hours in advance. They get taken really fast!!! We visited all the hotel's restaurants and truly enjoyed all with the exception of the he Beach House which we had hoped would be a lovely dinner. Unfortunately, it was poor!!! Service was just okay. The food was rather mediocre for the price especially. However, highly recommend all the others. The Beach Bar is a lively place all day and evening long.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Waikiki is a tourist destination so keep that in mind when you book any hotel here. It is a very busy area with a ton of high end shopping and restaurants. Music, loud voices and sirens are heard throughout the day and into the night. Many restaurants keep the music loud so you don’t linger. As for the hotel, it was lovely, clean and comfortable. The room was the typical layout and amenities- nothing special but comfortable. I requested a room with a view and was not disappointed with a spectacular view of diamond head. Staff was pleasant but in general did not go out of their way to help. The pool area was small and very busy as was the beach. I rented a chair and umbrella for the day at $65 which was very pricey. The spot my chair was located in was a walkway where people were walking on me all day. In hindsight I should have taken the beech towel and sat on the sand! One last comment, I am from the east coast so I woke early. There is no place to get a cup of coffee before 6 am unless you make it in your room which I will not use those coffee makers. I will be returning in two weeks and will be staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at the Moana Surfrider for 5 nights. The hotel is nice as we stayed in the partial ocean view in the tower. The older part of hotel is beautiful and has a lot of character. The staff was pleasant. That is where it ends. We paid $460 per night including all taxes, fees and resort fee (lol). Resort fee should just be included in your stay. Resort fee is a big joke. Plus, we had to pay $65 per day for our beach umbrella and two lounge chairs. Our party of 8 had to stare at a lady smoking crack, sun bathing and talking to herself just in front of us. We were in the the roped off area but very close to the public beach. This was followed by another homeless lady digging through trash and eating what she thought was still good. It made me want to vomit. We didn't have to for this but then how do you block the sun. The pool area is built for a small hotel and seating is free. Good Luck finding a seat. First time we have been to Hawaii and I think it will be the last. Overpriced and not relaxing. I had visions of Hawaii like you may see in the movies but it is nothing like I thought it would be.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Lovely view, great food but rather noisy by the area of double doors into another type of Room. On our second visit we sat at some bar tables which had the same menu and was much better. Pianist was near and we could actually enjoy the music. We asked for a white tablecloth and it was provided.....waiter was excellent and attentive, food and view was good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The over hundred years old Banyan tree(Ficus bengalensis), which came from India in late 1800, is a majestic grand tree providing a unparalleled canopy of shade and comfort over the swimming pool leadind to the beach! The Victorian architecture, the huge lobby, the rocking chairs in the front verenda and inside courtyard, evening performance, all add to the majesty of this iconic hotel! Yes, we will return in 2021!.One of their strong points is their customer service, they are absolutely top notch, polite, friendly, competent!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you enjoy historical architecture, then plan a lovely brunch under the famous banyan tree where Mark Twain would pen his wordy articles for mainland newspapers. When you first enter the Moana Surfrider, you give a big exhale. That is stress leaving your body. This magical place is celebrating 119 years of greeting and housing guests. There is plenty of old elegance around but you get the warm feeling that everyone is welcome here.The front facade is Waikiki busy, but there must be an invisible line on the threshold because the "busy" quickly fades once inside the airy hallways heading to the oceanside and famous restaurant. The menu has something for everyone and the service is genteel, never rushed. Moana is a grand lady. Long may she reign.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’m a Titanium Elite member which means I travel and stay a lot at Westin’s. I usually don’t write negative reviews preferring to discuss my concerns with management but not for this horrible experience. I checked in and was given the noisiest of possible rooms without warning. When I went back to the front desk to ask for a new room I was literally laughed at by the front desk clerks who advised me when I asked why I wasn’t told about the room he said “I don’t sleep in every room” and then his colleague next to him openly laughed and mocked me. I figured there was no point in speaking to a manager because these guys were probably trained by that manager who themselves were trained by ownership and crap flows downhill. I promptly checked out and moved to another hotel for the rest of my stay. Wow... never in my life.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hello everyone You guys must wonder why such a beautiful hotel and I only gave 3 stars ? Firstly the building has attracted me that’s why I chose to stay here this time. Checking in was ok but we have to wait for the room till 3 pm which I understand Inside was old and the minutes I walked into our room I went Omg the room so old , furniture ugly and old we have book the bigger room which has 3beds and one rolled bed , but just 1 bedside table which is another disappointing. Then I walk into the bathroom I immediately want to checked out but room already been paid too bad nothing much I can do . Bathroom was tiny. And the bath room door stupid enough is to open out so we have to used at least 3 floor mat a day or even use towel to clean water . Basin was so small can’t even fit all our make up . No tooth brush , no shower cap , no sleeper in room , no body wash .. OMG it’s worth than 4 stars and we paid like $1.100 aud + $40usd service fees and plus tax per night you will have to settle the bills with a lot of extra so be ready for that. Also be aware of booked room for 3 read careful because they will change you $125 usd per person which has never happened to me in any other hotel . When I booked 3 mean I already paid for 3 but with Moana you will have to be extra caution In room dinning nothing really great either. Every time we went out we don’t want to go back to our room because we don’t feel the comfortable of 5 stars hotel at all.. We won’t comeback to this hotel again The only reason I stayed this time just the location , excellent location that’s is all I like. Service in general wasn’t great if compare to most 5 stars I have been This review I wrote based on a very experienced traveller and I always stayed in good hotel , Moana is one of the worse on my list. The same amount $1100 aud i spent I could get a much better 5 stars anywhere around the world. So I won’t recommended if you like beautiful room and a clean beautiful bathroom this hotel only can provide you the building itself and location that’s all , sorry no in room photos because it nothing there for us to even take a photo ! Room are Bad Service very average

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved our time at the Moana Surfrider! Reception staff was quick, friendly and efficient. The location was perfect - in the center of everything and right on Waikiki beach.The old building has such a charm to it and the rooms are renovated and well maintained. Housekeeping did an extraordinary job daily and ensured not a speck of sand was left. The complimentary dole whip for Bonvoy members is a nice touch. Rocking chairs were a neat place to people watch.The hospitality room is such an amazing idea. We had to check out and and had a very late flight, but we could still go swimming and enjoy our last day on the beach since we were provided with the hospitality room to freshen up after! Amazing!!My only minor complaint was that we booked for a king bedded room but was given a handicap room with a queen bed. Would definitely return!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in a Tower Suite at the Moana Surfrider for 3 nights. I got in around 11pm on 01/31. I went to bed immediately… around an hour into my sleep, I can feeling something crawling on my face and in my ear. I turn the lights on and discover the bed is covered in tiny centipede-like bugs. Could it be bed bugs?. Anyway I killed most of them. The next day I went to talk to the representative at the front desk, he told me that it’s definitely not bedbugs but if I wanted a different room, it would be an additional charge of $100 for the Premiere suite. I said I’d tough it out. When I was checking out two days later, I was not happy. Again had these bed bugs all over me at night. I should pictures at the front desk. The representative went to the back to speak to her manager, she came back and told me that these are not bedbugs, but TERMITES and I don’t need to worry. I paid $800 A NIGNT for this room and they offered to waive the $37 resort fee which is in addition to the $800 for my inconvenience with the termites. Also room was very noisy. I usually stay at the Outrigger Waikiki Beach Resort and the room is way better insulated because it is quieter. In summary, I paid more than $800 a night to stay in a room filled with inspects/bed bugs/termites whatever you want to call it. In return, my “resort fee” of $37 was waived. The resort fee includes two bottles of water.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel lovely location right on the beach close to all the shops and markets. Staff was great especially the beach staff manning the towel and cabana booth Special thanks to Lee who was incredibly helpful Rick k

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, good food & wonderful spa experience. This was a family vacation with my husband, our kids, our nephew and my mother-in-law, it was an all around wonderful time. The service at the restaurant was really good, the breakfast fried rice was my favorite. Our spa experience was excellent, my masseuse Eva was AMAZING, when my massage was over I gave her the biggest hug! My husband, our daughter & my mother-in-law all got massages & loved their massages as well, my husband said his was the best massage he’s had. Our son & nephew got pedicures and enjoyed them as well. We had a room at the PH level & the rest of our family had rooms on floor 15. I wish I had pictures of the rooms to post but I guess I didn’t take any. Our bathroom in our room was so nice. The Japanese style toilets in each bathroom was an added bonus. We would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic Hotel Just a wonderful buildingSay in Banyan NOT the newer buildings The old lady of WaikikiThe Bar staff are just fantastic Conceriege guys so helpfulSadly let down by unhelpful Front Desk staff ....and "now" do not let you book for the next year - Just dismiissiveSadly let down a little by unhelpful front desk staff and "now" do not let you re- book for the next Year

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 나는 남편과 함께 하와이로 신혼여행을 갔다. 그리고 모아나 서프라이더 호텔에서 묵기로 했다. 왜냐면 이 곳은 하와이에서 가장 역사가 오래된 의미있는 호텔이었고, 고급 호텔 중 하나였기 때문이다.그래서 난 서비스 또한 편안하고 안락한 서비스를 제공할 것이라 생각했다.그런데 호텔은 생각보다 많이 낡아서 이 호텔을 가자고 한 것이 미안할 정도였다. 나름 개보수를 했지만, 한국의 5성급 호텔과 비교하면 형편이 없었다.욕실도 샤워커튼을 반드시 쳐야만 이용가능했다. 샤워커튼을 치지 않으면 바닥전체가 온통 물에 잠길 것이다.오션프론트뷰라 바다옆이어서 파도소리가 큰데, 베란다 창이 방음을 전혀 하지 못해서 자는 데에 불편했다.가장 최악은 호텔 측의 태도였다.우리는 이 곳에서 조식을 모두 먹는 것으로 예약하고 요금을 지불했으나, 호텔측은 조식쿠폰을 주지 않았고, 내가 조식쿠폰이 누락되었다고 말했을 때에도 내게 사과를 하지 않았다. 호텔측이 실수했다고 지적했음에도 아랑곳하지 않은 직원의 태도에 이 곳이 하와이에서 고급호텔이 과연 맞는 건가 의심이 될 정도였다.다음에 하와이를 방문하면 절대 이 호텔에 머물지 않을 것이다.I paid for the hotel room including breakfast, but the hotel staff didn't give me breakfast coupons. I pointed out the mistake by the hotel. However, he did NOT apologize to me. I was so upset. I thought the Moana Surfrider hotel was a luxury hotel in the past. Now, it's no big deal!The hotel staff seems to be very less trained.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The only positive to this hotel is the location. When we first arrived we thought the lovely lobby gave us a taste of what our room would be like, boy were we wrong.When we checked in at 4pm, we were advised house cleaning were running late and our room wasn't ready. Not what you want to hear when you have been awake and travelling since 11pm the night before. We were then advised we were in a double room, even though we booked a partial ocean view king room. We couldn't change it as there were no king rooms left.We were told to walk around and they would call us when the room was ready. That was the last thing I wanted to do, so I just said we would get something to eat at the overpriced restaurant. After half an hour we got the call to say our room was ready and the lady kindly brought our bags out to us. We then went up to our room on the 20 floor and our partial ocean view really was just that as most of the view was of the huge air con unit on top of the hotel next door.I don't know why the cleaning staff were behind as our room didn't even look clean. There was dust on the skirting boards and the mirror had tooth paste all over it. You could see the joins in the wallpaper, as it was coming away from the walls and the carpet and chair upholstery was dirty, faded and worn.The bathroom was TINY and I expected a four star hotel to have a separate bath and shower, not a tiny shub. The bathroom vanity had no space to put your toiletries etc. The paint appeared to be flaking off the ceiling in the bathroom. This is probably due to the lack of ventilation and absence of an extractor fan, when using the shower. Bizarrely the closet is in the bathroom with no extractor fan and has no doors. Needless to say I didn't keep any clothes in here as they would get damp and possibly mouldy.To top this all off our room backed into the lifts and it was so noisey. After 20 minutes, we had both had enough and phoned and asked to be moved. I honestly do not know how the hotel expects people to sleep in that room with all that noise.The next room we were moved to was exactly the same as the first,minus the noise from the lift and we no longer had a view of the air con unit. Neither room had a book outlining services offered and telling you about the hotel.The pool is tiny and there are no where near enough chairs next to the pool or in the bar area for the amount of guests. The beach out front is crowded and you have to go a way down to get a bit of beach to yourself. The beach towel thing was weird. You could get beach towels but if you didn't return them, they would charge you $10. However no one takes your room number when you get the towels, so how they police this is beyond me.Lastly my biggest bug bear is the exorbitant resort fee. I must have read the a4 sheet outlining what it covers and I still don't see that you get anything extra at Moana Surfrider that you don't get at hotels without a resort fee.After speaking with other people it sounds like most of the accommodation in Waikiki is rubbish and really expensive, so it would explain why Moana Surfrider is so sub par and they don't appear to be in any hurry to address it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in Double Historic Banyan Room, Room Only for 3 nights. Room had good facilities but had no view. Loved the rocking chairs facing the sea and the street. Location was perfect very close to the beach with a great view of Diamond Head and close to the restaurants in the area. Hotel has lovely character but very busy so not a quiet stay. Didn't try the restaurants as so many other great options nearby.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Returned after 29 years, honeymooned on this beautiful property back then and now I brought my 2 adult children with us. Booked an Ocean front room that did not disappoint! The lull of the waves made for a very pleasant sleep. The room was not grand but it was immaculate. There were 2 rocking chairs facing the beautiful waters of Waikiki. The only downside was the very tiny bathroom, no real vanity , the water pressure on the rain shower was good. Be prepared, the food and beverage is expensive, more so than 29 years ago. There is ample food and restaurants outside the hotel. There are also several trolleys that can be taken just right outside the hotel for a nominal fee. The afternoon and evening performers were actually very good! One of them was Bruno Mars' uncle, he resembled Bruno in voice and appearance, very nice guy -Johnny Valentine. There are activities throughout the week and don't forget to explore the 2nd floor beyond the majestic staircase. There is a mini museum dedicated to the hotel. Exercise room was a nice size with good equipment, they also had 2 Pelotan bikes but they were always occupied. Daily morning yoga was complimentary and they were good with the exception of one elderly instructor.Downside: Most staff was very pleasant and helpful especially the housekeepers and Ken, the wait staff at the Veranda. He was an incredibly hard worker. He was running back and forth servicing everyone all night long. There was only 2 staff members that were unpleasant:I had a very rude and temperamental older yoga instructor. She pointed her finger at me when she didn't like my pose and snipped at me that I should take Yoga 101. There was no skill level posted on the hotel activity schedule for this class. Her lack of Namaste was appalling as well as her ignorance regarding customer service.The second staff that was unfortunately unengaged in her duties was a young woman manning the concierge desk. She looked welcoming, with her hair swept up in a bun with a flower; however she was not. I had spoken with her several times and the last encounter, she crossed her arms as if she was to say "now what do you want"? She begrudgingly gave me a bus map of Waikiki and told me "FYI these are the last ones I have left". I bit my tongue, I wanted to say to her "well figured it out and get more, that's your job". By the way these are the same folks that sold my family a tour of the island to the Macadamia nut factory and the Dole plantation for a total of $390. If you are looking for a bit of history, do not purchase. The tour company basically unloads the bus to these places directly to the gift shop, there's nothing historical about it.It is a beautiful property. Just prepare yourself for some sticker shock. I did rent an umbrella with 2 chairs for $65 day. Another guest went to the local target and purchased a beach umbrella for $21 since she was going to be here for a week. The beach is public so she just used the umbrella on the beach-brilliant!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I obtained a package deal on Hawaiian Airlines that basically resulted in a free flight. My larger room with a city vIew, and king bed was $400/night inc airfare. Normally the room by itself is $400/night. The Moana is the oldest hotel in Waikīkī, opening its doors in 1901. Its on the beach and across from the International Market Place (Kalakaua side).Positives: National Landmark hotel located right on the beach with a great view of Diamond Head. Big room and nice view from the lanai; Toto washlet w/ remote control; Quiet room; Harry, Peter, Marnie, Clayton & Sean the bartenders at the Beach Bar showed a lot of aloha. I love this bar bc of guys like this; Friendly staff;Negatives: Small TV; You don't need your card key to access your floor at night; Closet is in the bathroom. There is enuf room for an armoire; Shower looks like one you would find in a cheap hotel; No mouthwash; Hard to get a chair or cabana, despite paying a $37 resort fee daily. They should do 1/2 day rentals to discourage peeps from hogging the foregoing all day, and only using for a couple of hours; I ordered calamari at the Beach Bar, and it took almost one hour to arrive despite Harry asking where my food was. A Mgr took over and my food arrived, but it was lukewarm;Despite some negatives, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The Moana is emblematic of the Aloha spirit. I felt like a mō'ī (king) here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I spent a few days at the Moana Surfrider in January 2020. It is a historic hotel right on Waikiki Beach and the location is perfect. It is really the best location on Waikiki Beach and is only meters from the water. It is also just steps from restaurants, shopping and entertainment in the Waikiki district. The history at this hotel is magnificent. It has great character but it is very busy and it will not be a quiet peaceful stay. They have a wonderful veranda in the front and back with large chairs to watch the world go round. The restaurants are good but not great. The staff don’t really know the menu and couldn’t tell us what items were gluten free. We were actually told that the chef didn’t know if the bacon was gluten free or not. I would be highly surprised if that actually was the case.We stayed in the old Banyan Wing. Rooms are small in this section and there are no balconies but they are 100 years old and filled with character. We knew what we were getting and decided to stay in the smaller rooms.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has history and I thought it is good to stay here. Therefore, I was expecting that the room is old but it was more worse than exception. The room smelled like mold and the wall was very thin. We could hear the conversation clearly from next room. I could handle with the environment. However, The worst thing is staff. Everyone is unfriendly and no one asks us to help luggage when we checked out. Also, Housekeeping staff open our room key and came in before checking out (9 A.M.) and no apologies. The staff quality is below 3 star hotel and Uber driver is more helpful than this hotel staff. 今まで宿泊したSPGホテルで一番最悪のホテルでした。ダイアモンドヘッド側の塔に泊まったのですがカビ臭く１泊なので耐えましたが連泊は厳しいような環境でした。また、スタッフの対応はとても悪くUBERのドライバーの方が対応が親切です。

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a pleasant afternoon we had today.....enjoying the food, the view and the exceptional service at Westin Moana in Waikiki!!! High tea is served daily between 11:30 -14:30. I would recommend making a reservation and kindly ask for a table closest to the beach as you can admire the spectacular scenery on Waikiki beach.Definitely a special outing if you enjoy the traditional particulars of high tea.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is one of my favorite hotels in Waikiki. It’s a beautiful plantation style hotel and the oldest hotel in Waikiki built in 1901. The location is in the heart of Waikiki on the beach which can’t be beat. Marriot Platinum members do get use of the Club Lounge and the spa. Breakfast and Happy Hour are served in the Club lounge which is right on the beach. The spa is beautiful and it also overlooks Waikiki beach. Unfortunately there are a few negatives which soured my stay as a Marriot Platinum member.The worst thing is the front desk. There is usually a line for Marriot elite members and sometimes there is nobody to help and at the most there is only one elite check-in person. If you have any questions, you inevitably wait. At check-in, I was“upgraded” to a room with no view from the room, only a partial side ocean view from the lanai. I changed rooms to a Diamond Tower ocean view and it was much better. Also at check-in, I was never asked if I wanted the measly 1,000 points (worth about $6) or a local gift. I had to go back and ask for it.There is no more restaurant breakfast for Platinum members. While the Club Lounge buffet is sufficient, the restaurant is a few notches above. Marriot Platinum members still get use of the spa facilities which is very nice but the steam room wasn’t working the first day when I went. I asked for a 4:00 pm late check-out and got a 1:00 pm late check-out. I’ve stayed at the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani many times and the buffet breakfast is better but overall the Moana Surfrider is a much better hotel.There were many annoyances at the Moana Surfrider but it’s still hard to beat “The Grand Old Lady of Waikiki.”

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I have been coming to the Moana Surfrider every year since 2012. Gloria, Lee and Mo have run the pool and beach front for the hotel during that time span and they're super. Everything is top notch when they're in charge. Gloria and Lee have provided us many great recommendations for what to see and do around Oahu. All of those have been delightful get aways from the normal Waikiki scene. Take the opportunity to ask Lee about Iolani Palace.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here back in October for business, and was very happy with my stay. The room had a partial ocean view and was ver comfortable and clean. The hotel is right on the beach, and very convenient to everything. The bar is great with excellent views. On my next trip for work I will be returning to the Westin.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed in other “five stars” hotel in Waikiki over the many visits. Moana SR is the best. Quite pricey but enjoyable. The staff helpful and facilities excellent. Convenient to many places of our interest.However, the buffet breakfast was not as good as we expected.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We haven't stayed at the Moana Surfrider since March 2013 when we got married. We had the opportunity to go back for a 3 day, 2 night staycation with our daughter and the Moana was as gorgeous a hotel as it was when we stayed there for our honeymoon stay. The workers are all amazing and showed so much aloha, that it made us wonder why we took so long to come back! If we find reasonable rates like we did this time, we will definitely be back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff greeted with a warm welcome and high regards. Always try to accommodate our requests courteously. Excellent Beach Club that we can visit anytime. Breakfast was fresh, hearty and appetizing. From pastry, bread, omelette, ham, bacon, cheese, yogurt, oatmeal, fruits-sweet pineapple and papaya.... to miso soup and rice.Relax at Beach Club in the afternoon for a sip of wine and cheese, nachos..We stayed at Pent House. Very roomy, Huge Bathroom with warming toilet seat. Firm bed and pillows. Just a few steps to the beach from Beach Club made this very convenient. Staffs at Pool and Beach areas were very attentive and friendly.Must Stay at this place if you're looking for an accommodation in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We love the Moana Surfrider! We have stayed at this glamorous and historic hotel many times during the fall and over New Year's. It is a gorgeous beachfront property - yes, just steps to the beach...something that is worth it's weight in gold when one has kids!The Moana Surfrider is perfectly situated on the main Waikiki strip, close to fabulous stores, restaurants and a cab ride/uber away from the Ala Moana Shopping Center. We love to have drinks at sunset under their famous Banyan tree and Dinner at the Beachhouse. Their Beach Club Lounge is worth the investment and is THE loveliest Marriott Bonvoy Club we have experienced out of all of the Hawaiian islands - in service, offerings and overall experience.The level of service one experiences at the Moana Surfrider is second to none. We tip our hat to Mr. C, the General Manager. He and team go above and beyond to ensure their clients have an amazing experience.We so look forward to returning!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband & I stayed 2 nights on points for 2nd honeymoon & couldn't have chosen a better hotel. I had requested to use my last 2 suite night awards & Tehani contacted me several days prior to let me know she would try to upgrade, but couldn't guarantee. I was excited to receive an e-mail the next day confirming upgrade to Diamond Head Ocean View room which was perfect for us. We enjoyed beautiful views of sunrises over Banyan courtyard, Diamond Head & Waikiki beach. Perfect for relaxing on balcony listening to the music from the courtyard without having to fight crowds below. Loved the lounge with great breakfast & evening light meal offerings, as well as free wine & Primo beer, which is my new favorite. All staff we met were very welcoming, especially in the lounge. Overall feel of iconic grand Hawaiian hotel, much like Hotel Del in Coronado, CA. Entrance from boulevard made for fun walking & window shopping. Found Duke's Alley across the street with vendors offering souvenirs at much better prices than what you would pay in stores. Would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent the New Years holiday at the Moana Surfrider, and it was excellent. The hotel opens directly onto the beach. Pro tip, the umbrellas at the hotel rent for $65 a day, and have to be reserved a day in advance (they book quickly). Plus, the hotel umbrellas are pretty far from the ocean. There are other umbrella rental companies that rent for $50 a day immediately adjacent. They open up daily sometime between 7:30 and 8:00 AM for same day use. They are closer to the beach, and easier to rent.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Upon check in, we were told by the front desk agent, that the hotel was oversold and our rooms that we booked were not available! I called a week before, to insure that our two rooms were either connecting or close together, in house reservations noted the request and I felt confident that the requests would be taken care of. I find it completely unacceptable that the room type that I booked wasn’t available. This isn’t the first time this has happened to us staying at this property! They tried to offer me dining credits and no resort fee for accepting a lower room category. At 700.00 per room per night all I was asking for was was a higher floor in the category I booked. As a Bonvoy gold member I’m eligible for an enhanced upgrade, which means same category but a higher floor. As a gold member this means nothing at this property! Completely disappointed with this Westin. Seems to me they don’t care, it’s all about revenue. I still don’t understand why they sold my rooms I booked and that were guaranteed. So here we are on the 4th floor rooms 485 and 491 no sun looking on to a roof with a small view of the ocean and a very noisy kitchen across from us, nice!We got “left overs.” We checked in at 1:15 wasted a 1/2hour explaining why I should get the room category I booked. The front desk manager did apply a 100 food/beverage credit to 1 room. This being said, I would have rather had the rooms I booked on a higher floor. The resort fee is another thorn in my side, 37.00 per room/night. This property, doesn’t honour requests. Next time I will be looking at other properties that don’t sell my room to someone else and that treat me right. I wasn’t asking for much. I did reach out to Marriott customer relations and the nice lady thought that it my experience was a bit outrageous.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a treat for surviving the holidays, my husband and I planned to spend a week in Waikiki to celebrate the New Year. I was thoroughly looking forward to my stay at the Moana Surfrider. It’s a beautiful historic property right on the beach and smack in the middle of all the fun of Waikiki. Unfortunately, after being here less than 24 hours, I am really disappointed that I’ll be staying at the Moana Surfrider for 6 more nights.Upon checking in, we were not greeted as an Elite member (something that I truly appreciate and pay attention to because it’s something they ask in follow up surveys) despite being in the specific Elite queue. I wasn’t feeling well and travel exacerbated the pressure in my sinuses. I couldn’t wait to get checked in and settle into our room so I didn’t ask questions to confirm my Bonvoy Elite Welcome gift or Lounge access. I also didn’t ask for a hotel map, but shouldn’t all these things have been addressed without me asking?The room was as expected, for good and for bad. The Westin Heavenly beds were quite that and the noise from busy Kalakaua was as present as other reviews have stated. But I was okay with that because I understood booking a city view room would have that potential drawback.As a Bonvoy Elite member, we chose this hotel over others because of the Moana Beach Club Lounge benefits. We even received an email reminding us of this benefit prior to our trip. We were looking forward to having an exclusive place to getaway from the rest of the patrons. Luckily, we stumbled upon the lounge on our own because we weren’t given a map at check in. Unluckily, our card didn’t work to gain access into the lounge =\ Ughhh fine, I’ll have to go back to the lobby, but first I continued my exploration of the grounds.Overall review, this hotel does not have enough amenities to support their guests, non paid or paid! We went to the pool, and not 1 lounge chair was available. Okay, the pool is small, but the beach is right there! Let’s see about chairs on the beach. For $65 you can rent 2 chairs and an umbrella for the day. Okay, how do I do that? I’m told I need to reserve at the pool kiosk 7am the day before I want to reserve, and a tip to come extra early because there’s usually a line of 20 people waiting to do so and they do sell out. There is not enough free seating and even if I’m willing to pay, it still doesn’t secure me a space to lounge!Then there’s the resort fee. I know paying a resort fee is a common added expense per day, but in order to maximize on the benefits, you have to spend more $$. If you aren’t going to the spa, visiting Sea Life Park, learning how to surf, or working out, paying $35 sucks because it’s really only covering your WiFi and 2 bottles of water. Also, no matter how short or long your stay is, you get the same benefits per stay, meaning any of the 1 time use per stay benefits must be stretched for the duration of your stay. Again, I’m here for 7 nights so it a bummer getting less out of the resort fee versus someone staying 2 nights.I would not recommend staying at this hotel however, it is a nice place to visit and walk the grounds - ironic advice that makes this an even worse place for paying patrons to stay! We finally got access to the Moana Beach Lounge, a nice place to relax and write this review. Now that I got that out to warn others considering staying at the Moana Surfrider, I’m going to enjoy my vacation. After all, I am in Hawaii!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Went with the family (there's 5 of us total) and, to get an ocean front hotel that allows all 5 of us to share a room, we picked the Moana Surfrider. Stayed in 3718 -- gorgeous view, in the Diamond Tower that they tried to rebuild but were stopped recently.Plusses: The staff -- at checkin, at the pool, at each of the restaurants (we tried beach bar, veranda, and beachfront. The view -- unbeatable enough that we slept with curtains open and loved the sound. The overall resort -- we took the historical tour (lovely), enjoyed the Beach Club (their version of the executive lounge), the family pictures a free portrait session and one tiny print is included free, the Christmas atmostsphere, including Santa and carols. The pool managers that rent umbrellas were all particularly friendly and helpful. I would stay again and thought this made for a lovely family vacation. I really appreciate their 1 hour and you get kicked out of free lounge chairs policy -- it makes the pool available to everyone, not just squatters. We also paid for and enjoyed the one the beach umbrellas.Also loved the spa. With my titanium Marriott level, 2 adults got free admission and we used it and loved it. Nice steam room without that smelled fresh.Negatives: Our old room. Never in all my years of many hotel stays have I had to call for a plumber to unclog a toilet twice in one visit. they did come promptly. Bathroom the smallest I think of my life of hotel stays -- smaller than Paris or Venice -- couldn't fit the towels. The concierge being a central outsourced service rather than real hotel staff -- they were nice enough, but I didn't feel they could give me the insider help with reservations a good concierge with connections could provide. The dining reservations system is just not good -- seems to be centralized and you have to get transferred multiple times and once I had 3 unsuccessful call attempts in a row where one of the very polite transfers ended up sending me to a recording to call back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider over the Christmas break with our two boys (9-11). Overall, we loved the Moana. • Pros: Great location, lots of charm, hospitality. • Cons: Rooms are very small (ours didn’t even have a dresser). They cahoukd consider increasing the size and update the pool. While we were there, the Beach Bar menu was a special “holiday menu” and very basic. Also, to reserve chairs at the beach or pool you have to reserve (and pay) in advance or get up super early. And while this is no fault of the Moana, the beach was packed and it was sad to find garbage floating (condom wrapper, soy sauce packet and the top of a coffee cup found me within 30 minutes of getting in).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Let me begin by pointing out the positives. The location is great. Our check-in attendant could not have been more friendly. We were told that we were being upgraded to an oceanview which did have an amazing view. There are two rocking chairs inside the room facing the ocean. However, we were literally across from the elevator which is quite noisy. Another positive is that the sheets are soft and appeared new. Now, the not so positives. The room itself was tiny. Hardly any room to turn around. And the bathrooms are very small. There’s absolutely no counter space for toiletries, a brush, or blow dryer. Definitely too small for a family of 4. The walls were paper thin. We could hear our neighbor sneeze, cough and giggle all night long. You could hear them open and close their sliding closet doors. Fortunately, the air unit was so loud, it drowned out some of the noise next door. Definitely don’t stay if you’re looking for relaxation or a good nights sleep. Also, the shower floors were slimy and did not seem clean. Wear flip flops in the shower!The hotel has so much potential due to its location and historic value but there are so so many people. And the hotel is way over-due for renovations.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we lived in Waikiki for eleven years (20 years ago), we would walk by this hotel before and after their major renovation. While we would wine and dine there on occasion, we always wanted to stay in the hotel. It didn't make sense when we lived in another hotel all those years ago. So, that's how it ended on our bucket list for our return visit in September. I should clarify that we did enjoy ourselves at the hotel and it was worth the price we paid for our oceanfront room. Now, we did book and pay for our hotel rate through our travel agency and Blue Sky Tours Hawaii. So, the actual room rate was "imbedded" in the total package, excluding miscellaneous charges during our stay. Regardless, when you go to Hawaii and want the best, you just have to expect to pay for the best, and hope you are treated as such. In our experience here, we certainly got what we paid for with regard to our hotel room. We had a magical, beautiful view of Waikiki Beach and Diamond Head. This is exactly what we wanted. It wasn't the hotel's fault that the outside weather was one of the most humid and hot periods during our stay. Having lived in Hawaii, we realize this can happen. It was just one of those things. So, we barely were able to sit outside on the lanai and enjoy the view. We just could step outside for a few minutes. With regard to the other resort amenities, most of the time, they were very good as well. I didn't bring my laptop intentionally, but the hotel had a great setup with computer stations right in the lobby area. And, there was no charge for using their WIFI. Granted, I felt very guilty checking my email while all around me was this beautiful atmosphere. We dined several times at breakfast and lunch, including high tea out on their Veranda/Beachhouse restaurant. And, we thoroughly enjoyed the food, service, ambience, everything. While there were occasional "hiccups" in service, their "service recovery" more than made up for any issues we reported. Issues were not that major. For example, we assumed that since we were staying in the hotel, we would get some sort of priority at the restaurant. We were initially told that it didn't matter whether we stayed there or not. We were somewhat shocked about this response and let them know at the reception. The following day, while checking my darn email, the same receptionist saw me and offered to accommodate us for high tea and even comped us for it, aside from any beverages. That was extremely nice of them and more than made up for the initial response. The concierge lobby staff were also extremely nice. Even Room Service was extremely good and reasonably priced. Of course, the hotel's location right on Waikiki Beach and along Kalakaua Avenue is perfect if you want to stay in this area. What dampened our enthusiasm somewhat was their "resort charge" of $37.00 per night, along with valet parking fee daily of $45.00 per night. Then again, hotels are now notorious for their "resort charges" and it's extremely difficult if not impossible to find any decent (paid or unpaid) parking in this area (perhaps if you're local). One more negative: the Marriott Bonvoy points system (again, not the hotel specifically issue). Turns out, since we made our reservation through our travel agency, we were not able to collect any points, except for our miscellaneous charges...a real bummer). Be aware of this if and when you book using someone else. By the way, our agency claimed they didn't know about this policy. Hmmm???So, overall we loved our stay. But, you have to "bite the bullet" on the additional charges, etc. As they say in Hawaii still: "It's the price of paradise". And, it's still paradise after 20 years away.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fellow Ambassador Elite: Do not stay here. If you stayed over 100 nights at a Bonvoy property you would expect to be upgraded (even a little) wherever you stay. Not here. It will make no difference if you are an Ambassador or staying at a hotel for the first time in your life. There is no difference. If you booked the regular room, you’ll be stuck in a 210 sqft room with a small window to peer out at either a street or a courtyard. We will not be getting what you’re prolly used to for being a loyal Bonvoy member. I would recommend the Sheraton Waikiki (updated rooms at the very least) or the Ritz (same amount of points required as Moana Surfrider). Avoid this place as they don’t care about you. They cater to large tour groups and not elite members.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was so happy with our room and service here. Our balcony directly overlooked the beach (special request made by my well-traveled friend who made the reservations.) We could see DiamondHead from our balcony too. There are many weddings here on a daily basis, which as a wedding professional I loved to see and even got permission to take a few photos. We were able to hop on trolleys and buses right in front of the hotel for easy access to most places we wanted to go. And talk about location! I've never spent so much time amid such names as Tiffany, Ferragamo, Harry Winston, etc., etc. Of course there were ABC stores on every block as well (new to me, but reasonably priced convenience style stores.) The free breakfast and happy hour were not great, but filled us up and saved us lots of money. - A typical egg and bacon breakfast in the dining room was $37.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love the Surfrider for one reason. Every night in the rear courtyard under the Banyan tree, they perform local music. Most nights with a hula dancer. Good bar bites, good drinks, the sunset and the ocean. Wow

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A great location on the beach however if you are a light sleeper then do not get a room at the front of the hotel as the traffic noise etc will keep you awake. We experienced this and paid extra to relocate to a side view of beach room with no noise disturbance. Beautiful courtyard with entertainment and easy access to beach. Food and drink prices are on the high side with the added taxes and charges including for tables of 6 or more.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I called guest services 9:45pm on 12/19 for 2 spoons to have ice cream in my room, the guest service person said room service is closed I can't get you spoons .. pretty pathetic service .. I hope they retrain employees on actual customer service then just sitting on their hands and offering generic answers ... if you want mediocre service this is the spot for you .... aloha ?!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent and professional service from staff: bellmen, front desk, pool desk, bar under the Banyon tree and security. We had an incident and needed to see security. They were very supportive to me at that time and I appreciate their help and the respect they showed me. Food and beverage were very good. Service by room attendants each day was superb. They greeted us every morning and asked us if we needed anything. The cleanliness of the hotel was excellent.We love the location of the hotel, the history and the extras that a member of Mariott Bonvoy enjoys. The hospitality room at the end of the stay was appreciated as our flight did not leave until 10pm. We have a couple of concerns about the noise surrounding the hotel. Whether hoteliers in that area could have an effect on the local government or not, I could not say, however the noise from the main street in front of the hotel has increased since our last stay. Multiple buskers in one block all singing loudly (and amplified) at the same time creates a very unpleasant atmosphere in the evening. I spoke with one of the shopkeepers across from the hotel and she said it is like that all the time. She finds it unpleasant as well. Could not the buskers be give separate times to play/sing by the municipal government? I don't know if they were licensed but one group was very much involved in asking for money from the crowd rather than entertaining them. They were singing a madeup song about asking the group for money including "if you only have a $20 we'll give you change". They collect on street corners and create a crowd when others are trying to cross the street safely. On top of that when we were sitting on the rocking chairs on the veranda of the hotel entrance at night, the music playing from inside the hotel and at the entrance added to the cacaphony. One other incident that upset our stay occurred on Wednesday September 18 around 3pm. We were cooling off in our room for about an hour and there was a announcement that there was an "emergency in the hotel and all guests had to evacuate immediately". Of course we scrambled to pull on shoes and clothes and just as we were about to leave another announcement came on saying that it was a false alarm. Immediately after that a lound horn sounded for about a minute. We couldn't stay in our room at that point so we left - we felt unsafe (we were on the 18th floor in the tower building) and we are in our 60s. Other guests we met in the hallway espressed the same opinion. Later in the evening we asked at the front desk what had happened. The desk clerk said that someone had smelt smoke - cigarette smoke. Understanding that it was a false alarm, we were surprised that management would think of evacuating the hotel due to someone smoking in their room. There is a difference between burning fire smoke and cigarette smoke. Why not just knock on the door and tell the people to put out their cigarette? Anyway, we understand stand that it was a false alarm but it scared us and upset us very much. The explanation for the long horn sound was that it was a test for the regular tsunami warning. Why could that not have been advised to the guests ahead of time with signs saying that the tsunami warning would be tested at a certain time and not to be alarmed. The hotel management took the time to put a note under everyone's door on Friday that the street would be closed for a block party the next day, so why not take the time to put a note under everyone's doors about the tsunami testing? I asked that the hotel manager be informed about our upset. We heard nothing from him/her during our stay but the desk clerk apologized for the inconvenience.I noticed that the signs in the hallways say "no smoking in corridors". This implies that it is only the corridors where one should not smoke.... leaving the guest rooms and balcanies questionable for smoking. We found a small yellow and white card saying it was a no smoking hotel/state law, but it was mixed in with a bunch of other papers and brochures under the table next to the bed. We didn't find those until a few days into our 7-day stay. I know that signing the guest registry indicates no smoking but not all the guests staying that week could speak English and it is not really emphasized at the desk upon check-in. We smelt cigarette smoke about 4 times on our floor while we were staying there. I think the signage could be clearer in the guest room and corridor/public areas.FYI - We were also surprised at the exchange rate among the hotels and shops in Honolulu. .64 Canadian to US dollar. The bank exchange rate is about 10 cents higher. (this is not a hotel complaint but something that we will consider before returning to Hawaii in the future)Other than the above we enjoyed our stay and especially the professional courtesies and genuineness of the staff. We have always loved visiting the Westin Moana Surfrider hotel.Thank you. .... Bill Robertson and Linda Holland, Vancouver, Canada

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good:Moana Surfrider didn't disappoint in it's grandeur and location.Rooms appeared to be clean, although (as expected) a bit small where we stayed in the historic section.Just a beautiful place and friendly staff.Nice salt water pool.Live music at outdoor cafe near pool and also occasionally at grand piano in the main room.Bad:Our sink was clogged upon arrival.Service came within minutes of reporting it and was very friendly and professional, BUT he used a plunger to unclog the sink!!!There are no specialty "sink" plungers, only general plungers that are primarily used to unclog toilets!After unclogging the sink, the plunger dripped onto the counter, hand toil and floor.Knowing this plunger was likely last and primarily used to clean toilets disgusted us and put doubt into the cleanliness of everything we touched in and out of the room.Mid stay we received a notice that our room was to be spayed for bugs the next day.Why this wouldn't have been done before, or after the occupancy is bewildering.There was an opted out of the spraying, by calling the reception, which we did.Needless to say, way dropped by the room mid morning just as someone arrived to spray our room!The heavy drapes, the curtain rod, screws and plugs fell from the ceiling the afternoon before our departure.$30 + for breakfast or $29(?) for a burger/fries was too steep a price for us to enjoy what smelled to be great food from this resort.Like other resorts, pool chairs are in high demand.
