Many chairs had towels on them for 1+ hours without anyone appearing. Perhaps some system of use can be followed and monitored.$65 a day to use 2 beach chairs and an umbrella. But I guess that`s acceptable, as you had to book a day (early) in advance to secure one. $45 per day for "basically" 2 bottles of water and wifi.$35 for self parkingWEIRD: Our rooms faced directly into rooms located in the newer wing about 60 feet away, which offered a fine view of a couple of exhibitionists.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an expensive place to stay, but if you don't have a car and want everything at your fingertips, this is the place to stay. It has history, a pool, the best piece of beach in Waikiki, great service, great food, and great Mai Tai's too! You can walk to just about anywhere in Waikiki fro here as well as the most restaurants, and fireworks on the beach Saturday nights. Stay here for just a night or two just to experience the place. You will be a part of Hawaiian history.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first time staying at the Moana Surfrider and the pool staff made our stay enjoyable! Our overall experience was good but on the last day of our stay my husband dropped his Oakley sunglasses while leaving the pool in the courtyard area by the rocking chairs. By the time we got to the elevator he noticed that he dropped them, so he went back to find them which was a max of 1-3 mins time-span but they were gone. It's upsetting to know that we stayed at a resort where they have thief's and our belongings are not secure. We immediately informed the front desk staff and they said to call the lost and found department (they didn't seem too concerned about the situation). I did notice that they have camera's all over the property but they didn't offer to review them in order to find the people that stole the sunglasses. My husband did notice two younger males that were sitting in the courtyard area when he walked by looking for his sunglasses and he overheard them saying "there is the guy that dropped his sunglasses". However, my husband didn't want to get into an argument on our vacation but it was upsetting to know that they let unregistered guests enter the property where people's personal belongings are. Considering the high resort fee that guests pay, the resort should have a security guard that walks the premises to ensure registered guests are safe.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a ton of fun, love the historic venue and wonderful amenities. If you are a member of Marriott’s perks program it only gets even better staying here. There are a ton of surprise and delight moments for you including Wine Wednesday happy hour, free Pineapple Dole Whip, and access to the spa and clubhouse. Be sure to take advantage of each of those perks as it will highly enhance your vacation.If your not a Marriott member this hotel still offers great value. The location is ideal, within easy walking distance of great shops and restaurants, and very friendly to almost any type of group (families, couples, friends). Plus, you get to stay at one of the oldest hotels in Oahu. Also a great place to hit the beach (get on line at 6:45 am sharp to book choice seats on the beach for the next day). Originally we had planned to book a stay in the hotel’s tower (newer rooms, many of which have a small balcony), but ended up switching to the historic side. Will say it was quiet and lovely, and our room had a great view of some of the beach and the hotels magnificent Banyan tree.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider during our honeymoon! The staff was amazing and very helpful! The architecture and history add to the charm of the resort. We loved every moment of our stay here! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love the old world feel of this hotels....the guest facilities are brilliant....the service is great and friendly. The location is amazing......the cocktails are a reasonable price and the hospitality was great......I recommend anyone to visits Waikiki to stay at this amazing hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have visited Hawaii many times. I always dreamed of staying here, but couldn't afford it until later in life. Its got the old and new traditions of a fabulous hotel on the beach. The building, grounds and the staff are amazing. Location is unbeatable. The giant Banyan tree on the beach, your right on the Waikiki Beach!!! Its just a beautiful and awesome property. My room was very nice, stayed in the vintage rooms, wood floors, small, but gave you a nice feel when you sleep.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm a bit of a hotel snob. This was perfect! The location and vibe and staff were the best! Every staff member we bumped into was so sweet! Love this place and would go back in a heartbeat. The mattress and sheets and toto toilet seat! Love it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great View but very poor service. The walls are very thin to the point you can hear the neighboring rooms phone conversations even at 3am!! Also as a Titanium elite member that spends a lot of time at other Marriott properties they do not honor the perks of loyalty denying the request for late checkout and limiting your lounge access. Also the pool is too small and you will not find an available chairs if you arent the first few there in the morning. This also applies to the beach which is EXTREMELY crowded by the hotel, to the point you are better going to other parts of Waikiki. They have a great location on the beach, but this does not excuse the rude attitude to guests from the front desk, retruant, lounge and poolside attendants. As a Marriott loaylaist the Marriott Courtyard and Sheraton Princess which I have both stayed at are much more enjoyable for your vacation even thou not beach front (the walk to the beach is simple and MUCH better hotels as well as much better sized rooms with good views).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was recently stressed and looking for time to relax. My friend and I found a massage and facial online for the Moana. We decided to make a day out of it. I received a massage by Ivan who was incredible. He was able to focus on the areas of my body that were giving me the most stress and tension. My friend had a facial that she really enjoyed. The amenities in the spa were incredible with beautiful views of diamond head and the beach. I highly recommend for a weekend of relaxation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just completed a five night stay at this amazing hotel. It was my daughter‘s 21st birthday and it was a special present for her that she had been looking forward to four months. We were given a suite in the tower section of the hotel which had a very comfortable king bed, large balcony with views of both the ocean and the city. The bathroom was spacious with both a shower and tub. We also had access to the concierge lounge with a nice continental breakfast and appetizers in the evening. I would recommend a room in the tower as I believe the rooms in the older part of the building are traditionally smaller. The pool area is smaller than most newer resorts probably due to the historical nature of this hotel as the first resort built on Waikiki. The pool does close at 6 PM to allow guests to enjoy the poolside music and drinks. Drink prices at the beach bar are a bit hefty, $16 for a piña colada, however the live music was consistently excellent in the evening. The location of the hotel is fantastic both in terms of being directly on the beach and also in the center of the upscale shopping district. The best part of the experience was really interacting with the staff, which was consistently friendly and helpful and professional. Kyle, Christopher, and Shane at the concierge were extremely helpful in making this a very special experience for me and my daughter. Karen in the beach club learned our names on day one and always kept our wine glasses full. Mericar in housekeeping kept our room spotless and well stocked. Cindy at the front desk was amazing. If I had to come up with any negatives, it would be the resort fee, the high drink prices, and lack of variety in the menu each day in the concierge lounge. However, all in all, we had a fantastic time and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel over all others in Waikiki. Westin should be proud to have Moana Surfrider as a crown jewelIn its collection. We will certainly return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 4 of us just finished Thanks Giving Buffet the food and service was fantastic our only gripe was on the verandah it was hot and the sun was in our eyes. Well done to all it was very appreciated the effort from all

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this place. Simply beautiful architecture that has been very well preserved. The staff are so kind and professional. The hotel is clean and beautifully maintained and decorated. It's old world charm that transcends the ages. From the ukulele player in the lobby, rocking chairs on the public verandas and the beautifully appointed rooms, the Moana Surfrider is understated elegance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We've visited Waikiki 9 years in a row but never stayed at the Moana Surfrider. Upon our arrival the staff was extremely welcoming. Our bags were taken away immediately and we walked to the front desk area where we met Keith, who was the first person of contact to get us all settled in. He greeted us with a smile and was so personable and knowledgable. Margie, our hospitality clerk was full of knowledge and left our room clean and well stocked with additional items we needed. I'd have to say this hotel is one of the best by far. The views are awesome!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first ever visit to Hawaii and we picked this hotel because it was in a great location.Great first impression but not the most warm or friendliest of hotels.Everything was where it should be and staff were helpful but it was all perfunctory and lacked that warm little extra touch.Very, very busy and perhaps that is one of the reasons.The hotel is right in the heart of Waikiki and close to all the shops and restaurants.Not good value but that is what you apparently pay in Waikiki.The room was in the newer tower so the view was outstanding and the beach was right outside the "back door".We found the whole Hawaii experience rather flat and very expensive.I am not sure that if we ever went back, Honolulu, Moana or any other hotel would offer a different experience.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great historic location with modern amenities. It never disappoints. Breakfast with server Paschal under the Banyan Tree is always a 6 star experience.Views from newer tower overlook Waikiki beach and the hotels is close to world class restaurants and shopping.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed four nights on our last trip to Hawaii and let me give you the good, bad and ugly of this resort. Location? Awesome and tough to beat. Right in the heart of Waikiki and the sand is right out the back door. History? The first hotel on Waikiki is steeped in tradition and wonderful for its nostalgia. It even has the old fashioned mail drop by the elevators. Service? Took 45 minutes to get checked in despite my being Gold Elite with Marriott. Embarrassing. Value? Awful. I did get a good price of $300 per night but the room was smaller than a cruise ship room. It was old, 10 coats of paint, worlds smallest bathroom and the big shocker is the heavenly bed was so old it was like hell. No deep for 4 days. The Kicker? To add insult to injury I return home to find out they do not give Marriott points if you buy through another vendor (hotels.com, Expedia,etc.). It that a kick in the head? Could have went with a dozen better options but my loyalty to Marriott was met with contempt. I highly recommend you find another hotel or be prepared to shell out three times as much money for the newly upgraded tower. Waikiki is great but we won’t stay here ever again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Now this place deserves the good reviews it has earned ( especially Sam on the front desk ).Helpful staff. Great rooms. Superb atmosphere in the heart of Honolulu.Take the Verandah breakfast. It is worth it.Evenings at the Beach Club were not to be missed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was OK - for the price average. We had some issues with check in / valet but we were compensated (without asking to be) - which was nice. Hotel is a little old but it is clean. I found the staff helpful and nice. It is crowded. An elevator broke and was down for about 2 days thus the lines were long - and we were on the 15th. Not the end of the world. Pool is small and not the greatest. Beach was OK. Water wasnt very clean - but its just teh tide and being on the outskirts of the city - it is what it is. Further out was really clean and awesome. I want to reiterate - the staff were all really great. At the pool at the valet at the desks and the service workers. I would recommend reserving chairs / umbrellas daily. $65 and very worth it - you get a little space versus packed on beach - and there is waiter waitress service - surf lessons / surfing on this beach amazing. Westin club was good too [IMO]

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: very nice old place with real charactor in a very good spot, good friendly staff and the bar under the banyon tree was nice and shady, but if you sat down you were expected to buy a drink as there was a shortage of pool lounges to sit around as the pool was very nice, food was nice as well

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family had a dinner at the Beach House Nov 13th to celebrate my husband’s Birthday. Upon arrival reception staff was very friendly and escorted our seat right away. William was our server and he was very attentive to our needs. Explained the menu very well and his recommendation was spot on. We enjoyed our dinner and the special acknowledgement that William provided to my husband’s birthday. We had our wedding ceremony in 2016 at Diamondhead lawn at this hotel so this place is very special to our family. Thank you Beachhouse, William and Westin Moana Surfrider. We will definitely be back again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: To me highly overrated, very expensive for what you get or not get, would not recommend it to any one, we didn,t even have a working fridge in the room which was very small, food over expensive as well as the bars

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel, enthusiastic and helpful staff, great location. The rooms are beautiful and the whole place is spotless, views good and the location on Waikiki Beach is perfect. This is a busy area of town so if you want something very quiet, head elsewhere. Otherwise, not a single complaint. Feels like home from the moment you walk in, albeit with a friendly concierge and right on the beach. Would stay again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family enjoys their high tea. We've experienced them in Europe, Asia, North America and now Hawaii. The Veranda at the Moana Surfrider offers an outstanding afternoon tea. Local flavours with traditional favourites are beautifully presented on a three tiered plate. Everything was very fresh and obviously prepared with skill. The service was the attentive but non intrusive. We never felt rushed. Sitting on the open veranda under the banyon tree while watching the scene on Waikai beach was delightful. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment you arrive the unhelpful concierge makes sure you feel like a bother. We as a couple where placed in a 2xdouble bed room besides booking a king. The aircon is noisey and no cutlery and to get some you have to pay $20 and it took 30minutes to get some, cutlery is a basic in all hotels how is it ok to make people pay. This hotel looks nice but the bathroom we had had black mould growing on the roof and it was cracking. For a Westin Hotel this is the worst I have stayed in and I would recommend staying at The Royal Hawaiian down the road, slightly cheaper, bigger rooms, better service and not as noisy. I won’t be staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everytime we visit Honolulu we make it a point to stap at the Moana Surfrider to have a drink and relax under the banyon tree This time we also enjoyed having lunch. The service was great. The food was good. The price is on the high side

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we first came to Hawaii around 8 years ago this was one place we said we would love to stay at! We booked two nights at the end of our three week vacation and were nicely greeted with leis and our luggage handled for us! Check in was very quick and the lady very nice and helpful! The hotel has an old charm to it and really makes you feel like you are in Hawaii! Loved people watching on the rocking chairs out front as it was Halloween!! The room itself was quite small and hard to get things sorted with our three large cases! The other negative was that it smelled really funky which of course may be due to the age of the hotel. Nonetheless housekeeping were very nice and room was cleaned very well. Breakfast was mediocre, my husband wasn’t impressed with the buffet at all and my egg white omelette was just okay! Disappointed they couldn’t make my cuppucino! Overall we had a nice stay and loved watching the sunset on Waikiki beach. The music in the evening was also really nice with a margarita or three. The location is everything!! Would come back some day but for a night or two only!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment we got checked in by a very friendly lady to the moment we checked out 6 days later, we were met with nothing but courteous people. A beautifull 1901 built hotel set on Waikiki beach. We had a room with a partial sea view, surprisingly had a balcony which gave us great sights of the beach and rearwards to the mountains. The room was spacious, coffee making facilities included. It is cleaned to perfection daily. Made our trip to Honolulu even better. Nothing seems to much trouble for the staff.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family stayed here for 2 nights and our arrival experience was terrible. We never feel the warm welcome. We never got leis. Valet never greeted us aloha. And when its time for check-in, front desk agent1 wasn’t that helpful knowing I have some issue on my papers, knowing I’m traveling with my kids whose very tired and wants to rest. There’s no anticipation on this hotel I must say. I still need to ask for crib even though they know I have a 1 year and 11 months old baby. Staff never say hi or aloha. Is this the norm here.? Not returning on this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Following a medical incident, we wish to thank staff at the Moana Surfrider for their support. Particularly, Rob at the Beach Bar for facilitating our connectivity while waiting for news from Queens Hospital. Additional thanks to Rob for his excellent evening service and to Mike for friendliness, courtesy and service during the day. Facilities are very good and proximity to the Waikiki water unsurpassed. This is our second stay at the Surfrider and will not be our last.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Open air common areas. Front veranda with rockers and the persistent scent of leis that greet all new guests. Comfortable rooms. Walk out to Waikiki Beach. A view of Diamondhead. Wonderful staff and fantastic food.A very relaxed atmosphere with lots of history.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My favorite hotel has once again excelled in their customer service on all levels. From the moment you arrive - Frank and team are there delivering the warmest welcome - to the incredible front desk staff - always accommodating to all my needs. Thank you Stephen, Haley, Keith and the Director of Front office, Kyle. On to the room - beautiful beautiful beautiful- housekeeping is exceptional. Best beach service ever - thank you Lee, Gloria - Hulali and the entire team. You all are the best. 10 Stars to all. Will certainly be back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Selected by our travel agent who deserves some praise as this was the most enjoyable stay we have had in the past few years - it was essentially hard to find any fault and I am a hard marker !Location - unbelievably good on Waikiki Beach and I mean right on the beach. Walk from your room, through the outdoor bar area and dip your toes in the water - excellent.Amenities - dining casual or formal in the restaurant or on the beach terrace - good menu selections or buffet available. Prompt service and well presented.Staff - always around to provide advice or assistance. Only the porters on the morning we left dropped the standard, but hey it was 7:00 AM so forgivenRoom - we had a beach facing room with a huge window and a tiny patio. We could sit in our rocking chairs and hear and see the surf crashing in literally at our doorstep. Great relaxing spot to chill. Must say the rooms were on the small side but efficiently laid out - good for our purposes.Bar - this was, in part, a highlight. Pull up a chair and chat to the bar staff or select a table on the patio area and have table service by great staff. Drinks and simple meals delivered quickly - spent way too much time here - impossible not to.Summary - very happy :-)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is right in the middle of the action with easy access to the best shopping in Waikiki. Shops stay open until 10pm every night and there are lots of eating options. As the oldest hotel in the area it has beautiful architecture and a breezy aspect with regular live music in the courtyard. The pool is outdoor and not open as long as most hotels (6pm closing) plus the number of deck chairs/cabanas is very minimal, but what they have is serviced well and people are not allowed to reserve in the morning and leave for breakfast. Any deck chair vacant for an extended period is cleared out for another guest. We stayed in a partial ocean view room which was beautifully positioned so the hotel next door disrupt our view and the size if the room was perfect for two people who needed a bit of space. The only big negative was housekeeping who did a very poor job of servicing the room and on one occasion didn't do it at all. The front desk seemed to constantly blame the guests but in our case I don't see how as we did nothing to suggest they should not enter the room and did nothing to interrupt them while they were there. Ignoring that this one is definitely worth a return visit.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Like stepping back in time with beautiful location, historic facility, live music for ambiance, and friendly attentive staff. Meals and drinks are on the expensive side, so possible to supplement both with nearby alternatives.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was struggling with how to write this review, as I truly love this property, and for the most part find their staff to be friendly and helpful (particularly at the front desk and back office; super friendly)Whats great about the property: Spectacular views, particularly if you manage to snag a Diamond Head view Upper floorLovely Restaurant, excellent Breakfast BuffetWorth every penny Beach Club (reserved for Platinum+ Bonvoy members, but Gold and Silver can purchase access)Grand but not stuffy old-Hawaii Hotel with a fabulous Porch (note rocking chairs)Very nice Fitness center.Nice Beach Bar, excellent spot for Sunset (although a Happy Hour would be nice)Whats far far from great about the property:The Pool. Its without a doubt one worst pool experience at any Resort style Property I've encountered over my many years of travel. (It should be noted, we stayed at the Moana Surfrider a year ago; had a similar issue, but loved the hotel so much that we let it go)Whats wrong with the Pool?1) Its tiny; way too small for such a large property2) The only view of the ocean from the pool is blocked by chairs & a retaining wall3) Its basically a kiddie pool. During most of the days during our recent 6 night stay, the pool was full of small, in some cases diaper clad kids. And when I say full, I mean full! Now dont get me wrong, families and small children should be able to enjoy a pool when visiting Hawaii, but what about the adult guests?4) By the time the kids are out of the pool, the pool closes at an awkardly early 6pm, so no chance for some pool time then either.5) The area around the pool is filthy. This is in large part caused by the lovely massive Tree in the center of the courtyard. It has a lot of wildly straggling branches that simply cut be gently trimmed back so that the pool area isnt constantly filthy.(we actually got hit several times by falling sap/nuts etc)The Solution: Please spend the money and create an adults only pool. The place to do it is directly between the pool and beach; in that narrow but big enough strip of concrete between the two retaining walls. You'd displace a handful of beach chairs; but having a useable adults only pool that looked out onto the ocean would be fabulous. Simply walk over to the Sheraton a few hotels down for inspiration. This wont be cheap and will require some work, but to the honest; with an expensive property like this; its expected, particularly when you charge resort fees for every day of the stay. Having an adult pool would pay for itself and could easily be made up for by tacking an un-noticed extra few bucks onto every room night, or raising the resort fee by a few bucks each day.As much as we love this property, we will not be back as we literally couldnt use the pool even once during our 6 night stay. Yes, thats our own fault, we coulda enjoyed being part of the human and kid stew, but no thanks.Please consider this an opportunity to make an already lovely property perfect.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Again I booked this restaurant after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and the fact it is one of the original hotels in Waikiki. It is a beautiful old style grand hotel on the main road and we were very lucky to have a table right by the ocean which we were very grateful for as the restaurant was very busy and quite noisy further back on the veranda. Service was very good and food excellent with a good choice of menu and again we had fish for our starter and main course although meat dishes are available. Again quite expensive but Hawaii is expensive on the whole. Good wine list and again some very expensive wines but a few reasonably priced ones. Definitely make a reservation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a lovely place to stay. It reminded me of an old plantation mansion. We stayed in room #327 and were so pleased with the sound of the waves at night rather than the sound of traffic! The a/c was super quiet. The room was spic and span clean and the pillows and linens were so soft. The employees were all very nice and helpful. We were so impressed with the service. The only down side was that it was so crowded with people in the lobby and restaurants. All in all, we had a wonderful stay here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Absolutely loved our stay at 'The First Lady of Waikiki'. It was truly a memorable experience for our family of seven. We had two Ocean Front Rooms with balconies in the Diamond Tower for four fabulous nights. The rooms were light, airy and fresh and provided the most spectacular views directly out to Waikiki Beach. Staff were friendly and helpful. The facade and entrance to the hotel and the Banyan Tree out the back are simply devine. Moana Surfrider is a very special place indeed... we will stay again if we make it back to O'ahu one day. We also really appreciated the provision of a room in which to shower and freshen up after our super early arrival... that, a swim in Waikiki Beach and then lunch at the Beach Bar was just enough to get us through to our rooms being ready for check in. Just home in Western Australia last night after following our stay at Moana Surfrider with a 20 day cruise on Ovation of the Seas from Honolulu to Sydney. A dream vacation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider and will definitely go back with the kids on our next trip. Beautiful hotel that was grand and very clean. Our room was spacious and clean. The staff where great and always willing to help. The food choices were ample and great. Overall good experience

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Currently staying here in for our 7 night family vacation and the hotel location is great. Right on the beach. So far the only issue we’ve had is valet parking. We have an over sized vehicle since we have 13 people with us. First night there was a festival so the street was closed so we had to drive around to find parking. Luckily the Sheraton had space, but they can’t accommodate us for our entire stay. We asked a valet staff to see what we can do and he said we can park in the street or find parking somewhere else. Every single hotel we’ve stayed at would at least try to find a way to accommodate us instead of telling us to find our own parking. Very poor customer service on the valet part. Spoke with the manager and they are currently working to find something for us. Keeping our fingers crossed to see if they step up with their service and help us find a solution.Edit: Did not mean to throw all valet department under the bus. It was only 1 that was rude and did not want to help

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Again another favourite to visit when in Hawaii. A must is the Long Island Iced Tea $15. Shared calamari $18 and a Shrimp Plate $28 for lunch. Tips are getting higher here... now range 18 to 20%! Most meals out seem to average around the US$100 - 120 for 2 people...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider is absolutely beautiful! The hotel grounds are stunning and the location is perfect with breathtaking beachfront views of the ocean and Diamond Head. It's also right across from the International Market Place and near several restaurants, shops, and bars. They even have Honolulu Coffee near the main entrance of the hotel, which was super convenient for us to stop in and get our caffeine fix every morning. Everything is within walking distance but if you decide on renting a car, valet is $45/night or you can self park in the garage at Sheraton, which is directly across the street from Moana Surfrider and costs $35/night. My fiancé and I had a suite located on the Pent House floor for three nights. We had an amazing view of the ocean and the city skyline. We loved waking up every morning to the gorgeous view. We found our suite to be extremely spacious, modern, and clean. It had a large balcony with lounge chairs, mini fridge, microwave, sitting area with desk, and a flat screen tv. In addition, the bathroom is humongous. I loved the rain shower head and the water pressure was perfect. Some nice perks during our stay included free WiFi and newspaper (which my fiancé loved getting everyone morning). We also had access to the Beach Club Lounge. We were able to eat breakfast (which was delicious by the way) in their outdoor patio and relax by the beach every morning. The club also offers happy hour during the day with snacks and beverages- such as coffee, tea, and soda. What stood out the most during our stay was the customer service we received here. Everyone from the front desk, housekeeping, bellmen, and valet were extremely friendly and courteous. They always greeted us with a smile and even remembered us by name. They made us feel welcomed the entire time we were here. On our first night during our stay, we had an issue with the tv. One of the engineering guys immediately came to our suite and fixed the issue right away. Overall, my fiancé and I had a wonderful time here especially because it was our engagement-moon. The next time we visit Waikiki, we will be sure to stay here. I highly recommend this place! You won't regret it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel right on the beach. We were only here a short time, but had a room that accommodated 5 with a direct beach view. Very open air and helpful staff. The pool and beach were just steps from each other.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana surfrider is as grand as it gets. We were greeted with fresh lies upon our arrival by the friendly valet workers. As we arrived early in the morning and check in beginning at 3pm we were granted access to a temporary room for 45minutes to freshen up which was above and beyond great service. We booked a tower city view room but were lucky enough to have spectacular views of the ocean from our balcony. This hotel has it all Great staff (especially the cleaners), unbeatable location, modern yet classy vibes and speedy wifi. definently will be returning soon

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We turned up at Midnight and there had been a computer entered error with our booking. It did no show up on their system that we had our two children with us - despite us having a hard copy (Thank God) stating our booking included our children! The front line staff could not have been more helpful.They upgraded our room and we had the best time there over 9 days! The Gym is clean and well kept, our room was excellent, the Bar area and Pool area would have to be one of the best on Waikiki. An excellent place to relax in the shade or walk down to the waters edge. Thank you Moana for making our family holiday in Hawaii a memorable one!! We could not fault it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This review is just for the afternoon/high tea at the Verandah restaurant located within the Moana Surfrider. We were not guests of the hotel but booked for the afternoon tea via their website months before. It was such a treat to be sitting on the verandah under the banyan tree and facing the ocean. The service was exceptional, the tea lovely and the cakes were beautiful. Just gorgeous. We were a party of 3 with only one of us having the afternoon tea and the other 2 ordering food off their menu. This was no problem at all. It was a wonderful way to spend a few hours relaxing and feeling quite posh. Would recommend.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was beautiful and we were lucky enough to get an ocean view. The service from the staff is better than average, and our room was clean. We did encounter some slight problems, like my drinks froze in the refrigerator, they had to fix our door which didn't close all the way and they also had to switch up our TV because it stopped working. But at least they responded rather quickly and the staff was friendly. However, we were not impressed with the Beach Club during breakfast, lunch or dinner. It was just so so in taste and there wasn't a lot of variety.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were on our honeymoon here and booked a penthouse suite on the 21st (highest floor). On our second night we decided we’d love to sit outside around 830pm and enjoy the beautiful weather. Our lanai was covered in giant cockroaches. We informed the front desk and their reply was “wait on the top floor? We’ve never had complaints of cockroaches up that high only on lower floors. You didn’t leave the doors open did you?” So the hotel could care less. We then moved to a different room for our last night and were terrified to even go out on the balcony and looked around everyone to make sure this lower floor room didn’t have any bugs. The 15th floor was safe but it was SO loud from music at the bar and voices. The views from the penthouse were gorgeous though

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thought with the name and it being a Westin it would hold to a certain standard. Certainly at checkin it did. After arriving late to the hotel we did not question anything till the following morning. I awoke then realised that the room's AC smelt of damp and that it had very little storage other than a wardrobe. I was with my partner and we had to make do and live out of our suitcases. The Banyam rooms are very small indeed. Went down to reception to complain or pay to get moved and NO suitable options were available so it was a like it or lump it situation. We did not come to Oahu to worry about a pissing hotel....Then you get to the staff (cleaners, concierge were excellent). Yes you'll hear about how time moves slowly; that's BS when the staff are checking there phones, scrathing their collective arses and heads seemingly looking busy. Very laxadazical attitude around the main bar and the restuarant. We just gave up and eat in other places which were far more on the point, responsive and deserved the accolaises. There are far cheaper places, with tastier food and tip deserving service.Its not the worst Starwood property I've stayed in, but at the price its a ripoff and the bar/restuarant staff are playing games. Leave them too it and find another hotel. If you need to stick within Marriott chain then many options just avoid the Moana. If its about the history then come visit, you can walk away to your nice hotel and not worry about rooms/service, etc.Will never stay at this hotel again, this is hoping its visitors are ignorant, dont travel alot and will put up with the flaws.... At this money.... no chance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Came the last week of September, 2019 and discovered it was their annual parade that weekend, which was amazing to see down the main street in front of hotel. Be aware that the streets are closed for hours as the 2 hr plus parade goes thru town. We had a room facing the street, which can be pretty noisy as street musicians and crowd are out late into the night. The back rooms face the ocean, but will add to your price.We were in the older part of hotel, so rooms were smaller than those in the Tower, the newer section. Room was adequate, and the balcony was very nice. Small fridge, nice wardrobe, and a few small drawers in tv console.  Staff were super friendly and helpful booking our trip to Pearl Harbor, but the activities desk is only about 15 feet away from loud piano music, which did make it hard to hear. As a guest, you are entitled to FREE food in the Beach Club, all hours of day. We made the mistake of eating at the Beach Bar, where our chicken tenders for two with a pina colada came to over $75. The view was nice, sitting under the Banyon tree, but the drinks tasted like they had no alcohol and were very pricey!! ($16 each) It is a lovely hotel, and a favorite spot for weddings- half dozen a day or more! Many gift shops, spa, and exercise room as well. Close to all kinds of shopping on same street.You can walk right on to the Waikiki beach through the lobby! Be wary of the undertow, though, as it can easily knock you off your feet!We loved the hotel, and would highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The colonial style building and inviting entrance attracted us to dine with them despite reviews of being expensive. Staff were very attentive and found us a lovely table for two where we watched the sun set. Practically every table has a pretty good beach view as far as I could see. A Japanese wedding party were right next to us so the atmosphere was great. The seafood sharing platter was excellent, the wine was great, as was the dirty martini but the main courses were a teeny bit underwhelming for the price considering all sides were extra. We would definitely return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came for their afternoon tea at the Veranda Restaurant. The place is pretty and offers a nice ambiance. Any given day, you will see couple of brides and grooms having lunch. It’s so cute to see the beautiful bride with their white gown.The food was ok. Nothing special especially for the price of $50. I have paid double at other places but were very good. Once is enough to try their afternoon tea. Halikulani’s afternoon tea is better quality and slightly cheaper (see my review). The view at the Veranda is nice especially facing the ocean. Service was good. Jeremy waited on me.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a buisness trip for myself that I decided to bring my family along on. Booked through AMEX Travel the trip was slotted for a ocean view king suite in the new tower. Upon arrival I was given the key to a garden view small room and instantly tried to figure out where the disconnect was. After 20 minutes at the desk with multiple trips to the back the concierge told me his manager found out AMEX had changed my booking and there was nothing they could do. As a gold elite member with 100 nights in the last 3 years I expected a bit more but I asked if I could pay out of pocket for the room I had booked two weeks prior and was told no that they were sold out and I was given a dual twin room in the old tower. This entire process took almost an hour with my wife and kids waiting so I paid the extra 300+ dollars and left the desk unhappy but putting it behind me. The next day after our room had been cleaned we returned to change for the pool and a plumber shows up to fix the toilet because the room cleaning crew had broken the handle on it and we had no idea. We also told the plumber that our drain in the shower did not work and he fixed that as well but the fact that two things broke within the first 24 hours did not bode well for the trip. The next day infact during a shower the water pressure went out with soap in my hair for about 20 minutes where I had to get out and dry off and wash my hair in the sink. All of these things are possible bad luck and coincidence until the final straw for me. Since I was on a buisness trip I needed to print out a manual for the customer I was working for and tried to use the hotel complimentary workstation and printer. I tried to print the 62 page manual on dual sided print which would have been 31 pages of printing but the printer was not working. I asked for help twice and was told if I couldnt figure out how to fix the printer to go to the activities desk and they would print it for me. After heading over there and emailing the PDF to their email they printed it for me single sided and completely jumbled as they kept taking about 5 pages off at a time and mixing them up thoroughly. After about 40 pages printed they said that this was too many pages and that there would be a charge. I said fine if you need to make a small charge to my room that is fine and left with the wad of paper he handed me to sort and re-order on my own. As I checked out of the hotel I find that to print those 62 pages they charge me 35 dollars... thats more than the ink cartrige and the entire ream of paper cost for what should have been a complimentary print. Suffice to say I have never been as displeased with a hotel as this hotel. There were some nice parts so I cant give it a 1 star but I wish I could. They were extremely curt with every interaction from the towel cabana to the front desk. The only great staff I encountered were the room cleaning staff and the bell hops. Other than that I had zero positive interactions with any staff or policies. For the prices they charged I would rather stay ANYWHERE else in Hawaii than this hotel and its by far the worst Marriott property I have ever stayed at.I hope they do better by other guests but for me it was abysmal especially for the cost and with status to boot.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana was recommended to us and it was perfect for our break. On arrival we where offered an upgrade to a suit and Beach club access that was very worth while. Friendly staff, clean rooms and comfortable bed made this break awesome. Full ocean front was spectacular in the newer tower. Services all worked well good air conditioning, quick lifts certainly recommend this awesome iconic hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wow! Just WOW! I had never been to Hawaii before & on my first visit, I stayed at this wonderful, historic hotel. & now have been spoilt for all other hotels/ destinations, anywhere. This is a Top Class hotel, in every way- service, accommodations, restaurants, pools, beachfront etc. I could continue raving but thats excessive. So, go to Hawaii, stay at Moana Surfrider & enjoy the holiday of a lifetime.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is s great place right on Waikiki BeachThe view of Diamond Head was spectacular. We sat outside at the beach bar and had a few drinks..the Mango Daiquiri was excellent.Our waitress Shantel couldn't have been better!We scoped out the menu..but it was very over priced for us.Go there for the view and atmosphere..live music. But consider eating elsewhere if you aren't rich!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana is the oldest hotel on Waikiki. It was beautifully restored a few years ago. The setting is spectacular.We decided to have lunch under the ancient Banyan Tree on the beachside terrace. It was absolutely beautiful. We ordered Cesar Salad with grilled chicken. ($24) After a long wait, the salads arrive in a bowl that was unstable and kept tipping one way or the other. The greens were ok, the croutons were hard as rocks and the chicken was in a perforated slab thrown on top. Every time you tried to cut it the bowl would tip over. The chicken was bland and rubbery.All in all, while the setting and the hotel itself were spectacular, the food hardly matched. Glad we went, but disappointed that Westin didn’t make the extra effort in the kitchen so that their cuisine is worthy of this grand and elegant hotel and it’s extraordinarily setting.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was on vacation with my family and friends and we went to the Moana Surfrider to watch the hula dancers and band. We had some drinks and appetizers which were very nice, a little expensive but that’s OK. The problem was halfway through our food we noticed the birds right next to our table eating out of the bins with the dirty plates. We all found this rather disgusting and a white pigeon flew over the table and left his mark if you know what I mean. It ruined the whole experience especially when we saw the birds near the water pitchers figuring if they got thirsty that’s where they would go. Didn’t seem like anyone cared other than our table. We are all animal friendly but when you’re eating and drinking the last thing you want is bird poop anywhere near your food and drink. For an exclusive hotel this seems unacceptable!!! We all agreed that we would rather go to Duke’s where we had been the previous day and didn’t have a bird problem. I would not recommend this restaurant after our experience.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place is awesome. My hubby has always wanted to stay even if it was for only one night. It was on his bucket list. If or when we go back we will stay here a little longer. It maybe a little pricey but well worth it. So if you want splurge a little i would go for it. loved it

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Currently staying at the Westin Moana and completely disappointed with the rooms and service. Let me start with the positives - absolutely gorgeous entrance and beautiful pool. The general staff is great and both the reception and housekeeping have been friendly. The club room that offers free breakfast and light bites in the evening is a nice touch - the "snacks" were not the greatest, but the staff kept refilling on wine (which was a nice gesture). For breakfast - for platinum members, just get the breakfast at the Veranda as your amenity gift, since the lounge breakfast looks like what you would get in an airport lounge. The negatives - read the reviews below before you book. The minute we arrived, we were completely overlooked. The valet had to be flagged down to help us and his response was how many bags do we have while talking to other guests. No welcome, no leis. I am a platinum member and received no upgrade - totally fine, since they are overbooked, but we also received the lowest floor and smallest room for our category. The banyan rooms are in the historic building and nice, but incredibly small (coming from an NYC resident) and honestly look like you are staying at at the Courtyard by Marriott. Not the cleanest, no amenities in the bathroom, ton of noise regardless where you stay and honestly can barely move. For the "guest relations" manager to email us ahead of time is almost a waste - at least attempt to find reasonable rooms for your elite members since you know ahead of time we are arriving. Also never even heard from anyone during our stay - usually at least get a note from the guest relations manager at most Marriott hotels I have stayed at. It was interesting to see this was not the case just for us - upon check-in the supervisor told another guest if he did not like his room (which was next to the elevator), he was happy to help him check out. Clearly they have issues with service and consideration at this hotel. Lastly, the pool has literally 20 chairs and its like the pool-chair hunger games trying to find a place to lay down. How this hotel attempts to charge a resort fee for pretty much nothing is hard to understand. We would definitely not return here and sadly the last part of my husbands birthday trip was a disappointment - definitely needs to be looked at in terms of their star rating and service.
user_name:
sbgass86
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My first time in Hawaii was and experience I will always remember. I am so glad we chose this hotel. It is reasonably priced and located near the main strip. The staff is friendly and I look forward to staying there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for two nights. The hotel has a nice feel. Kind of like you are at Disneyland but in Hawaii. Lots of comfortable places to sit and people/view watch. Lots of action. The rooms are very small and can be loud. We are Platinum Elite and had a front view of the ocean.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked 4-nights here with my husband and our 3 young children upon the advice that the Moana Surfrider was one of the nicest hotels in Oahu. On the surface, yes - it is a gorgeous hotel and its location right on Waikiki beach and in the centre of the strip is immaculate. However, the perks, in my opinion, end there.Upon arriving with at least 12 pieces of luggage, a pram and toddler and the rest of my family, the bell hops completely overlooked us at the front door - they were more pre-occupied with taking photos of the bridesmaids at a wedding that was happening there. And once inside, at least another two bell hops walked straight past us without offering to assist. We took all the luggage up to the room ourselves!We had an ocean front room which had lovely views of the beach, but the air conditioning was so loud, we couldn't have it on at night which made for restless sleeps all round. The walls were also paper thin - I heard someone having a coughing attack every night in the room next door. Also, for such a big hotel - the pool is tiny and basic.I am not one to complain and I am more than happy to pay for a luxury hotel, but I would expect the service and amenities to match the price tag. After staying at the Hyatt Regency in Maui immediately prior which came with a proper island welcome with leis and loads of family-friendly facilities etc, Moana felt cold and unwelcoming with unhappy and unfriendly staff. I won't be staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 4 nights in the older part of the hotel and enjoyed our visit. Right on the beach and in the middle of Waikiki. Nice room and the street noise did not bother us too much but it was evident each night. Drinks are expensive but the setting is great and the entertainment good too. Our only gripe was trying to get a deck chair near the pool which we were never able to do. On most occasions the chairs were vacant for hours but had been "claimed" by other guests or visitors with a towel or shopping bag. 40-50 deck chairs, a dozen people in the pool and and many chairs unoccupied but "claimed", management needs to look into this.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is a wonderful hotel sitting right on the Pacific Ocean. Very friendly staff. The only draw back we experienced was the Beach Club having the same things out everyday, I think Westin Hotels could do a much better job at this,

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked out today after 2 weeks! Had a great time in Hawaii! The hotel is extremely beautiful! However with this being our 3rd trip we can honestly say that we will never stay at this resort again! Horrible service from front desk! Thank goodness they did not ask how my wife how our stay was! We never received our leis. They did not know how to help with basic WiFi connection when we called down. Pool closes at 6 pm and they basically chase you out at 5:30 pm! Do not stay in room at street side! You will here street performer bright and early every morning and late into evening singing the same songs every day! They say you can get a GoPro for the day however, that is if the AT&T desk in hotel across the street decides they will have someone there between 8:30 - 5 pm. We went multiple times throughout the two weeks with no one there!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very good hotel. Our check in was pleasant and speedy. I asked to upgrade to a tower room and was accommodated. My room had a fantastic view and spacious lanai. The room itself was good size, clean and comfortable. Elevators worked hard to get everyone up and down, sometimes they took a few minutes. Restaurant was good, a little pricey, but best views in Waikiki. Music everyday and night at the banyan court. Pool is average size for that area and well maintained. However, the pool closes every night at 6 pm!?!? WAY too early. Room service was hit and miss. Sometimes it was well done, sometimes I could have been better. Lanai was never looked at in the nine days we were there. Bird poop on railing and coffee spot on lanai table was there upon arrival, and remained there day after day until I cleaned it myself. Valet parking was efficient and expensive (like most Waikiki resorts). Location of hotel on Waikiki is perfect. Can’t wait to go back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a beautiful stay for our wedding & honeymoon, beginning with Chris at the front-desk who took great patience in helping us decide on a room for our longterm stay; he is super friendly and helpful, instantly kicking off a great stay. Rachel (Food & Beverage Coordinator) helped us be in touch with various key players to ensure our and our guests stay + wedding dinner went off without a glitch. Rachel is amazing and our entire wedding plan successes are due to her care & initiatives to us. Nadine (The Beach Bar - Assistant Manager) helped with the entirety of reserving a section for our wedding party, pre-ordering drinks & food, and allowing one of our young guests play her ukelele on stage for our first dance (which was so special to us). The entire Beach Bar staff is amazing throughout our trip (our guests shared the same sentiment) and we can't be more comfortable or felt taken cared of. Chris (Guest Services Managers) also was kind in answering so many emails to assure us and our guests received special attention for the Moana Surfrider. We are so pleased and grateful for our 11-day wedding / honeymoon stay.I also love the daily morning outdoor yoga that is offered free to guests; we witness double rainbows during one session!The only blemish is how incredibly crowded this resort can be, where vying for a chair can be a hustle. The grounds are beautiful thus frequented by both guests and the public.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic hotel right on Wakakki Beach! Just beautiful and worth the stay. Pay the extra for the access to the beach club. Great continental breakfast, evening appetizers with wine and beer, afternoon snacks and a nice place to relax if your room isn’t ready yet. Friendly staff and lovely rooms.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: the service from all the hotel personnel (besides the front desk) has been amazing..the front desk; not so much! i should have received a nicer room with my status..and if I was willing to pay additional $200 per night, it was mine...but, i am not willing to pay for an upgrade when i should have received it with my titanium status...the front desk isn't very truthful with all the facts...the initial gal told me they only have 3 jr suites with my level and they were all taken? then said i could have a suite but had to pay $200 extra per night. I even wrote email to GM to let him know of my disappointment...that was on sat...still no response..is it because they don't care?

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at The Moana in March 2019. Our rooms were excellent. Clean, comfortable and quiet. Good dining in the hotel. Interesting presentation of hotel history. The staff was very helpful. Convenient to walking in Waikiki and exploring the area. We have been coming here for many years and will continue to do so.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed here as part of our Labor(less) Day Holiday escape. The location was ideal for us, right on the beach and close to restaurants and shopping. The facility is majestic and very charming with Hawaiian touches. Our room had a beautiful ocean view and our king bed was very comfortable. We fell asleep with the sound of the waves through our open balcony door. The bathroom was a nice size with an electronic bidet which was a nice touch. Although I prefer a shower over a shower/bath combination, the water pressure was good.Here are a few cons that made me deduct one star:- Unpleasant front desk staff. It’s as if they were programmed to say no to every request with no apologies. No “how was your stay” or any genuine concern or appreciation for being us being a guest or loyal Marriott Bonvoy elite members.-One of the older female pool towel staff was hovering over the complimentary beverage container/dispenser near the counter and embarrassed a guest when he used a regular paper cup instead of the flimsy cone cups they offered. She said something to the effect of use the cone cups instead so others can try the beverage too. The paper cup he was attempting to use was sturdier than the cone cups and wasn’t going to fill his cup too much more than the cone cup. She made it seem like he was being greedy by using a better receptacle. Regardless, the bland watered down juice/beverage was part of the high Resort Fee the hotel charges and not really complimentary. They need to make the beverages taste better, replenish as necessary and give guests better and environmentally friendly cups.-The Breakfast Buffet really needs improvement especially at the $38 per person price point. Duke’s buffet is much better for $18 per person.- Change the faded blue umbrellas at the beach! They’re an eyesore for such a majestic property.We would consider returning here overall because of the location and room but the service and other areas noted above will need to improve.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Historical, clean, great rooms. Worth the price!You are greeted with a scent which will bring a smile to your face. The front desk staff are knowledgeable and friendly. Concierge was helpful, probably the only person I found deficient at the hotel. Asked where to find some fresh flowers and was sent the wrong direction.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This beautiful plantation-style hotel right on the beach in Waikiki is comfortable and inviting. If you can, get an oceanfront room in the original building, and peer at the gorgeous ocean from your bed.The back veranda is wonderful. The bar serves up some delicious mai-tais, and great conversation!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My daughter and I spent 5 days in a partial oceanview room with 2 queen beds. Very spacious and comfortable. Right in the middle of all Waikiki has to offer, shopping, restaurants and the beach. Loved people watching from the front porch sitting in the rocking chairs. Lounge chairs in the shade at the pool were at a premium and you did have to get there early to snag one. Unfortunately pool was closed for 5-6 hours one day due to child without a swim diaper!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The epitome of aloha spirit. The location can’t be beat, it is within walking distance to superb shopping and dining experiences. Hotel guests can avail of private beach access which is easily accessible from the hotel’s beach bar, veranda and swimming pool. The staff are very professional; courteous, patient, sends good vibes and treat you like you’re ohana. From the lei greeters, valet service, bellman, porters, réception/front desk/guest services, pool attendants, custodian, they all exemplified what aloha is about. Mahalo for the wonderful experience!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The old queen of Waikiki is a wonderful old hotel full of character and grace. Wonderful staff was SO helpful, especially Crystal. Beautiful view from the balcony, great breakfast restaurant on premises. $$$$ so bring your money and a fresh credit card. If you want to spend the money it is THE place to stay on Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my 3rd time @ the Moana Surfrider. I love this hotel. I stayed at the historical banyan wing and it’s the way to go. It’s such a pretty place with great history. The service is extraordinary, Gloria at the beach desk is a delight. Really cares for the confort of guests and really friendly. I’d like to ask Management if they have considered changing the rental chairs on the beach. They’re a bit old & uncomfortable. Other hotels around Waikiki have other chairs that can be hosed down and the person sitting doesn’t fall through...just a thought...other than that this place is top notch! Will do another staycation here soon!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A week in Heaven!!! That is how I would call my stay at Moana SurfriderI stayed in the tower, in a room with ocean view. Hotel location is incredibly good, close to anything you can think of: beach, restaurants, shopping, even the trolley stops in front of the hotel. You do not need to rent a car, unless planning to roam the island. My experience, from check in to check out, was amazing. Next year I’ll be back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had lunch with friends. Sumptuous meal. Try their poke nachos and chicken wings. You wont go wrong. Great staff of Filipinos! The place is very relaxing. Nice place to unwind and grab a beer as well. Will go back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a magical time at the Moana! Staff is incredible. From check in to check out Sam at front desk was so accommodating. And Kylie and Harry at the beach bar are always rock stars with the best service. Give these employees a complimentary spa day at the beautiful Moana lani spa! They deserve it☺️Mahalo! Vannessa

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: In summary this hotel is very price for what you get. With the exception of the location everything is average. Location is very good, right on the beach with a beautiful lobby. The rest is really nothing much. Rooms are small. The AC is noisy and doesn’t really get the room cooled very well. As a general comment it is very warm on this hotel. It seems like there is no air conditioning in the hallways. I had dinner in the main restaurant called beach house. Again location very nice, outside on terrace. But the food was average at best while the price was very high. I would only recommend to stay here because of location.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in 4 great hotels on my last trip to Hawaii but the Moana Surfrider was my favorite.It is the oldest and in my opinion the grandest of the large hotels in Waikiki Beach. Although it is a historic building, the grounds are in excellent condition and the room is top notch (with a balcony with great views).For Marriott members with status, there is a lounge that serves complimentary breakfast and wine in the evening, which will save you a lot of money considering Waikiki prices.It is expensive like all other hotels in Hawaii but it is worth the splurge.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We just arrived at the hotel and the rooms are nothing like what you see in the pictures advertised by the hotel.The rooms are small and very dark - just a window you can’t see anything through.Also, the rooms are not clean. We are so disappointed because we were expecting a luxury hotel and this is a sort of hostel.They don’t even offer you alternatives or ways of getting a refund.Very bad experience, strongly not suggested.
user_name:
rossanab261
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana for 4 days in August 2019, Tower, partial ocean view. 13th Room with king-bed large, quiet. Tower (ca 1969), has an eccentric room layout with the small closet, safe are inside the bathroom with the sink, toilet and shower. This is inconvenient,for a beach hotel. Tower needs update...few plugs...no USB...Wi-Fi coverage spotty. Bed comfortable but soft mattress...AC not up the job in hot/humid weather: Maxed-out but room temps mid-day ~ 75, only ~70 at night. Tower view from odd-numbered rooms dominated by adj. Outrigger tower, with no privacy on the balcony. Higher room-#'s offer a better view than lower. Even-numbered rooms should afford a vastly superior view.   The Beach Club is great if you have access...good breakfast (bacon, eggs,...) and appetizers in the late afternoon (wine, cheese,...)....Basic munchies, fruit, beverages all the time. Very helpful and friendly staff. Excellent, central location within Waikiki, friendly staff (though the front-desk is occasionally understaffed)...Beautiful grounds, especially the Banyan Court & Pool, which is small but fine for kids. (Per current custom, all the lounge chairs are "reserved" with towels by mid-morning, but mostly empty throughout the day.) The Beachside Bar is a lovely place to relax with a decent Mai Tai, and just a few steps from the pool or beach.Be ready to pay roughly $ 110/night for taxes + "resort-fee", plus $ 45/night for valet Parking (Self-parking is $ 35/night, but 1/2-block away)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for four nights at the Westin Moana Surfrider and found it to be a solid choice in a great location. One of the negatives was the check-in process which was slow and a bit disorganized. Our room (Tower Ocean Suite) was spacious and had a great view. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki and has direct access to the beach which was convenient. However, the hotel’s pool is very small and crowded. We had access to the Beach Club Lounge which had a reasonably good selection for breakfast but offered very limited food the rest of the day as compared to other club lounges that we have been in. Overall though a pleasant stay.
user_name:
andrewPL99
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was great, reasonably priced and got upgraded to a room with an ocean view for $50/night (disclosure: Marriott Gold). The pool and beach are wonderful but you’ll pay resort prices. Staff was exceptional and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When we arrived we were greeted on the steps with a lei by lovely staff. Check in was easy and we were able to get a quiet room facing the pool. The room was clean and spacious. The location on the beach is fabulous (even though the beach is extremely busy, but as we expected). We opted in for the breakfast included and the buffet was definitely worth it. At breakfast, we were seated beside the beach for a beautiful view and breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We can't say enough about our 2 night stay at the Moana Surfrider. However, a few days after we left the hotel we noticed a charge on our credit card for $112 CAD (about $85 USD), I called to inquire thinking we had missed something during check out or were inadvertently charged by mistake. Well, to our surprise, there is a $40+ resort fee charged to all rooms per night. We spoke with the hotel representative (Todd) he assured me this would have been listed on our confirmation. It was not. After he reviewed our confirmation, he agreed it was a miscommunication and his supervisor agreed to waive the resort fee for one night. Well, it has been 3 weeks since we left the Moana Surfrider and over 2 weeks since talking with the hotel. We still have NOT been refunded the resort fee. If there is always a resort fee, include it in the hotel cost from the beginning. Hidden costs after the fact is very shady. It certainly tainted our great experience at the hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has the best location on Waikiki. It is neAr the best activities and restaurants. The beach is amazing. Rooms are very good in the tower. My only improvement would be to add some improvements to bathroom. Service is amazing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I cannot be more grateful for the amazing stay we just had at the Moana Surfrider. My family and I were only there for 2 nights but it was the most amazing stay. Josh at the front desk was there very early in the morning and he was just a delight to be greeted by and helped us out so much! Thank you Josh! The entire staff was very helpful and always accommodating. The grounds are breath taking and now definitely our favorite resort on Oahu. The convenience to the city life while being tucked away in our own little paradise was just priceless. Thank you Moana Surfrider!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Definitely being picky, but given I have the highest level of status (Ambassador) with Marriott Bonvoy, it might be even more inconvenient for others. Not sure the point of mobile check in when it is done days before hand and at a reasonable time of 2pm, but still sitting here over an hour later longingly looking the beach/water others are enjoying. Also found out at check in the gym (which is a key factor for me in making reservations) is under renovation, but there was no note of that when booking the hotel and of course the resort fee is still charged in full. Only in town for a bit on business, but not a great welcome and still waiting on the room...now 90 minutes after the mobile check in time. Frequent travelers may want to look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Forty years ago november 1979 :))Such a lovely room overlooking to the sea great barbecue party at the back garden with a lovely music...coppa cabana...yes that was our memory..Wish all newly married couples to visit Waikiki...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We 'moved' to this hotel because our original booking was very disappointing. This hotel is beautiful, the staff is pleasant and helpful and the food is good. A 4 not a 5 because the bed was not comfortable (unusual for a Westin) and the coffee pot and hairdryer really should be updated. But Moana Surfrider is probably the nicest hotel on Waikiki Beach. I especially liked that I could reserve an umbrella and chairs for the day ($$) - best to do it at least a day ahead of time. Then you are assured you have a spot all day even if you come and go.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Worst experience among my 600 stays with SPG and Marriott, Even I am an ambassdor of Marriott/SPG, I have to say this. 1) the staff was rude and unprofessional; 2) the housing keeping hardly cleaned the room and tried to enter without my permission; 3) the very loud false alarm happened 6 times at 5am and woke up my families for multiple times, and there is no apology at all. Definitely avoid this hotel. There are enough great resorts nearby to choose. 这是我遇到的最差的SPG/万豪酒店了。做为一个大使级的万豪会员都要劝大家绝对不要来。1）前台粗鲁和不专业。2）打扫房间不干净，还在为不允许的情况下进入。3）更糟的是半夜5点警报多次错误响起，吵醒我们很多次

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We’ve stayed several times at the Moana and have been very happy, but this last time was exceptional due to the excellent customer service from Joseph at the front desk. It was a very busy time but he went above and beyond, our room was great- beautiful view and it made it so nice and relaxing. This hotel is right on the beach, close to all the restaurants and shops. We look forward to returning as soon as possible!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We love Waikiki but it is getting seriously expensive Don’t forget to add tourist tax and the $38 daily “ resort fee” to whatever price you get for the room. Add $60 a day to hire a chair ( or get to your free poollounger by 6 am they are so scarce ) . So Summary - expensive but sometimes you just gotta pay as ( if you like packed beaches, and people watching and glorious views ) the hotel is beautiful

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beware of staying at this hotel, as I now fear for my safety here. At around 10:30pm this evening, an alarm went off throughout the entire hotel saying there has been an emergency in the hotel, and everyone must evacuate. The entire hotel is leaving their rooms, and when we get downstairs, no one has any idea what’s going on. Everyone is panicking, concerned as to what was going on, and the staff had no idea that there was an alarm going off. Their response was simply “it must be a false alarm.” Not at all reassuring. When many people begin asking to hear from a manager or security to let us know if we’re ok, no one would come. The staff begins yelling at us, showing no empathy, or even trying to see what the situation is. After finally returning to my room, I called BonVoy to see if they can help me get an explanation of what’s going on, and if we’re safe. They reached out to the hotel, but the message they relayed back to me was “they are changing shifts right now, and will get back to you in 5 minutes or tomorrow morning.” It has now been over 20 minutes, and no one has reached back out to me from the hotel to tell me what’s going on.This is UNACCEPTABLE, and makes me fear for my safety in the case that there may be a real emergency. The staff here doesn’t seem to be able to handle these situations. The service is awful in that no one can answer my questions, or even get back to me to tell me what’s going on.I do NOT recommend this hotel, and I don’t recommend anyone to stay here. Your safety and concerns do not matter to the staff here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Waikiki fantastic. People great. Great location. Some hotel staff great, some below average. But Very big hotel and like a zoo. You will have to downstairs at 6.45 am to get any remote chance of a sun bed. So badly organised. If you are happy to spend your holiday in amount at 6.30 am it’s the place for you. Management don’t seem to care about this fundamental structural error. Pool closes around 6. Bar closes at 10.30. But staff clear up at around 10. If you like the big busy zoo great. If you want luxury, avoid.Ps. 9.30 Beach bar has run out of the best beers. Again. How does that really happen or can they not be bothered to change the barrel ? You decide. PPs . Concierge is outstanding. Management need to address the basics.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
