review_body: Had such a great visit, was treated beyond expectations with josh at the front desk! He goes over and beyond for his guest made us feel very special and we will definitely be back again! Thank you Josh !!! -Gina

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have been coming to the Moana Surfrider for many, many years and this little gem has not lost its glow considering it’s more than one hundred years old. The charm is incomparable! From the majestic columns and inviting rocking chairs at the front of the hotel, to the airy and beautiful lobby and sitting areas, then continue to walk past the veranda to the infamous Banyan Tree, this place is truly magical. We love where the hotel sits! We enjoy what Waikiki beach has to offer. Our room was on the 15th floor overlooking the Diamond head and of course ocean view! What a treat! You wake up to the sound of the waves inviting you to come play and the view is just spectacular and breathtaking. A shout out to the bellman and valet people like Wayne, John, Al, Frank (I cannot recall the others’ names) they were friendly, informative, professional and they were way better than our car navigation and when we asked where they went as locals to eat, they were right on! These frontline guys are the mouth of the beast and they set the time of your stay. We thank you! We also enjoyed the service of the pool guy Reyn and the Beach cafe waiters Will and Cody. All of you guys are awesome! We will be back soon, if not sooner! Mahalo

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is right on Waikiki Beach. A lovely old hotel with all of the modern amenities. We stayed in a tower room with a view of the beach and Diamond Head. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We loved the Beach Bar. Ate lunch there every day. Plenty of shopping and restaurants along Kalakaua Ave. Definitely recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed for 5 nights. The hotel has an open air ground floor that blends well with beach and street. It has a historic feel. The club lounge had great food and views. My room was a corner street view room, a little noisy with the crowds at night, but it added to the fun atmosphere. Sometime after 1030 pm the crowds died off.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is beautiful and filled with historic features. Back of the hotel is Waikiki Beach. Front of the hotel is the main road where all the shops and restaurants are. You can’t beat the location. From check-in to check-out, every staff we encountered was professional and helpful. We ran into a glitch with the airport shuttle service when we were leaving. The hotel valet staff went above and beyond their duties to help remedy the situation. We were amazed by their level of service. Can’t wait to go back someday.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed 5 nights at Moana Surfrider. We were greeted at the desk by Irene who was professional, kind, listened to our preferences and set the Aloha tone for our trip. She was able to book us a room perfect for us. At the oceanview Veranda restaurant, we enjoyed the breakfast buffet daily which had a nice variety including an omelet station. We only tried a burger at the bar restaurant which was okay and ate elsewhere for our other meals (including eating at well-known Duke's nextdoor). The offered daily yoga classes were great- yoga by the beach cant be beat! Waikiki beach is very busy, so we quickly learned to take advantage of reserving umbrellas ($$) for our beachtime. We definitely will return to Moana Surfrider and the wonderful staff!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Love the Moana Surfrider!! Top notch property. The staff made us feel very welcome. The guest services manager Chris went out of his way to make sure that everything was perfect for our 10 day stay. The poolside hosts Hulali, Lee, Gloria and Mo made our stay very memorable, they made us feel like family. We will definitely be coming back here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Historic, beautiful, on the beach. Our room (224 Banyan wing) had a superb view of the ocean (front window) and Diamond Head (side window) - very clean and comfortable, but somewhat small. Time from our room on second floor to go downstairs to main lobby/outside eating area/patio was just a few minute walk (we like to be close to the main areas). Outside the hotel, we could walk to many restaurants and shops. The breakfast buffet (included in our package) was excellent! Many choices, and a few new choices each day. Service at breakfast was very good, and we could see the ocean from where we ate breakfast. Bartender service at the outside bar was also good (and so were the Mai Tai!). The ABC store across the street was convenient. Also had a good laundry room. Check in line was rather long, but not terrible. Service in the patio area was sporadic - a few times we sat at a table on the patio (for drinks & dinner) and never got served, so we went elsewhere. But another few times we sat down and had great service.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: In interest of full disclosure I was an SPG platinum lifer and the program was hands down better than Marriott’s BonVoy so it’s been an adjustment to get a lot less for your loyalty. I knew the loyalty program was not as good but I was hoping new ownership would not change the service at some of my favorite hotels like the Moana Surfrider which we have been coming to for over a decade. The long time staff are still there and offering great service, Gloria and team at the pool and beach, Nancy at the snack bar and the friendly staff in the Beach Club. But all of the family observed changes that were subtle but definitely noticeable. They are now selling timeshares in the tower elevator lobby, the focus seems more on selling real estate than hospitality. Prices have gone up for the rooms and certain amenities like the Beach Club, but they are offering less. In the Beach Club they have cut out simple conveniences at breakfast like hard boiled eggs and salads. In the evening, they no longer offer a warm protein. The edamame is cold and for a snacks they offer barely edible, slimey cold cuts. It reminds me of a badly executed airport lounge rather than what should be a nice club room at the hotel. I hope they will reconsider cutting corners this way, the Moana and it’s guests deserve better.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved this experience of sitting outside under umbrellas but almost on the beach. We could have gone to the upmarket restaurant but chose this, great music and artist singing, cool atmosphere and fabulous food and drinks. Well priced

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our 3 days stay at Moana Surfrider recently to attend a wedding. The room that we stayed at was facing Diamond head, the pool and the beach. The housekeeper that was looking after our room was Cynthia Chavez, everything in the room was done well. She was friendly and asked us if there was anything else that we needed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We travel at least once a year to Hawaii and always stay at the Moana Surfrider.It's a lovely property but I have to write that I have experienced poor customer service on several occasions. It's usually the reservations team or the concierge team.There is an attitude of what appears to be a lack of helpfulness and a somewhat dismissive nature.For example, I just called to confirm an upcoming reservation for a room in the Tower section.It's a Tower Premier Ocean View Room and we always try to get the same room.When I asked if that room was available ( I had made that request when I booked a few months ago), I was told flatly, "No". I understand. This is not a problem. It was just an inquiry without attitude. When I asked if rooms were available on the same floor I was told flatly again, "No" She then added, "You are traveling at a busy time and you'll have to take what you get."There was no, "great to have you back and we'll see what we can do" etcIt's that delivery that doesn't sit well at all. There was no indication that she would do her best and/or let the front desk know etc. It was just a non-helpful and non-caring reply. They probably don't need to business but they don't have to act like it.It's time for re-training. At least fake it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I attended a conference. I stayed in a Tower City view room. The location is excellent. You will not be disappointed with this hotel. I had minor complaints that were addressed quickly by the management.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I came here in 1992 and always wanted to come back. We finally made it here again this year and it is so we remembered it to be. Full of old Victorian charm, opened in 1901, this hotel is one of the few right on Waikiki Beach. The courtyard is centered around a huge banyan tree planted in 1885. Spend the day on the beach, have a drink at the beach bar under the banyan tree, go out to dinner and end the day with a night cap under the banyan tree. That's paradise. Repeat as many times as possible. I how it's not another 27 years before we come back again

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed two weeks, lovely welcome. Can't beat the location. Hotel full of character and history. Biggest strength being the staff, especially Nathan and Tim - thank you for our lovely breakfasts. Sorry don't know all the names, including the lady on reception in the restaurant; who gave us a big cuddle when leaving. Fruit as it should taste, freshly cooked and you can't beat sitting outside; looking out onto the sea. Enjoyed lunch many days at the Beach Cafe. Spacious room, good bathroom. Staff had been there many years, excellent hotel receptionist, sorry don't know his name, worked for 30 years, lady working at the beach cafe 23 years (although first talking to us, she thought 24 years!); just so they may recognise us! The longest serving employee 50 years, we were only told about him, didn't have the opportunity to meet him. Very different to the UK! Our stay was not all perfect but the hotel compensated us. This included a noisy room, when booking avoid the road side of the Tower. Outside to eat our breakfast was closed on two occasions including my husband's birthday, told due to lack of staff. Third stay for me, first for my family, they now understand why for all these years, I only wanted to return to this hotel and why Honolulu. :-) It's wonderful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fabulous 5 day stay at the Moana Surfrider in June 2019. 4th time staying at this incredible property. The staff is amazing! Lee at the beach desk, Karen in the Beach Club, Janet in housekeeping and Haley at the front desk. We were treated like Ohana - family. Nice room in the tower overlooking the historic Banyan Tree with great views of Waikiki Beach and Diamondhead. Got chairs and umbrella each day. Great stretch of Waikiki Beach. Beach Club Lounge offerings were outstanding - Breakfast, all-day snacks, beverages and evening happy hour. The Moana Surfrider is the place to stay in Honolulu!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is a great hotel right on the beautiful beaches of Waikiki! Likely the nicest Westin property in Honolulu, the service, the views, and the accommodations are top notch. Take the time to walk around the hotel and look at all the historical aspects of this little piece of Hawaiian history. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location on Waikiki Beach. The bathroom in the historic wing is small as has been noted but we like the original hotel and how it has been incorporated in to the newer wings of the property. The Staff is very nice (including the housekeepers Cecilia and Cherry Mae who were very helpful and accommodating).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Westin offers a bland, cookie-cutter experience in the heart of Waikiki. The property has enormous potential, but is let down by rote service and poor attention to detail.The Westin offers a bland, cookie-cutter stay in the heart of Waikiki. The enormous potential of a historic property in a prime location is let down by lackluster service and poor attention to detail.Location: The Moana was the first big resort hotel on Waikiki, and the original building dates to the early 20th century. Additions, including a high-rise tower, have since expanded the property. The hotel is in the middle of Waikiki’s retail and entertainment strip, and on a good - if very crowded - stretch of beach.Rooms: We stayed in the old wing. Note that the rooms and bathrooms are quite small. The door could barely open without hitting the bed, and the king-sized bed and our luggage took up almost all of the floor space. We didn’t have a balcony or ocean view. If you're on the tower side of the old building, you’re very close to the balconies of the tower rooms, and have a view of nothing except the tower. Anyone sensitive to noise should avoid the inland side of the hotel, which is subject to noise from traffic and street performers. Food and amenities: The pool is small, and packed. We didn’t eat at the hotel. Service for drinks at the beachside cafe was adequate. There’s an interesting exhibition on the hotel’s history on the second floor of the main building.Service: Here’s where the hotel underperforms. Laden with luggage, we walked into the old building and searched in vain for anyone who could tell us where to find check-in. Check-in itself is delineated by a Vegas-style rope line, an indication that you’re going to be processed, rather than welcomed - and that’s exactly what happened. After waiting in line, the clerk greeted me with “Just wait a second” as she scanned her computer. Perhaps it’s a hangover from the Starwood acquisition, but it took a long time for the clerk to find my Bonvoy information.I was on a business trip (granted, not the hotel’s typical demographic!) and needed to shine my shoes. When I asked if there was shoe-shine service, I was told yes, and then someone arrived at the room - not to pick up the shoes, but to give me shoe polish (in the wrong color). Housekeeping was spotty (see photo of the A/C vent in the room). Twice, the soap dispensers were empty in the lobby restroom. It’s trivial, but I had to laugh when the drink on offer in the lobby was marked with a card reading “guava elixer” - even details like spelling seem to be beyond this place.Pick the Westin if you want an adequate stay and the sense that you’re another tick on Marriott’s tally. Otherwise, look around for a property that offers better value for money and starts with a focus on the guest.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For our first trip to Hawaii my husband and I were lucky to book Moana Surfrider for our 7 night stay as it was last minute. From the moment we arrived to our last day was truly amazing! This place is beautiful from the entrance lobby, amazing smell, fruit infused water containers for thirsty beach goers, BANYAN Tree, and comfy beds! The location is perfect and close to everything; the beach, restaurants, snorkeling, surfing and so much more! PLUS, the private beach lounges available for guests is in the BEST location in Waikiki! While you lounge on the beach, you can go to the beach cafe in this hotel which serves up the biggest acai bowl in the area for your buck or have lunch/dinner beachfront at the restaurant! The best part of all was the people and ambiance of this hotel. We met MO and LEE who accommodated us at the beach/pool lounge area and made us feel like family during our visit. Mo and Lee were the friendliest and always greeted us with the 'Aloha' spirit which made us really fall in love with Hawaii, especially the Moana Surfrider! We can't say enough about this place, you REALLY have to experience it for yourselves! We can't wait to go back next year to our second home, the Moana Surfrider!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in 4 different hotels on this trip and this was my favorite. The old building has been beautifully redone. The service was great. The pool and beach were small but not bad for being in the city.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I would love to give a special thank you to Ms. Maria for the most wonderful facial I’ve ever gotten I definitely recommend her, she’s very sweet and kid and all around a good person with an amazing personality. Her facial made my skin glow and feel so soft, getting all the dirt out and getting that deep clean in my skin. I would also like to thank Ms. Teresa for the lovely pedicure, she has magic hands my toes look amazing. I’m not going to anyone else to get my toes done, for the short time I was there I got to know the great person Teresa is, I got some amazing life changing advise. This was just an amazing experience I feel everyone should go to this spa it’s so wonderful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: An exceptional property that stands apart from all other hotels in Honolulu. Elegant and well preserved. Not surprisingly, the rooms do vary in size and comfort. The veranda area is lovely and worth a visit even if not staying at the property. Parking is tight and valet seems like a must. Immediately next to the main tea of Waikiki Beach. Hotel can and does accommodate many foreign visitors, mostly notably from Japan, with an occasional wedding party in the lobby.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is the oldest hotel on Waikiki and consists of 3 wings. The historic wing in the center is on the national register of historic places and is breathtaking. When you arrive it looks like an old Hawaiin Plantation with the White columns. Because its a historic hotel, nothing can really be changed that would change the structure, and that would include soundproofing on the windows. The windows still operate on a pully system and for those who enjoy old historic hotels from yesteryear with modern amenities (but very small rooms), then this is the building to pick. The historic wing reminds me of the Hotel Nationale in Havana or the Saratoga and everything has been beautifully preserved. However, because the hotel is located in the "Times Square" of Hawaii, it is very busy outside with a lot of noise and street performers. If the noise bothers you, do not book this wing, ask for the more modern tower. We stayed in the historic section 1 night and the manager graciously moved my entire family (3 rooms) over to the quieter and more modern tower for the remainder of our stay. The tower rooms are larger with lanais but will be a little more $$ to book but worth it. We are adventure travelers so most of our activities happened outside the resort and in the mountains or at sea, but when we arrived back late afternoon for the breathtaking sunsets, we were always greeted by the friendly valet and bellmen by our last name... nice touch. The hotel restaurant for dinner was very good, but quite expensive (typical for Waikiki) and I recommend the tasting menu. (If you want something more authentic the venture out of the hotel). A grand banyan tree dominates the outside sitting area by the beach and during the entire day there's a Hawaiian band playing music with a hula dancer. The pool is too small to accommodate the hotel size and the beach is very crowded. Remember that all beaches are public places and hotel guests from other hotels cannot be prevented from using the beach behind this centrally located hotel so it is crowded out there. The hotel however, does have a small section reserved for their guests. The surfing behind the hotel was quite good and you can rent surfboards and paddleboards. The beach is much smaller than last time we visited as there appears to be a lot of beach erosion which is happening everywhere because of the rising seas (we are from Miami so we are aware of it). Overall a solid 4 stars. Compliments to the entire staff and manager for such a wonderful stay. The manager was probably the most professional I have dealt with over the years and Westin is lucky to have this gentleman running this resort.
user_name:
David L
Davie, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is very clean and has some special qualities, don't get me wrong, great location, beautiful beach and lots of dining and shopping options. The pool area has maybe 30 lounge chairs so unless you are in line at 6am don't count on a chair leave alone shade. The beach chairs are $30 per chair and booked a day in advance. Mainly you will be in the sun and lay a towel on the beach. They cannot accommodate the hotels capacity at the pool/beach. I saw employees getting yelled at all day due to no room for people. The restaurant books up for dinner so make a reservation do not plan on walking up. I reserved a double queen which was not available upon check in so they rolled an extra bed into the room. Do not plan on a relaxing beach or pool vacation at Moana.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Upon my check into my room I discovered 4-5 of these bugs crawling on the box spring when I lifted up the bed skirt. Front desk was able to give me a new room, but still not what you would expect at a “resort”. Disappointed Marriott member.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We Stayed 12 nights at Moana Surfrider Resort & truely experienced "The 1st Lady of Waikiki"!!, displaying Grand Victorian Elegance with Modern Resort amenities. Yes, it is perfectly located in the Heart of Waikiki, shopping, restaurants & all the attractions. Situated right on the beach front, it's all there for you to explore.Unfortunately, we did have a few hiccups. Our room only had a partial ocean view, where we had booked ocean front. When we queried the front desk, they acknowledged the mistake & couldn't understand why we were given this room. The hotel was full, so we had to wait 4 days before they could move us. We we moved, not once, but twice due to the new room almost being the same, but the next floor up, both times we had problems with sloppy porters!!Hayley on front desk, "Full Credit" to this lovely staff member, finally found us the perfect room, plus, gave us tons of advice & information needed for facilities around hotel & Waikiki in general. The Manager, Christopher, I cannot speak of highly enough for his Professionalism, All Was Put In Order, when we brought these few matters to his attention.For the last week of our stay in this Lovely Hotel we immersed ourselves, finally experiecing a Truely Tropical holiday. The "Beach Club" access with superb meals, drinks & the best of service from the lovely friendly staff who go out to their way for U. Nice pool area and the "Beach Bar" Live music, good meals & awesome cocktails!! made it very hard to leave.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is our second and last visit to the Moana Surfrider. We had a great stay in 2018 with an ocean facing room in the tower wing. Because our stay was so nice in 2018 we decided to spend more time at Waikiki and treat ourselves to 9 nights at the Moana. Big mistake. We again got a room in the tower, but this time facing the street. The room is clean and the turned out well on a daily basis. The noise at night from the street entertainers is monotonous and loud. On a Saturday night it is unbearable. It is currently 1.20am and we have been trying to get to sleep for approx 3 hours, with no sign of the music from outside abating. We might as well be trying to sleep in the middle of the bar. Reception staff were quite apologetic, although can do nothing about it or tell you when it might end. For the high rates they charge, they really should invest in some better soundproofing. If you want peace and quiet, I recommend getting somewhere a little less central to all the nightlife. We certainly will next time. At a much lower rate as well, I am sure.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The outside of the hotel is beautiful! We just checked in today and I’m a little bummed the person I spoke to in reservations recommended the partial ocean view over the ocean view. I really try to go with recommendations of people that know the property best. The day I booked they were the same price. I understand the partial ocean view has outside balcony seating, but I should have gone with my gut and chosen the full ocean view without the balcony. I won’t be sitting out there because it is not that nice. Missing the view...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Title says a lot since I travel for work and get to stay at many different hotels. To start off the hotel experience when pulling up was a big turn off, busy front full of cars and no where else to go. Valet didn't even greet us or help with our luggage. The hotel is one of the oldest hotels in Oahu and it feels like it, the main building has that old smell and small rooms. Even the newest building they have is getting very dated and worn, bathrooms are small and the furniture needs updating. For the price I paid here, It was probably the most disappointing stay I've ever had,

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my first time staying with Moana Surfrider in Waikiki Beach, Hawaii, A Westin Resort & Spa. The facility is stunning on the outside and inside. This review is in regards to our "exceptional housekeeping experience" at the resort. The resort supplies one complimentary bottle of Sleep Well Lavender Aromatherapy Balm per room upon your arrival. Since I raved about the balm to my daughter, from our last visit to Maui two years ago, she too wanted to have a bottle of her own.I also wanted a bottle for myself. In an effort for both of us to enjoy the small bottle of oil, I wrote a polite note to housekeeping requesting another complimentary bottle of the lavender balm. I left the tiny note on the restroom counter top, in hopes that our housekeeper would read it.Upon our return to our room that evening, our housekeeper, Ce Aud, left a card next to two pair of Westin white slippers, two chocolates, and four bottles of Sleep Well Lavendar Balm!This is exceptional customer service in housekeeping and a kind gesture from an employee of Moana Surfrider. Thank you so much, Ce Aud!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We’ve been to Hawaii 3 times and the first two times we’ve stayed at cheaper hotels to compensate for the expensive places we’ve stayed in Maui. So this time, we decided to try Moana Surfrider but were a little disappointed. The location is great, right near Cheesecake Factory (my favourite) and on the beach. But the hotel rooms were surprisingly lacking. Most luxury hotels provide toothbrushes, cotton buds, sewing kits, shavers, slippers... none of that in Moana Surfrider. We had a partial ocean view which was nice, but walking onto the balcony felt like being in a goldfish bowl. I didn’t mind that so much. Was quite interesting to see different people going about their day. But saw some hooligan boys spitting off their balcony and throwing things down.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I got a room paid for by points. At checkout, on the 27th of December, 2018, I paid my incidental charge amount of $281.61 with my AmEx card, and received my checkout invoice showing a zero balance. My front desk person assured me that my points had covered my room charges entirely. That very experienced individual has handled my checkouts from the identical room I had on this visit for many years. Then, in 2019, without my knowledge or permission, the Moana charged my AmEx account $13,726.44 for my December of 2018 stay of 4 nights. I have spent months complaining to AmEx, the Moana, and to Marriott with no results.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, spectacular views but me need a major facelift with the accommodations.Rick got in the heart of everything, location, beach access, shopping restaurants, fantastic public space, info delightful in house restaurant and lounge.Good:l Awesome locationSpectacular viewsAwesome service Rooms are largeBeds extremely comfortableSheets excellent Bathroom amenities greatlyRestaurant excellent Bar excellentLarge balcony with awesome viewsExcellent air conditioningExcellent fitness roomExcellent location with beach accessBadRooms need a faceliftBathroom smallShower night experienceCloset in bathroom

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying here currently, very nice rooms. We got two queen beds both newer, high end sheet and pillows. AC is good, and cold. TV is newer flat screen maybe 32 inch with smart tv, Netflix, YouTube TV and others all free. Balcony is nice and kinds big for Waikiki. Bathrooms are bigger than expected with smart toilet seat meaning heated and controls for water spray. The shower is good, safe in bathroom can hold a laptop. Clean hotel, great staff especially the bell shops and valet guys, very quick and nice. Pool is ok, big for waikiki. Restaurants are high end and expensive. I like this place alot. Check out pics.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If I could choose negative star, I'd give them negative 5 star.It's my first time to write a review but I can’t but talking this terrible story.OK, I know I booked a cheapest room but I did it through westin official web site.We're staying(now I'm writing it in the room)a city side room which is face to an atrium of main room, which is SHUT OUT from other rooms.Between this atrium(there are also historical museum, 2nd floor)and other rooms, there is a door. It's closed at night.But our room is located outside this door, like part of the museum, along side of the atrium.Which means, we could enjoy THE BIG BACUUME CLEANER NOISE AFTER MIDNIGHT for cleaning up main robby and, interesting receptionist attitude.When I went and said complain about it to the reception, can you imagine their first words??"WE NEED TO CLEAN UP THE HOTEL" I said "I need to sleep" it's like a comedy isn't it?? They must'nt know there is a room outside the door.In the first place, I can't imagine there is a room outside that door as a luxury hotel. Even they know there're guest in that terrible room, they keep on vacuum cleaner.初めてレビューを書きます。それぐらいひどい滞在です。私達が泊まっている(ひどすぎるので部屋で書いてます)のは２階にあるヒストリカルミュージアムに沿うように位置する部屋。ここの部屋は他から締め出されるように存在しています。メインロビーの吹き抜けと各部屋の間にはドアがあり、夜になると音が入らないようにするためか防犯のためかこのドアが閉められますが、私達の部屋はその外に存在します。夜中の12:30頃から掃除機の音が聞こえ始め、まず電話でエクスプレスサービスに止めるようお願いしてももちろん止まず、レセプションに苦情を言いに行ったところ「でも掃除する必要があるから」という面白い回答をいただきました。「私は寝る必要がある」と返しておきました。コントか何かでしょうか。レセプションに苦情を言いに行った後も１０分ほどはまだ掃除機の音は聞こえていましたね。仕事熱心で結構なことですね。レビューを書いている間に一度止みましたがまた再開しています。その心を知りたい。悪いことは続くもので、上の階から引っ越し作業レベルのどん！どん！という音も聞こえます。工事か何かしているのでしょうか。ハネムーンと知っているのにわざわざこの部屋にしたのは嫌がらせでしょうか。さすが、ストライキを何ヶ月も続けさせたホテルグループと、そこで働く従業員という印象を持ちました。お客様にも勧めませんし、自分でも二度と利用しません。

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the reasons I chose to stay at this resort was the beachfront location and it was our first time in Hawaii. Having said that, the average night cost just over $500 after taxes/fees (resort fees and parking fees) and the issues below made the value behind the cost minimal. You could definitely do better for the price point.1. No where on the hotel website does it indicate that the $35/night self-parking fee is for an off-site 5 floor parking garage more than two blocks away from the resort with no elevator. I am thankful that my son and I are able bodied and could do the climb to the rooftop parking daily but if you require handicap access, you have no choice but to pay the $45/night valet parking fee. This is important information that should be clearly stated on the site.2. Most beachfront resorts include beach chairs in their resort fee, this resort does not and charges a $60 up charge per day for two beach chairs and one umbrella.3. The resort only has 4 elevators servicing 20 floors in the tower making it slow to reach the lobby and your room if you are on the higher floors. We were on the 13th floor. One elevator broke down and was out of service making it even more difficult to get to the lobby/room. There were lines to get on the elevators from the lobby. When I asked about the stairs, I was told they were for emergency use only. When you have an elevator down, the staircase should be made available for those who would like to use them as an alternate method.4. The hotel needs a update ASAP, and room servicing was not detail oriented. On arrival, I had to clean the refrigerator with disinfectant wipes before using it because it had brown spills on the bottom shelf. The ice container was not emptied and the glasses were not replaced on several days. The bathtub was backed up. I had an ant near the fridge which tells me the rooms are not that clean and another small black bug crawling up the wall. There was no coffee on our last day when we were traveling and needed it the most. The room thermostat was set to 65 degrees Fahrenheit and it was wrong. The coldest the room ever felt was about 75 degrees. To this point, I was fine with it because I don't like my AC that cold but for someone who does, they would have thought it was warm in the room. 5. Air conditioning throughout the hotel in general was not great and certain areas didn't even have air-conditioning (the elevators, bathrooms (near gym), hallways on the floors, lobby.Had I known all these issues, I would have stayed at the Hilton beach front which was comparable in price and the amenities included on-site parking and beach chairs. Their facility is also more updated and upkept. At $300/night, all these problems/issues would have been more acceptable.I would not choose to stay at this resort again on visiting Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has a lot of history. It’s beautifully updated but yet has the historical look to it. We stayed at the diamond wing; ocean front. Room is a bit small but it suited our needs. Restroom on the other hand is too tiny for my needs. If you’re a “girlie girl” like me-it’s too small! However I made do. Overall our stay was pleasant. Staff was great!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We shared a room with our 17 year old twins. The "queen" beds were smaller than queen. The room was nice, but the bathroom is really small and has no space to set down a ditty bag while in the bathroom. No bath, just shower. Breakfast buffet was nice. There are CONSTANT Japanese brides coming and going-they said they do 12 weddings a day. Makes for an interesting experience.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff are all very lovely and accommodating. We have stayed before because we like how easy it is to access the beach and shops. Very clean and the beds are very comfortable. Definitely recommend getting a view of the beach. If you want to rent an umbrella on the beach make sure you book it the afternoon before. We missed out so many times.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great staff who are very welcoming and friendly from the moment you check in. Beautifully kept rooms, comfortable beds, and great views. Great restaurants and a fantastic location right on the beach with easy access to the main shopping strip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I picked this hotel based on location and reviews. Overall, I am very happy with my choice. Most shopping and restaurants are within a half of mile or less.The staff was very friendly and helpful.The hotel rooms were very clean. The hotel was quiet during sleeping hours, which I was pleasantly surprised. On the last day, we had our luggage held at the front desk after we checked out. The front desk offered the use of the shower before we left for the airport. That was so nice and appreciated. We definitely took advantage of that. We really enjoyed our time in Hawaii and the Moana Surfrider contributed to that.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved this hotel. Smack bang where all the action is. It is literally on the beach. Beautiful Banyan tree which gives cover over tables and dining area. Spacious rooms and the softest beds. Very friendly staff

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed in an historic room in The Banyan Wing. Large comfy king bed dominated the room. But there was still ample space. Liked the sleep potion left on bedside table. Lots of lovely herbs (lavender, chamomile, et al) to induce sleep. Small wardrobe. Very tiny bathroom. Shower door banged on toilet when opened. Everything clean and immaculate. Except for someone’s pizza left in the fridge! Free botted water each day was a bonus. Great views. From the bathroom had an excellent view of the beach. Picture postcard. From the bedroom to the left had a bit of a city view. Biggest drawback to the room was the lack of a balcony. Not a lot of space to dry wet swimmers. Pool was a good size and depth. Lots of lounges and tables. Lounges in the shade under umbrellas were taken very quickly each day. Could rent a shaded cabana or an umbrella and lounges on the sand. Very expensive. Umbrella = $US80.00. Had access to The Beach Club. Breakfast – standard buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, waffles, lots of fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurt, juices, coffee, tea, etc. From 12 noon, snacks were available – biscuits, muesli bars fruit, maui chips, corn chips, mixed nuts, coffee, tea, soft drink, water. Dinner opened at 5.00pm until 8.00pm. Alternated between fish pieces and chicken, vegetables – hot and cold, fruit, cheese, crackers, soft drinks, tea, coffee and unlimited beer and wine – red and white. All food offered throughout the day was plentiful, tasty and great value. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. If you get the opportunity to stay here, grab it with both hands. Totally recommend.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the 1st glimpse of this historic Waikiki hotel, you know it's a special place. Located in the heart of Waikiki Beach on the upscale side of town, built in 1901 as a place for the world's upper echelon to relax and "be seen" this hotel still retains its charm and elegance but more affordable to the "middle class" traveler. They need to upgrade their double room options to queen size beds (there certainly is enough space) but other than that, the rooms are nicely appointed and decorated. You can walk to many great restaurants and shops or hang out at the beach or sit under old Deva and enjoy a tropical cocktail at the pool bar. The Veranda at the restaurant is a great way to start the day with great ala carte options or a buffet for those with a heartier appetite. Waikiki isn't my first choice when visiting Hawaii but if I find myself back in this area, this will definitely be my hotel of choice.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Now don’t get me wrong if you want to stay right on Waikiki Beach in June it’s gonna cost you a few bucks. So we get to spend that kind of money, you might as well stay at the Moana Surfrider a Westin property. First of all it’s historic and has a lot of charm. The rooms are beautiful right on the beach and the staff certainly has the spirit of aloha. Many amenities but I recommend getting out there on the beach that’s right in front of you and you can take it from there. Thank you for my Marriott titanium room upgrade which overlooks the beach in the water. They certainly know how to treat their titanium members so kudos to you Westin. Feel like a King of Queen for a couple of days and enjoy yourself.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Moana Surfrider for our wedding ceremony/honeymoon. It's a beautiful historic hotel in the perfect location.I'm writing this review to compliment Merlita, a member of the housekeeping staff. My wife accidentally left her wedding band and engagement ring on the desk. We went back to the room to retrieve them as soon as we realized what had happened. Merlita was cleaning the room at the time. I was very impressed with her professionalism and the security procedures in place at the Moana Surfrider. Before Merlita allowed us back into the room, she politely checked that our room key opened the door. She also mentioned that she had called security to take care of the items, but cancelled the call once we returned.We really enjoyed our stay and meals at the Moana Surfrider and look forward to staying here again in the future. Thank you Merlita for helping to make our stay at the Moana Surfrider a pleasant experience!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is older, but updated and very nice. Rooms are ok size, but bathrooms quite tiny. Bonvoy members can use the lounge which save a ton of money as breakfast is very expensive, but BEWARE if traveling with kids - they charge you a very high price if your kids are over 12 and use the lounge. They are militant about checking age and i saw many families upset over this. There are two outside bars with slightly different menus and both are excellent. One of the few hotels actually on the beach. Consider renting beach chairs early as they fill up fast.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pros:Front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful. Beach club access was an added bonus. The food and drink were great as well as the amenities. A huge thanks to Karen and all the lovely staff who went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect!We stayed in an ocean front suite. Could not fault the room and wow that view!Recommend a day at the spa to relax. A sauna with a view is rare!Buffet breakfast had a bit of everything and fresh food. Centrally located and you can walk everywhere.Cons:Housekeeping were a little slack. Corbin from the tours desk was quite rude.Overall an excellent hotel and would highly recommend. We stayed at The Modern last visit but would definitely stay again at Moana Surfrider next visit!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Beach Bar is a great place to spend a Sunday afternoon. Enjoy a swim and then relax in the bar. Relaxing, great location, good music and delicious cocktails. Free hula lessons, friendly and quick service

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My first morning there I was sitting out on the wonderful deck on the eighth floor overlooking incredible Waikiki beach with a view of Diamondhead.I hear a tap behind me on my sliding glass door and there stands a woman who is there to clean my room with the most vibrant smile ever. I open the door had a conversation with this very delightful woman named Ruth - she obviously works the 8th Floor. She did an excellent cleaning job, was Interested in me and my story. I shared with her that there was supposed to be two people here but that my partner missed flights and connections out of Tucson LAX which ended up with her having to cancel this Hawaii trip. so I felt very welcomed by Ruth on my very first morning which started off my day here at the Westin Moana Surfrider Hotel. Ruth was an excellent face for the hotel very pleasant very nice. Obviously an exceptional employee.With much love for Ruth. “PJ”. Tucson, AZ

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Good hotel, central location, only downside is there are not enough sunbeds and not really enough space for more. The attendants have a preference for regular guests it appeared. Generally the staff were helpful. We did not dine at the hotel as there were plenty of restaurants in close proximity. We requested a quiet room, which was, apart from the noisy fridge. But overall would stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arrived late one night and we were put in a horrible room without a balcony which we had specifically booked (and wanted).The hotel was very busy so they couldn’t move us but understood we were on our honeymoon and babymoon.The next day they moved us to a lovely room on the top floor of the old wing with a big balcony for the rest of our stay.The hotel is in a beautiful location and it’s a lovely hotel with lots of charm. The staff on reception were very helpful and Nelly on the concierge desk was a delight in helping us book things and plan our week in Waikiki.Breakfast buffet here is excellent - not cheap but ticks all the boxes. Pool is small but we prefer the ocean. If you have kids who like a pool you may want to look elsewhere (Sheraton has a big pool and water slide!)Sun lounges and chairs around the pool are all taken very early each day - again we didn’t care because we prefer the beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I cannot stay enough positive things about the Moana Surfrider. We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of a 2 week vacation that took us through Oahu, Kaua'i, and Maui, and saved the best hotel for last. We stayed at the Ritz during the first trip through Waikiki, but it was a little far from the beach and decided to stay at the Moana during our second trip through.First of all, the staff was amazing - we were only supposed to stay one night, and I thought I had changed my reservation to two nights and apparently hadn't and they accommodated us. I also ordered online deliveries to the hotel with no issues. Second - the actual building is incredible, they did an amazing job of keeping everything feel authentic to what a historic building it is, but also everything is renovated and modern. Third and most importantly, location! It is right in the heart of Waikiki and right on the beach. We paid for an ocean front room, and I highly recommend you do the same. It's right on the water and there's no bugs, so we slept with the doors open both nights and listened to the waves.One thing I'd say is that the room was quite small, so although this was amazing for 2 friends or a couple, I wouldn't stay here if you're a family. If you're only 2 people, don't even consider anywhere else, it's AMAZING and I would take it over the Ritz any day. It would be nice if the pool was open at night and if there was a hot tub.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Lady of Waikiki is so much more than a place to walk through. If you are looking for a place on Waikiki this should seriously consider staying here. When you walk ou ton your lanai all you hear are waves. You, of course, have a great view of the beach and access to all that it offers out the front door.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed 10 nights in an ocean view room(no balcony) in the Banyan wing. The room was very small and mostly quiet and we enjoyed listening to the ocean as we drifted off to sleep. The only annoyance was the very loud yoga teacher every morning at 7am. The linen and towels were luxurious and the room was impeccably serviced. The drinks and meals in the beach bar are overpriced and badly made . Neither breakfast options failed to wow us. We were invited to wine Wednesday which served quality wine and nibbles. We also enjoyed the spa and sauna rooms, just separately as it isn’t unisex. The pool seating situation needs evaluating as it is unfair the people can hog poolside lounges all day and that you have to pay for shade and chairs on the beach. If you are after a relaxing holiday by the pool or beach this is not the place as it is overcrowded and too busy, weddings are held all day every day and you are constantly dodging bridal parties. However I am glad I have experienced the Moana on my fourth visit to Hawaii, it is a beautiful historic hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband & I have stayed at the Moana Surfrider twice - both times for a week. We have traveled a lot & this is by far our favorite place to stay. We are already planning our 3rd trip back this fall. First of all, Hawaii is the most amazing place in general. Rent a car & drive to beautiful beaches, awesome hikes & the best food you've ever had. Or walk a couple blocks from the hotel & find the best hidden gems of bars & restaurants. Second of all, I could not imagine coming back to Oahu & not staying at the Moana. We have visited many of the other hotels in the area (for dinner, drinks, etc.) & nothing compares. This hotel truly gives off a "feeling" & we love it so much. I've also seen reviews about the pool area being crowded but not once have we had an issue getting a chair or a seat at the beach bar. If you're visiting Hawaii for the 1st time or 50th time, the Moana is a must!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I just spent 7 nights at the Moana and really enjoyed it! The hotel is beautiful and located in the heart of Waikiki so you can walk anywhere! We stayed in an ocean view room in the historic building and found it charming. The room was small, but who cares with the views of the ocean view nobody in their right mind would complain. The Banyan tree was stunning at night. The food was pricey! We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary and my husbands 50th so we wanted something fantastic so we opted for the Beach House/Veranda on the property. They gave us a spectacular table with ocean views and the service was wonderful. We opted for the pre fix dinner and found the meal underwhelming. We spent almost $300 on dinner for the both of us and walked away bummed! The rest of the trip was awesome though...there are tons of amazing places to eat and play that are within walking distance. We loved Dukes Market for wine--awesome selection and the prices weren't out of this world. There are oodles of Udon places around--it's a thing there! It's amazing and should be tried at least once. We rented a car for one day from National, which is around the corner from the Moana. It was $65 for unlimited mileage. We navigated our way to the North Shore easily using WAZE. We were able to visit Kailua (#1 beach in the US for 2019), as well as eat lunch on the North Shore easily in one day. We walked down to the Hilton Village to go to their beach (#6 in the US for 2019), it was AWESOME. You could see the Sea Turtles from shore. This beach is less crowded than the one in front of the Moana and I'd highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the minute we walked in until checkout we received the best service! We had a 9 pm flight and after check out we went snorkeling. The desk gave us a hospitality room free of charge to freshen up! This place feels like family!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment you pull up you feel special. The staff greets you with a genuine aloha and Hawaiian lei to boot.This trip we stayed in the original section of the hotel, just one floor up from the lobby overlooking the famous banyan patio. We didn't have a balcony but we did have a great view of the patio, tree, and beyond to the ocean. Our room is equipped with comfy linens, robe, high thread towels etc. that you come to expect at upscale Westin/Sheraton (now Marriott) properties. Everywhere you walk you get an appreciation for the history of this place and the fact that it is the oldest hotel in Hawaii. The 2nd floor is actually a museum of artifacts of not just the Moana but of Hawaii and its people. Take time to appreciate the architecture.My favorite activities: Be sure to enjoy a late brunch at the Beachouse restaurant and on another day lunch at the Beach Bar (Banyan Patio). Grab a morning coffee at Honolulu Coffee next to the hotel then camp out on the rockers to do your morning people watch. If you're from the mainland trust me, you'll be up plenty early the first few days. LOL. When not touring take one morning to layout at the quaint small pool or even the legendary Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I will review our overall week in Waikiki in a separate post with all the activities and details. This post is dedicated to giving huge kudos to four Moana Surfrider groups:1) front desk personnel 2) club level personnel3) hotel security 4) the banyan tree1) Thank you to manager Christopher for helping us fix a huge mistake that was made by the person who booked our hotel stay for us. He was able to make our last night at the Moana enjoyable instead of an annoying ordeal. We really appreciate his efforts. In addition, our check-in person was awesome and was able to get adjoining rooms for our family of five. 2) If you’re contemplating whether or not you should upgrade to the Club Access, do it. The team there is on point and super-friendly and accommodating. The club is located on the main lobby level close to the beach access so very convenient. The staff are always there asking if you need anything or clearing your plates. The food selections are really good including fresh fruit, veggies, eggs, etc. I’m vegetarian and gluten-free and they had gluten-free bread and lots of veggies every day so I was happy. Great coffee machines too. The place is run like clockwork. 3) BIG Thank you to the two 6-foot-something security men in their tropical shirts who were by our side within minutes of calling when a man from another hotel was being inappropriate. Let’s just say after seeing the security men, I think the perpetrator made himself disappear and we didn’t see him again. And to be clear, this was a person randomly doing something lewd, not anything where we ever felt threatened or in danger. Waikiki Beach is safe, clean (spotless really!) and perfect for families. 4) The ginormous banyan tree (on the beach!) needs it’s own Facebook and instagram accounts. The tree was planted in 1885 and is over 130 years old. Magnificent is an understatement. The tree alone is reason to just book your stay right now. Thank you to all the hotel grounds staff for keeping it healthy and alive for since 1901. I read dozens and dozens of reviews about all different properties before booking this trip. I am so grateful we had this time here. It’s a beautiful hotel with a rich history and we enjoyed every minute.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family recently stayed at the Moana for ten nights. This was the first time our family of five stayed at the Moana; previously we stayed at The Marriott Waikiki, and a non-Marriott hotel. Our room was in the tower section with an amazing view of diamond head and the beach, breathtaking!!!! Others have posted concerns regarding rooms near elevators, our room was right by the elevator; while there may have been some noise, it did not prevent us from sleeping, or rest. Others have also posted about noise from the night activities/music at the Moana. We traveled from the central time zone, so a five hour difference, and again, had no problems sleeping. I think having the drapes closed helps keep out some of the noise. Previous reviews also mention the layout of the room, specifically the restroom. I appreciated the safe being in the restroom area as it provided extra counter space; it would be nice if there was a divider between the shower and the rest of the washroom, but I guess there’s only so much that can be done with the size of the area.As I mentioned, we’re a family of five (three young children), I was concerned about staying at the Moana and “kid behavior”. Overall, our family was treated marvelously, and in true Ohana fashion (even when our kids were fighting over who gets to push the elevator buttons). Below is a breakdown of Moana staff that made our trip memorable...-The crew at the towel hut...they recommended Faith Surfing Instruction for our 11 yo; this is one example of the knowledge and passion this team has for the area. Each time we went by for towels we were greeted warmly and with enthusiasm. We rented an umbrella one morning, stopping by the previous evening to inquire about the process (having read reviews regarding the process, we wanted to make sure we understood how this worked).-Housekeeping...Kam is amazing!!!!! Kam ensured our room was clean early; she also left us plenty of towels/linens, bottled water, and an immaculate room. There was at least one day Kam was off, and her presence was missed. Kam always greeted us warmly in the hall, and even complimented our kids on their good behavior.-Karen from Beach Club; Karen moves around with a hop in her step, and radiates of kindness. Karen was eager to answer our questions, and made us feel right at home. Karen went above and beyond in making sure we had somewhere to watch the Stanley Cup Finals.-Shelton from Beach Club; Shelton always had a smile, and was quick to clear dishes from the table, as did Karen. -Haley checked us in and is not only an asset to Moana, but the Marriott brand. Haley is well versed in Platinum benefits, and the check in process; it was as if Haley knew every question I had regarding our stay, and answered them before I needed to ask. Haley was also eager to help with an instant point redemption during our stay. A few notes for Platinum Members, our experience included:-a room view upgrade-a late check out of 2.5 hours -Full access to Beach Club (this made staying at the Moana a great value. The Beach Club regularly had bottles of water, fresh bananas, fresh apples, a fabulous breakfast buffet, day snacks, and a decent light dinner assortment (especially when we had a late heavy lunch)-Mini activity books for the kids

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Cecilia did an exquisite job cleaning our children-run room everyday! It was just wonderful to come home to a clean room every time. Bathroom was always clean with fresh towels. We would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days as we were in town for a friend's wedding. I have nothing but great things to say about the hotel. 1. It is a beautiful property set in the madness of Waikiki. Being able to sit in the rocking chairs on the front porch or in the back under the Banyan tree is something I'll always remember.2. The beach right behind the hotel is great. I went surfing everyday and then would come back and relax by the pool for a bit. 3. We sprung for the Diamond Tower Ocean Room and it was well worth it. It is a view you can sit and alook at for hours and hours at a time.4. All staff was very attentive and helpful.The bad:1. Holy s**t everything is expensive. I think that's more of a Hawaii statement than Moana, but paying $30 for a cheeseburger and $18 for a cocktail is crazy. All in all, if I ever go back to Honolulu I will be staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here after cruising to Hawaii from Sydney. Beautiful old hotel with some modernisation where needed. Whatever you do do not get a room at the front. Noise is so bad that after one completely sleepless night we paid an extra US$600 to get moved to a quieter part of hotel. As well as noisy the rooms at the front of the hotel are very small so if you have a child like we did, they sleep on a bench! Where you need to make it up yourself!Once we were moved to the new tower room our stay became bearable.Small pool with limited lounges, you need to be there by 7am to get one, then the beach is mobbed by 9am, but it is Waikiki. Food and drink expensive at hotel but lots of options to eat out and around. Hawaii on the whole was very expensive. Hotel staff wonderful and very helpful at all times.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For a long time we had wanted to stay in the Historic Banyan with an ocean view at the Moana Surfrider, and finally had the chance earlier this month.While the room is older and rather small, it is well kept and we had a great view of Waikiki beach and a bit of Diamond Head in the background.Light sleepers may want to consider staying in the tower rather than the Historic Banyan building. The ocean waves splashing against the sandy beach could be heard loud and clear all night, even with the window closed. If you can sleep through a bit of noise, it's a pretty nice tropical lullaby.Check in and check out were both smooth, and the hotel staff was friendly. We would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana for 7 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is stunning inside and out - we loved it! The staff go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. The food was AMAZING - we were room only, but ate breakfast at the hotel everyday and enjoyed three lovely dinners. Location is great - right on wakiki beach and surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars. Can’t wait to return

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at this hotel twice and will continue to stay upon each visit to Hawaii! It is by far the best hotel I have stayed at, ever. The room I had overlooked the beach. Everything about this hotel, including the lavendar oil on the pillow is a dream!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Comfortable rooms, spacious halls, and right on the beach make this a great hotel.Breakfast on the wide balcony terrace and afternoon drinks in the courtyard under the old shady Banyan tree just a few steps from the beach make this an exceptional hotel. The friendly staff are very helpful. In particular, the assistance provided by Nelly at the concierge desk was outstanding. Her assistance in resolving a personal problem ( a lost wallet) was immediate, successful and made with a genuine desire to help. Nelly turned a great stay into an outstanding stay and an enduring memory. memory.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We treated ourselves to a 3 night stay at the Moana Surfrider, which was a wonderful welcome to Waikiki.The Moana is the oldest hotel on Honolulu’s famous beachfront resort strip of Waikiki beach, and takes her reputation as “First Lady” seriously.Service and attention to detail throughout our visit was impeccable. We were greeted on arrival with beautiful orchid leis and offered a hospitality room to refresh for 30 minutes as we’d had an overnight flight from Australia and we arrived before our room was ready.By the time we’d done this and enjoyed a cocktail in the beach bar, our room was ready.We chose an ocean facing room in the Tower, a newer section of the hotel but with the added benefit of larger rooms with balconies (lanais).We were on a lower floor but very happy with the view.Rooms include robes, slippers and everything you expect from a 5-star hotel.Tip: if not already a member, join the Bonvoy Club for 10% off dining and other benefits. Covers Westin, Sheraton, Marriott & other brands.If you have time, head up the stairs in the main entrance lobby to discover some of the hotels unique history on the upstairs landing, plus a delightful spot to read and relax on the front veranda.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is very beautiful. The bar area behind it, with the giant tree in the middle, is also very pretty. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and upgraded me to an ocean view room without request. The room was clean and very large and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.
user_name:
lemonlime78
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We planned a visit to the Moana to celebrate our 45 anniversary after spending our honeymoon there. Booked it a year in advance. They asked if we were spending a special occasion and shared our visit.They said we'd like to offer a special welcome gift for the occasion. Arrived and they never heard of such a thing, no notes. The view room requested was very marginal. Side of a building. Our kids asked if we enjoyed the gift certificate they arranged to have presented on our arrival. Never happened, couldn't find it. They had to call the person they arranged it with and remind them. Still not presented, slipped under our door the last night. We asked about whether we could use it on charges we had already accumulated since it was late. They had to check with the manager to get an ok! The staff couldn't be slower unless they were underwater. We followed up and asked what ever happened to the "welcome". They insinuated we might have made that up. Really? The poolside hamburger for $26 and the watered down drinks were also disappointing. The service in our platinum ownership line was the slowest one at the counter. this has become a wedding destination hotel. 6 in one day. That's their focus, not guests. Never even gave us a stay survey. Wrote to the gm and said the memory we hoped to make was a poor one. No response. We stayed at two other Westins on our trip. Others great but this one failed us. Spend your good money somewhere else, this place is tired and lost its edge.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a little issue with the air conditioning in our room and talked to Josh A. at the front counter. He arranged for our luggage to be moved to another room while we were exploring and we came back to a great room without any hassle. He really was great and accommodating and turned a sour situation into a great customer experience. Thank you, Josh!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful, historic property. They are right on the beach. They have a lovely pool. We stayed during October, and although there had been an ongoing strike, we were NOT advised ahead of our stay about it. We arrived travel-weary, with tired children, and did not have options to check in elsewhere, and so felt compelled to stay after the staff re-assured us that all of our needs would be met while at the hotel. The food amenities were certainly limited, and no one came to clean our room (which can be tough when you sprinkling sand out of your clothes each day and night). But the WORST part of our trip was dealing with paying for the hotel afterward. The manager charged the WRONG card for our stay (in spite of previous clear communication), they tried to deny the charge-back, and THEN after they finally charged the correct card, then contacted us 2 months later with a bill, CLAIMING that we still owed the the cost of the stay. We spend HOURS AND HOURS dealing with their incompetence, especially since they NEVER responded to our emails, or answered the phone during normal business hours to help us resolve this matter. Our bank finally completed the charge-back because of the poor communication from the hotel management. They ALSO promised us on arrival that the "resort" fee would be redacted from our stay cost, WHICH WAS A LIE. If you would like to reflect back on your stay in Honolulu happily, DO NOT do yourself the disservice of dealing with this POORLY managed property (courtesy of Sheraton and Westin). We've previously had a great stay at the Hyatt across the street.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved this resort! It’s beautiful, incredibly clean, very friendly staff. We received a late check out free of charge, and when we told them we lost one of our room keys, there was no fee for it. Check in/ out was a breeze. Located downtown Waikiki with walking distance to hundreds of shops and restaurants. Gorgeous beach. The bus and trolley pick up there (don’t pay for cabs!) They have a “private” beach but no one checks and we noticed several people walking down and hanging out on the Moana’s beach. Food is incredibly expensive, like $37 per person for breakfast expensive. We walked to LuLus which had delicious, reasonable food. Walking distance to Hertz to rent a car (which is inside another hotel) They have beach towels to use for free, and they never ran out which other places we have stayed at never had towels when we needed them (one less thing to pack!) I really can’t say enough good things about this place.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was opened in 1901 there is a small placque in front of the hotel with the description of the First Lady of Hawaii. On the second floor there is the Moana Muesuem with pictures of the earlier days of the hotel. The hotel is the last hotel on the beach in Waikiki Beach. The hotel has a pool, valet parking, restaurant, pool bar, shops and two buildings of hotel guest rooms. There are a full staff of concierges.The room was on the twentieth floor. The elevators service was very good. The Internet connected and speed was good. The room was large with two windows on different sides of the room. The work table was large with extra electrical outlets. The dresser was large with three deep drawers with a television on top. There were two double beds with a large center table with two drawers and a open shelf. The bathroom, closet and safe was in a separate enclosed area of the room.The beach the restaurant are on ground level.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my go to for quick trips to Hawaii! The minute you enter the lobby you feel relaxed and peaceful thanks to the constant breeze and lovely music.This visit we weren’t thrilled with our room and after a very pleasant conversation with Joseph, the manager, he found a new (better) room for the next day!! Thank you Joseph for finding a solution! Irene at the front desk is always kind and remembers me and my kids and is such a friendly face! All the staff are very helpful and pleasant. The fact that you can walk to to the beach or the pool on property may sound like a no brainer in Hawaii but it’s rare and it’s perfect.This was the first time I went to the spa and it was amazing. Tomomio (I think!?) listened to my issues and gave me the best therapeutic massage of my life. And Tanya and the entire staff were welcoming and accommodating and friendly!The Honolulu coffee in the hotel is sooo good. Can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my second time at the Moana Surfrider and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I will keep this review short but would like to highlight and acknowledge the incredible service from Taylor, who is a barmaid/server at the Beach Bar & pool. Taylor is the consummate professional with immaculate grooming and personal presentation. My food & beverage orders were very specific and Taylor always ensured I was happy and that my requests were met. She greeted us with a smile every day and instinctively seemed to know when my partner I required another refreshment and we was prompt and courteous at all times. I also observed her training a new team member and she did any excellent job setting the standard for service for this new recruit. Taylor is the reason I will return the Moana Surfrider as she ensured that every aspect of my experience an absolutely positive one. I'd also like to acknowledge the female bar manager (cannot recall name) who also assisted me at time of checkout.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful old hotel that has been well restoredLovely courtyard by the beach with a fantastic old banyan tree surrounded by a really nice restaurant called the beach bar with nightly entertainment and hula dancer from 5.30pmThe piano bar is also lovely and serves good cocktails whilst a good musician plays a wide selection of musicLoved the solid rocking chairs dotted around Nice beach area with umbrellas Pool bit small but does the jobStay here for the atmosphere

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were really looking forward to our 3 night stay here after being a cruise ship for 20 days, but were really disappointed. Don't get wrong the Hotel building is absolutely beautiful and is in a perfect location. But our room was terrible. We were on the fourth floor close to the front of the Hotel facing the road. We could hear every sound in the street all night and very early in the morning, so not much sleep. I really think they should not rent these rooms until they put in soundproof windows, the windows are so old and thin, didn't matter if they were open or shut made no difference. The bed was comfy but the worst pillows we asked if we would change them to firmer ones, but they told us they didn't have any. No shower cap in the bathroom which I found to be so scabby. The Drinks at their Beach Bar were very expensive. The pool isn't that big for such a big hotel with so many rooms and hardly any lounges to lay on. We ended up hiring 2 lounges with umbrella for two days at $60US each day (about $85 AUD) so quite expensive. Would definitely not stay here ever again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was out in Hawaii for work but invited my friends to join me (some one should enjoy the sun while I’m inside in meetings) and this hotel made my stay just that much better! The hotel feels like your in the lap of luxury but in the 1920s, with all the modern flare! The staff is super friendly! They don’t have parking if there own , but there drinks are sooooooo good. I love surfing and am just getting into it, so I wanted a hotel that i could surf at after work which this place definitely provided. They had a wide corridor that went at least 200 yards off shore with multiple break lines, i threw off my suit, grabbed my board and jumped in!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Historic hotel with a great beach area. The bar area was under construction during our stay but can see where that is going to be a great addition to the hotel. The pool is small but the proximity to the beach can't be beat. The bar on the patio area is nice but both close very early (10pm) which is disappointing even when they were both very busy. I imagine that has something to do with noise level as the rooms arent far from the open area. Thankfully there is a bar very close that is fun and stays open late.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was so excited to plan on staying here when I was planning my trip. I remember arriving and feeling, wow, this is even more beautiful than I imagined. Check in was easy. They upgraded my room as knowing I was traveling alone, they gave me a room away from the noise of the street, assigning me a room overlooking the courtyard. The room was clean and I especially liked the scent of the potpourri in the hallway corridors. It smelled like a guest house rather than a hotel. All the people were courteous and pleasant. It was truly a pleasurable experience in a beautiful and historic hotel. If you stay, take the historic tour (free) they offer. As the First Lady of Waikiki, she offers elegance, relaxation and all the services you would expect in a luxury hotel without the nose in the air attitude. Touches of old Hawaii I enjoyed so much! Would stay again in a heartbeat! Just wonderful!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the Moana on business then extended for some R & R. If you like the hustle and bustle of town and shopping close by, this hotel is for you. Out back you have the beach and out front the best shopping in Hawaii. I stayed in the orginal part of the hotel. Rooms were quaint, a little on the small side, but the luxury factor was there. For the downtown area this hotel is one of the best that I've seen.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband had a work trip 2 Waikiki, so I tagged along & we extended it into a mini vac. I was a little worried after reading some critical reviews that it wouldn’t be everything I hoped 4 in Hawaii, but I was pleasantly surprised! First, the hotel is gorgeous. Old world charm, that is impeccably maintained. If I were footing the whole bill, I might be underwhelmed about having 2 reserve beach seats, but it isn’t really necessary. They have yoga outdoors every am @ 7:00, which I LOVED (shout out 2 Crystal, my yogi guru!) & afterwards I had my pick of seats at the pool or facing the ocean by 8:00am. After that, I’d head 2 an amazing buffet breakfast on the veranda (included 4 Marriott preferred guests) & as long as u get back 2 ur chair in an hr your chair is reserved. The pool staff was very friendly & good @ clearing off spots when people were gone after 90min, so others could enjoy seats later in the day. The location of this hotel cannot be beat. It is walking distance from all the best shopping, beaches, Dukes, & Diamond Head Nat’l park. We were even able 2 spot some large sea turtles swimming @ the end of one of the black rock formations that juts out into the ocean. It is family friendly & I’ve got 2 say all the kids were exceptionally well behaved, so I think we came on a good week. There is the most majestic tree in the middle of the courtyard that is a protected land mark, & there is lovely Hawaiian music played daily. It was so crowded that we couldn’t get an ocean view room on day 1, but we opted 2 move rooms 4 the last 3 days, & it was totally worth it. Falling asleep 4 the lullaby of waves & waking up 2 surfers in the distance every am was magical. All the staff were very upbeat & friendly, & they didn’t hesitate 2 give a generous pour during happy hr.I would come back without batting an eye, the MoanaSurfrider is a little slice of Heaven in a little scoop of Paradise. Mohalo!
