hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have traveled a lot for business for decades. This hotel is easily my favorite place. From the minute you walk into the lobby, you are enveloped by the magic combination of the elegance of a gorgeous old hotel and the breathtaking beauty of Hawaii. The lobby completely opens onto the courtyard with its historic banyan tree and then the glistening water of Waikiki beach. Get a room overlooking this in the original building. The rooms have been remodeled with pretty colors, an amazing bed and spa bath. The windows open so you can hear the surf at night and feel the tropical breeze. We ate in every restaurant and the food was fresh and delicious. Even room service was fast and really well prepared. Everyone on the staff was super nice to us; especially the room service waiters. This is the first hotel on Waikiki beach and it has the best location. We could walk everywhere. There is a great coffee place out front which is super convenient in the morning. Just sitting and talking in the teak rocking chairs on all the verandas was a great way to relax in the in-between times.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Westin Moana Surfrider is a pleasant hotel with a lot going for it. First, of course is the location on Waikiki Beach. This property is right on the ocean -- beachfront -- so the convenience is unbeatable. The hotel is partly historic, and Starwood (now Marriott) has upgraded and maintained the hotel well for the most part. The hotel is divided into 3 parts. There is the original historic hotel that houses the lobby and restaurants on the first floor. Two towers comprise the other two parts of the property. The only true, unobstructed views of the ocean are in the Diamond Head tower. The service is generally good, but there were a few staff that didn't seem so thrilled to be there. When we arrived, we were told that they did not have an ocean view room with a king bed. They offered a room with two full size beds. That was not a good start. We said no. It felt a little like bait-and-switch. After checking with the manager, the desk clerk came back and said that they had found a room with a king bed. For $600 (plus a bunch of add on fees and taxes), we were not settling for less than the room we requested. If you reserve, get the rate with the pre-paid breakfast that has a buffet. The food is really expensive. Our first night, after the room check-in incident, we wanted something light to eat. We ended up ordering two salads, a beer, and glass of wine - nothing fancy. The bill was $150. The food was of good quality, but it was the kind of thing that we might pay $50 for somewhere else - even in Waikiki.This is a place that will nickle and dime you to death. We found better and much cheaper options for dinner within a few blocks from the hotel. The hotel is on the main street of Waikiki so there are lots of eating and shopping options available. We would go back just for the location. The beach is stunning. You are steps away from many things.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my favorite hotel in Waikiki because of the exclusive cleanest beach view that doesn't have the rock paths with clean large sandy spaces. We had the king deluxe room with ocean front view. It was so beautiful to wake up seeing crystal clear water and listen to the peaceful waves. The bed is super comfortable and the service is always great. I love the free spa they offer with beach front view and a resting area for just a quick nap. The food is pretty decent, they have really great breakfast.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff were friendly, atmosphere and location was amazing. Also, the convenience of getting the best coffee in front of the Moana Surfrider. We have been back here to this hotel three times. We love it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was a beautiful building and very clean, but due to being in a room right above the main entrance and sharing a balcony with the neighbour next door didn't sleep for the 3 nights we were there.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was afraid to stay in Waikiki because it seemed to lack intimacy and was too commercial. But this hotel was AMAZING for its location and, despite its size, it had a great personal touch. People like Susan Koehler took time out to give us personal recommendations and and to get to know us. The recreation staff went above and beyond and the overall experience showed the Aloha Spirit.
user_name:
CPTLAX
Cape Town Central, South Africa

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana for 3 nights last week.Check-in was easy, with staff very friendly and accommodating. We were there early after disembarking off a cruise ship. Staff advised us that our room wouldn't be available until 3pm, however, if it did become ready before that, they would ring us if we wanted them to. True to their word, they called us around midday to advise us our room was ready. The ambience of this hotel hits you the moment you walk in. It is open, airy and friendly.Our room was a Historic Banyan Ocean View. The room was airy, very clean and spacious. The bed was very comfortable with quality pillows and bedding. The bathroom was again spotless and quite roomy. Shampoo, lotions and soaps provided as well as a hairdryer.The wardrobe had robes, slippers, coathangers, iron and ironing board.The view of the beach from our room was perfect. The staff were all so very friendly and couldn't do enough for you.This hotel has alot of history, so check out the "museum" on the 2nd floor. Sadly, we didn't know about it until we checked out.We had breakfast included in our stay. Upon check-in we were provided with vouchers for the breakfast buffet. At breakfast, we presented our vouchers to a lovely lady, who was always so helpful and happy(even under pressure). We never had to wait long to be seated.The breakfast buffet has quite a variety of choices. There are pancakes, cereals, fresh fruits(pineapple, watermelon, strawberries, rockmelon, honeydew melon to name a few. Toast, muffins, eggs benne, fresh made omelettes, many Asian choices as well. The food was always fresh with again, all staff being super helpful and polite.The hotel is on the beachfront, so swimming is easy to do. To obtain as many beachtowels as you need, you go to the poolside kiosk, scan your hotel card and you are handed your towels. When finished, just hand them back to the kiosk. Staff there, are also very friendly and helpful.Check-out was very easy, with quick check-out available, just drop your room key into the recepticle provided.As we exited the hotel to wait for our pick up to the airport. We were approached by staff who asked if we needed a taxi or did we have a pick up organised. He took our large bags and said he would look after them for us until our bus arrived. Again ultra polite and helpful.Overall, our stay at the Moana was an exceptional experience. From the beautiful hotel to the fantastic staff who made sure our stay was a memoriable one. Thank you to everyone at the Moana Surfrider, we will be back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you want to be in the heart of it all, then this is the place for you. Breakfast on that patio facing the ocean was our most favorite thing. Lobby area is beautiful. Pool is small, must be up early to get chairs like 5am or 6 am no lies.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm here right now and I honestly can't think of anything that could make our holiday here better. Check in was seamless and our room was ready. Bed is really comfortable and room is clean with lots of space and amenities. Housekeeping does a fabulous job . Patio is clean with partial ocean view, two chairs and a table. Public areas, lobby and walkways are kept meticulously clean with lovely planting seeds and sculptures. We are in the tower nod rooms are updated. The procedure for renting chairs and umbrellas is fine. We have been able to rent either a cabana or chairs and umbrella each day. Some reviews indicated that it was difficult to secure chairs but we did not have any problems. Staff at the beach rental area are fantastic. They greet everyone cheerfully each morning and go out of their way to help people with towels and rentals. Cabana rentals include two drinks, fruit and water. This hotel is right on Waikiki Beach but once you step inside the hotel grounds you find a quiet oasis. Bar offers nightly entertainment and a guitar player from 12:30-2:00 each afternoon. As Marriott Elite members we have access to the club lounge which is truly wonderful. Great breakfast, snacks all day and evening beer, wine and appetizers.We head to Maui tomorrow but will definitely return here next year. Great staff and great service here at The Moana Surfrider Hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our stay at the Moana Surfrider at Wikiki Beach, Honolulu was truly memorable. Firstly, it is bang on Waikiki Beach, so you can't ask for a better location! The view from our room was truly outstanding and something we will treasure for the rest of our lives. The facilities were excellent too. We loved, in particular the Beach Club Lounge, which was a perfect place to relax. We used this for breakfast every morning and also for the appetizers and cocktails in the evenings. Overall, we would strongly recommend the Moana Surfrider for it's location and facilities which we felt were superb!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is the oldest hotel in Hawaii. It is a beautiful facility with a lovely courtyard featuring a large, old banyon tree. The service was quite good and the room small, but very nice. The view of the ocean and partial view of Diamond Head was spectacular. However, when we checked in, the A/C was leaking right inside the door to the room, creating a sizable puddle. The hotel staff was quick to respond, stop the leak and clean up the puddle. Upon returning to the hotel the next afternoon, after sightseeing, the A/C was again leaking and there was another huge puddle. The staff quickly responded and this time stopped the leak for the remainder of our 4 day stay. We didn't want to switch rooms as we didn't seem guaranteed to get a room with such a wonderful view. The staff - front desk, bellmen, housekeeping - were all friendly and efficient. In spite of the leakage problems, we loved this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Have just checked out after 3 nights here. The hotel is beautiful and room was lovely though very noisy as faced the street and windows are not double glazed.Great access to the beach out front and all over has a beautiful old world ambience for this historic hotel in a perfect location.Unfortunately service is appalling. Check in we had to lug our suitcases ourselves from the kerb to the long line Check in. Was in the line 30 minutes and room not ready. Not usually a big issue however we then needed to search for a bell boy ourselves to look after our bags. They were hard to find. All other staff appeared non caring. No advice re what to do for a few hours. No offer of a cool spot to sit and wait or offer of a drink. Bar staff service is terrible. Can sit for minimum 20 minutes even when bar is nearly empty and wait for service. Tried to find a drinks waiter and was told not their table but they'd find someone else !!Concierge/tour desk was rude and unhelpful and felt stupid for asking a simple question.Not sure what you pay the resort fee for as a couple there are no real benefits but fee is compulsory. Pool chairs and beach chairs are all gone by 7am although we were happy with the sand. A beach umbrella would have been nice for shade. Overall wouldn't return due to terrible service from lots of staff. Doesn't come close to 5 star service anywhere in Asia.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We’ve just had 8 nights at the Moana Surfrider and we check out in the morning. The staff have been amazing and the hotel and its amenities are superb as always. This is why we’ve been coming here for the past 7 years.If you’re expecting low end budget accommodation, then, this isn’t the place for you. It’s not cheap, but, it’s really very good.It’s the only place we stay at in Honolulu and years ago we tried some others before settling on the Surfrider.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The customer service at this hotel was horribly lacking.We did not receive the room we booked and weren't offered any compensation for their discrepancy, not even a simple bar credit.Terribly understaffed, as there was always a long wait at the desk, even at 11:30 pm when we needed a simple request of ear plugs because of the street noise. In frustration they said they would send to our room. This was after we called the desk to be put on hold until we gave up and decided to walk down to the front desk. LAME.I was also double charged for my stay and room and called 4 times, leaving 3 messages before I got a reply 4 days later, only after I emailed the billing department head. Even still, the problem was not immediately resolved and I was given no assurance on time of when the problem would be rectified or explanation of why it occurred. Other than "Sometimes it takes longer but I don't know why."Its a nice hotel as far as ascetics goes but this is hard to appreciate when the people in charge don't seem to have a clue.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: So when I'm on vacation, I like a margarita now and again - and so I thought I would combine my enjoyment of this location with a top-shelf margarita. The first one I ordered here was an ok well tequila and a splash of Grand Marnier - ok, no worries - it is only $16 after all...... So the second one.... I watch the same bartender squirt the margarita out of the soda dispenser and then put a little dab of Grand Marnier on top and pass it to me. I commented that I was surprised to see the "top shelf" come out of the dispenser and he said "I put Grand Marnier on top". As if that's what makes a $16 margarita.Epic Fail.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is lovely...it is as expected for Waikiki...lots of people. But I want to give a shout-out to the Beachhouse Restaurant staff...particularly Matt and Eva who were so terrific despite being So busy! They were fun. Very professional, but easy to laugh. We totally enjoyed the two evenings we spent there.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I checked into the Moana Surfrider one week into our Hawaiian honeymoon, after spending time in Maui. We loved this hotel - You feel like you are a part of something special, walking through that grand lobby! SERVICE - Excellent. Our check-in staff member was absolutely thrilled that we were on our honeymoon, and made us feel very special. Excellent service at breakfast. We also felt very silly after doing a lot of shopping - we asked the valet if we could leave our car outside the hotel while we ran all of the shopping bags up to the room. Instead he loaded them all onto a luggage trolley and brought them right up to our room for us, while we parked the car. ROOM - We booked a Partial Ocean View room, and were allocated one on level 11, facing out the right side of the building (when facing the beach). We had quite a generous view of the ocean from our balcony. The room furniture was modern and did not feel dated, compared our Maui hotel. We also laughed at the Japanese style automatic toilet (with washing and drying feature)!!LOCATION - Right on the beach on one side, and right in the middle of upscale Waikiki shops on the other side, could not really be better! An awesome location to explore from. If we return to Waikiki, and have some extra cash to splash, we would definitely stay at the Moana again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited Waikiki this week and were both fortunate and unfortunate enough to stay at the Moana Surfrider hotel.The property is lovely in a great location. The staff, across the board, leave a LOT to be desired! From check in, through pool bar staff to pool area, all had distinct problem areas and despite bringing our issues to various people’s attention, nothing was done and no follow up’s were provided!Definitely will not stay there again if we visit the island.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A bit disappointed with this hotel. The fact that one has to pay a daily ‘Resort Fee’ for some towels and a few ‘Extras’ is unfair as the pool side is a battle to find a lounge or umbrella...unless you are lucky you probably won’t find a suitable space at poolside. We regularly paid USD$50 + per day to hire 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella outside the hotel. Would definitely not go there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff at Moana at the beach/pool and the Beach Club were amazing: Lee, Gloria, Huali, issac, mo, Jim, Constance, Emiko, Yuki, Karen. They were all friendly, attentive, smiling, tolerant of our poor humor, quick to respond, and proactive to ensure our stay was effortless and a true pleasure. Thank you, Moana!!!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Thanks so much to the Moana staff for making my families vacation so special!! Thanks to Mo, Isaac, Lee, Emiko, Karen, Yuki, Constance, Gloria, Huali, Jim, we will be back as soon as possible. So stoked!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My friends and I have been coming here for 25 years on an annual boys trip. The staff always take A++ care of us. Thanks so much to staff members Lee, Huali, Isaac, Mo, Gloria, Constance, Emiko, Reyn, , Kainoa, Jim,Karen, Yuki, and the rest!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Honolulu, that is Waikiki Beach, the Times Square of the heart of Hawaii, can be a mess, especially those who just got off the plane with a travel brochure and luggage larger than they are. This is just as difficult for any seasoned TA visitor: just which part of such a melting pot are we writing to? My personal favorite has always been the classic Victorian grand hotel, the Surfrider, which has survived both a few changes of management and even the beach hordes on its gracious steps. Clearly, many of its contemporary clientele (who may think that a luau shirt qualifies as dinner dress), this is no fault of a magical legend of early Hawaii trying to survive the ages. So this review is happy to report to all those travelers of such different stripes that the Surfrider has managed its own time-fold ways to satisfy most of you. It's up to you top know how to navigate the rest.  The simplest customer is simply the bargain-hunting beachcomber. If all they need is a mattress, a beach and an all-day bar, it's all at the best spot for surf and trade winds; that's why they built it here a century ago in the first place. But for the more fastidious (or nostalgic) travelers, the royal Surfrider can still show its regal side, even if it's a bit more difficult to find. The original wing's floors, each of which was built from Banyan or a different wood, has been carpeted over, but the luscious open-air breezeways remain across its lobby and terraces; from the entrance to the courtyard, the gentle wood rocking chairs are still in place. If you're drawing comparisons to the other original beach palace, the Royal Hawaiian, all bathed in sunrise pink, in my opinion, it has been submerged beneath a seat of upscale mall shops.  The Surfrider, of course, has now added new wings to the original, some smaller, warren rooms requiring a hike to the nearest elevator, but here's where a little advance scouting helps: the reservations, concierge, baggage and customer service desks are all impressively loyal and personally attentive; you may even forget there are hundreds there beside you. Room and housekeeping service are just as responsive: a room can be cleaned up, on request, within an hour or so, and empty trays are picked up before you even notice. The range of rooms, from classic verandahs and plantation shutters to suites with beach and city balconies, are available, but require going through a maze of advance scouting, worthy of some resort paleontology. They can all be found, up to your preference and your budget, but buyer beware: don't leave it up to online reservations.  Finally, the hotel's spa and fitness center are all updated and the best that can be found this side of Eden. You will also find a young and athletic crowd present, maybe a surprise to find them sharing the same historic and romantic hotel that you are. Best of all, the Surfrider's open-air, Oceanside, verandah restaurants for breakfast and dinner are literally in a different space and price point from the bar menus, but in the evening their sense of peace and old Hawaii tides and breezes may remind you that the calming ancestors of Waikiki are still there with you. One non-property warning: the local taxi drivers can be notoriously ill-mannered and poorly trained (mine couldn't understand the directions to Waikiki or the Surfrider. Arrange beforehand for hotel shuttle or service to collect you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the lei greeting upon arriving, to the check-in experience, to the room, to the beach impeccable guest service. Many Mahalo to Frank, Samson, Stephen, Houlali, Lee, Gloria, all housekeeping - and the entire Surfrider staff - love our time with you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Samson Mokuahi at the front desk is such a great ambassador of Aloha!! Went above and beyond to make sure that my family and I had a smooth check in and amazing stay. Service was exceptional! We will definitely return! Thank you so much!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My time at the Moana Surfrider was awesome .... From the valet to Heivalani at the front desk, the room was a beautiful ocean view.. Leilani and Stacie at BeachClub was very helpful and full of “Aloha”.. Nightly entertainment was a plus

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Moana Surfrider. Friendly staff and the room was very comfortable. Nightly entertainment in the lobby and at the beach bar. Waikiki is a VERY busy area so there are plenty of nice places to eat and great shopping.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Super crowded and charge you with additional resort fee with a free photo but all the booking are full until the next day 3:20 pm Chair around the pool and beach are always occupiedThe bed itself is comfortable though

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Aloha!Had another awesome stay at the Moana Surfrider...everything and everyone was wonderful. Special shout out to Charles S who works in the BeachClub and made our family feel like a part of his family. His kindness, warmth, island tips and service were second to none. Also, Mo who sets up the beach and pool area is an incredibly hard worker and provided great service as well. Mahalo Moana for another great stay and the best service around!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The best place to stay in Waikiki. In the middle of Waikiki beach, on the strip of shops and restaurants. Clean bright rooms. Lovely reception spaces. Friendly staff. We had four nights here and it was a lovely relaxing stay. Don’t forget the resort fees will be added to your room costs.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic location and ambience. Very comfortable room but the piped music which came in through the A/C vent and drove us mad! 6am-11pm. We asked for it to be turned down but after a day, the volume was back up again. And what is it about the coffee? Stewed Luke warm on the Terrace. Even when we paid, it was very average! We finally found a coffee shop outside the hotel which served a good brew!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved this classic "icon" of a hotel that was initially built in 1901 as the first hotel at Waikiki Beach in Honolulu. We stayed in the old section because of our fondness for the classic part of the hotel. The much-newer tower part of the hotel is clearly modern. The restaurant and beach-side bar were in lovely settings, under an ancient banyan tree. The food at the bar, however, was disappointing - being "average" at best.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our third stay in Honolulu and second in Waikiki. One of the big plusses for us of the hotel was location, and it doesn't hurt that you can walk out of the hotel right on to the beach and have fun immediately with the kids. The beds were excellent and we all slept well, and having a balcony off the room allowed us adults to have our coffee while the kids slept in.The restaurant buffet was pricey but very nice, and it's worth the wait for an outside table. Front desk staff and room service staff were always helpful, friendly, and added brightness to our stay. Where things fell down was at the bar. We waited forever to get served, the person barely spoke with us (we had to actually go up to 2 different people at times) and the drinks I thought were overpriced for what you got. So while we did do the buffet the first morning, for all our other meals we preferred to eat outside the hotel.For those with kids, the zoo is only a 10 minute walk away. We even did a long hike to Diamond Head direct from the hotel, but TBH I think unless you are in good shape you are better off Uber-ing it over to the trail head. Having the shops so close was great for browsing with the daughter while my wife/son were on their own adventure.Oh - pro tip! If you forget anything, the ABC store across the street is the best place to stock up. You can even buy poke and other food items there for lunch vs. having to go to a restaurant, which is smart as the nearest Starbucks is a 5-10 minute walk away.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location wonderful, beach on one side, main drag of Waikiki on the other. Plenty of shopping & eateries walking distance.Elegant Grande Dame lobby & restaurant on veranda.All staff we encountered were very nice.We reserved a King oceanfront room... only room with 2 double beds available when we arrived. This was a large corner room but without the French balcony.We were moved the next day to a King room with balcony on 7th floor. Much smaller than corner room, but having balcony was lovely. Rooms could have better soundproofing & A/C noisey in both rooms.Coffee maker & tea kettle, mini fridge in room, 2 bottles water provided daily.Hotel does a large business with Japanese... 2nd reception area for Japanese speakers, all menus, many signs English & Japanese, programmable toilets, Japan airlines office on site, convenience store with many Asian snacks & ramen to go.Daily weddings, 1 with very noisey reception, thankfully quiet after 7:30 pm.Pool small, like all Waikiki hotels. Saline filter. Most lounges around pool claimed by early am. Sign said towels would be removed after seats empty 1 hour, but staff did not. You have to take over an unoccupied spot yourself. Only 1 side of pool area had umbrellas... the hotel easily could remedy that.Bar area under beautiful Banyan tree next to pool with short menu. Electric music, mostly Hawaiian after noon.Veranda/ Beach house restaurant very nice but pricey... like most of Waikiki. Delicious lobster bisque, Bacon, lettuce, lobster & tomato sandwich, perfect steak.Had room service for first breakfast... a $12 delivery & tray charge were added to food cost. This was not mentioned on menu. After adding a tip our small breakfast was $90!In summary hotel would deserve 5 stars if minor changes were made.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’ve only been here for a few hours, but I’m so enthusiastic about this experience I felt compelled to write a review immediately. And the reason for this review is a gentleman named Samson. I’ll spare you the details, but we arrived in Waikiki a hot mess. I can’t recall a better check in experience in my life. Samson was compassionate and professional and thoroughly elevated my mood. Incredible. The man is a champion.  The hotel and its position on Waikiki beach is amazing, but it wouldn’t matter without people like Samson.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the Spectacular view from our balcony to the delightful morning breakfasts overlooking the beach, plus afternoon relaxation on the beach patio watching the children swim in the aqua blue waters - this place is a paradise!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Review: Pros- This is a beautiful property located in an excellent area of town. You can walk to stores and restaurants easily. Our room was comfortable and quiet. We had a decent view of the beach in our partial ocean view in the tower. There is a coffee shop onsite that is great. Housekeeping did a good job We did encounter some problems with our stay but overall it was a decent resort. Not for sure we would stay here again but not terribly unhappy. Cons - The pool is very small and close extremely early. People save chairs starting at 6am and you can rarely find a seat. The beach area is very small and chairs are very limited. We did not have the opportunity to rent them because they were always reserved. The beach is not good for families. Two boats(large) pull up and take up so much space and make everyone get out of their way. Parking is not good. We had to pay for valet all week because the parking is pretty far away by the time you walk through the garage and through another resort. The breakfast at the Veranda was wonderful every morning. The staff there were fabulous. However we had terrible service twice at the beach bar. We were charged for things we shouldn’t have been charged for and had terrible service. They do not have very many options either to eat. The staff was not friendly here overall besides the waiters we encountered at the Veranda and the valet staff ( of course we tipped them well also). I’m not sure one person smiled or acted like they were happy to be there. If I had some suggestions it would be more management onsite, better training, longer pool hours, more beach chairs, free beach toys to use and return, cheaper valet since the parking garage is not convenient, more items on menus for lunch and dinner, healthier and gluten free options for people with allergies, Lei welcome for members, open the veranda for lunch.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I had the chance to stay at the Moana Surfrider in a Diamond Oceanfront room, and it was incredible. Upon arrival, we were greeted with flower leis (which is the dream, really) and because our room wasn’t quite ready, we stored our luggage at the front desk and wandered Waikiki for a bit.Our room had a breath taking view and we fell asleep to the sound of the ocean each night. We had amazing service at the bar, and stopped by for late afternoon/evening music and drinks on our last night. The common areas are bustling but calm down a bit in the evening, when you can pretend you’re in a modern day Blue Hawaii.We booked our rooms through Costco, and the package came with airport transportation. We waited quite a while for our shuttle to arrive, and one of the bellmen asked the name of our shuttle company, and then offered to keep an eye out. The shuttle never came, so he booked us a taxi that came pronto.We were sad to go but can’t wait to go back! Mahalo nui loa, Moana staff!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed in the historic banyan wing for 3 nights. The room is tiny, not a Westin standard that I experienced in other Westin hotels. The bathroom is also very small. Nothing luxurious at all as decor is also dated. The saving grace is the location and the beach front lawn and bar. A great place to hang out, having a drink and watching the sun sets.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: There are some great things about this property: the building itself, the location, the views, breakfast is awesome, the hostess/mgr at the evening restaurant, and the housekeeping staff!Here are the negatives: they we’re renovating the « beach bar » during our including sawing tiles during happy hour sunset band performance (nice one GM!), valet takes at least 20 to 30 minutes to get your car, but the main annoyance is the policy for the 35 beach umbrellas (2 chairs each) for hundreds of hotel guests. They have a policy that I imaging was created in a back room after the GM threw up his hands and said I can’t think of anything else and let’s just make it easy for the staff. They’ve created a Hunger Games type of competition to reserve seating for $60 a day. 1/ you have to reserve in person the day before, so when you arrive no chairs for you and by the way, none for the next day. 2/ the next day you arrive you have to be in line by 7am to reserve for the following day, there were already 17 people in front of me at 6:30am. 3/ if you can get a set of chairs, they are yours for the entire day whether you sit in them or not. When someone does leave for good day at 3pm, they put the chairs away and do not let anyone else use them, or even pay to use them, nice! 4/ on the last day, I heard someone say you could get a chair for a half day due to availability, but since no one, not the front desk, not the beach staff ever explains these beach chair policies, you have to figure it all out yourself.Let the games begin!PS hotel was booked when I stayed there, maybe a better chair experience when the hotel is not at capacity

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful character filled old hotel. Right on the beach, front and center. I love the ambiance of the place having been a guest 20 something years ago when it was a Sheraton. It is certainly very expensive but hardly at the top of the tree as Hawaii is an expensive place to holiday. We initially chose a Banyan city view room because of price but upgraded at $US100 to a beach front tower ocean view premiere room after a long tiring flight from Sydney. Tower rooms are looking slightly dated and needing some minor interior maintenance but worth it for the view, ocean sounds at night and bigger size of room.. Waikiki you have to expect crowds even in the Moana Surfrider which is a shame as the hotel exudes style but it can be a bit hard to see through the people to the finer details of the old hotel. Beautiful beach front location so why fuss about the pool? Pool loungers are at a premium and almost impossible to get due to 'hogs' who reserve them but hardly use them from early morning till night.All beachfront rooms suffer from some daytime 'fun' noise from people enjoying the ocean directly below and the expected 'Hawaiian amplified singing/ musak in the early evening. Beach front rooms with Diamond Head views are fabulous

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I contact the general manager, Front desk, Reservations about our trip. My friend James is son a terminal fase of ALS disease and I convince him to do his last travel to Hawaii where I go three or four times a year and I suggest the Moana as a best place to stay normally I stay in another close by but this “ Supposed to be special “I did ask since week ago for a Handicap Room which they did not have it ..We have to wait In line to do the check in for so long he could walk or stan up well and also suggeste if they could give him a cake small thing for his birthday and no one ever reply just the concierge who says you can go to the bakery and buy a cake or buy flowers for him ..The 5 days I did ask for a Bed for him on the beach it seems I have to book in advance so he never could lay on a special bed or even on the pool because it was not available Anything for him ..The amount of kids around the pool without parents control make him fall when a bunch of kids run over him..4:30 Am they put a buffet area next to the room which was the main building and they never care about the noise they made because they have. Large group of a private Event the whole weekend ( he could never sleep because the singer and bar stoops at 11 pm then 4:30 the whole crew putting the buffet..I feel so disappointed with my self to suggest stay at the Moana as a last life wish and no one ( NO ONE DID CARE OF IT )And I feel so ashamed to see how they have a special Treat for the Japanese tourist, they got the own lobby and vip area .. and of course they where able to gey anything they want .. SHAME ON YOU

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We brought our family of 5 here for Spring Break. We upgraded to an Oceanfront Tower room which was worth it just to hear the waves crashing to fall asleep to. Plus the view of Diamondhead is amazing. What really makes this trip with a family a value is if you have elite Bonvoy status so you can get into the Lounge for free. Our platinum status got us free full breakfast for 4 of us daily and cocktail hour in the evening that pretty much comes with a full dinner (they discounted our 5th family member). I'd return here in a heartbeat. Important tip! Parking is outrageous (as it is with all hotels). 4 blocks away at the Waikiki Banyan (2532-2520 Kuhlo Ave), you can buy a weekly parking pass with in & out privileges for $110 ($16/day!). Valet is $45/day at the hotel and self park (1 block away) is $35/day.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was the trip of a lifetime...spending 3 weeks in Hawaii visiting our daughter who lives there. Staying at the Moana Surfrider our last week was magical! We were immediately impressed with the "old world" elegance of the hotel. In the heart of busy Waikiki, it seemed like an oasis of serenity and beauty. The Moana was large enough to give one the feeling of openness and space..yet small enough to make one feel welcomed. The beauty of white was everywhere and was especially noticeable on the wide wraparound veranda. Such charm! Afternoon tea served there was delightful, especially with the lovely view of the turquoise water. Friendly and hospitable staff members were everywhere and definitely got the sense they are happy with their employment. I felt the Aloha spirit! No one was rushed, and we were able to experience the gifts of time and kindness! There is something for everyone to enjoy at the hotel from live piano music, to pool activities, beachfront access, shopping, eating, hula dancing, etc. The Spa is lovely with very attentive and talented staff- definitely worth spending some time there. Thank you for a most memorable hotel experience...we will be back for sure!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was on a business trip and took along my family. My family had a great time, they rented paddle boards and surfboards to enjoy the beach. The concierge staff was very friendly and informative about where to go and visit while on the Island. Breakfast buffet was delicious with plenty of variety. Highly recommend and will be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel feature by feature summary:Valet/luggage boy - 1 star experience (valet hustled our car out of the driveway as soon as I unloaded the luggage)Entrance/Lobby - 5 starCheck-in Agent - 5 starConcierge Agents - 1 star (very nonchalant or cavalier about imparting information on public transportation)Restaurants/Lounge - 5 starElevator - 5 starHallway/carpeting - 2 starRoom furnishings - 4 starRoom flooring - 2 star (carpet in badly in need of upgrade/replacement)Bathroom - 3 star (would have been 5 if not for old floor tiles, cracked sink, and mismatch tub surround-tiles)Regardless of the minor issues with this hotel, I do recommend staying at the Moana Surfrider hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here with my husband and son in a city view tower room and it was terribly noisy. Ended up leaving early. The street noise from bars below was shocking even on the highest floors. I could hear a busker singing on the street below at 2am one night and I could hear him word for word from the 19th floor! I asked multiple times if we could have another room and willing to pay for upgrade to ocean view or ANYTHING only to be told there was nothing available. The hotel was obviously full which didn’t help but it ruined our holiday not being able to get a quieter room. Don’t waste your money here and stay at the Royal Hawaiian instead at least it’s quiet and much better value for money.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our trip started off driving by the hotel as my girlfriend said “wow that place looks nice!” She was pleasantly surprised when I told her it was our hotel. Our check in with Samson was as smooth as it could be. He was so kind, helpful and funny. As a group, we decided to cancel our plans for the day and stay at the hotel after seeing how nice it was as we only stayed for one night in Honolulu. We had such an amazing day. The room was probably the nicest we have ever stayed in with a sweet view of Waikiki beach. The staff and service was happy and helpful throughout the stay. The hotel had every amenity you could think of. The breakfast was amazing as well. I would highly suggest staying a night or two at this beautiful property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The new Shorefrye in the International Market Place is located on the 3rd floor. We have eaten both breakfast and dinner at this location. Pricing is very reasonable for Waikiki. The food is delicious. They have a great menu,superb staff and the views from there eating lanai is terrific!! Worth your time to stop!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked-in today and the front desk informed us that they are fully booked and that the Premier Ocean Tower room that we paid for in advance is not available and we are being downgraded to a lower class of room and they will be throwing in some freebies to compensate. Shocked to receive this kind of treatment at The Westin. Shameful for the hotel management to treat its guests like this. And to make things worse, the air-conditioning in the room we received was not working properly. Called the hotel technician and he said there was a problem with the thermostat and he would try to look for a replacement unit but most likely only the next day it can be fixed.Can't imagine what the rest of our stay at this hotel is going to be like.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My 1st expression here are horrible. The receptionist was not welcome at all . She just like doing then tells u just go come back at 3. Then she left without saying nothing or showing around. Then extra resort fee ? And u have to pay for your own chair and umbrella by hours when u are actually a guest at the hotel. The pool are tiny may be fit 10 aldut max to chill not to swimming.  Room are little old but decent clean Plus is it close to everything walking distance. Hope hotel fix the receptionist attitude and those extra nonsense fees
user_name:
phuocnguyen711
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Currently staying at moana surfrider. The location is great, rooms are okay, but pool area is the worse. Visitors come at 7am when the pool opens and throw towels on the chairs and leave for hours. Pool attendants say they are monitoring the chairs (they are supposed to be freed up if the visitors haven’t been on the chair for an hour), but having been at the pool for hours on several days of our trip, we can vouch that the attendants aren’t doing a good job. One lady beside us had 2 chairs blocked all day and no one used the chairs beside her. There were several other families that came to the pool and left because they couldn’t get chairs. Frustrating to see such weak controls.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this hotel! the historical charm, great service, and location were perfect. The room was clean and updated. Being in the center of Waikiki allowed us to walk to everything. The restaurant was excellent - we ate breakfast there every morning, and we easily walked to other restaurants in the area. Parking across the street was easy too.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm not sure why this hotel gets the hate that it does but my family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We were here from March 2nd to March 7th, 2019. It's a wonderful hotel located in the heart of Waikiki and directly on the beach. First off, this is the first hotel ever built in Waikiki and the reason why it's called the First Lady. The hotel is gorgeous with its classical open air decor that leads to the terrace and beach. The service and staff here is phenomenal. We had no problems getting assistance with any request. We stayed in the Tower Premier Ocean View Room with a View of Diamond Head. Its was worth every penny for the view. They have onsite restaurants, gym, spa, a pool, and beach rentals. The list of included amenities that the resort fee covers is definitely worth it. It even includes a one day GoPro rental. Yes, resort fees suck but to us it was worth it this trip. The pool is a bit on the small side but who goes to Hawaii to be in a pool when the beach is just steps away. Also, for those who complain about Waikiki Beach being crowded just get there early or later in the day. Enjoy the fun of the island. If you're looking something quieter head to the North Shore for a day. Thanks again to the staff and management for making our first trip to Hawaii memorable.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently spent a few days with my sister at Honolulu, and being that I stayed at Moana Surfrider before a few other times, I suggested that we do the same. The hotel is just as lovely as ever, with very comfortable beds and it's so conveniently located. The BEST part of our stay was definitely our experience with Nelly, the concierge. She patiently booked everything for us, and was happy to move a couple of things around later when our trip to whale watching didn't go as expected (no whales!). Service like that is hard to find (we know as my husband and I travel pretty extensively), and we wanted to especially thank Nelly for her extraordinary service. She made our girls trip wonderful!Oh, and I must also say that we enjoyed the piano music at the lounge so much. Ethan Capone was playing. He took song requests, played Bossanova, Jazz, etc. and was absolutely delightful! We stayed pretty much the whole time he played, and he never even took a break. We would probably become groupies if we lived on the island :)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved our one night stay before heading out from Honolulu. The location is perfect right in the middle of Waikiki. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are amazing, view was great too.My two things that were not that good....the pool is very small, not really for the size of the hotel. Beach is small and very crowded, I understand it is a public beach but it is just very uncomfortable how tight you are with the umbrellas next to you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived excited for our Hawaiian vacation and weren't disappointed. From the lovely front desk associates to the servers in the Beach Club we we're meet with top service coupled with the beautiful Hawaiian spirit of ohana. Can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The best part of our experience at the Moana was getting help from Nellie , the hotel's concierge. we spoke many times on the phone before my trip. She planned the perfect week's worth of activities for my family, even when we checked to stay up north for the second part of our trip. We had to do some last minute changing of things due to my daughter's broken foot,and Nellie was always prompt and amazing - including getting a wheelchair delivered within an hour! She is an asset to the company for sure!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here in August 2018 for 5 nights, across the period that Hurricane Lane was threatening the islands. Unfortunately this meant that the outdoor bars and restaurants were closed, but the hotel put on a temporary restaurant in the ballroom. The staff worked very hard across this period, keeping us informed of the latest situation, ensuring that there was plenty of available hot food. This was essential as Waikiki was effectively closed down for 2 days. The hotel itself is right on Waikiki beach, and is in a beautiful old main building, with two towers on either side. We had a partial ocean view room, but would probably go for the full ocean view in future. The room was big enough for our family of 4, with a decent size balcony. If we return to Waikiki, we’d definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had a short notice trip to Hawaii and was able to secure a room at a Bonvoy property. The highlights of the property is its location and the young ladies that work in the Beach club lounge. As a Titanium Elite member there is an expectation regarding upgrades and overall service, the Moana uses its status as a Spa to reduce your expectations unfortunately. Upgrade was only for a room with two beds, as a Titanium I am guaranteed room type /bed type choice unless its a resort and I was unable to secure a late checkout. Those inconveniences are a disappointment but I did utilize the lounge for breakfast each morning and enjoyed the local beer on tap during the evening lounge hours. Again, location, location, location is the best part of the property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in a fabulous water front suite in the Towers. Photos of the view are attached. Our check in with Keith was fantastic. Very helpful. We enjoyed lunch on the Veranda where Jeremy provided top notch service. And moreover Zenaida, our housekeeper, she surprised me with a beautiful Mylar birthday balloon and really looked after us during our 8 night stay. All of the staff were fantastic. These were just a few of the standouts. We will always stay there while in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here in January 2019 for one night after a long flight. The room was a little musty and smaller. The location was perfect. Right on the beach. This hotel has been around Waikiki for many years! It is a landmark. The pool is small, but he location and overall upkeep of the hotel is top notch. I would recommend this hotel! Questions, message me.
user_name:
jgallag
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is a beautiful, historic property! Wonderful views! Excellent, helpful staff! I would definitely recommend the Moana to everyone visiting Oahu. The Mona and her staff made our anniversary very special! The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. Always kept a smile on their faces and always willing to help. The food was excellent! The pool/beach staff were helpful! Their surfing instructors, amazing! They made us feel confident on the waves. We thank you again for the wonderful experience!Special thanks to Samson, Shane, and Ken at the front desk. Abigail from the club. Kealii the surf instructor.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do not stay here! Save your time and money. The room was super tiny and we paid for an ocean view and got the garden instead due to lack of availability. That was fine but had no refund or credit for the price we paid. When we complained to the manager he said there is nothing he can do. Beyond disappointed in Westin.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Be wary of this hotel you pay big bucks and it is very overated if it was cheaper I’d rate it better Great location very busy very tiny pool We had a tower partial ocean view old style bathroom don’t know why they bother with the heated toilet seats freak me out!Queen size bed to soft for me ended up with a bad back dark room okay balcony not a bad partial ocean view Slow check in Ok breakfast

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is awful. I’m so gutted we stayed here during our trip to Hawaii. It looks beautiful from the outside of the main entrance, however, it’s a different story when you go inside. Huge tower blocks where the hotel has over-inflated the amount of rooms but not increased the guest facilities. Tiny, cold pool and an expectation to pay to use a sun lounger and parasol on the beach. I am well travelled and have NEVER experienced this when staying within the hotel’s section/sun lounger/parasols on the beach.They also disgustingly charged me extra to stay in all a king size bed - which is what I had paid for on booking. When I realised this I went berserk, admittedly it seemed Chris had sorted it, however I’ve just received my credit card bill to find that they’ve still charged me for it. I’m livid. I’ve already contacted the resort/umbrella company that owns the hotel for a refund on the “daily resort fees” which they sell to you as taxes, yet are actually more ways for them to steal money from you - surely when I’ve booked the hotel, I’ve paid everything within that price?! I have had no response - disgrace.Furthermore, there was boarding up around the beach cafe area which wasn’t advertised anywhere on booking/prior to arrival: it made the resort feel smaller and completely blocked sunset views.Hugely disappointing stay, and would suggest you go literally anywhere else! I’m very interested in the Hilton next time!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room- looks good but many negatives. Corner room so tv was put on side wall and not on a swivel bracket so watching tv laying in bed not really practical due to angle.We stayed in the old part of the hotel so windows were thin glass panes which let every bit of noise in- mainly traffic and buskers. Awake every morning at 5am when the delivery trucks across the street started arriving and beeping horns and reversing beeps. Shower door opened out so poured water onto the floor everytime. Poor water pressure for size of shower head and the basin had very little space to put out toiletries and cosmetics so it was very cramped. Lack of towel rails/hooks. Staff- a bit rude and unhelpful at times. Some were lovely. Pool bar and restaurant- despite being a guest at the hotel and paying resorts fee there is no discount for this. Anyone can use these without being a guest at the hotel and pay the same price for food and drinks which is unfair. Service charge for 6 or more people of 18/19% and then same amount for tip on top makes it even more expensive. Again- hotel guests should be given 10% discount and service charge waived. Pool bar area had construction so sunset view obscured. Noisy. Singers/music was the same stuff every night- where is the diversity??? Two nights out of our stay they had piano player inside the hotel but again- no diversity. It seems they expect all guests to be the same. Also served drinks in PLASTIC disposable glasses with plastic straws- I heard Hawaii had gone plastic straw free??? I expected more eco-conscious products in a beach front hotel with heritage like the Moana. Same with hotel room toiletries- although there was a recycling bin in the room and hotel foyer too. Resort fee - no activities after lunch/early afternoon so it was impossible to get value out of the resort fee as we were sight seeing etc during daytime. One day I did go to crafts on the verandah- but it wasn’t on!! Tried to opt out as I knew we wouldn’t use services offered but was unable to and told it was compulsory. 6 nights equaled $226 USD. For which I managed to get two yoga classes and about 10mins Internet each day. Internet i didn’t need as I had my own travel data!! They offer gopro hire- but you have to go to another hotel to get this. There was no Wednesday morning sunrise ceremony as per checkin handout as I checked the foyer computer for updated info. Something I actually wanted to and could have attended. Hotel will book day trips for you- but I would advise against this as it is so much cheaper to book stuff yourself direct instead of tours. Especially if you have use of a car while you are there- but you have to park away from the hotel.Positives- comfy bed. Clean hotel. Central location. Overall- disappointing stay. Have stayed in top resorts before and the moana fell short of expectations for the price.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is great in the day, right on the beach. Our room was listed as "city view", but from the balcony we saw the beach to the left, and the International Marketplace to the right. The view was great, but music from outside was really loud until past midnight. The rooms were clean, but basic. I heard some rooms had been renovated, but ours was not. The rooms were very average, in contrast to the beautiful exterior. The cleaning staff was excellent and very friendly. The front desk staff we nice, but not very organized. We had a daily room credit, but some staff said it expired at midnight, some said it was ok to use the next day, some never heard of the credit and did not offer to find an answer.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After some hotel visits of the new styled Marriotts Bonvoy program on Oahu, Maui, big island and Kauai, after mixed impressions this time a totally good feeling. We were hosted great all wishes fully fulfilled, even difficulties like closed street because of festival, courtesy room for late leave, and a all around nice and interested team. Our room view to inner part of the hotel and sea gave a great sundown panorama with diamond head in the back. We could smell the history and high class level of this hotel. Expensive? Yes definitely, but it’s value is exactly what clients might wish. We had weak experience in other hotels not much cheaper but less attention.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for just one “day” as we needed a place close to the airport to hang out before we left on a red-eye flight back to the mainland. *Remember highway traffic is unpredictable and can be congested at all hours in Oahu. We should have spent a couple days here at the hotel in Waikiki. The Surfrider is “just a hotel” and the pool is tiny... but access to the beach and the actives, shopping... all great for the end of our trip. Also, staff here was pretty good, poolside drinks were great!! The Marriott members lounge is really good too. For the $$$... a very good option!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying here for a week with my family. Initially we loved the place, and were ok with the beach bar being closed although it mars what would be an excellent view. To cover the construction they've put up white wooded barriers (see photo bellow).I recommend canceling your reservation and/or not booking until the construction is complete. Every day during prime beach time from morning to evening they are using power tools to renovate the bar.It's high season on Waikiki right now and this should have been finished months ago (apparently there was a problem with the construction team not working during a hotel strike).Below, I've attached a picture of my mom "enjoying" the beach with noise canceling headphones on. We complained to the manager who just shrugged. C'mon, at least a $1 off coupon for your $18 drinks would have been a nice token.Other than that the rooms are fine, the locations is great. Could have been a truly world class experience.Also: expect to be up-charged every chance the hotel gets and don't trust the concierge (it's a separate company and not working for guests).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for three days after a week's cruise around the islands. the best words to describe the experience is 'magical'. From the incredible breakfast to terrific dinner, a large room and impeccable service, this resort had it all. Would definitely return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: stayed 2 nights here, nice room with great view of ocean, rocking chairs to view sunset from room, rocking chairs while waiting for valet car pickup, ate twice at resturant under the big banyon tree, was ok, upstairs has alittle museum stuff. was an ok stay but they would not let me play the piano, bummer.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed in the Diamond Tower. It was brilliant. The views are unsurpassed. A well-equipped room. The buffet breakfast is substantial and staff are friendly. The pool is ok, could be bigger. The facilities otherwise are very impressive

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Luvd the beach bar. Service was good. Tried the fish tacos and lava flow. Taste good, small portion. should’ve ordered more. Ambiance was good sitting under the banyan tree with live music though we were seated further back almost near pool but is ok as close to walk toward restrooms that were super clean. moana hotel interior looks lovely and can sit on those rocking chairs.
user_name:
NQuoryo
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed for a weekend and wow Ivan at the spa made the trip. He and Lei made our couples massage so special. We were celebrating my birthday and he had even got us a cheesecake to celebrate. He is so in tune and a master at his craft. Thank you Ivan and Lei!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in an "historic banyan room". No lanai or balcony. Overlooking the pool. Very small. In future, I'd probably ask to stay in the Tower. The absolute highlight, however, is the hotel's main restaurant. We had Dinner on day of arrival, and breakfast day after arrival. Both FANTASTIC!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider stands out as one of the few architectural and historical jewels on the Waikiki strip. The decor is relaxing, warm with a touch of sophistication and luxury. I stayed in a deluxe tower ocean view room with a fantastic view of the ocean and Diamond Head! View aside, the room itself was mediocre and slightly outdated. Service here was hit-and-miss as the greeters were non-existent and check-in felt like doing business at the DMV. I thought great service is something you should expect when paying an almost $40/day resort fee! Another issue I ran into was that part of the hotel was closed off for a wedding event. Apparently, this is one of the busier ‘honeymoon hotels.’ The property is located in a prime spot being both right on the beach and close to shops, restaurants, and attractions. Most of the shuttles and tour companies have stopovers here as well.We did not dine in the hotel at all, so I have no opinion about the food aside from Mai Tais we ordered from the courtyard lounge—excellent drinks, but slow service.Aesthetics, history, and location are the Moana’s strong suits but there are probably better values to be found on the Waikiki strip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently spent four nights in Waikiki Beach grand old hotels — two nights at the Royal Hawaiian en route to a cruise in New Zealand, and two nights at he Moana Surfrider on the way back. The Royal Hawaiian is more famous. The Moana Surfrider is actually the oldest luxury hotel on this famous beach and the one which we greatly preferred. Its original layout is preserved and there are public balconies both on the busy Main Street and on the beach. There is a spacious interesting “museum” on the second floor. The dining room is wonderful — around the central beachfront courtyard, both inside and outside tables. The Royal Hawaiian on the other hand has been overtaken by a shopping complex, and many of its spacious “historical” lobbies are vacant and under-utilized.The bar and restaurant staff at the Moana Surfrider seemed friendlier, and that hotel generally had a better vibe.If you like grand old hotels, your choice is between these two. I had heard only about the Royal Hawaiian, but having now stayed at both, I would return to the Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After we had booked we heard about the picketing and staff strike going on at the hotel through a friend in Hawaii but the hotel never mentioned a thing. Luckily it was over by the time we got there but there was still obviously a lot of issues.I was also told about the beach bar being boarded up but it was months before we were due for our trip so assumed it would be fixed, nope not even slightly prettied up. This big eye sore is smack bang in the middle the yard under the famous banyan tree and blocking the view to diamond head from the pool. Our agent asked the hotel several times if there were renovations going on and they kept saying no until we sent them a photo of the bar, their excuse was that they had put up a pop up bar to replace it so it wasn’t counted as a reno. One guy she got through to totally agreed and offered us complementary beach club access.Anyway, so we get there and there is the bar all boarded up over the New Years break, looked even worse than I expected.The room service was in between certain times and finished really early so a late lunch for kids or in room dinner after 10 wasn’t possible. We called to order the kids in room dinner on Year’s Eve and they told us they had a limited menu of burgers and hot dogs only, you have to be kidding!Ummm what else.. water coming through our ceiling in the bathroom, not a drip, pooring through the lights, the guy that came to fix it said someone upstairs must have been having a wild shower and that it happens.. it happened to us twice. Another day all the water through taps was completely brown, they told us just to run the water and it would come good.Last but not least, my husband was refused entry to the beach club on our last day for not having the correct dress code.. everyone else in there including my self had thongs on and had just come from the beach also, he was completely dressed and quite embarrassed by it.Such a shame as it is an absolutely beautiful hotel and if it was run properly I would recommend it to no end. I’m really hoping to hear wonderful changes in the near future.(Photos wouldn’t attach for some reason)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful, well-maintained and clean upscale hotel in Waikiki! The hotel is well-situated for beach and activities - phenomenal restaurants both on site and within steps of the hotel. The room was beautiful - with a great view of the ocean off the balcony. Higher floors are likely to be more restful, as it is right on the road. I stayed on the 20th floor and it was perfect! Coffee on the porch rocking chairs is a must! Pricey? Sure...but it’s Waikiki! A great place to stay and enjoy!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A stay at this hotel will ruin your vacation.My partner has platinum status with SPG and we travel together extensively. We've never been so disgusted by a hotel in our lives! Upon check-in we were informed that we wouldn't have platinum privileges during our stay. This is something we've never encountered before, and the person at the front desk wasn't sure why this was the case for this hotel. He offered for us to speak with his manager, and we agreed. The evening manager came out, guns blazing, and aggressively told us he "did not know or care" why we've never encountered this issue before, and left. The night manager left both us, and the front desk attendant speechless. He was completely rude, unhelpful, and made myself and my partner feel uncomfortable and unwelcome. Avoid at all cost!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here as a splurge for part of a recent trip. The grounds and courtyard dining options all make you feel so relaxed and appreciative of the history that the property oozes. The rooms in the main building are understandably a bit dated for the price, but considering the facilities that come with it it's not outrageous. Some high-end boutique gift shops if that's your thing and the beautiful Banyan tree in the courtyard pulls everything together wonderfully for a sunset chillax.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have always wanted to stay here and so happy I finally did. It is such a special place.Aloha from the moment I arrived. All the staff was nice throughout my visit. View was the best! Can hear the waves an fun as well. Yes, bathroom and tv are small - seriously? I prefer to save the waste of replacing tvs. I don't turn mine on anyway. I've always enjoyed walking through the lobby in the day at night, it was nice to see so many people enjoying the piano playing at night. And the banyan tree at night is so pretty.The resort fee, while not hidden or a surprise, is the only bummer...but everyone does it now.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Upgraded to an ocean front suite, which was the best decision of the trip. Room was perfect with large balcony overlooking the beach. Great sunsets and access to the Beach Club was very cost effective. Sun, sand and surf at the bback door made this a perfect location. So much more character than the steel and glass condos. Front desk staff were very helpful and went out of their way when we had tovstay and extra night due to a cancelled flight. Notbcheap but worth it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hotel is very nostalgic and romantic a perfect place to create everlasting Hawaiian memories. Is not only a perfect place for a wedding reception, but also a perfect place for families with children. Everything is within walking distance to the Hotel. It is also Ocean front property with white sand beaches.My room was very impressive with a private balcony facing the Ocean. The Hotel is attentive to details and it was very much appreciated. When I first arrived and entered into my room, I was welcome with the beautiful smells of lavender. My bed was very comfortable with lot''s of pillows. I highly recommend this facility.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stopped by the Beach Bar and had a great time. We were not staying at the hotel but thought we would check out the hotel then found the bar. They have a Mai Tai called the 1944 and it is good (highly recommend...we each had 2 :)). The bar is under remodel, but still a great place to stop for a night cap and enjoy the atmosphere.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Although the hotel itself is undeniably beautiful, aspects of the hotel really created a negative vibe for the trip. It took us two hours to check into our room, simply because the line was SO long and the short line was reserved for 'VIP Western members'. I understand having a separate area but making the normal line wait so long compared to the members created a real elitist vibe. Every time we went back with a question it took us at least half an hour to speak to anyone. Renting the chairs by the beach was so expensive, and for those that were free, it was a one in a million chance of getting it. My room had two king singles, which is also quite awkward for a holiday away with your partner.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After spending 8 days at turtle bay, we stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. It is beautiful driving up to it, and the lobby and grounds are elegant. As platinum SPG members, checking in was seamless, and although it was to early to get our room, we enjoyed a nice lunch at the Beach house, where there was live music. In fact, we ate there for lunch twice. The pool is super small, and unlike Turtle bay resort, no one comes by to take your order. Apparently, you have to snag a lounge chair early in the morning.Our room was in the diamond wing, and it was super small- the bathroom is the size of what you find in an airplane. The views were beautiful, though, and we loved the rocking chairs with the view of the sea. There is no room on the lanai, so next time we would request a room in the newer wing.As platinum members, we enjoyed breakfast and happy hour- very generous and the staff serving there were great. There were a ton of weddings held while we were there, which was more than amusing. The location of this hotel is perfect, and although I doubt I would want to ever spend time in Waikiki again, I would definitely return to the Moana.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this hotel, if I could bottle the scent of the lobby I would and I would spray it everywhere! It's a charming grand hotel, full of old Hawaii charm. Soothing colors and relaxing, yet elegant decor makes one of the most inviting hotels in Waikiki. The Banyan bar for drinks at sunset, listing to live music, doesn't get much better. I can't wait to come back.
user_name:
Jeremy S
Toms River, New Jersey

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: First things first, if you are coming all the way to Hawaii for a relaxing or romantic getaway like most, I would not spend a lot of time in Waikiki Beach. I'd skip altogether or spend 1-2 nights there and then head up to the North Shore of Oahu and stay at Turtle Bay, which is night and day different than Waikiki Beach. Waikiki Beach is extremely crowded, loud, a big city, and there are tourists everywhere. It's busy just like any big American city and reminds me a little of Miami Beach in regards to business, traffic, noise. With that being said, if you are going to stay in Waikiki the Moana Surfrider is a nice place to stay. It has a great location in the middle of the beach, has better beach space than most, and is an overall nice hotel. It looks big in the pictures but is actually smaller than most hotels there at the beach. ***Please ensure you stay in a room on the courtyard or ocean side, NOT a room on the street side*** We arrived from the North Shore and were shocked by the traffic, noise, tourists and overall busyness of this area. We were put initially in room 601 and spent only one night there. We got NO sleep. Street performers play directly below your window until 10:30pm, motorcycles, buses, ambulances and other vehicles pass by all night long, a garbage truck came through at 5:30am and didn't leave the area until 6am. Also keep in mind this is the first hotel in Waikiki Beach and the walls have very little insulation to noise (unlike cities on the mainland) and you hear everything through the walls. Needless to say, this was the opposite of relaxing, it was noisy and honestly we considering leaving and going back to the North Shore. Thankfully management was very receptive to our complaint, and we were moved the next day to 615. The new room was on the courtyard/ocean side of the hotel and was a totally different experience: quiet, peaceful, relaxing. We slept great in this room. Neither room had a balcony and both are small rooms. The restaurants in hotel are exceptional. They are expensive but its Hawaii so we expected this. We had fresh guava juice every day. A musician is almost always playing in the afternoon near the pool. Staff throughout was friendly. My advice would be to stay here in Waikiki for 1-2 nights and then go. It's worth seeing the area and the water is very clear in Waikiki and sunsets are beautiful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel: when we checked in they charged our credit card for the room fee and tax without telling us, even if we had already paid the full room fee and tax.The room: very small will limited natural light. Can hear loud noises from the street at night. The tv need a upgrade. The bathroom was tiny.The staff: on the first evening I called the front desk twice. No one answered the phone. When I walked down to the front desk, there were actually several staff staying there. So they just chose to ignore the call? On the second evening I heard very loud singing noise from my room. The staffs were not helpful at all. They first checked the beach bar per my ask. They didn’t give me a feedback though. I called half an hour later because the noise was still there. Then I found out the noise was not from the beach bar because it was closed at that time. Now that we know someone was singing down the street at 11:30pm, I don’t understand why the staff told me she would send another security people to the beach bar “because I asked”. What’s the point here? They are not trying to solve a problem. They are not better then your Siri. Then this staff transferred my call to her boss. Her boss promised a room change for me. Then the boss quickly transferred me to the front desk. They picked up the phone this time.
