However, they told me all the room they have were facing the street, which I doubt a lot since there’s many empty room in different booking websites. I asked them if they can help me to call the police, because it’s almost 0:00. They agreed. Then the singing noise stopped for like half an hour before it started again.In one word, bad facility, unhelpful and unfriendly staff. Not worth the price. Will not come back anymore.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From arriving, getting a lei, friendly smiles to leaving with more smiles. Staff are friendly and helpful. We had an ocean front room with large balcony. Falling to sleep with the sounds of waves hitting the beach was soothing, Beach Club Lounge was very relaxing. They also served breakfast and snacks in the evening. We had a great time at High Tea at the Veranda. The spa was luxury. The staff there is professional, friendly, and again lots of smiles.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I recently stayed at the Moana Surfrider hotel on Waikiki Beach. A local friend and business owner recommended the Moana Surfrider or The Royal Hawaiian. I saw the Moana had rooms available on Expedia that we’re cheaper than booking direct. I took a screen shot of the Expedia price, then went on the Moana Surfrider’s website and booked direct. When I checked in, I showed them my screen shot and asked them to honor the price. The front desk guy got his boss Joseph Woodworth to come out and talk with me. He said he wouldn’t help me with the price. I explained that I booked direct even though it was more money to help them out. He seemed indifferent. Then I asked him for any kind of help, and he went off on that I wasn’t a diamond member or special enough to get any help from him. It was horrible!!!! I’ve been so many places and this place was completely ridiculous. I’ve never been treated so rudely by a service provider. I told my local friend about this experience, and he was sorry to have recommended I stay there. I wouldn’t recommend staying here. Try the Royal Hawaiian.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We got upgraded from a Tower block City view room to one of the historic Bunyan Rooms with an Ocean view on the fourth floor. Falling asleep to the sounds of the waves on the beach is really magical. As a Platinum Elite member, also gained access to the Beach Club with free lunch, breakfast, dinner, and other snacks. That food was OK, maybe stay away from the scrambled egg!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here from Jan 31-Feb 9 (just checked out). This hotel feels like an oasis away from the crowds (although lobby can get busy at times, it just felt more relaxing once you enter the hotel from the hustle and bustle of the street). The beach was great as was the pool. The staff at the beach/pool desk were so friendly. It’s true that the pool chairs do get snapped up pretty quickly but we usually found somewhere to sit after a few minutes. The location was perfect. We stayed in a banyon deluxe suite (#226). It was spacious and clean with 2 queen beds. It could get quite noisy at night (performers/ singers would park across the street with varying levels of talent...) but they usually stopped playing by 10 or 10:30 (just know that you can hear quite clearly what is happening on the street below). The noise likely wouldn’t be an issue if you go to bed late however if you have trouble sleeping it may be beneficial not to have a banyon big room that is facing the road. It wasn’t much of an issue for us (except for one guy that played a few nights that was pretty off tune!). The housekeeping was great. All staff that I encountered were friendly and professional. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, it has character and history and was just a pleasure to visit! Thanks again to the staff for being so warm, welcoming and professional!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The people here are so pleasant. The place is so beautiful. I love sitting on the porch with the rocky chairs. Such a feel of home! You will not be disappointed. The beach is amazing! They will help you with anything you need.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel, unfortunately I got “upgraded” to a 2nd Floor room with a view of ocean and courtyard. But they didn’t mention that with that comes all the loud noise of the wooden staircase. The clanging of tables being set at 5am and loud music until 10:30pm. Oh yeah they decided to fix the carpet in the hallway from 11pm-12am on my last night. Again great hotel just a bad room. I would request a different room for next trip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here two years ago in an ocean front room and it was amazing, from service to the room (although not enough storage in the bathroom).Just checked in this afternoon and it’s been a nightmare. Overcrowded, rooms were not ready by 3pm to check in. We asked for more hangers and a luggage cart, never arrived.We are in a partial ocean view room and while it’s big, there is no good use of space. It’s so loud from the people next door and you’re a stones throw away from the Outrigger Reef where the parties feel like they’re in your room.If you’re not spg, plan on waiting in line forever. Beach bar is beyond tired for such a formerly beautiful and luxe property. Now it’s just a people factory. No personal service, managers don’t call you back.....Take my word for it, the Royal Hawaiian is the place to stay. They know the value of service and they value they’re guests. So disappointed. Can’t wait to leave

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Historic hotel what if beautiful and located on the beach. My room was extremely small for 2 people. They did not recognize my SPG status. Commonly we would eat elsewhere because it other restaurants were better priced. I travel a lot and have never had such a small SPG/Marriott room. Next time I am going to stay at the Hilton.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is hotel is very convenient as it is centrally located in Waikiki. Close by to restaurants and of course Waikiki beach which is just outside the hotel. I stayed at one of the suites and it was amazing. Thank you Westin for always being “Best”in!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As loyal Westin customers, we were bitterly disappointed.Before explaining why, as frequent international travelers who spend as many nights in hotels as we do at home, for a "five star" hotel, the customer service is severely lacking. The irony is that this hotel sits in the key location where the Pono Aloha might rest ... it's not felt. It's almost like a Walmart version of Hawaiian Disney. There are very few gracious greetings from employees as you enter the foyer or walk through the aisle. The only exception during our 6 night stay was the guy cleaning the sand from the bottom of the pool and 2 of the 4 house keepers we met daily. The thing is, this hotel could be something AMAZING, but it's not. It's just located in the right place for peak tourism, and the structural heritage beneath it's façade still graces the street. The truth is, it feels like a business owned by wealthy corporations who know nothing of quality customer service and loyalty. It's just a fancy rat-race.Back to the Westin (Marriott/SPG/Ritz) loyalty in Honolulu, the primary name on the loyalty account MUST be present for loyalty to be rewarded, despite the fact that we both use the account and this rule is only administered in this city. This must change.On a positive note, the room was clean yet small. My original room was a "partial ocean view" - this room type is a farce. You have to lean over the balcony to see a partial glimpse of the ocean between the Surfrider and the building 50 meters across from you. You WILL be staring at people staring back at you in these "partial view rooms". This marketing is rudely misleading. After a discussion with management, I was graciously given improved accommodations - none however to match the Platinum loyalty promise. Reviewing both room types, the bathrooms are small, there is no place to set up toiletries other than shallow shelving for @ toothbrush & paste. The air-conditioning struggled in both rooms, and toilets also strained to flush efficiently. The Westin heavenly bed, as always was a pleasure to sleep in. There were sufficient USB plug in and room lamp lighting was satisfactory. Due to the fact that our Westin Loyalty was disregarded, we intentionally ate outside of the hotel. A shame, because room-service breakfast in bed or an evening lounge cocktail was specifically what I desired on this essential R & R getaway. On the flipside of that, the hotel is so convenient to a multitude of incredible cuisines or just a take home bottle of bubbly and nibbleys from the ABC store across the road suffice for a relaxing afternoon in.The beach is small and crowded, the water, of which is only credit to Mother Earth is always refreshing, and is perfect for floating and chilling ... but you don't need this hotel for that experience. The key positive for this hotel is the tourist location. You are right there in the heart of the bustle.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love staying at the Moana Surfrider. The staff at the front desk, pool and who housekeep are very good at what they do. Mildred D. who works in Housekeeping even remembered my name and provided friendly and exceptional service in looking after our every need. She was always smiling and a great ambassador for the Mona Surfrider. Steve at the pool was so helpful in unlocking my pool Aqua Vault. I thought it would have to be cut but he said know he enjoyed a challenge and he was able to open it. My thanks and appreciation to both Mildred D. and Steve for making my visit so enjoyable and memorable. Only disappointment was that my room was not upgraded as I have Gold Status.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've been to Honolulu many times but this is the first time I've stayed at the Moana Surfrider. The customer service I experienced at the hotel, from checking in to our daily room service to checking out and leaving our bags for a few hours before our flight, was above and beyond excellent. Especially Mildred D. who cleaned our room everyday. She was very friendly and professional and always greeted us with a smile and Aloha. Our room was very nice and big overlooking the street. I love this hotel and its history. It is walking distance to many attractions, International Marketplace, Honolulu Zoo, and Waikiki beach is right there! Definitely recommend staying at this hotel if you ever get the chance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love, love this hotel. It is situated right on Waikiki and the rooms, lobby, verandas are sumptuous. They offer live Hawaiian music on the beach....which adds to your experience of being on holiday in beautiful Hawaii.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a lovely stay that was very comfortable and totally enjoyable. The hotel is beautiful. It is full of character and style with modern conveniences and comforts. The location is perfect. We found the staff pleasant and helpful without being intrusive at all. It felt very private even though it is a very popular hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Group of 6 guys ending our north shore surf trip in Waikiki. I booked three rooms and they upgraded one to an ocean front suite (395) so we had a large common area to congregate. Very pleased with the staff on accommodating us! Thank you! We will be back again! Sunset from the balcony of the suite below.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: At the onset, I will say this hotel is not for those seeking expansive pools with waterslides, an abundance of hotel-sponsored activities, lively bars or a multi-level ‘mini-mall’ that are characteristic of other area hotels. To the contrary, the Moana Surfrider exemplifies the quiet and historical class and elegance we were looking for, in addition to beautifully decorated rooms, extraordinary hospitality, and magnificent views of Diamond Head and aqua waters of Waikiki. The beautiful Victorian exterior of this hotel stands out among the ‘concrete jungle’ of resorts on Kalakaua Avenue. The main public spaces encircle a giant lush banyan tree that provides welcomed shade and serenity following a day of watersports or sunbathing. Superb service and endless hospitality from the bell, housekeeping and Moana Lani Spa staff, and excellent dining at the Beach Club Concierge, the Beach House, Veranda and Beach Bar, completed the experience. Moreover, the resort is in a prime location, as when we were looking for a more lively and casual experience, Dukes and Hula Grill were just steps away at the Outrigger right next door. Our only hiccup was that, as Platinum Premiere Elite, we were not automatically upgraded and were assigned the room we booked despite availability (I routinely check online immediately before checking into SPG resorts). Eventually, we were upgraded to a beautiful studio suite with a huge lanai and beautiful view of Diamond Head. We most definitely will return to this special place.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just returned from a six night solo stay at the Moana Surfrider. What bliss! Needed to recharge from a big year and this was just the place. Arrived after a 10 hour flight and was greeted with a beautiful orchid lei and able to check in to my room at 9:30 am.Throughout my stay my room was cleaned seamlessly everyday. Toiletries and towels replaced, everything was done efficiently and without fuss. Thank you to the staff!The Moana is in such a perfect position ; busy shops out front, pool, bar and beach out back, you are spoilt for choice. I loved reading my book by the pool and dipping in and out of the ocean and pool when hot, such luxury. Thank You to the pool staff for their friendly ‘good mornings’ and clean fresh towels.A special thank you to Crystal for her 7am yoga classes, she manages a group of varying abilities and languages so well. Just waking up listening to the waves crash upon Waikiki beach was such a treat. It’s worth getting up for....Another aspect of the hotel that I enjoyed was the pianists in the lobby in the evening. They were both great, dealing with requests in such a professional manner. Thank You.I don’t know how anyone can complain about this hotel. All staff were friendly and efficient, this is the best position in Waikiki. Of course it’s busy and you pay for the quality that you receive, but now, I can’t stay anywhere else, I will be back. Thank You!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've had this hotel bookmarked for so long since it's right in the middle of the strip and directly on the beach. We're currently here but checking out and moving hotels since the experience is horrible and not relaxing.The first room we had was on the 3rd floor facing the street. Unfortunately the walls were so thin we could hear the street performers all night and garbage trucks first thing in the morning. The 2nd room we had was a beautiful view of the courtyard, which played music until 10:30pm every night. Even thinner walls and our neighbors had a baby crying most of the night. Then housekeeping starts knocking on the door at 8:15am. Wth?! I haven't sleep more than 3 hours each day in the past 3 days.The pool is tiny and not heated. There are never any seats since it's so packed and small. The beach chairs you have to pay for, but they were sold out every day too. There is ZERO shade at the beach in front of the hotel and no umbrellas available for rent. The guys at the pool actually told us to walk down 2 hotels to our right to try to rent their beach chairs and umbrellas. wth ? We're guests of the hotel!$500/night for the most unrestful stay I've ever had.Checking out today to go to Outrigger Reef to see if it's better, at half the price we paid here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We love staying here. Great for SPG members. They really look after their members. Lovely staff, very clean and very accomodating - amazing!We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a stress free holiday

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We returned to the Moana Surfrider for our third visit in the last few years, and it certainly has changed.. And not in a good way.When we arrived, they simple didn’t bother with our traditional lei greeting, which was not a big issue, but was just an indication of the somewhat don’t care big hotel attitude that pervaded the place. Others did get them, but the staff were just busy chatting to each other. I had asked for an upgrade via messenger as they didn’t respond to emails, and did have an acknowledgement of that, also asked for something special for our daughter as it was her birthday.. When we checked in, nothing about the birthday, had no record of the room upgrade request, and when we arrived in our room, it had two balloons with congratulations Mr and Mrs Lee.. I guess somebody else was disappointed too. The porter did say he would sort it, but nothing happened.The room was tidy and clean another, and serviced every day with no issues, a tad tired and could do with a bit of a refresh, but the shower was huge and had good pressure..Pillows were either very hard or very flat and super soft, but that it what you are used to of course.We didn’t go for the breakfast as it was super expensive from past experience..Getting a seat at the pool was a huge mission, as they were in the midst of revamping the bar, which had been going on for four months due to strike action on behalf of the workers. The pool staff reserve heaps of seats for regular visitors, and I do get this, but this is a huge hotel with very very limited pool seating, even less as they have taken some away for the bar construction. It is very frustrating to try and sit in the sun with heaps and heaps of empty seats as they have been held for people who may or may not turn up. They also say that you can only reserve a seat for an hour, which is fair, but a rule that rarely if ever is followed.. They need to add more seats, stop reserving for people who may or may not turn up and have a better way for monitoring how long people block seats unattended.. Having said that, when you did find a seat, it was fairly nice, but the volume of kids running around diving into the pool, uncontrolled certainly takes the shine off things, and whilst I have no issue with kids, we have 3, the way in which no staff seemed to even be around never mind say or do anything was quite annoying.Staff around the pool to take orders for food were basically invisible, and most people went to outside places and brought in food, such as drinks and pizza etc due to the almost non existent staffing levels. It was odd to see people bringing in food and sitting at tables with staff occasionally walking past..Also after around 4pm, the noise from the bar in the next door hotel made sitting near the beach just very unpleasant.The seats at the bar area were pretty nice, although with the construction going on, there were less near the beach, and with a big barrier, it obscured the view a little.We chatted to several off the bar staff, who were very nice, Brandy in particular, Margaret was also very nice, but most of them were simply doing a job and very obviously not at all interested in helping the customers. At one point I spotted 7 staff just chatting at the makeshift bar and nobody serving customers.. A real issue especially as they were wearing badges about supporting workers rights.. Seems that they have a little forgotten about why they are there, and whilst they deserve a fair go, they would be well placed to talk to the customers far far more than they do.At one point I waited 45 minutes for a beer. A lost opportunity for more sales and for them, more tips.Still, they have the location with great sunsets and trade very much on location these days as service and looking after the customers and providing that something special is very very much a think of the past.. This place is now a mass market hotel with indifferent service, high prices and low staff quantity to do the minimum.. Not what you pay for at all, and for charging a resort charge for a pool with few seats, a bar with few staff and poor range.. What is the charge actually for ?The other unpleasant change is the addition of heaps more tables and chairs nowhere near the bar, but in the way of the banyan tree and even walkways. Clearly an attempt to add even more people to the Moana Bus so as they can get more and more and more people in.They are also about to become a Marriott as they can run more conferences etc etc, which is fine, but many nights you could not get to the bar or the seats as it was full of business and conference people, again, why charge a resort fee for things you can not get anywhere near.. We also were frustrated by many public areas roped off for groups.I do have to comment on the music. Every night they had a couple of people playing Hawaiian music, but it was so loud some nights you could simple not talk to each other, although this did have the positive of emptying the bar quickly.. You would think that they would notice that. Whilst I like Hawaiian music, it was too much, too loud and to my ears, and I do understand music, as I play myself, they were simply not good. Still I walked through the Sheraton a few times, and there music was even worse.. Overall, it is not what it was, just a mass market hotel trading on name and location. The pool area is tired, poorly staffed and not well managed. The Bar area is the same and not the pleasure it was in the past. Poor service, poor food range and packed in to maximise every dollar, which is ironic as if they had more staff offering better service, they would make more.Sadly I would no longer recommend the Moana Surfrider, and would not plan to return to this hotel. Others have better prices, better service and just more of an attitude of actually wanting to make your stay a positive experience, not the felling of staying in a churn and burn hotel designed to grab your every dollar.Finally, we did try and book some tours, but the staff really didn’t know too much at all, and had limited English.. Some places they said were not available, which just translated into they don’t get a kick back so we will tell you that to sell something that they do get money from…America at its best, give me tips for service that this not good as the companies don’t pay the people or employ the quantity or quality of staff to make it the experience and ironically the profitable business that it sure could be.Moana.. A lady now in retirement
user_name:
Gary N
Greater Wellington, New Zealand

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my fourth stay in Honolulu/Waikiki and 4th hotel stayed in. Moana has a great location, beachside and right in the middle of great eateries and shops.We were greeted after exiting cab by staff bearing leis. Aloha! There was a line at check in-but it moved fast-key in hand in 7 minutes I was definitely surprised.The room was great, with balcony facing Diamondhead and one west, for great sunset views.There’s a beach side ‘beach club’ lounge where they have breakfast foods, midday treats, snacks, dinner foods with beer/wine, beverages including Hawaiian bottled water accessible all day with room key-depending in your room package purchased. There is indoor as well as outdoor seating, as well as areas to relax, read, whatever.Staff is friendly, but what really impressed me was how friendly housekeeping was. Many places they will step inside a room and/or say nothing as you pass-here at Moana three times I was greeted by housekeeping, one lady I didn’t even notice, she made a point to smile, say hello and wish me a good day! Nice.The Banyan bar on site is a great place under giant banyan canopies, great service and live music.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Minimizing personal comment.....1. I booked and paid for a room in advance, but room I pre-paid was not available when I checked in. (The assumed flexibility only works one way - against the prepaying guest).2. According to Uber I arrived and then entered my room 32 minutes later) perhaps more check-in staff?)3. Room service, really surprisingly, finishes at 9.30pm. I am currently in room 483; (in the unlikely case) this hotel has any management who care (I can only assume it is a franchisee that does not care about SPG/Westin).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel was fantastic! From the moment we checked in until the late 6 pm late check out the hotel staff was helpful, friendly and accommodating. Our view over looked the ocean. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: CON- check-in was horrible - parking location was not clear and not at this hotel (not convenient)- small outdoor pool- bed is high not safe for toddlerPRO- great location - very beautiful hotel with great history - great beach location - housekeeping staff is nice and friendly - provide crib and toddler bed Not pleased with check-in at all!!! Arrived very late with my 15 month old son exhausted and tired. My husband dropped us off with our luggage and he drove off to parking. Front desk staff wouldn’t let me check-in because we paid through Expedia. I have my husbands ID, passport, booking # and valid credit card. He insist my husband to be present for check-in. I mention my son desperately need a change diaper and bell staff already took my bags. I understand there is rules and regulations, however I feel staff needs to exercise flexibly in situations like this to accommodate guest with small children or guest in need assistance. Hyatt Centric was able to check me in without the present of my husband when he missed his flight last time. I waited 15 min at lobby, another 10 min at check in counter because there was no sign oh staff to process check-in, and another 15 for my bag from bell staff. Another points off for a small stain on sheet and unserviceable TV. Always no answer on their Service express phone line. The check-in experience already left me with a bad impression, we still have 3 days here but not sure if there is anything else they could change my perspective. Probably will go back to Hyatt again ...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I waited all my life to go to Waikiki Beach. What a disappointment! Too crowded, too loud and simply over rated! Will NEVER return! Perhaps I should have NOT waited and went when I was 20! Other islands way better!To top it off...the "Local 5" union workers marched directly in front of 3 SPG properties from 7a-10p. Parked themselves directly in front of front door and beach front! Banged on drums and gas cans while blaring their message with a megaphone. They made that one week in Waikiki the worst vacation EVER in my life! Local 5 shame on you! I will NEVER support your island again! Sorry, no union where I live. Find another job if your life is so unhappy!Our 25th Wedding Anniversary. So sad for this amazing hotel with such cool history! I wish they had called and gave us a choice, they did not. Because of that, we were disappointed as customers (also Platinum members), we had no choice. However; we felt they did the best the could be under such horrific conditions. Resort fee waved, most resort amenities were unavailable (maid service, valet parking, ect). Day 3 at 0730, went to the front desk. We were comp'd more $$$ and re'cd mega points later. Good job Moana!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Jan 2019 was our second visit here. We stayed in both the Tower Block and the Banyang wing clearly preferring the latter with its large rooms and balcony's as well as the view through the Banyan tree to the ocean beyond. All staff especially reception and housekeeping were excellent. We appreciate the architecture, location and for an expensive location, the hotel provides good value.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family and I arrived at this hotel this morning after a one and a half year absence from visiting Waikiki. We were so pleasantly surprised that the valet staff member named Frank remembered us and even remembered our names!  It is such a wonderful feeling to know that our patronage at this hotel is valued and that they take such excellent care of their guests.  His attention to detail is a wonderful trait and we appreciated the offer of ice cold water upon arrival. Thank you Frank for making our day so special!  He is a wonderful ambassador for this resort.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We last stayed here 4 years ago and on return found it was still as good. Checkin and out seamless. Room service in a timely manner. Only concern was with the pool deck chairs. We could see the pool deck and people were out there at 6am reserving chairs. There was no one in the pool so they go away and the chairs are often empty for several hours. The hotel needs to address this. It kept us away from the pool and was rude. I would not have sat there all day and would have welcomed the opportunity to utilise a deck chair for an hour or so. Lots of history and worth a visit despite the pool situation

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family and I have stayed at this hotel for many years. It is most definitely the best hotel on Waikiki Beach. It has such a great vibe and a beautiful bar overlooking the Pacific Ocean. The team at the pool is unbelievably helpful and friendly. Lee, Mo, Hulali and Issac go out of their way to make your time around the pool enjoyable. Always there to help with seating and any questions along with always having fresh towels available on request. If I had to say what this hotel offers compared to the others, and have seen all the other ones on the strip, is at this hotel is directly on the beach While the others are set quite far back. We will definitely be back next year. I really wanted to put in this review to acknowledge the hard work and effort that the team do around the pool area.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is in a great location and has beach access and has nice spa. But....“Historic” means old and bad in this case. Rooms are tinyCity view room was noisy as hell. We were awoken at 430 am with loud garbage trucks beeping in reverse. We thankfully got switched to the tower which was much better- bigger and nicer and nice view. I would refuse the banyan wing until they renovate and stay somewhere else Also no hot tub by pool. Since when do resorts not have hot tubs?

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do yourself a favor and toward the end of the day head to the Moana and make your way to the Beach Bar and find a table closest to the beach...order a drink and wait for the sunset...stay after an continue to enjoy Hawaiian music or some local contemporary music on the beach in Waikiki... Order some food if you are there long enough - and of course another round for you and your family and friends... Whether you are from Hawaii or visitor - the Moana and the Beach Bar is a great place to unwind...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have been staying at the Moana for the last 6 of our 7 visits to Waikiki and each and every one of our stays has just got better and better. From checking in with Keola at the front desk, who by the way gives excellent restaurant recommendations, to all of the staff - they are exceptional. Even though we arrived on Christmas day, which was extraordinarily busy each, of our requests were accommodated. Particular mention must also go to the beach and pool staff - Mo, Lee, Hulali and Isaac who always greeted us with a smile and made our stay so beautiful. Will definitely be back

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I visited this hotel 10 years ago on my honeymoon and my experience then was Exceptional. This time though the staff weren’t nearly as helpful (they had just finished a strike) check-in to our rooms was delayed due to rooms not being ready (we booked 4 rooms) and had to wait in the foyer for hours during peak season with no where to leave our bags and No Lai on arrival. The location is Very noisy and close to the hustle and bustle of the busy streets of Waikiki due to so many new stores. The music goes till 9pm so if you like an early night buy some earplugs. Pillows were flat and difficult to sleep on so I used my travel pillow to sleep with. Room Service was ordinary and the food at the restaurants was average and very pricey. Honolulu Coffee is downstairs and open early and close late.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed at the Moana Surfrider for 8 out of the last 12 years . This place gave me the best memories. The location is perfect and the service is excellent. Thank you Cecilia for making my room perfect . I plan to come back with my children in the future. Brenda

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved our stay at the Moana surfrider.It’s has everything that you need close by. We loved the beach access Very nice restaurant and bar that backs onto the beach. Rooms were nice, keep in mind that this is an older style hotel. Rooms and interior are not modern but there isn’t an issue for us with this. We loved everything about it Shops were very close, restaurants etc.High speed internet in your room. Staff were very helpful Can’t complain about anything

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is a good looking outside, not so much inside. Old carpet, smells old. Good thing it’s right on the beach. Beach is crowded. Quiet time only starts after 12am. Since there is a bazar right across the street, loud music and loud people. You won’t fall asleep earlier than 12am. Not a great place to visit with small children. Very busy. Restaurant at the hotel is pretty expensive. Food is regular, nothing fancy.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome mix of beach and city life. Stayed there during Christmas 2018 and had a good time. Beautiful beach with Diamond head at the backdrop and lots of eating/nightlife options in the downtown waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: In the past 9 years, we came to Oahu 7 times. The highlight each trip is the Afternoon Tea on the Veranda. It is early afternoon and it is time for Afternoon Tea.Ambience:Sitting in the elegance of a classic Victorian architecture, feeling the slight ocean breeze on a warm afternoon under the shade of the very large 114-year old banyan tree, listening to the sounds of the water rushing onto Waikiki Beach soften by the melodic Hawaiian music; it was the perfect setting for Afternoon Tea. Food & Beverage: Top Tier Plate - Spicy Tuna Sandwich: mixture of tuna, black pepper, cucumber, & mayonnaise — not spicy, but tasty.Truffle Egg Salad Sandwich: mixture of chopped hard boiled egg, chopped scallions and chives, truffle oil, & mayonnaise — very appetizing & delicious.Curried Chicken Salad Sandwich: mixture of curry, chopped chicken, & cranberries— yummy & very tasty, the slightly spicy curry chicken is balanced with the sweet cranberry.Watercress & Cucumber Sandwich: thinly sliced cucumber and finely chopped spinach — very good, light and refreshing.Roast Beef on Sourdough Bread: it is ok.Middle Tier Plate -Devonshire Cream: better than heavy cream with more fat percentage, it is tastier than heavy cream.Lilikoi (lemon) Curd: smooth consistency with mild lemon flavor.Orange Cranberry Scones: soft & light — The scones tasted great with both the Devonshire Cream and the Lilikoi Curd. Bottom Tier Plate -Dulce de Leche Cream Puff — very tasty.Pumpkin Marshmallow Tart — very nice.Chocolate Macaroon — it is ok.Strawberry shortcake — it is ok.Lemon Poppy Seed Financier — yummy, very lemony.Green Tea w/Lemon Grass Sorbet: helps to clean the palate — deep lemon flavor with green tea in background.Service:Our server greeted us and provided water glasses. After indicating that we will have the Afternoon Tea, he brought a box of fragrant tea leaves and explained the flavor of each one. With 6 different distinct tea leaves, it was very hard to remember the settled differences. He would repeat the description again with a cheerful attitude. He brought the 3-tier tray and processed to name each one of the sandwiches and pastries. He checked on our water glasses and replenished our teapot frequently.It was great to enjoy a leisurely afternoon in one of grandest hotel in Honolulu, sitting under the shade the 5-story Banyan Tree in the central courtyard, listening to live Hawaiian music, and watching the little birds fly in and out picking the crumbs off the floor of the veranda. It is still the BEST AFTERNOON TEA... in Hawaii at the Moana Surfrider Hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Westin’s Moana Surfrider January 3 to /6 on our way back from Australia. I can tell you this: it’s luxury stopped at the facade. I e been traveling to Hawaii for years and have always wanted to stay here. I should have passed. First I booked a top grade room through Expedia for $516 a night. 3 nights $1700 bucks. What I got: a cramped room in the “diamond wing” meaning diamond head side with two double beds which could classify as twins. It had two rockers to enjoy the ocean view which were nice. Small parapet balcony you could stand on. The room was clean with worn carpet. The wallpaper was coming off in places. The door stop in the bathroom was punched into the wall. Over all about a $300 dollar a night value. Getting up to the room was a burden. One elevator services the Diamond wing. Prepare to wait. The hallways have no elegance at all and make the hallways in the Shining look elegant. Beach and pool. Be prepared to wake at the crack of dawn to get chairs on the breach(which they charge for) or by the small pool. At 7 am all the beach chairs were reserved already for the next day and the poolChairs had been snagged up with saving towels the pool is small and you shouldn’t. E allowed to save chairs like this. Breakfast was included and thank god. Mediocre buffet fruit pancakes weird European meats etc. wouldn’t have paid for it. Lunch was decent ahi tuna poke bowl was good. Had to ask to have bird poop wiped from the table. The place was packed kids since it was post Christmas holiday. Couldn’t be helped but not my scene. Overall I’d give the Moana Surfrider a huge pass. While the grandeur of the front is awesome the insides lack the carry through. Save your money on this one and go else where

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here at least 6 times previously but this time I was disappointed. Acknowledging it was the busy festive time it was not as good as it should have been. In the 8 days we were here I don’t think once anyone asked if everything was OK. The lines for breakfast sent us elsewhere everyday and the pool area just dire. We were told to line up at 630am the following morning to get a chair or book an umbrella for the following day. Even that early every single pool chair had a towel on it but only a dozen or so people present. And we couldn’t move towels. We did manage to secure an umbrella for the next day at the cost of $60. The staff appeared overbusy at the bar and rushed to put your order down and move on. All in all nowhere near as good as previous stays and no acknowledgement of my gold status either. We did eat at more than one other hotel on the strip and found service to be much more pleasant. This property is absolutely stunning architecturally , it’s such a shame it isn’t what it used to be.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: First the stumbles. Check in was late ... 5:40pm. Clearly the place was swamped for the holiday and the manager did give us very generous compensation for the delay. The room was upgraded to a very larger ocean front suite. Great rain water shower head and Toto toilet as well. The club level amenities were very good. Breakfast was an excellent buffet. The later snack was a nice assortment of food as well. The bar restaurant was excellent... quick service and great Ahi Poke. The veranda for lunch was also very good. The only problem was the line there for breakfast was very long so we stuck with the club buffet. Again holiday crowds are difficult for any property if that is a problem maybe go a different time. The water of Waikiki beach is beyond fantastic. Big Wave Dave surf lessons were a great option. Valet was 45 per night... fair price for the locale.I did not see another hotel in the area that looked nicer. Plan to return! Great option. Mahalo Moana Westin

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For years I have relied on Trip Advisor’s user reviews whenever considering unfamiliar travel so though this is over due, here goes. We visited January 14-22, 2018. Our fourth stay at the Moana. Bought along two other couples. The property is lovely and perfectly positioned and much of the staff is above board. The beach club is nice but redundant in selection especially when staying a while. Biggest complaint continues to be the lack of pool chairs for a hotel this size It is grossly inadequate and becomes frustrating if not up bright and early. The partial obstruction of the beach by the $$ cabana beds still questionable especially when the area could provide ten additional pool chairs. The kicker , there is a $37.70 a night resort fee on top of the already overpriced room and You pay a considerable fee for beach lounges, umbrellas and self parking. At least for the first few years of our visits the fee included self parking. Who knows soon there may be coin operated rockers on the verandah. We are scheduled to stay again this coming January so I’ll update my thoughts when we arrive. Lets see if the Marriot has made any positive changes, I know they’re already increasing the resort fee......if not, I think we’ll spend the next five years at another beachfront property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: With this hotel is right on the beach and with the prices they are charging per night I had a little higher expectation of this hotel. First, the location is great, it has easy beach access, nice pool, beautiful lobby, it’s right by some great shopping I thought this would be a perfect hotel for me and my friends. However, the rooms are very small, there was barely enough space for me to walk around the 2 double beds. The bathroom was filthy, there were hard water stains all over the shower, it looked like the cleaning services never touched the shower the entire time I was there and the hand held shower head was broken. I went to the front desk to request a bathroom cleaning but it didn’t look like anyone cleaned when I came back. I had a safe in my room that had a hole drilled trough it so it was completely unusable. I had some excursions planned and wanted to lock up my valuables, I had to go to the front desk where they had storage lockers but you need a managers key and the key to your locker to open it. When I got back to pick up my stuff the manager on duty couldn’t find the managers key so she had to call another manager. This whole ordeal took 30 minutes so I said forget this and just kept my valuables on me the rest of the time I was here. I did talk to another manager about my stay and he waved the resort fee but when your on vacation you want a clean hotel and to know your valuables are safe.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana has totally lost its appeal. Who redecorated the interior? Where is the historic ambience? I spoke with a few Japanese guests who were staying here at the same time (and who have been returning for the last few years) and they said they wouldn’t be coming back again either. There must be new ownership? It’s like it’s just a “get them in get them out” concept with boring “modern” decor that doesn’t even try to be charming anymore. If all they’re after is making a quick buck, that’s the way it goes I guess, but good luck making that last. Once the word gets out (and it will in this social media age) this place will go down if it continues along this way. So sad to see a cultural gem selling out.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider for four nights on our way home from a busy US east-coast holiday to Australia - it was a perfect place to unwind!We could choose to relax at the Beach Bar, watching the daytime activity on Waikiki Beach or sit by the lit Banyon tree at night time, listening to live music, watching a Waikiki sunset; go shopping in the Waikiki main strip simply by walking out the front door; or take a tour of Honolulu as the Surfrider is one of the stop-off points for each tour operator.And a couple of doors down is 'Dukes' - great place for meals and live music as well.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I go to Hawaii a couple times a year for work. This time I stayed 10 nights at the Surfrider, my first time at this hotel. What the hotel does well:Food & Beverage: From room service to every bar, red restaurant and tea service, the food quality is exceptional highlighted by local ingredients. Architecture: The hotel has preserved the historic details, first hotel on Waikiki, but never feels dated. Only elegant and comfortable. Banquet Staff: I lead meetings on the property and the banquet staff, especially Bob went out of his way to make everything seamless. I work with a lot of hotels but the genuine dedication shows the true Hawaiian spirit. What didn’t go well:Check-in: I had coordinated arrival time with the hotel in advance of my arrival however when I arrived my room was not ready. Food & Beverage Selection: during the 10 day stay I ate mostly at the hotel. On a couple of occasions I wanted to order something for dinner from what I knew was on the lunch menu. They absolutely would not waiver or allow me to do this. If they are going to be that steadfast, they should have a more expansive menu, as I was having the same thing multiple times. Capacity for guests: Twice a colleague and I wanted to have a drink and dinner at the hotel and could not find a seat. Since I was on a longer trip it wasn’t that big of a deal, but if you only have a couple of days in Hawaii and you are paying to be at such a nice hotel you expect to be able to use the amenities.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at Moana Surfrider from December 18th to 25th, 2018.Everything was perfect ! Starting with our check in! I booked my vacation through Expedia , but I was able to do my check in before 3pm, a little before 2 ! We had a king size bed prepared , but we were three and they could accommodate us with a two double beds corner room. The room was cleaned every day, but I had to ask more than two times for amenities ( guess the tip I was leaving on the bed daily was not too much?).We ate 5 of our lunches at the Beach bar by the pool. The staff was really great ! The food was delicious. I also enjoyed the yoga classes in the morning. The perfect way to start your day .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Came here for an anniversary dinner and enjoyed wandering through the main house/museum and having a drink in the courtyard before dinner. The property is stunning, but the drinks were watered down... The service was fantastic and there was live music which added a fantastic touch to the pending sunset. I would explore staying at the hotel in the future.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is way understaffed. Check-in process took way too long, and proved that advanced online check-in is a waste of time. They only had one staff member working the reception desk, at 4:30 pm - prime check-in time.They charge an exorbitant daily Resort Fee, but still charge for such resort basics as beach chairs (when chairs are available!). No food or beverage service on the beach, either.Rooms are dated, especially the bathrooms. Bed sheets don’t even fit over the entire mattress, so the mattress is exposed - disgusting.This is a 3 star hotel, at best. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very happy with our stay at the Moana Surfrider. Great location, can’t beat it! Hotel was clean and staff was very friendly. Pool gets very crowded extremely early if you want to get a seat. Rooms can use some updates, but they work and are clean. Only stayed for two nights, but would stay again if I make it back to Honolulu.
user_name:
Schnutz1
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Always wanted to stay right on Waikiki. The Moana Surfrider with its' beautifully restored 1901 main building and ancient banyan tree will not let you down. We spent the week of Dec. 8 to 15th. Breakfast and dinner outdoors every day. Waikiki beach on one side and the equivalent of Rodeo drive on the other. Rooms in the Tower were average but staff were way above average. Everyone should do it once in a lifetime.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best place for a vacation stay. The beach umbrellas and lounge chairs are the way to go. Shout out to LEE, MOE and GLORIA. They are the BEST on the beach and will take great care of you. We've been coming here for years and Lee, Moe and Gloria always remember us!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I recently visited Hawaii for the first time. The Moana Surfrider sits right in the heart of Waikiki beach, surrounded by infinite blocks of luxury stores (i.e. Louis Vuitton, Chanel, etc.), restaurants, and other hotels. This historic property was so cute and charming, and was beautiful on the inside and out (it also helped that it was decorated for Christmas). We were able to walk right out to the beach from the lobby and enjoy the gorgeous views from sunrise to sunset. Our room itself was a Historic Banyan Room with a city view. The room was average in comparison to the hotel, and being right on the street was rather loud throughout the night. The bathroom was also pretty small. One thing I recommend is getting Beach Club Lounge access which provided us with a delicious buffet breakfast every morning (eggs, potatoes, fresh fruit, pastries, banana bread, oatmeal, and more), as well as pupus and snacks throughout the day (until 8pm). If I stayed here again I would recommend an ocean view room on a high floor, as to avoid the noise.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very pleasant to lodge in this historic hotel, the oldest in Waikiki that has housed the likes of the Prince of Wales and Agatha Christie. This is a deceptively large hotel with a new tower. Located on the beach, a nice hotel on the main Waikiki shopping area and near the finish of the Honolulu Marathon. Be sure to dine in the Veranda for breakfast or diner Be sure to check out the magnificent Banyan Tree in one of the courtyards. Service is friendly enough here. We certainly enjoyed the stay, even if we were dreadfully jet-lagged the first 3 days. The club lounge is quite nice and plentiful in its food offerings. Negative: For the price, terribly disconcerting that the Starwood Group, now owned by Marriott, is too cheap to provide guests with amenities like a toothbrush or razor in the rooms. it is FALSE ECONOMY and DEGRADES the brand. When the room charge exceeds $300 a night, is this really smart marketing?????Although not exclusive to this hotel, the RESORT CHARGE is nothing but a RIPOFF. Very expensive to cover such items as a BOTTLE OF WATER, WI-FI, other standards available free in other places. GIVE US A BREAK. Totally outrageous and demeaning. I am not sure whether this tax is a gimmick of the hotels or simply a tax-and-spend hoax of the local authorities.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This had to be the finest and best located resort on the island. The entrance was beautiful, the staff was friendly, and the location was surrounded by the beautiful ocean on the back side and on the front side of the resort was all of the high end shopping. Our first night we arrived we were able to catch the most beautiful sunset as we sat at the beach bar for dinner and were entertained by singing and a lovely hula lady who danced the Hawaiian style dance. They offered yoga every morning and Jen was simply the best instructor. She even spoke a little Japanese for her students from Japan. She was so warm and fun and taught us a little about the flowers and birds. So should we return to Oahu the Moana Surfrider is where weWill stay!!! Aloha

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights and couldn’t enjoy the hotel any better. The staffs were so attentive and very friendly. The food was good. I enjoyed breakfast in the lounge peacefully every morning. The location was best. Many shops nearby and in a walking distance to Waikiki beach. Love every minutes spent in this place. Definitely coming back soon.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall the hotel is okay, it needs an update as it’s very old. I recommend a high floor with Ocean view. (The only option other than a suite, albeit if your paying for a suite go to the hotel listed below! The front desk service is poor, certainly not a 5 star hotel and certainly not what I would expect from a Westin Hotel, so it’s back to the Halekulani for me. The other staff (cleaners/porters wait staff) are friendly...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The best blend of traditional Hawaiian Hospitality with the conveniences of a top modern hotel, blending the old with new in a natural way.The place is a magnet for weddings because of the natural beauty and environment, but it is also perfect for business travellers seeking something unique and relaxing after a hard days work.Great service and attentious staff in every area make this a new favorite for me and my family.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Brought the family to honolulu on a work trip last month. Stayed at the Surfrider for the first time since living in Hawaii for past 10 years. We never stay in Waikiki; it always seems way to busy and touristy for us. Now, we'll never stay away ! ....A wonderful hotel, staff and management. Even though in the heart of Waikiki, it didn't feel phrenetic and the views are spectacular. Great eating just across the street for the whole family.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: People must realize that this hotel is just a real treat to hang out. It is in the touristy area, but that means everything is at your finger tips. Not to mention the hotel is right on the beach and the city is bustling to your backside. The decor is nice and the rooms have some epic views. 2 thumbs up and highly recommended place to stay for a part or the entirety of your trip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are Honolulu residents & after attending the Average White Band concert at the Blue Note (a few doors down from the Surfrider) Saturday night, we decided to pop in to enjoy the Veranda & maybe a nightcap. When we walked into the hotel lobby, we heard a pianist playing so we wandered over to listen as he was playing a song I like. After the song was over we mentioned we had just been to the AWB concert but was surprised they didn't play "Play That Funky Music". To our surprise & delight, he started playing & proceeded to sing/play the song in its entirety! He asked us what else we'd like to hear & as he continued playing & we continued clapping & talking with him, the seating started to fill up with other guests! We & a good number of others ended up staying for the rest of his performance because he would play anything & everything we requested, was engaging us in conversation, made us laugh with some funny lyrics & even played a romantic song & encouraged us to slow dance (which 3 couples did). Keith Montross is a gem - so talented & entertaining - & the Surfrider is lucky to have him! Mahalo nui Keith for a memorable evening!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If walking along Waikiki Walkway and streets you will notice this stunning White Hotel and must walk in for a visit even if not a guest. We always enjoy the stunning decor in the entrance and Christmas time did not disappoint! Front porch with stunning rocking chairs to sit and enjoy watching the world go by! “Veranda at the beachside”.Keep walking out back to go to “The Beach Bar” where there is a large outside area that goes right to Waikiki Beach. We scored a table right at the beach’s edge just before sunset! Try the Moana Mai tai or The Honolulu Beerworks-Cocoweizen Coconut Hefeweizen! Had a few of each and then ordered dinner while watching the sunset, cruise ships leaving, dinner Sailboat/cruises with lights and silhouettes of the last of the surfers at Waikiki!Excellent service, attentive but relaxed. Had an amazing salad and Burger! Many menu choices for all appetites. To add to our enjoyment a lovely duo singing Hawaiian and current songs including ukulele and dancer for background music to set the mood. Our one overnight stay in Waikiki before our cruise was made at this wonderful bar!Highly recommend. Thank you for a lovely evening and taste of Hawaii-we will remember it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location in Waikiki beach, in the Main Street of Honolulu.The hotel itself, as said in the main entrance, is a Princess. Or, as I would say, is an old classic lady. It was recently renovated (not remodeled) and the age is visible in many details. Although it’s a great option in Honolulu.Staff was very kind and helpful in everything it was necessary. Great gym for a city hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hawaii has been a dream for me for the longest time now, arriving to Moana surfrider was one of the most unique experiences ever, such a welcoming hotel, makes you instantly feel in the tropics, felt at home from the moment I stepped in the hotel, front desk service is amazing, people are so friendly, such and amazing hotel, would 100% go back, forever and always

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have been to Hawaii a few times and always hoped to stay at this hotel, finally we were able to stay here. Don’t book through a third party to stay here, you’re are treated like second rate customers. The strike was still going when we arrived and we felt the aftermath for our entire stay. We moved rooms three times, first because we had a room with no balcony, the other two times our toilets over flowed and flooded the bathroom. Management did make some allowances, removing the resort fee and giving us credit at their beautiful restaurant but I can’t say that made up for the middle of the night flooded bathroom and numerous moves. We’ve stayed at other hotels on the strip and we had an amazing time and staff were so amazing, not so much here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had such an amazing trip here last week! About 30 of us went to Waikiki for a wedding, and people stayed at 3 or 4 different hotels. I’m so happy we chose the Moana Surfrider. I chose it over the others due to its history, the look of the hotel, and being right on the beach as opposed to across the street. It’s a beautiful, historic hotel with modern amenities in the right places. It just felt and looked like we thought the Hawaiian experience should. It was close to all the Waikiki restaurants, shopping and “action,” but while at the hotel it was our beautiful oasis away from everything. Nice, small pool area partially under the beautiful banyan tree. And the sand was just steps away. What truly made this experience amazing was the room upgrade we received upon checking in. Our room, 1595, was just perfect. Balcony off the living room overlooked Waikiki beach, just astounding views. Large and well appointed living room, very comfortable bedroom, and we loved the bathroom too (I now need to invest in heated toilet seats). It was all great! Service at the hotel was top notch, from check in, to the beach club lounge, to the pool area. Nothing but love to give to this wonderful experience. We may just have to do this all again :)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My partner and I stayed at Moana Surfrider from 15/11 - 25/11 which was during the strikes. We were prepared for the worst as all the reviews and comments were poor. We originally booked a room in the historic wing which is near the protestors - we were instantly upgraded into the tower and our room had a partial view.The rooms were serviced everyday (besides thanksgiving) and the staff were lovely and friendly. The tower room was large and spacious - the only thing that bothered us was the bed was very soft and so were the pillows. Other than that could not fault our trip. Would definitely be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently spent 7 nights here, as we loved it so much last year we decided to return. What a difference a strike makes. 6 out of our 7 nights we had all the noise from picket lines emanating from both the front and the beach side of the hotel from 0700 to 2200. We were in the Banyon Wing with ocean view and Juliette balcony. No restaurants, Thanksgiving dinner cancelled, no happy hour, virtually no services and slowly the Xmas decorations were going up but nothing stops the endless Japanese wedding photo shoots that take place from morning to night!. The daily resort fee of US$36 plus tax was waived; is this enough we ask? I had to ask housekeeping to please clean our shower stall as there was black mould on the grouting of the tiles stating this was unhealthy. They did by throwing bleach at it so yum very nice, not; strong smell of bleach when we returned to our room. Asked for a credit and of course we were told we would have to approach the company. A credit for our next stay would be nice but won't hold our breath. Certainly not the 5 star resort it usually is so very disappointing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had the extreme misfortune of staying at the Westin Moana Surfrider during the strike, October 24 - 30, 2018. This hotel used to be one of my most favorite Westins and that's why for the last 8 years i tried very hard to exclusively book this hotel when my destination was Honolulu. I have stayed at the Royal Hawaiian and Marriott in Waikiki when the Moana was sold out. My October 24-30 stay was so miserable that I don't know if I can ever stay at that hotel again without experiencing PTSD. That hotel stay felt like torture for the following reasons:1. cleaning my own room2. emptying trash3. going to certain floors in search of clean towels and other room amenities4. self-parking at a lot on another street due to no valet5. headaches due to the NONSTOP, loud picketing of the disgruntled employees on the beach side and street side of hotel utilizing loud speakers, drums, banging of pots and pans, cowbells, and whatever obnoxious noise maker they could think of utilizingto make matters worse i spent over $1800 to be tortured at this property. This was the very first time i could not wait to LEAVE Hawaii. This is not a smart tactic for a state that depends upon the hospitality industry for jobs and revenue.I feel I need to be compensated for enduring this torture as I did not get any advance notice that this was going to be the circumstance at the hotel. Getting a break on the parking and resort fee does not make up for the trauma I endured. Additionally, I have business travel end of January /early February 2019 and where in the world am I going to stay as I hear the strike still persists??? I think the strikers should be fired at this point and non-union workers should be hired?

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here while in Waikiki. The room and bathroom are very small and not well lit. The internet is not secure. The hotel workers were on strike and that didn't help. I would not stay in Waikiki again! Too crowded and too commercial.
user_name:
Craig A
North Atlanta, Georgia, United States

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I are staying here. Room and bathroom are very small. No secure WiFi. The ice machine on our floor is broke. The hotel workers have been on strike so some activities and restaurants are closed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in a stunning location. while our stay was disrupted by the protesters and services limited I can rate the hotel as excellent. However, using the express checkout due to lack of staff I now find charges on my credit card that should not be there. It is also impossible to find contact details on the site to have this followed up other than phone numbers. why is there not a general email on the site. I am now extremely disappointed that I have incurred incorrect charges while being a very understanding guest.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights while strikes were on. Before we arrived I was hesitant to stay here because of the protests but came anyway. So glad didnt change to another hotel love this place. Jules assisted us with check in and was absolutely amazing accomodating us to have a ocean front diamond view and no noise. Nothing was to much trouble thanks Jules. The view is stunning bathroom alittle bit on small size but hey overall room is fantastic. The beds are so comfy, had a fridge and 2 bottles of water supplied every day. The hotel itself was beautiful, fantastic location and all the staff were friendly. The protesters were very noisy but I wont go there. I was there to enjoy my holiday which I have been planning for 12 months. Thanks again for a lovely stay. We wil return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were informed ahead of time that the strike was going on so mentally were prepared. The property and location was still fantastic. The piano player in lobby was great and music in backyard was too. The sunsets and view of the beach and surfers were outstanding. I could only hear the picketers in the morning and for us it wasn’t that bad. Certainly and opportunity for our children to learn about safely protesting and the reasons around it. We loved our stay at the Moana. We thought the staff were all pleasant and helpful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our second trip to Oahu, and our first time staying at Moana Surfrider. We were there to celebrate my husband's birthday and our wedding anniversary. I was looking forward to staying in this "luxurious" piece of Hawaiian history. The Arrival:- Upon arriving, you will be greeted by union protesters with bullhorns and drums. The hotel staff - housekeeping, restaurant staff, etc. are in the middle of a labor / wage dispute. What I find WRONG about this is that the hotel was very intentional in NOT communicating this dispute and the resulting disruptions it would cause to their upcoming guests. - Checking in was easyThe Room:- Ours was located in the Banyan Wing. We had a partial ocean view, directly facing Diamond Head. - At less than 300 sq ft., it is a small room. I felt the furniture could have been arranged in a more practical way. - The Westin touches were all there, including the Heavenly bed (which truly is heavenly) and the Heavenly robe. - There is no lanai.- Because of the protests, housekeeping was non existent. Instead, the hotel rolled out huge pallets of towels, and boxes of toiletries for the guests to help themselves. In our five nights there, housekeeping called on us twice. - The pillowcases were dingy. There were stains. I asked for a new pillowcase, and the "fresh" one that I was given also had stains on it. Gross. - For as long as the dispute is happening, expect to be woken up at 7 am every morning. The Grounds:- Stunning. However, because of the protests, neglected. - Pool area is small, but right off the beach. There is a small slice of sand cordoned off from the public, where you can rent umbrellas and beach chairs. - We rented a poolside cabana twice - ~$65 USD for a half day, ~$100 USD for a full day. There was one person running poolside service who called on us perhaps once every 60-90 minutes.The Food: I can't speak to because their restaurant / room services were shut down as a result of the labor strike. The Staff/Services:- Prior to arriving, I called the hotel to make arrangements for airport-->hotel transportation. I had the most difficult time just giving the concierge my basic information because she couldn't understand me. She said it was because of poor reception which was an ABSOLUTE LIE!!!!!!! As it turns out, the (loud) protests were happening right outside of the concierge area. It was hard to even have a conversation in person, much less over the phone. I don't think anyone likes being lied to. So unethical. - During our stay, the SAME concierge was useless. We asked for tips on waterfall hikes, North Shore excursions, and paddle boarding. The most help she was able to offer was to hand us brochures. You will be better served using a concierge elsewhere. TIP: Just around the corner in King's Village, there's a great concierge service for luaus and other land excursions. BONUS TIP: Want stand up paddle boarding or surfing lessons? Check out Big Wave Dave's Surf Co., just around the block from the hotel. Overall:- No thanks to or help from the hotel, we still had a fine time in Hawaii. You're right on Waikiki beach, and there's not much that beats a Hawaiian sunset. - With that being said, I don't think we got what we paid for. In the end, it felt like we rented a self-service AirBnB and NOT a Westin hotel. The hotel should be ashamed. This ongoing dispute is a true disservice to the legacy of this historic local landmark. - I'm an SPG-turned-Marriott rewards with status. I almost exclusively stay SPG-branded hotels for work and for play, and this Westin unfortunately fell way below my expectations of the brand.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here with my mum a week ago and we had a great time. We were surprised to see the picketers out the front but we could not hear them from our room (Diamond Wing). It did occasionally get quite loud in the lobby though. The staff working were very friendly and we had housekeeping each day. The Moana Surfrider is in such a fantastic location on Waikiki beach. We had a wonderful holiday!
user_name:
Nicole H
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is absolutely illegal to sell services that are published and remove them entirely without any pre communications. Due to a strike ( which I found out at check in) and with seniors in my party to find out no valet, bellman, restaurant, housekeeping or any other amenity is an actionable offense. To say parking is a few blocks away in a lot with elevator service only for the top two floors is a joke. So two seniors would have to walk down stairs and bocks awaybwith luggage. I recommend people research a class action lawsuit going on against this hotel and others in the chain by a reputable law firm in Honolulu. ( easy to find on google). The Moana knows better and in a digital world there is no excuse for not communicating a strike that had been going on for two months. Btw the lobby update is sinfully bad taste with a strange yellow gold color scheme with way to high back chairs that block the open air feel unless you are nba tall. Used to be gorgeous now hideous.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We arrived to find the strikers in our face. The constant noise from early morning to late night destroyed all ambiance. All hotel restaurants and room service were closed. These things happen, but it is highly disappointing that we were not informed in advance. I understand that the hotel is trying to avoid cancellations. However, dishonesty and deceit are not soon forgotten and will long be remembered after this strike is long over.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hawaii - all the islands - have always been a source of joy and relaxation. From over 40 years ago, I have been coming to visit friends, family, and have loved bringing my own children here. The Moana Surfrider is one of the best hotels - location in the center of Waikiki - ease of beach access, the beautiful Banyan Tree, so many weddings - it's always fun to see all the bridal gowns. The strike is awful. I support first amendment rights - but this goes beyond the pale. The strikers at Local 5 are actually quite scary to me. It's one thing to exercise your rights, but to reject reasonable raise offers, and then use shock tactics on guests is not in the spirit of Hawaii. Militant chanting, beating on drums, "We Want Our Share" at noise levels of 104 db (I am measuring). I politely asked them about their strike requirements and was met with indifference and rudeness. So...onto the helpful stuff - ask to stay in a room on the ocean side - then the noises are gone and you enjoy the peaceful beach. Hang out closer to the ocean and it's very pleasant. The staff at the hotel are really kind and persevering despite the noisiness from the outside. When I spoke to people outside of the hotel and local friends - the sentiment seems to be indicate that the strikers have gone too far and that there are plenty of local folks willing to take these jobs. The pay rate is not unreasonable. $22/hour and now $12/hour increase on top of that stepped up over the next several years, full insurance benefits. The HI police are also saints - having to endure endless droning, drumbeats, shouts and shrieks all day of We Want, We Want. Guests can at least go into the hotel grounds and enjoy the ocean. They asked the strikers to keep it down, and instead the strikers raised the sound even higher and banged their plastic bins harder. Sad situation but eventually it will end - and I do hope the folks who govern Hawaii realize that the Union Local 5 is important - but their tactics are really hurting the tourist industry and not earning any sympathy but instead disgust at the level of their tactics to intimidate and harass at the expense of others health and well-being. Local 5 has taken their first amendment rights and impacted the mental health and well being of people around them.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Picketing and protests are still continuing and have been for over 45 days now. Don’t waste your money and stay elsewhere. We booked 3Rooms and different ends of the hotel and could hear the noise all day and all night. This is not a holiday!! We were not advised of this until we arrived and saw the protestors out the front shouting at us. Don’t bother booking this hotel until further notice and check to see when the protest has been resolved. Shame on your Marriott for not providing the customer service we all pay good money for.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Been staying at the Moana for 6-7 trips,(spent over $25k here I suspect) location on beach so prime location at premium $. I booked and pre paid in March for this trip, my wife’s 50th bday, paid sizable $ for ocean front suite in tower(best rooms)..we enjoy sitting on balcony soaking up view however totally ruined by the strike action in all Marriott Group hotels in HI, being The Sheratons, Pink Hotel and Moana.7am and the noise starts on the beach, ( no need for an alarm clock!!) there goes that tranquil coffee on the balcony, 10pm in evening quietens down(no enjoying the sunset!!). We should’ve been advised prior to arrival, just like when refurbishment are happening..no mention of the picketing or noise, dishonest Marriott knowing that high paying guests wouldn’t attend so they kept if quiet until it was too late. We have always called this our happy hotel in Waikiki, however has now left a bad taste, the banyard tree bar is also closed plus the breakfast dining is out of action.. not advised prior...we were still charged the $k+ per night. The staff try to soften the blow, those which are working, but the complaints fall on deaf ears, slow or no response.I’m a Disgusted platinum elite member who will be changing loyalty programs for my 75+ nights a year. All should Stay at alternatives until or if Marriott becomes Corporate, Socially Responsible and thinks about their guests instead of their investors and the $$

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I can't say enough wonderful things about the Moana Surfrider. I have been staying here for years and have a positive experience every time. On my most recent trip, the manager, Joo Ah, went above and beyond... The entire management team has been working long days and nights to provide comfort during the strike that is taking place at hotels in HI and CA.
