Joo Ah provided me with advance notice and in our communication, I let her know of a tragic event that happened in my family recently. When I arrived, she literally treated me like ohana (family). She greeting me when I got there, gave me a hug and wanted to do anything and everything to put a smile on my face. I can't thank her enough for her kindness, especially when I know how much stress she is under. After my week-long stay, I certainly went home smiling and happy.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Warning!!! Be careful or they will over charge you!The stay at the Westin Moana Surfrider was bad enough. The workers were striking and yelling with a bull horn starting at 5 am and lasted until 11 pm. My window was facing the street where they were picketing so I could not sleep! No to mention there were no services in the hotel, like cleaning, restaurant personnel, bar tender. Only the management was there attempting to manage the long line of unhappy guests every day. That’s where they can’t even get that right!I was slated to stay at the Westin from 10/8/18 to the morning of 10/12/18. Then I was moving to another hotel in Waikiki. I left a day early and management agreed without cancellation fees and they would refund me the one night. I noticed days later that they charged me for an additional night than my initial stay! I went back to the hotel to talk to the front desk and they were reluctant, but refunded the one night. Since their receipt doesn’t show the morning checked out, just the date of the night of each stay, I thought I was in the clear when I saw the last date was 10/11/18. However, that was the night of 10/11/18 – 10/12/18. When I got home, I was doing the math and realized that I was charged an additional night. So I tried calling the Marriott customer service line, but their phones kept hanging up on me when they would put me on hold. A couple days of trying later, I finally was able to stay on the phone for the 2 hours it needed to get a case made for me. THEN I was told that it will be 3-5 business days and I will have a decision emailed to me. That was 10/29/18. Since I hadn’t heard anything, I called back, was put on hold so they could verify this issue with the hotel, then the phones cut me off again. I still have no resolution to this issue. I have spent countless hours now trying to bring this to a close, to no avail. I understand mistake happen, but it shouldn’t take this long to make it right. AND IT STILL IS NOT RIGHT!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: With the pool area being renovated and staff on strike we didn't pick a good time to visit. No food/beverage service by the pool or beach and our room wasn't touched during our entire stay. Still it's a great location and the staff who were there tried their best. Dissapointing, but I'd give them another chance. Main complaint would be that no warning of strike was given and we weren't advised that our room wouldn't be serviced.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my first visit to Moana and I landed huge expectations. However, from the moment we stepped in the taxi we were warned of the impending situation at what should have been a dream hotel stay. I completely understand that unions felt the need to take their case to the streets, however what I didnt' understand is that the Marriott chain could not inform us prior, giving us the option to stay at a full service hotel, given that is what we paid for. If this was any other industry you would have to provide a refund as we paid for services that were never provided. We complained to 'corporate' which has fallen on deaf ears. Really disappointed at the lack of compassion for the guests like myself that did not sign up this. I feel sorry for the current staff who have to wear ear plugs to drown out the noise of the union strikers. Not to mention the Japanese weddings that were drowned out by strikers on the beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Its unfortunate to hear that some of the guests did not have a pleasant stay. I'm only staying at the Moana Surfrider when I come back to Hawaii. The hotel was gorgeous, the views were remarkable, and the staff incredibly friendly and top notch. To deliver the service and friendliness we received while such a large portion of the staff was on strike, was incredible. Yes, there was a strike during our stay, but the staff reached out well in advance to advise us and to enable us to make the decision to rebook if we wanted. And this isn't affecting just Moana, it's affecting a half-dozen hotels in the area. It's all of downtown Waikiki that is experiencing this. We decided against rebooking because nothing compares to Moana and went into the experience knowing they'd be understaffed. Given this, I was so pleasantly surprised. The management has done an excellent job quickly restaffing so there was no shortage in services and the new people were trained in a way I didn't any realize they had just started. If anything, be MAD AT MARRIOTT corp, not the people who live their life to create magical experiences for their guests.One manager in particular, Joo Ah Ige, went above and beyond to make my friend and feel like we were royalty. It was incredible! Our room and the view was BREATH-TAKING.And regarding the strike, they started and stopped at the same time each day. If anything, it was quite respectful so we were able to plan our day around it if it bothered us. And really, it didn't. Again, the strike impacts most of the hotels, and Moana has done an amazing job to accommodate their guests.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a nightmare We booked the best hotel in Honolulu expecting impeccable service - unfortunately we are experiencing the opposite. FOR 41 DAYS STAFF HAS BEEN ON A GENERAL STRIKE - making life hell. Chanting yelling and screaming mob wake you up at 7 am, most services have been shut down and life is a misery here. Police don’t stop the mob from creating a public nuisance on all customers - had we known we would have booked a different hotel. Beware .... Sorry for those employees who are still working - and working hard for all the deficiencies - management apparently doesn’t give a s....t about customers. FJH

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Do not worry about the outside turmoil at the Moana. For the most part the strikers are courtesy, occasionally a very few get obnoxious and focus on wedding parties being held on the beach side.The staff of Moana Surfrider went above and beyond to make my November 2018 stay pleasant and relaxing. While short-staffed, with minimally decremented services, the staff went above and beyond to provide incredible customer service. There was pool-side service, beach support, executive lounge was open, functional and staffed. Breakfast and evening service was exceptional. I was so impressed with Moana’s staff efforts, I cancelled a December returning reservation and rebooked with the Moana. Labor disagreements are unfortunate, however Marriott/Moana staff have dealt with the inconvenience to guests. Managers have been flown in from the mainland, supplemental staff have been hired from the local economy, all are probably doing better jobs than the previous staff. EXCELLENT job Marriott and Moana staff.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A complete and utter disappointment. I personally will never stay here again. I got this recommendation from a couple of friends who said it’s one of the oldest hotels in Hawaii. I was hoping my first experience in Hawaii would have been epic but the hotel almost ruined it. There was no room service available. Calling concierge was a waste of time. And in all honesty, could have gotten better service somewhere else. They claim the strike and labor negotiations are the cause but they had no trouble taking payments for the hotel . Anyway, I am sure some folks have had a wonderful experience there but I will never go there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel. My room was comfortable and clean. Yes, there was a strike going on out front but it really had no impact on me. I actually preferred being able to park my own car rather than valet. Beach access was perfect and it is a wonderfully central location to tons of great restaurants. There was good maid service to my room each day. I hope that they settle the strike soon but really it had no significant impact on my stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Others have covered the strike and the noise impact. The thing I want to point out is that there are barely any services at the hotel and most of the staff has been imported from the mainland and so they are very very new (read slow). There is no valet. There is no restaurant. There is minimal maid services. And (this is my theory) they don't have all of the rooms open because they can't keep them clean so you don't have access to the full Moana room inventory. I'm a Starwood Platinum and I walked out of my room because it smelled like a gym locker. They said they had no other rooms to offer. On any floor. With any view. Until this dispute is over I think it makes sense to find another hotel in Honolulu. That's what I did.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has the best position on Waikiki beach and is a really beautiful old building but currently there are protesters over pay and conditions who maintain a racket day and night outside the hotel which made our stay quite disappointing. I suggest people stay away until the dispute is over.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just arrived to the worst reception ever. Staff on strike so temp staff have no idea. The hotel restaurant is closed, so no dining, no afternoon tea, in fact very little service at all. Strikers all outside chanting through megaphones. And banging drums constantly. I know the hotel knew about this strike, and, the restaurant being closed.....months ago. I would definitely not have stayed here if they had told me!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I'm absolutely disgusted that the management hasn't advised customers before they arrive that the hotel workers are on strike. If I had received an email to advise of the situation and to offer either a discount, member points, or credit for a future stay I would not have been so angry and disappointed with my stay.I was on my own on the way from Australia to San Diego (my husband came direct without stopping a few days later) and all I wanted was to relax by the pool with a drink and some food. I was in Hawaii in March (stayed at Shoreline for a swim camp) and September (stayed at Waikiki Parc & Hilton Hawaiian Village) so didn't even need to explore or leave the hotel - that was the plan !! However due to no bar or food I had to go over to ABC to get snacks & drinks to enjoy by the pool - not what I'd planned for a 5 star hotel break.The reception staff could only say 'we've taken the resort fee off due to this sh*t' !! Really I've never had staff say that to me before at any hotel. The only plus point of my stay was an early check-in - thanks to be a Gold SPG member I think.On the way to the airport my Uber driver was a striking worker so interesting to hear his perspective and to hear that the hotels are desperately employing staff without the proper checks he had to go through.I'm sad as we so looking forward to staying here as had the best message ever in the spa in March and the hotel looked lovely.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Trying to get the concierge to help make transportation reservations from the airport was a very big deal. We had suite upgrade certificates for our trip to find out when we got here that they didn’t honor them. We had to be let off at the back door of the hotel when we arrived because there was a picket line at the front door. Apparently this has been going on for weeks and we were never notified that we would have to deal with this. As a result of the strike, much of the service are not available. The room we received is smaller than most cruise line rooms we have had in the past. There is practically no drawer space and we have to live out of the suitcase. We will try to make the best of it, but what a let down. I’m a major Marriott supporter and hopped that the merge with Sheraton would be a good thing. Now I don’t think so.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stay away! Check your booking currently, the hotel won’t advise you they have no staff and the ones they have don’t have any idea. There has been a strike by workers for 5 weeks hotel should be closed while this is going on. Nothing open rooms not cleaned on a 6 night stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My second visit to Waikiki and I had always dreamed of staying at the beautiful Moana Surfrider. When arrived at the hotel I was unaware about the strike that is currently happening, although my stay was only a short one at Moana Surfrider I was told by one of the staff to just "ignore" the noise. I could here the strikers every morning at 7am and this did interrupt my sleep. Walking past the strikers one day I was told to "check out" - this made me feel uncomfortable and my stay here wasn't as pleasant and peaceful as I would've liked it to be.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After an 11hr flight I was excited to get to the prestigious Moana Surfrider to relax and unwind. The hotel itself is beautiful. The rooms were nice. The rocking chairs on the front porch after 10pm (city noise ordinance) are very relaxing. But stay away from the hotel in general between 6am and 10pm.We were not notified that there was a Union strike underway. Not by the hotel, and not by the booking agency. Upon arrival, there was a rowdy crowd of Union workers on day 28 of their strike. Banging buckets, yelling on megaphones, and loud chanting directly in front of the hotel. While we pulled into the driveway, a woman greeted us and directed us to self parking.. since there is no one available to valet. She forgot to give us a Lei, but did catch up with us as we were going up the steps to give us one. Deflated by the lack of Aloha in our greeting.Our initial room was street front.. lucky us! After listening to the banging as we were trying to settle in, we decided we weren’t going to tolerate it, and requested a room change. They did accommodate this request which did help after 10pm, and before 6am (city noise ordinance). Our daily wake up call was the loud clanging of the Union.Upon check in, we were told we can collect bath towels, shampoo, etc to the side of the front desk since housekeeping services were unavailable, or at request, and that the restaurants were not operating but some would have prepared take away dishes. To say that our experience at the hotel was dismal is an understatement. There was no “above and beyond” to assure that guests were enjoying their stay. There was no Hawaiian spirit. All of the spirit was outside on the sidewalks banging around.Can’t say that I will return to this establishment. Felt the handling of the situation allowed for a disappointing vacation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are planning a trip here shortly, please check the progress of the strike action to avoid a disappointing experience. Wonderful resort but facilities including restaurants closed due to staff striking. A lesson learnt here is to research with your travel agent that these events are happening when you book. Doubt if we will will stay in Waikiki again. Felt very sorry for weddings happening every day we were at the resort due to the noise of the protesters. Very disappointing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel and it was fantastic. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the location is perfect. Close to great bars, restaurants, shopping and it is absolute beach frontage. Spoil yourself and that someone special and stay in a suite, you'll never look back.There are currently some strikes taking place in Waikiki so it is impacting some of the normal hotel services and they are noisy at times. The staff who are working are doing a fantastic job of maintaining the friendly Aloha spirit and deserve credit accordingly.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had big expectations for the Westin Resort &Spa. Had there not been a strike by union staff we would have had a great time, listening to banging and shouting from 7AM to 10PM from the front of the property to the beach out back was annoying to no end!! Service was poor, but given the circumstances they did the best they could I guess? Had we known about how bad the service was going to be due to the strikers we would have stayed elsewhere!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Forgot your workout gear? NO PROBLEM! This amazing resort not only offers paradise but back up (for $5), if you’ve forgotten your sneaks, or workout clothes! Comfortable beds, towels, robes, and a welcome atmosphere all around! Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have spent some wonderful times in this Hotel in the past so we had expectations of another superb 9 nights when we checked in on 29 October. We booked an ocean view room with buffet breakfast at cost of nearly $9,000 AUD including economy airfares from Brisbane Australia 6 months ago. We checked in only to be told the restaurant was closed. The truth is there is virtually no service as staff are on strike. There is a very loud picket line from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm. The cacophony from chanting with aid of megaphones, beating drums, pots and pans, etc. is unbearable. They start in the morning right outside our room. We make our own bed, change our towels, replenish the toiletries and toilet paper, bottled water, tea and coffee ourselves. Yet, we were given no notice of this appalling situation and no monetary compensation has been offered. The lack of communication is completely inexcusable and unforgivable.I guess this review will be met with yet another patronising and meaningless response from Karen W of customer relations, Just like all similar reviews from other disgruntled house guests.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: W have been staying at the Moana Surfrider for almost 20 year's, visiting once a year sometimes twice a year( was here in March most recently)We arrived today for an 8 day stay, to celebrate my birthday, having traveled from Sydney, spending a large amount of money.When we arrived, we didnt recognise any of the usual staff, and the noise from the protestes was deafening.On check in, we were not told all the restaurants and room service were closed, housekeeping non existant and limited everything!Unpacked came downstairs for lunch, and then we found out you just cant access ANYTHING , after trying to track down staff or concierge who were hard to find.Paying $5700 USD or $975 a night AUD , is just pure robbery ,Our package was with breakfast ,to have to walk across the road for food to the other Sheraton is a joke, if i wanted to go to the Princess sheraton, id have booked there.For us, we come here for concvenience, we eat here every night, have breakfast here every day, and if we had been told, we would not have come.I called the hotel a week ago to confirm and was not told anything, in fact I got emails trying to push me to book spa treatmentsMost decent hotels will tell you if construction is happening etc, but not hereThe dilemma now, is theyve taken 9000 AUD on our card, so if we check out, it will take up to 7 days to be refunded, luckily we have other cards, but the whole experience has ruined our trip and its Day 1The staff on the desk are doing their best, and i feel for them, but they couldnt care less one way or another.They offered us beach club lounge access, saying its worth $150 a day, yeah, i know that, again, i never boook that package as its of no interest to usNo offer of a discount or upgrade, just basically tough luck, youre stuck hereWe are cancelling our starwood membership after 20 years and will never visit or support another Starwood or Marriot property again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staying here at present during the strike! Our room is quiet, comfortable and relaxing, yes out the front is loud with the on going protest, but out the back sensational ocean views, great staff and that that great ambience...you are on holiday...enjoy!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I absolutely hate writing reviews like this, but I just have no choice. It isn’t simply about the staff protest that was occurring at the time, but the way the hotel and Marriot handled it- not telling the truth and not giving any compensation for it. I had heard that there were protests occurring and called ahead 3 days before our arrival. I was told there was absolutely no issue and that no one was aware of a protest. I would have stayed elsewhere had I been told of the actual situation. (Turns our the strike has been going on for two days already from when I called)Upon arrival there was no one at the front desk or anywhere to be found. After wandering around the hotel for 10 minutes I finally found someone. We were checked into a standard room. In the hallways were cardboard boxes with toilet paper, shampoo, towels etc and big dumpster looking containers with dirty towels and trash cans for trash. Given the staff protest there was no maid service and you had to empty your own trash, towels, etc. Free breakfast was part of our package but all the restaurants were closed because of the strike. The protests began at 530am‘ with bullhorns and our room faced the street where the protest was occurring. I asked someone at the front desk if we could move to a room on the other side of the hotel. I was told that it would cost an extra $400 to do so even though there were rooms open. I spoke with the front desk and asked what level of compensation we would be given for this. The room cost 140,000 points for a two night stay (70,000 each night). The front desk originally offered 1500 points back. So the hotel was offering a 1% reduction in the cost of a room with no breakfast, no maid service, no restaurants, and a 530am wake up with a bullhorn. I said that it really didn’t sound fair and complained to the manager. I was told that I would be given 50,000 points back. Of course that has never happened. I have tried to call the hotel 5 times since our stay and have only been able to get through once (after over 20 minutes on hold on the phone). The one time I got through (the last time) I was told that I was lying and that no one would have ever offered me that. This was the single most disappointing, frustrating, insulting, and horrible hotel stay I have ever had. Being lied to from the start about the protest, to the actual service, but worst of all being offered 1% off, and then being told that I was lying about what the manager ended up agreeing to was really the worse part. I have never written a bad hotel review. Never. But this was just too terrible not to.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider is NOT a luxury escape! No peace & relaxation as staff protesters outside at beach & hotel entrance from 7am to late at night! SORT it Marriot & owners! Guest dissatisfaction HIGH - no prior communication, lack of service, no peace here to relax. If this is how you treat guests I wonder about your staff relations???NOT GOOD ENOUGH.Stay elsewhere dear readers.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at the Moana Oct 31 for a one night stay prior taking a cruise. We were upgraded to an ocean front room. While workers on strike were picketing and signing in front of the hotel and attenpting to disrupt our stay, it was still excellent as there is so much to do and see around Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Central to beach and shopping! They were having a stike on our visit but really took care of us moving us to a quiet room with and upgrade and Starwood club privileges. Really went all out to accommodate us for any inconvenience. Great big rooms and generally very happy with our stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I have been wanting to stay at this hotel for over ten years, we married in 2008 vowed that for our ten year wedding anniversary we would stay at this beautiful hotel. I booked a trip for myself and my husband for our anniversary and my husbands 40th birthday. I want to be fair in this review, as i like so many others have been put in a bad position due to the labour strike which has meant protesters have been out out there front of the hotel for several weeks now which quite frankly makes you not want to go near this hotel or any other on the strip , but it has meant that the lack of service has made this 5 star hotel feel like a no star hotel. I have stayed in the marriot servalTimes before in other locations , always with no hiccups and amazing service . The brakfaat nuggets as usually to die for in these hotels, however no knives one day and paper plates the next in addition to maybe a quarter of the breakfast buffet being servedOur room was never cleaned, there was an obvious lack of staff which made the place feel like a ghost town. However in fairness having never stayed here before I want to make a fair review do not withstanding no service or staff I will pretend this never happened.Pros- amazing location could not do better Beach access Beautiful outdoor area with great live music as night If there was someone at the bar the drinks looked good and reasonably priced Cute Cafe just outside owned by moana has A cafe with the best coffee on the island as far as we were concerned A big name hotel with a name you can trust Lovely check in counter people Cons- if you like me went over the website one hundred times thinking , $500 AUD minimum and weighed up the fact that the Rooms look small and dated, this was certainly the case for the banyan wing. Our room was tiny with our little one year old but we couldn't afford a bigger room. It does smell a bit of mildew as others have said. If we stay again we want to try one of the more expensive rooms to see if we like them more.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had our wedding at the Moana Surfrider, amd also stayed there for a week as guests. As a wedding venue this hotel is stunning. The historic building and well maintained grounds offered a beautiful backdrop, and the staff was so accommodating in making sure it was a perfect event. We also enjoyed the hotel as guests, and were impressed by the beautiful bar and pool area. We stayed in two different rooms, as we were given the honeymoon suite for the nights before and of our wedding. The normal rooms are quite small, but beautiful and clean. The bed was also great. If you can afford it, treat yourself to the honeymoon suite or a similar room in the tower. The view was AMAZING and the room was large and very nice. Unfortunately, the strikes started 3 days before our trip ended. Despite the hotel's best efforts this was very disruptive. Obviously not their fault and they discounted our resort fee as a result. We look forward to returning to the Moana Surfrider for our anniversary in a couple years. It will always be a special place for us.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just finishing up a lousy stay at the The Fairfield (by Marriott) Moana Surfrider on Waikiki beach. Without any notice we have to put up with plastic glasses & utensils. Paper plates in an overcrowded club due to no other food options. Nasty brown streaks on the chair – nobody likes that. Self serve linens although we did have maid service 1 day.I hated to cross the Untie Here Local 5 picket line, but with no timely notice it's too late to switch. Due to the owners and Marriott every one received a 7 am wake up call by the picketers which we support. Fair is Fair - Hotel Worker deserve their ShareMy last stay at any and all Marriott hotels and soon to cancel my SPG AmEx Cards. Never experienced this at a Hilton or IHG property Sad beginning of trip of a lifetime celebrating retirement and 40th Anniversary

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I recently stayed at the Moana Surfrider for our wedding in Waikiki. Overall we were disappointed by the experience and would not recommend this property.Pros:Location - The property is located in a prime spot on the beach and really in the heart of everything Waikiki. Also, the building’s lobby is gorgeous and fantastic for pictures.Front Desk Staff - The front desk staff were quite helpful and polite. Cons:Rooms - Our room smelled of mildew for the entire trip as well as the hallways. Check-In process - We were told at check in because we didn’t book direct with the hotel that they are no longer honoring king bed requests, and king beds are only available to customers booking direct. We were then told we could upgrade our room for an extra $275 USD per night to a room type that wasn’t sold out and had a king bed. After escalation, this was resolved and we were placed into the original room type and bed type we had reserved. Housekeeping - On two occasions housekeeping came into our room without knocking at precisely 8 am. After the first incident we kept the deadbolt locked, this at least prevented the housekeeper from walking into our room and forced them to knock to enter. On our second day of the trip, housekeeping removed all of the caffeinated coffee and teas from our room and replaced with decaf which was really disappointing as well. This was rectified on the 3rd day of our trip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is on strike!!! No room service , no valet parking , no pool bar open, I had to go get my own soap and towels, room wasn’t clean, was told to goto either the 3rd or 5th floor to pick up my things like towels for my room , yet there was no towels and the front desk said they would look into that, picketers out front with mega phones screaming at the hotel and everyone going In and out. I paid extra to stay , cause I was here before and liked it , not any more. Why did no one tell me this was going on? Seems like hotel management chose not to tell anyone about the strike until you get here and have people blasting you in the ear with mega phones and banging pots and pans. I would not have stayed here if I had known this , I feel ripped off , pay extra for a nice place and services and you don’t get all what you pay for. They did offer no resort fee and discounted room upgrade. But if you don’t take a room upgrade your room will be facing the people striking and yelling and banging pots and pans at all hours. I don’t feel that’s even close to making things right.I will not stay at any Marriott International owned properties since they have shown they don’t care about the guests staying.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just got back from Waikiki Oahu. We stayed at the Moana Surfrider. It is a beautiful place to stay with a long history. The staff are first rate and attend to you every need. The Hotel is immaculate and beautiful. It Is located right on the main drag of Waikiki so everything is within walking distance. The beautiful beach of Waikiki is located directly behind you only steps away from the Hotel. There is a small pool located outside adjacent to the beach area. There are plenty of seating areas where you can just sit and enjoy the Ocean breeze. The rooms ( one bedroom for two) are rather small ( more like a New York Studio) the bathroom was really small ( only one will fit in there at a time) with your basic shower, sink, toilet ( with built in Bidet). The room view we had was of the main street and the rooms do not have balconies. I would suggest getting a room with the ocean view. The room did have a small refrigerator, one cup coffee maker and TV, I will tell you that everything there is very very very expensive for example if you wanted a "Continental Breakfast" in your room it was $32 so that gives you an idea of what the food and drinks cost. As far as as the room services I cannot tell you about that because as soon as we arrived ALL OF THE HOTEL STAFF WAS ON STRIKE. So our beds never got made or serviced, we had to exchange all of our own bath towels and get all of our necessities at the main floors. But the place is still beautiful and location is great and the staff that did attend to us was exceptional. So if you want to splurge its worth the money. As far as food and drink go you can find plenty of cool local spots with really great food and drink for reasonable prices within easy walking distance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Normally I would give this hotel five stars however due to the strike it is truly lacking.I think the hotel or booking.com should have notified guests before arriving. Currently there is no room service, housekeeping, etc. This means guests are responsible for getting their own towels which are different floors of the hotel along with the complimentary soaps, lotions, gel.We are booked here for 11 days. In the last five days our room has been cleaned once. We had to ask for clean sheets to make our beds.Since I traveled on a business credit card it's not as easy as getting a refund and finding another hotel. Trying to get the hotel refund the card has not been easy and so far no luck that I am aware of.Again normally this is my favorite hotel on Waikiki. With the strike going on it's not worth what was paid.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were booked into the Moana Surfrider Resort Waikiki which had been given glowing recommendations. We were not disappointed BUT there was and maybe still is a workers strike going on They were noisy and nearly drove us crazy. But we had our resort taxes waiived and also given a room in the tower which helped with the strikers noise. Under normal circumstances it would have been fantastic and would definitely stay there again when all the services are up and available

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: SO DISAPPOINTING.....I have literally waited my entire adult life to stay here since first visiting Hawai’i in my 20s. Finally got to the point where I could afford it and of course! employees were striking. Now, while I totally respect an individuals right to strike unfavorable and unjust working conditions I DO have a problem with them making racket on the beachside from sunup to 10PM. I’ve been told the breakfast at the beach house on the veranda is divine, but due to the strike was unable to experience it:(. We were in town for the ADA 2018, thankfully we had an idea of the strike prior due to the ADA sending out emails to notify attendees. Many others I spoke with had no idea until they arrived. People usually vacation at a place like this with the expectation of being pampered. There were absolutely zero services, no restaurants, extremely limited bar service (meaning you get up and obtain), no housekeeping, breakfast with plastic utensils (doesn’t seem environmentally responsible) and a lot of temporary staff (who were trying their best). I am disappointed in the executives who make decisions. Why were they trying to hide the strike from their clients? Shady..... it was very inconvenient to have to explore outside the hotel to eat every single meal. It was definitely not relaxing hearing bullhorns, cymbals and chanting all day long. I felt sorry for all the weddings we saw at the resort during this time, I can’t even imagine. The hallways looked like a war zone and you could fetch your own towels/toiletries from the front desk.We left on Oct 22nd. If you do stay here during the strike be sure to ask for a reduction in your rate as you’re NOT receiving what you’re paying for. In conclusion, this isn’t JUST an Oahu problem. The problem exists in every major metropolitan city in America, people working hard every day without the ability to afford *decent* (not mansions) housing for themselves and families. It is an AMERICAN problem that requires changes from within.Undecided whether I’ll give it another go sometime

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed there as part of a package but believe the rooms start at over 500 USD per night. OUTRAGEOUS!.Our room was very small and poorly lit.The beach is poor and has many rocks under the water. I cut my foot on 1 of them.The restaurant is ridiculously expensive. 55 USD for a microscopic fillet steak with nothing else! And it was overcooked!There was no warmth in the staff and at times they were simply rude.On checkout we found that they added USD 33 per night as a "service fee". What a rort! We had a major fight but eventually it was reversed.Also they were reluctant to give the USD 250 food credit included in our package.There is no way in the world we will ever go back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We just arrived to the din and noise of striking workers outside shouting and banging drums. Apparently they have been here for 10days and start at 7am and go right through to 10pm. Shocking look for a luxury hotel.Now have to wait till daytime in Oz to sort out alternate accommodation. This will be a poor 9 night stay given the noise and disruption. Restaurants are closed. Who will be cleaning rooms if staff are on strike???

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our honeymoon started with employees yelling at the doors and containers of clean and dirty towels at the reception. No honeymoon perks, no special attention, no service, disposable dishes for breakfast. Only breakfast, no bar, no pool side bar.But we did pay full price, no refund, no nothing. No free cabana (110$USD/day). Oh wait, we did get one popsicle one day. Just over 3 days, we were just happy to leave for Maui

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: OMG..I paid $635 a night. What I got was the following:1. No room service cleaner. No towels.. nothing.2. Protesters blasting there blow horns at all hours so we could not sleep. 3. Rude front desk and concierge that could not recommend any local restaurants to eat. 4. Restaurants and bars were closed so no hot food. 5. The owners should sell to someone who cares. Either deal with the unions or get rid of them. I got ripped off.6. Room is dated and shower water would not drain.7. Breakfast served was moldy strawberries and fake eggs.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed as a couple for 5 nights on a room only basis in June 2018 on our last leg of a 3 month round the world trip. The hotel has a great location on the beach front and alongside the main strip nearby to shops and restaurants. Check in was easy and the staff very attentive to our requirements. The restaurants offered a good choice of food menus although with so much choice nearby we only tended to take breakfast at the hotel. The beach bar and restaurant offered a good choice of food, snacks and drinks whilst, in the evening there was live entertainment. Our room and the hotel was kept very clean and our room was of a reasonable size with the bed being very comfortable. However we stayed in the main building and if booking again I would stay in one of the tower blocks which seemed to offer b better accommodation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently stayed for a couple of days this week, there is currently a labor strike on going. Basic hotel services does not exist at the moment. 1. No restaurants2. Limited house keeping3. Noise in front of the property due to the strike (all day)4. Upon check in, rooms are not ready until night time. 5. Management chose to hide to situation to avoid cancellation. They did not advise guests in advance of the situation (what happened to email) rather, you'll only going to find out about it when you get there. 6. They dont wanna compensate you for all the trouble.
user_name:
Gino T
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Checked in today and was told staff are on strike due to pay dispute, we were told that we had to get our own towels and clean our own rooms. We have friends who stayed here the night before and were woken up by the protestors. Not the best way to enjoy a relaxing holiday. Phoned SPG as a status member to complain and was told too bad these things happen and we won't be doing anything about. Might as well stayed at an air b n b if I knew we had to fend for ourselves at the hotel. At least we wouldn't be woken up by protestors. Only good thing going for this place is location other than that don't stay here. I'll be changing hotel chains due to this awful experience. Not a great start to the Marriot and SPG merger.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We came to the hotel and were absolutely unaware of the strike. Upon arriving we had to cross the picket line with people yelling don’t check in. The bell men was someone brought in from another state and tried hard but don’t know anything about the hotel. Checking in was difficult. Behind the counter were toilet paper, towels and soap. We got to our room that was still dirty. We asked for an upgrade and got one the next day which turned out to be a lovely room but still with no housekeeping or room service. The noise from the protestors is loud and constant. The club floor actually is really nice and set up for full service food for breakfast. The spa closes early and this is definitely not the same feeling you would expect from the hotel. The staff is doing their best but clearly without a lot of direction. The offer from the front desk is to waive the $38 resort fee! We were told they were told by corporate not to alert guests before they arrive of the conditions. So to sum it up we are doing our own housekeeping and eating all meals but breakfast out is the hotel. There really doesn’t seem any end in sight. I would say if you can avoid this property until this is resolved, it would be a good idea.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a challenging review to write as there were quite a few problems related to the stay that came as a direct result of the Entire Hourly staff of this (and 4 other Marriott owned Waikiki Hotels going on strike). This was a huge distraction; with 24 hour a day loud protests at the hotel entrance that spilled over to the beach on several occasions.All of the on-site Restaurants and bars were closed. Housekeeping was very limited, and the hotel definitely suffered from a cleanliness standpoint. HOWEVER.... the management staff onsite as well as staffers brought in from other properties on the US mainland worked tirelessly to do everything in their power to make the stay as perfect as possible under these conditions. They Are to be commended for their efforts; likely working long hours and dealing with a lot more complaints than positive feedback. I feel like the only thing the hotel truly did wrong was not notify guests in advance of a pending strike (which certainly would have caused some cancellations; but likely resulted in fewer upset guests).This was a big miss on their part!With that said..... WE LOVE THIS HOTEL!!! The check-in process was seamless; likely in large part due to my Platinum Status with the hotel. The staff did give us a lovely upgrade that truly ranked as one of the 5 nicest rooms I've stayed at in my many years of travel for business and pleasure. The Beach Club lounge had a lovely breakfast spread, and light dinner each night; and was staffed with likely very tired but very friendly folks. (some were hotel management, some were brought in from the outside)Yes, we were disappointed not to get to have dinner on the lovely veranda, or cocktails at the beach front bar. (that was actually our biggest bummer, since we booked this hotel specifically to spend more time at their exquisite beach front bar which we loved so much last time; it was under construction and closed off in a manner that blocked the view of the beach from the otherwise pleasant courtyard)Still; We LOVED this hotel. How can you not? Its grand, yet not stuffy. The rooms are fantastic; the vibe is old Hawaii mixed with a dose of old Hollywood charm. So we had to make our own bed and get our own towels; big deal! The hotel to their credit didn't flinch at my request to reduce our rate a bit; again... a well trained staff with the autonomy to make decisions.The strike is a sad situation for all involved; and I do hope its resolved soon. Yes it was inconvenient, but damn if we don't just LOVE this hotel. We will be back!!!!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am a huge fan of this hotel- have been coming for 15 years at least once or twice a year. Today we check in and we see not greeted Aloha style with a lei and fruit punch as always but with no valet and picketers our front screaming. We are escorted to lobby to check in . What a disaster- towel carts in lobby and we are informed no restaurants are open/ place looks like a wreck. Would have checked out but no availability due to a convention - check before you come it’s awful. Soaps are in a box when you get off the elevator. Room cleaning not up to par- I’m being told by other gas at I’ll be lucky to even have my room cleaned - $460 a night what a joke

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For a Westin resort this feels more like a tired Hampton! Views and outside look lovely but the room are tired and definitely need some TLC! Unfortunately there was a hotel strike while we were there but above and beyond that they really need to update it! I wouldn’t give it more than 2 ⭐️!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: With only one more day left in paradise, I must say this is one fantastic hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. The location is great, the beach is out your back door, the iconic history hits all the high notes with comfort and ambiance. But what really makes you love this place is the staff. Arrived in the middle of a hotel workers strike and the staff here handled everything with grace and efficiency. They always had a smile on their faces despite the situation and the long hours and did everything they could to accommodate the guests. They were all kind and generous under adverse conditions . I can only imagine how wonderful it would be with full amenities and full staff and hope that we might be able to some day return and experience that as well. Thank you to all the staff for everything you did to make our 35th Anniversary vacation a memorable one! You were all great!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed here 5 times and we have enjoyed every stay. Unfortunately this time we were caught in a labour dispute which disrupted the whole hotel as well as others. The restaurant was closed, no room service and picketing outside the entrance every day. I am surprised there wasn't a contingency plan in case such an incident happened.The management staff tried their best to cover all bases but it is not something you would want to have to go through on your holiday.we still love this hotel and would return.
user_name:
Graeme W
St. Andrews Beach, Australia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really nice original hotel, nice staff and great location right by the heart of the beach.....Very clean and tidy they have both the older original part of the hotel you can stay in or the newer more modern tower, rooms were a good size and well equipped, prices were on the high side but that compares with all of Honolulu anyway.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Surfrider about 8 years ago and loved it. Needless to say when we decided to take a cruise that departed from Hawaii we wanted to stay again. Sadly we were a tad disappointed. The hotel is centrally located and you can feel the history just being there. We were upgraded but the room was really small which we can live with but little things were missing. The concierge desk needs some help. We asked for recommendations for dinner one night and the gal on the desk could not make any suggestions. On another day were purchased tickets for a bus tour. Again we were given incomplete information on how to us the vouchers provided by the hotel so ended up having to go out of our way to get the required documentation. We asked the front desk for s late check out (we are gold members of Starwood) only to be told that our request could not be confirmed until the day of departure because "this is a really busy hotel". When we made the same request to a different person the next day we were given the late checkout. The poolside bar is great and service really to notch. There is still construction in the poolside bar.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love the Moana Surfrider and it takes more than a labor dispute to change my opinion. The staff made every attempt to make our anniversary-vow renewal vacation perfect. Upgraded to an Oceanview suite, parking fees covered. Many smiles, patience and grace amongst the Elegance of the property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Unfortunately we arrived at hotel In the middle of industrial action. Staff did their best to provide guests with necessities. Charges were reduced to compensate for almost no amenities available. Room clean and comfortable bathroom a little small after renovations. Pretty hotel full of history shame we couldn’t enjoy it due to the protestors outside all day.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this hotel. So much character, fabulous location and rich history. The lobby still looks good but the Diamond wing needs a facelift. Redocoration and bathroom upgrade required. When we were there the guest lift was closed so guests used the service lift. This is not ideal given we paid top dollar plus resort fees for the hotel. In addition the Banyan poolside bar was being renovated. It really spoilt the ambience of the bar area. We didn’t she much construction activity during our week stay. Recommend the hotel’s history tour. See concierge for details. Vintage 1901 is great for cocktails (served in a glass not plastic), snacks and has excellent service. Room tip: Diamond ocean view high floor but after renovations

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: High Tea served by Eugene (the Best) Tea Sommelier at Mona Surfrider Historic Hotel on Waikki Beach. Selection of special teas, served with all you would expect. Served on the veranda in comfortable casual eligence.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Original hotel was beautiful and historic. Beach access and nice central location on Waikiki beach. The cons: The staff was downright rude even to wedding guests (they went on strike during our stay and picketed so loud outside you could hear from the pool area) but had terrible customer service prior to. Outside of the resort fee other people have mentioned, they basically make you valet as the parking garage is two blocks away. Do yourself a favor and find a different hotel!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here, and the location and beach are gorgeous. Our room was lovely. There is only a small pool, and limited loungers, and it is expensive to hire loungers with a sunshade on the beach.
user_name:
Yvonne S
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights to start our 2 week vacation in Hawaii. This hotel is nicer than the other hotels we have stayed at previously in Waikiki but still leaves a lot to be desired. The pool area is small with limited chairs. If you aren’t out early it’s hard to get a spot. Also the service at the pool left a lot to be desired, no waiters ever came over. Had to get up and order food, then bring back ourselves. This was all before the strike happened.The day we were leaving the hotel staff went on strike. At 6 am you got woke up from hearing the chanting and screaming. We had valeted our car for our stay and when we went to pick it up, they told us we had to get it ourselves. I’m 5 months pregnant and we had to drag our bags to the car.We were fortunate we were leaving the first day of the strike but they significantly limited services. Going forward housekeeping and other basic services were not being offered.I support the staff for doing what they need to do but the hotel management did nothing to makeup for the fact that the services being paid for and expected were not being delivered. I also felt badly for those staff who were working filling in for jobs they normally don’t do, the IT guy getting bags, the spa lady handing out pool towels and taking the brunt of the angry guests. The hotel management and owners made no offers to guests on reducing rates or any sort of concession to guests to make up for lack of services. Shame on the senior management and owners of the hotel for not handling the guest situation better. People are on holidays and this is not what they are expecting when they book vacation at what is supposed to be one of the best hotels in Waikiki. I also emailed the general manager about how we were not satisfied on the last day of our stay as we were not getting services paid for. It’s been 4 days now and I have yet to hear back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had dinner here one night. Place was packed and we didn't have reservations but they manage to accommodate us. Restaurant is nice with a beach front. Live music and nice ambiance. You can also here the waves from the beach Wich gives a certain asset to the dinner. Prices were kinda high but in the same time you are in Honolulu in nice restaurant. Service was polite friendly and prompt. All in all it was. Really nice birthday dinner for my wife.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have been visiting this hotel for 20+ years, enjoying the beauty and hospitality. Despite the ongoing strike and the limited services, we are very happy with our decision to stick with our reservation for this week. Over the years, we have come to know many of the service staff members, and they always have been professional and welcoming. We hope they can return soon. Meanwhile, the Moana management has done an excellent job of continuing the aloha spirit under challenging circumstances.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was supposed to be a vacation of my lifetime, instead what a disaster. All service staff are on strike. No room service, no onsite restaurants, no housekeeping, no nothing. Each day the place filled with trash that needed collected. We had to pick up clean towels and bathroom supplies. Each day the outside area was a mess. Each day we heard the chants if protesters who want a fair wage. They said they have had no contact since June. For the price we paid, why can't they be paid so your guests are taken care of. While the beds are in fact heavenly, nothing else about our stay was. We paid too much for no service. Never will recommend this resort

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A wonderful property in the midst of Waikiki. Close to everything including being on the beach. Staff are wonderful and so helpful and everything you need is at your doorstep. A beautiful property steeped in history. We will be back without a doubt!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, it’s located on Waikiki beach and offers the perfect location for watching the sunset over the ocean. The service was friendly and attentive and the rooms were comfortable. I really enjoyed cocktails on the verandah overlooking the ocean, their bar is popular with locals and tourists so you’ll probably meet some interesting people to talk to!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment you step foot into the Westin, age and material with overwhelm you. This building is the oldest on the strip. White, full of timber and plenty happening. Weddings are a constant occurrence so get ready fir a busy stay.Once you walk through and into the garden towards the pool, your holiday begins, private pool and private beach area mKes this one a must stay hotel.Rooms are small but tey an ocean view as the waves crashing on the sand will wake you every morning.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel staff have gone on strike. This has gone on for three days so far during our stay since October 8th. The workers are constantly chanting outside the hotel and blocking the entrance. The bars and some restaurants are closed. There’s no housekeeping (our room hasn’t been cleaned for 3 days). You have to take your old towels down to the lobby to collect new ones. So much for a relaxing holiday. So far the hotel has offered nothing to compensate the current guests and there is no end in sight for the strike.I don’t blame the workers on strike, but the way the hotel has handled the situation so far is appalling. I would not risk staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel does not care about its guests or workers! The taxi could not even drop us off at the valet because of the strikers. There was hardly any staff to help us or check us in. We only stayed one night, and then spent the rest of our vacation else we’re. They charge $300 plus a night, and can’t pay there workers enough to prevent a strike!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We popped in for breakfast one morning,and although we werent staying,we were made to feel very welcome,which makes me want to go back,and stay next time.We had the fluffiest ever pancakes with maple syrup and mangoes,beautifulll.The next time we had a selection of pastries yummo.The staff were very warm n friendly even tho they were very buzy,well done to them and the management.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A beautiful facility that is worth the money! I enjoyed our room and the friendliness of the staff. Great location and exactly what I was looking for! We had a tropical storm while we were there and didn’t get to enjoy the beach and pool like we wanted to. But we’d stay there again! The beach photos were early in the morning!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Enjoyed a fantastic afternoon tea on the Veranda overlooking the Banyan tree and the ocean. Idyllic! Great food, plenty of different teas and a most attentive member of staff called Aki, she was brilliant. Just book this value for money experience, far removed from the fast pace of Honolulu's streets.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at many 5 star hotel in my life and of course, been to Hawaii 3 times previously but in different hotels and due to my upcoming bday agreed with a friend to pay the extra for Westin which was forever in our goals. With that said, the hitel of couse was beautiful with luxurious bedding, coffee, pool, and amazing staff.what one would typically expect from any 5 star hotel so i likely wouldnt have posted a review ss unnecessary and likely many other reciew full of superlatives. HOWEVER, a strike took place today which woke us up early and left the hotel with minimal staff etc which is when the true beautiful nature and manner of the night manager Chris Alemdar came to light. Unbeleivably gracious, and cool under pressure he answered all our questions and concerns and managed everything we raised so well that i felt compelled to commend him on this forum. I will return here just for him and all that he has done for us. Well done moana surfrider for having an amazing manager like chris as i know without his input and conversation, actions and follow up, this review would have been very different.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Employees, local 5 went on strike today. Hopefully this gets resolved soon. All amenities shut down, rooms nor being cleaned, towels staged for guests to pick up self service but they ran out. Prett soon they'll have ius emptying our own trash. My understanding is somme was threatened about a month ago and negotiations have been ongoing for months. I would recommend finding other accommodations and avoid this situation. How do guests get compensated for not getting what they expected. Rooms are not cheap.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love a great hotel.. and this has a great restaurant area but in terms of staying here, unnecessary. The hotel lobby and restaurant are great but the rooms are not at all up to par with what you would expect for the cost and the beach is jam packed.Would recommend staying somewhere cheaper and saving your $When we walked into the room, we had two double beds and the extra cot set up..considering we are one couple, it was unnecessary and felt cluttered, like it was rushed to be ready, although we arrived late in the night. We had to go get our own lei's the next day as checking in, the person at night did not give them to us. Not a great experience, will not be returning.With that being said - the restaurant outside (the Beach Bar) is fabulous and I would highly recommend for lunch or dinner.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Moana for four nights for our anniversary. We had an exceptional time. We stayed in a Tower Premier Ocean View room and the view from our balcony did not disappoint. We loved sitting out on our balcony in the morning with coffee watching the surfers or in the evening with a beer listening to the live music from The Beach Bar. We received great and friendly service from all employees, especially Gloria and Lee at the Pool Desk and our server, Hays, when we hung out in a cabana for a day. The Moana is a beautiful oasis in busy Waikiki and we truly enjoyed our stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We love this hotel and have been here every year for the last 7 years. But today 10/8/18, the service staff went on strike . Restaurants , housekeeping, room services , pool services are non existent. Management jumped in to help and are doing the best they can , but they cannot cover all the services . A little disappointed because we pay more to have those luxuries but what can you do? The cannot predict how long the strike will last , call first if you have booked a trip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We absolutely love this hotel. . .it is one of our favorite hotels in the world! The ambiance is exceptional and the rooms are great. The front desk staff are very attentive and helpful especially when you arrive jet lagged. My wife and I especially want to thank Irene T. for her help! Her professionalism was top tier to say the least. . . we recommend this hotel to all our friends and business associates!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a beautiful wedding my niece and now nephew had here!! The views were great and just the overall ambiance of this hotel was beautiful! Everyone on staff was very accommodating and friendly! We had the wedding on the lawn and the reception there too. This place is great for weddings or a special getaway!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We first came to the Hotel 3 years ago and were very happy. Now it seems to be getting a little tired especially the bathrooms.The bar at the pool was also closed due to renovations but what really hit home was the service was low. We stayed at the Grand Hyatt too and that was better.It’s still a lovely hotel but needs some something new.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana is a beautiful old hotel however the day to day running needs immediate attention. This was our third visit and each time I submit a review and the same recommendations fall on deaf ears. It is insulting to the reviewer and paying guest to receive the same tired, insincere response from the hotel manager or his/her representative. Apologies and promises of chats at the next meeting are not what’s needed- action is what’s needed.Firstly-the pool area needs attention- not quite sure how this worked. Days went by with lounges, tables and chairs reserved for special guests. Sometimes these guests did not arrive till midday- sometimes not at all. The pool area was filthy- every single day of our ten night stay. Tables were sticky and dirty. Food residue was still under lounges from days before. Pool service for purchase of drinks/snacks was non existent. Secondly-prices per stay are very expensive -add to that the local tax imposed by the hotel and it makes for an exorbitant stay. The Moana no longer provides shower gel and body lotion- these are standard at every other Starwood hotel we have stayed at. Here you have to contact Housekeeping every day (because that’s how they operate) and ask for these basic hotel toiletries. Cheap motels offer these as standard.Thirdly- The Concierge situation is a joke. Staff allocated to this position during our stay were not knowledgeable and fumbled their way through any inquiry we had- in the end we made do without this poor service.Fourthly- when we arrived the bellboys/valets were too busy chatting to notice our arrival in a taxi and we went through carrying our own bags and without the leis they traditionally hand out to welcome guests.These are just some of the cons of this place. These things need action- not more talk and promises. Guests pay a premium and surely the Starwood name carries a responsibility to provide guests with a special experience and not rely solely on the fact that the Moana Surfrider is the Grande Damme of Waikiki. Yes it is a beautiful property and its location is fabulous however with that comes service and service is the problem here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was in Waikiki for a quick visit. Got three night at this wonderful hotel. It was really a great experience. Kristen and Cindy at the front desk were friendly and got the room quickly. I had a long flight and i so appreciated that. The room was comfortable and had a view of the ocean. Very nice to open the door to the lanai and see diamond head. Everyone makes sure your visit is the best it can be. From the front desk to the beach bar to the valets. It really is a beautiful place to stay. Thank you!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Westin Moana Surfrider last week for two nights and wanted to give a special shout-out to two staff members who were BRILLIANT. Nua on the front desk/reception was exceptional - he is warm, friendly, welcoming and incredibly professional. I made a mistake with our booking and Nua had it sorted out immediately. Thank you, Nua! The other staff member was JD (John) who served us out by the pool. Again -- thank you, John! This is a beautiful, historic hotel and walking into it makes you feel like you're in a movie. The experience is made even better by the team of people working at the hotel. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed in the Banyan Rooms of the original Moana Surfrider both prior to and after our Pride of America cruise. Such a lovely old hotel with the original six floors and beautiful foyer renovated to today's standards but in keeping with much of the original decor. There is a high rise tower to the side with additional accommodation which has been thoughtfully constructed so as not to distract from the original building. Staff were very professional, friendly and helpful. The front verandah is lined with wooden rocking chairs which adds to the Hotel's charm. It would be very difficult to stay anywhere else if we should return to Hawaii in the future.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: She's a stunningly gorgeous hotel set right on Waikiki beach. You're only a few yards from dining, shopping, swimming, dancing, and anything else you could want. The location could not be better! The experience started as soon as we got to the valet - flower leis, cold water, a warm welcome; we started living our Aloha right then and there. Then you walk into an amazing lobby - we were blown away at how stately the hotel was, the online pictures did not do justice. There was a bit of a mix up with the rooms (thanks to Hawaiian airlines booking our trip through a third party) but Irene at the front desk did everything she could to accommodate us, including letting us view multiple rooms to decide which one would better suit us. We ultimately decided on an ocean view room in the Banyan wing which, while cozy, was perfect for staring out and the clear, blue the ocean while taking our morning coffee or listening to the sound of the waves crash while falling asleep under the glow of the moon.Everything is immaculate and the service from either the front desk to the waitstaff, the valets and the bellmen, even the gift shop was top notch. Also, can we talk about the smell! Westin's White Tea and Aloe fragrance is by far one of my favorite scents and the entire Hotel smells of it - not in an overwhelming way but a delicate, pleasant way.We were so so pleased and can't wait to visit again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: a must if you enjoy fine foods and tea the staff are happy to let you see samples of the teas and explain the tastes we were never rushed but the food was to die for loved every bit it was a sight for both eyes and taste buds

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in an ocean front tower room that had a magnificent view of the ocean where you could enjoy your morning coffee or afternoon wine while watching the surfers. The whole atmosphere of the place was classic and as you walk in off the street and lookout onto the wrap around porch with rocking chairs and dining options you feel you went back in time. In the center of the back courtyard is a large banyan tree that adds to the atmosphere. It may cost a little more but definitely worth it. I thinks the had a wedding each day we were there as the bride and grooms were posing for pictures on the staircase.
user_name:
Bernadette R
Fort Myers Beach, Florida

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The place goes by the name "first lady" it's really an old, decaying lady. You will find absolutely no recognition of your SPG (now Marriott) status. This appears to be endemic to Westin chain hotels. I have never, ever once been upgraded. Also forget about preference like high floor or no connecting door being honored. The least I expected for 4 nights at 500.00/ night ( when charged a ridiculous resort fee) was something higher than the 9th floor in the category I booked. The standard response is "sorry we sold out of everything". The LA clippers happened to be staying here along with all the entourages and hangers on, so that may be the case. So word to travelers check your dates before booking and ask if a basketball team is staying as you definitely won't get any upgrade for sure. The room was tired and very being. The view of a rotting old building next door and a tiny sliver of ocean. This Westin is super cheap in their stocking of toiletries. Do not expect body wash or soap unless you ask for it. For managements part they are unresponsive and just smile with stupid stares. This happened at 1130 pm when the room next door decided to have what sounded like a furniture moving party and yelling match heard clearly through the connecting door I didn't want. Obviously Waikiki is old and decaying due to the climate. However like the sinking sub from the movie, this is one old lady to avoid.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our first visit to Hawaii from Scotland.....and wow! We stayed on the 11th floor in a Tower Ocean view room. We had 2 queen beds, plenty of space within the room and a balcony that looked right out onto Waikiki beach. It was lovely waking up in the morning and watching the early morning surfers (6am as soon as the sun rose). Everyone at the Moana made our stay pleasurable. We loved the fact the Moana was right in the heart of Honolulu and we easily walked to many fab restaurants and all the shops. The pool seems a bit small for the amount of guests staying within the hotel, but they have a very fair system of allowing first come first served a bed, but if that bed is left unoccupied for longer than an hour it is made available to someone else. Beach beds are not included in the price, they have to rented out, but once rented, they are available to you all day at a cost of $55 a day, so allow this in your budget. it does stop the whole 'putting' your towel down and keeping a bed which you so often find in Europe. We would def stay again at the Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pros: I think this is a good solid choice for Waikiki. It’s about as close to an oceanfront boutique hotel vibe as we could find in the city.-beach club provided great breakfasts and happy hours-Banyon tree is super cool-location to shops was excellent Cons: -resort fee is WAY too high and doesn’t include anything I wouldn’t already receive. This should not be charged to platinum guests.-refrig didn’t work in room -parking was too high ($30 per night, not included in resort fee) -pool too small & therefor too Crowded for hotel -the beach area was also too small & too crowded for hotel -bummed we couldn’t see the ocean! As a platinum elite Starwood /Marriott Guest, it was disappointing to see how many ocean front and ocean view rooms exist and they couldn’t find even ONE for 2 nights for me. I don’t think they should call the tower partial ocean views as an upgrade from anything - as I can’t imagine a lower category. If you can’t see even a sliver of the ocean from the living spaces of the room sans one chair in a corner (ie; we had to go onto balcony, and look to the left to see ocean), it shouldn’t count as a view. I don’t like laying in bed looking at another hotel’s balconies. The royal Hawaii is almost next door and then the Sheraton next to that. The Surfrider is a good medium- but overpriced for what it is.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wow, a grand dame on the beachfront. Lovely rooms (we were in a premium beachfront tower room), really really lovely wait and service staff. Best spot on the beach. Great afternoon tunes at the Beachhouse bar area and walking distance to a tonne of bars and restaurants.We had a little problem at check in as we were allocated twin beds, but they found us a room on the same floor the next day and organised a smooth move for us.Amenities in the bathrooms are a bit sparse and the bathrooms are a little bit dated, but it's Waikiki and nowhere else on the beach i looked at was much better. It's the only reason it gets 4 stars, not 5.I chose this hotel for the location and was prepared to grin and bear any negatives, but when the restaurant service, food and drinks were so good i was happy i paid the extra to stay here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for a week. Our first visit to Hawaii. The location was just great and the customer service fantastic. They could recommend and organize activities for a first time Waikiki visitor. Hotel is very busy but most of the time they have enough capacity to take care of everything. There is though some waiting in line involved. The room in higher floor was with partial ocean view was nice. Enough space. The wine selection is though pretty narrow with a lot of wines from Europe but after all we did not travel there for the wine.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for there nights after our cruise on the Pride of AmericaFrom our first sight of the hotel and then walking into the main entrance we were blown away.Check in was fast and easy with no fuss, our room was even ready by 9:30am.We stayed in the historic Banyan ocean room and we were presently surprised by the size.Yes it is busy but that did not worry us as we have stayed in busy hotel rooms in new york city before.Both my wife and I will certainly comeback to stay again

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Found it relatively impersonal as it is like a major train station so many people everywhere . Can’t fault the location . We did not trial restaurants there so can’t comment . We Did have a few cocktails and they were not the best so not sure why . We had a great room beach facing but it did come with a hefty price with no additional benefits and a resort fee which I’m not sure what that covered . Did go to join the water aerobics one morning and no class was being undertaken as only I had rocked up . We had minimal interaction with any staff .
