hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Never stayed here. But the little restaurant in the back is pretty awesome. Entertainment was beautiful (I wish I remember the guys name playing the ukulele, he was so great). Food was yummy! Drinks were pricey but worth it! The view of the beach is really pretty too

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everyone was extremely courteous,pleasant and helpful. We were blown away by the service we received. The hotel has been refurbished and has all the modern amenities yet all the old world charm and design and details. The location on Waikiki is perfect. It is Paradise!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the long shady porch at the entrance, out to the magnificent old tree stretching over the entire hotel courtyard, The Moana really welcomes you to Honolulu: it's bright and buzzy, filled with beautiful tropical foliage, friendly local staff and a continual sea breeze. We loved our stay! One of my favourite things to do was sit in one of the rocking chairs on the front porch and watch the world go by - even for a few short minutes - while waiting for the rest of our group to assemble.I will ask for an ocean view room next time, as opening our balcony doors overlooked noisey airconditioners on the roof of the hotel next door, but hey, it just added to the whole vibe of a busy city, with GREAT shopping just outside the front door, with the relaxed Waikiki beach at our back door. We are looking forward to our next stay here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for three nights at the moana surfrider during our honeymoon and overall it was a very nice stay. However there are some pros and cons: + Perfect location, the hotel is in the center, beach front row, wonderful + We booked an ocean front room and had an absolutely breathtaking view over waikiki beach, diamond head and the hotel, it was gorgeous. We observed the surfers and enjoyed every minute of this experience. We slept with open doors to hear the ocean during the night. + The Hotelgrounds are very beautiful with a lof of plants and a nice interior+ Every night there was live music, which we enjoyed very much- Our room was quite old and needs a renovation. We paid a lot of money for this hotel and therefore we expect a room according to the current standard (especially the badroom).- We mentionned in our booking that we are on our honeymoon and they did not considered that fact at all (not even a „congratulation“) In the „Grand Hyatt Kauai“ as well as in the „Fairmont Orchid“ Big Island they gave us a bottle of champagne to celebrate, which was very customer-oriented. - Unfortunately the cocktails at the cocktail bar were not good and the service was rather basic Overall a good (but also very expensive) stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I feel I am as qualified as anyone to write this review. I've been a visitor to Honolulu for more than 30 years - just keep going back because there's no reason not to love and enjoy it. Sure, Waikiki and it's resort hotels can appear a bit 'lost in the 70's', but it's more about the weather, the beaches, the cocktails ...and convertible Mustangs :-) Having said that, in those 30+ years, I've also travelled the world for business and pleasure. My reviews on this site are my personal and unbiased views.In all my visits to Oahu, I've always dreamt of enjoying the charm and delights of the Moana Surfrider, having stayed next door at the Outrigger Waikiki multiple times, along the beach at the Royal Hawaiian, Hyatt Place and so on - this was the one beachfront hotel I wanted to enjoy.So, to celebrate a 'milestone birthday', why wouldn't it make sense to fork out more than AUD1,000.00 per night for a beautiful tower beachfront suite at the Moana Surfrider??OK - does that set the scene !!!Yes, the beautiful and historic original building that opened as Hawaii's first hotel in 1910 is stunning - the Raffles of the Pacific. The opulent driveway, entrance and foyer, concierge etc is like stepping back in time to grandeur and royalty. Then again I already knew that having seen it's facade many times.If only that same look and feel and everything else could be continued into the guest suites. Very sadly - it's not.Yes, the Waikiki beach views all the way to Diamond Head and beyond as well as to the east take your breath away. But a 30 sqm suite with a bathroom that has not had an upgrade since the 50's, save for a new remote control whizz bang 'bidet' that would have limited patronage, just shows how out of touch the general accommodation market is in Honolulu. I guess it's because people like me keep going back, they don't think they have to change anything!!Then there was the delightful 'paper' coffee cups - which once used were only replaced upon tracking down the cleaning staff to ask for more. And after all 3 original tea bags were used - do you think they might have been replaced over the course of a week - nuh ..... sadly not.Now, did I mention the cost of Suite 1292 was in excess of AUD1,000.00pn - yes, I think I did.The other side of the coin is - well no one travels to Hawaii to sit in a hotel Suite. True - but when celebrating a milestone birthday and wanting to chill in luxury, I'm expecting just a tad more than a 3 star motel service - irrespective of how damn good the views might be.Anyway, I've already conveyed my feelings and comments to The Westin Moana Surfrider management and they were ever so gracious in apologising and offering me a small refund in compensation. Yes I am an SPG (Starwood Preferred Guest) member.I think I should stop here - except, let me say the beach bar under the largest banyan tree most people are likely to see in their entire lives is wonderful, as is the 1910 bar for an evening cocktail and The Verandah restaurant is classy and stylish, with the food (for Hawaii and USA standards) more than reasonable in price.Unfortunately the pool is a bit like the suites - tired, small, cramped and over run by kids - so if it's a beautiful pool you are seeking - not here.Now, I probably need a 'disclaimer' - because it saddens me to think that such a stunning property can fall so short in so many fundamental areas. And I think I know a thing or two about this also - being a part owner of a tropical absolute beachfront resort in Far North Queensland.Yes - Moana Surfrider location is tops, so are the original historic buildings. Staff are obliging, but I wouldn't say personable. Shopping and dining experiences along Kalakaua Ave abound. The transformed International Market Place opposite offers relaxed and fun shopping as well as half a dozen rooftop level restaurants that are all very well worth trying.So - if you haven't fallen asleep yet reading this manuscript - that's a wrap !!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Whether it was reception, concierge, wait staff or beach staff my wife and I could not have been more pleased with the service we received during a week long stay at The Moana Surfrider in Waikiki. Always available, providing viable options and, without exception, positive feedback. Of particular note the beach staff went well above and beyond when facilitating use of the loungers and umbrella sites. Special kudos to Lee Libby for his efforts and customer service.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Can’t beat the location. It is right on the beach, and on the Main Street as well. We enjoyed the short walks to nearly everything we wanted to do. We had a couple of dinners, and were able to walk to each. Rooms were small, but comfortable. It is an old hotel, so you expect some of that. Views from the Banyan wing were nice. Food and drinks are definitely pricey if you are eating at the hotel. $30/person for breakfast, and well over $50/per for dinner. Drinks were $12+ depending on what you wanted. Pool was nice, although closed early each day. Proximity to the beach is the really crown jewel. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Paying through the nose for a supposedly 5 star hotel - check out the view from our room 208. Check-in experience was worthy of Best Westin. Porters to busy standing around to assist with luggage. Room was also very small.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just arrived at the Hotel and experienced great service. Even though it was 9am we were allocated a room strait away and looked after. Bags arrived minutes later including a large number of shopping parcels we had sent to the hotel. Looks like it’s going to be a fabulous week.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I had a reservation for 6 nites at the Moana Surfrider to celebrate our anniversary. I am a Lifetime Platinum Starwood member. When we arrived we were assigned a room that was the size of a broom closet. The foot of the bed was practically next to the entrance door. The bathroom was so small that when you sat on the toilet you would injure your left elbow due to hitting the toilet paper dispenser. I have been a loyal starwood member for over 20 years. This is by far the worst room I have been in. I requested to be moved to the tower which has larger rooms or to a larger room in the historic section. The management denied my request. I guess my loyalty to the brand does not matter. We had a reservation for 6 nights but left after 1 night. We did not feel we could stay in the closet (room) because we are not brooms.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After much persuasion I agreed to stay at the iconic Moana Surfrider Resort in Waikiki. The reason for staying was that it was right on the beach and was one of the oldest and most historic resorts in the area.The facade of the building is beautiful and the foyer is elegant and traditional however for me that is where the experience finished.Upon checking in there was a problem with our booking. We booked online and had requested a twin room. Surprise, surprise. They had allocated a single. To get a bigger room we needed to pay more. We agreed to the pay the difference and so checked in to our room.This is where the next problem occurred. The air conditioner was leaking water and the carpet was saturated. There was obviously an ongoing problem with the air conditioning as there were patches in the wallpaper where repairs had previously been done. We complained to the front desk and I must admit a repairman was sent up immediately and the problem was fixed the next day. The carpet dried over the next day or two.The bathroom while a god size was tired and filthy. The top of the tiles behind the toilet were covered in dust as were the tiles under the towel rails.The saving grace were the beds and pillows. I don’t know what it is about 5 star resorts and there beds and pillows but they seem to find the best. The pillows were full and were like sleeping on clouds while the bed was just right.The Moana Surfrider charges a resort fee of about $50.00 AU a day and what you get for your money is still a mystery to me. The pool area is small so if you are not at the pool by about 9.00 am in the morning you have no chance of getting a lounge chair by the pool. Now this is where my biggest issue arises. As there is a very small pool area the resort has several lounges on the beach. Fantastic I thought. I don’t really mind whether I sit by the pool or on the beach. But no. To sit on the beach lounges you have to pay. What do you mean I have to pay says me? They expected me to pay $50.00AU for I/2 to hire a banana lounge and umbrella. What a joke! How is it my problem that you do not have enough lounges to meet your guests needs. If you visit several of the other 5 Star Resorts along the beach you will see that they have more than enough lounges to meet guests needs. I understand that land is at a premium but you could at least not charge for the lounges.The pool area bar is being updated which is fine and I appreciate that facilities need to be maintained so a temporary bar is in place. I also understand that glass is not the appropriate material to use around a pool but to deliver $25.00 AU cocktails in 10c AU plastic glasses is abhorrent. The cheap plastic glasses are inappropriate for a 5 Star Resort to serve drinks in. We drank out at several other beach/pool resort bars and while the drinks were also served in plastic glasses these were of a much higher quality and were reusable (unlike the Moana Surfrider glasses) therefore having less impact on the environment. The Moana Surfrider used paper straws but cheap plastic, disposable cups so where is the sense in that.To say I was disappointed is an understatement. For me staying at the Surfrider was a bit like hoping to see a famous, glamorous movie star and then realizing that the picture on their Facebook Profile was taken more than 70 years ago and they look nothing like what you expected. The front and facade is amazing but when you take a closer look you start to see all the flaws. I think it’s time the hotel had a closer look at what it provides and what the expectations are. The resort fee needs to be looked at and the charging for lounges on the beach is ridiculous.I would not consider the Moana Surfrider as my choice of accommodation if I was to stay in Waikiki again. I think there are much better options that would provide better facilities and cleaner, more updated rooms.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is going to be a tough - but fair - review. I truly hope that the General Manager of the property reads it and that changes are made, because it would be a shame to lose this history gem known as "The Queen of Waikiki" which dates back to 1901 and when opened was and for many decades after acted as the "anchor" of the Waikiki Beach/Honolulu tourist industry.I title this review "They Don't Know What They Want To Be" based upon my observation that the ownership/management seems more concerned with being a wedding venue than a 5-star Grand Dame resort hotel.Service is... spotty. Goes from highs to lows. The young lady who checked us in was wonderful in the sense that she upgraded us to a room (3704) with a fantastic view, a small balcony, two rocking chairs, and a bathroom with a combination toilet/bidet.Our room was small... but... comfortable... and again the view was to die for. Small but upscale. No complaints other than that the remote control for the bidet function (think a TV remote control) was screwed in to it's holder (which in turn was screwed into the wall) so that one can't get at the water/seat temperature controls which are on the REVERSE side of the control unit from the jet pressure and direction controls. We had to have a member of the engineering staff come up to unscrew the remote control from the way so we could use it.Also... MINOR complaint... (but, again; we're talking a 5-star hotel; there should be no minor complaints)... the alarm clock was set to the wrong time and after playing with it for five minutes yet being able to reset the time I was forced to call housekeeping.Oh... last "gimmick" comment... they give you an IPad for your room. I don't want an IPad. I just want a phone with separate direct call buttons for operator, front desk, concierge, housekeeping, dining, etc. An IPad is impersonal; I stay at 5-star properties because I'm looking for INDIVIDUAL personal service - from human beings.HERE'S THE KILLER, THOUGH... and sadly... unless the policy is changed I will never return nor will I recommend to the property to others: THEIR POOL CLOSES AT 6:00 PM.Let me repeat that: A 5-star resort hotel on Waikiki Beach in Honolulu Hawaii... and they CLOSE the pool to guest use at 6:00 pm.This isn't simply unacceptable; this is downright crazy! Not only is this a HUGE disservice to guests with small children for whom the pool is a safe "family time" zone, but I know that my wife and I aren't the only folks who like to take evening dips in a perfectly heated pool... perhaps before heading out to dinner... perhaps after getting back from dinner... perhaps right before retiring for the evening.I have NEVER in my life seen anything like this! One of the staff opined that management didn't want noise from the pool "disturbing" dinners because outdoor seating was in part close by the pool. My reply was to simply install a noise barrier. In any event, the "solution" of CLOSING the pool each afternoon (BEFORE SUNSET) at 6:00 pm and throwing both the children and the adult guest out... not a decision I can accept. Again, if this is how it's going to remain, they'll never have me or my wife or our extended family stay at the Surfrider again.Oh... and I truly do HATE to have to report this... but it's the truth. On our first FULL day/night there when we used the pool (by the way, we had arrived the afternoon before - Sunday, Sept. 9 - to find the pool CLOSED altogether at approximately 5:00 pm due to... contamination... found in the water) we couldn't help by notice that the pool area - the pool chairs, tables, under the chairs and tables - was strewn with rubbish, uncleared plates and used utensils, empty cans and bottles not disposed of...You just CAN'T have this at a 5-star hotel.For added context, this was our FIRST trip to the Hawaiian Islands - celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary in fact. We had started in Maui, staying at the Hyatt Regency Resort and Spa for four nights; moved on to the Hilton Waikoloa Village on the Big Island for three nights; next on to the Grand Hyatt Resort and Spa on Kauai; and the Moana Surfrider on Oahu was our last stop and the only true 5-star property. Sadly, I'd have to say that both Hyatts impressed us far more than this 5-star Westin property.No lais upon check-in. No bottle of sparkling wine for the room. Not even a drink voucher. While I DO appreciate the room upgrade... every single other property we stayed out on the other islands made us feel extra special in that we were in Hawaii for the first time celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. The Surfider largely lacked the "Aloha Spirit" we'd been accustomed to on the other islands.Buffet breakfasts were very nice... ambiance was pleasant... food very good... service very good...The concierge staff was... not as enthusiastic, helpful, and welcoming as we're used to. The photo service staff... focused more on selling packages than on making folks like us who just wanted our one "souvenir photo" (which is INCLUDED with the mandatory resort fee) feel welcome.The pool staff had absolutely NO sympathy for the children - and their parents... and the other adults - disappointed by being told we all need to vacate the pool at 6:00 pm.Though we didn't have a vehicle in Oahu the valet staff WERE friendly and helpful and quick with walking directions when asked.This hotel COULD be SO much better than it is. Again... I hope that the General Manager reads this review and takes it to heart. As for those of you considering booking at the Surfrider... I've done my best to give you the good and the bad and you have other folks' reviews to go on as well.
user_name:
William B
Harriman (Orange County) New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was such a disappointment. It is known as a 5-Star hotel and it came with high recommendations. I didn't mind paying the absolute high-prices thinking we were going to have a 5-Star experience.WRONG!First of all, the pool closes at 6 p.m. so if you want to be able to have a drink and a dip in the pool in the evening, think again.After we checked in, went up to our rooms, refreshed and needed to get some dinner. Went down to the hotel's restaurant and was told very rudely that we couldn't dine there without reservations. Another night we sat at the Beach Bar and had a good drink, but the service was super slow even though there weren't many other patrons there.The room was the most disappointing. We had the "Historic Banyan" room which is one of only a few with a balcony. Sounded quaint. WRONG again. The walls are so paper thin that all we heard was the street noise, sirens, street acts, horns, etc. Definitely not a "paradise" vacation. We stuck it out the first night but didn't sleep well. The next day after a morning of beach fun, we wanted to take a nap before our dinner plans. However, there were protestors marching outside and with the paper thin walls, a nap was not going to happen. I spoke with the customer service and asked to be put in a quieter room. They obliged, the new room was in the back, much quieter with a nice ocean view, no balcony. However... the bathroom ceiling was leaking and there was a pool of water on the bathroom floor. For $300+/night - this hotel is not worth it!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband, 2 year old and my parents have stayed at the Moana Surfrider before and decided to again for our family holiday. The service has been wonderful and we already look forward to returning again. With the pool and the beach right out front it’s great for children. A special shout out to Cecilia for housekeeping who has been so kind to our daughter during our stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had the most wonderful stay from beginning to end. I upgraded my room on arrival and wasn't happy with the position so spoke with the lovely Keola on reception who went out of his way to find me something more to my liking. My new room was delightful. I then had Eric move my bags to my new room. I felt embarrassed as I hadn't had time to get any American dollars to tip Eric but he was so nice and told me not to worry. I spent most of my days hiring a deck chair on the beach where Lee went out of his way to find me a shady spot and remembered my name each day. It was a faultless holiday made all the more special by the great service provided by the staff. Thank you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great central location in historic hotel, beachfront location, excellent customer service and very good concierge. Hurricane Lane happened during our trip and despite not really becoming anything dangerous on Oahu, the hotel made all preparations and accomodations to keep guests safe and happy. They set up buffet meals in the ballroom for everyone and the GM of the hotel gave regular weather updates and kept everyone calm. The entire staff worked hard to make sure guests were not affected by the storm. We wound up staying a few extra days and upgraded to a suite because the regular room was a bit small. Very good breakfast buffet, and great views from this property. Their pool is a bit small, but Hawaii is really about the beaches anyway.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location next to the beach was great and the main building was beautiful with a clean friendly reception in such a beautiful looking building. My opinion soon changed when finding that the lift wasn’t working and the room we was in was tiny for the amount of money I paid for it. The decor is dated, the net curtain came off on one side and the bathroom door was hanging on one hinge. Be used for seeing weddings in here because they have an average of 8 per day and reception is full of grooms and photographers.The main hotel service was always friendly but I wouldn’t recommend the complementary photo session as they take the most lousy shots and you cannot pick your own best photo out of the bunch! So why bother at all. The staff in the bar by the restaurant really need to perk up as the mood seems that showing a smile is really left to others. From staying at a few hotels in Honolulu I must say was the most expensive and disappointing. Waikiki is really Tokyo by the beach and you need to have plenty of cash and tolerance to have fun here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This historical gem is my new favorite hotel. It's a feast for the eyes with classical architecture like columns, high ceilings, wooden floors, wide balconies overlooking Waikiki beach and the main street. It's also a feast for the senses with the floral smell of Plumeria drifting from the gardens and the leis that are placed around your neck on arrival. The valet and desk staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was upgraded, free of charge, to a balcony room overlooking the pool and Banyan tree. We received a free beach tote, also. Get a room in the historical section, or just don't bother paying the steep price to stay here. The other sections of the hotel are more typical and modern, so you'd miss the ambiance. Rooms on the second floor are larger, or so I was told. The beds are piled high with heavenly linens and plush pillows, the towels, robes, and slippers are soft. The bathrooms contain rainfall shower heads and luxe toiletries, even lavender oil to place by your bed to lull you to sleep. Take advantage of the live music in the courtyard, the deep, warm swimming pool overlooking the beach, and the historical tour of the hotel. Ask the tour guide about Mrs. Stanford's hotel room, while you're there.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is our first time in Hawaii and Moana Surfrider has exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived things went great, they checked us in early and we started having a great time right away. The staff was the highlight of our stay, they went above and beyond to make sure the stay is memorable. We always got consistent service at the pool and the beach bar. We always returned to well made up rooms by the wonderful housekeeping team especially Cecilia, I'm sure there are others but I didn't get a chance to meet them. All in all they made this trip so special that we are already planning our next one. Mahalo

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From amazing views, service, rooms and meals! My mum and i highly enjoyed staying at the Moana Surfider together and would recommend it to anyone thinking of going!It is an amazing location that everyone will enjoy.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The older heritage building is gorgeous, check in was good and for an extra $100 for two nights we were upgraded and we were able to check in early 9.30 am, location was great view beautiful and thats where the positives end really. We had a room in the newer tower which was large with a balcony but bland, dated and very beige!Pool was tiny for a large hotelBuffet breakfast very expensive and not inspiringService overall was efficient but not friendly.overall great location but not worth the price

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When your here, you're in the middle of everything nice and very enjoyable. Kalakaua Avenue after dark is a must. Walk up one side and down the other. The shopping is fantastic. The restaurant selection is great! And people watching is beyond compare.. The resort is a dream, both day and night. You'r on the beach and can enjoy it along with a fantastic pool. If you want something, just ask! You will get it when you want it. At times, I will just sit on the front porch and watch the tourists try to do everything at once. Don't do that!! Take your time and enjoy where you are and with whom you are with. This is Paradise. You will want to return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a historic hotel in the old heart of Waikiki beach. Walking distance to restaurants and shopping. Inches from the beach. I had a darling little room in the corner of the older section. I was able to secure a govt rate since I was on official travel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Every time I have visited the Moana Surfrider beach bar I have enjoyed it.It is a great place to meet friends for a drink, and nibble, at all times of the day.I particularly like watching the sunsets here

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is located very centrally in Waikiki. We arrived and the ipad compendium in our room was not working, so no info until we could get this working about the hotel and wifi etc. Contacted the the desk and they sent up a technician who told us he would have to take the ipad away for 24 hours and as far as info well then basically tough we would just have to wait, he didn't really appear to care. We then followed up with the concierge and had to call them twice and finally got to speak to a manager who was apologetic but could not provide us with a new one, we also mentioned to him the dirt and bottle tops located behind the bed so the room had not been cleaned properly or the ipad checked before we checked in, we did receive the ipad back with in a couple of hours. The room is quite compact and bathroom very small with only a shower and no room at all for toiletries etc to be placed in the bathroom and no place in shower for shampoo etc only a small soap dish, good shower and good pressure, very comfy bed and nice view of the beach from our room. Concierge seemed to be more focused and helpful to one particular nationality and needs to remember that we are all paying guests no matter what country we originate from and not just focus on visitors from one particular country! Beach bar staff very slack, buffet brekkie very good and lots of choices. Only 1 lift in our wing and it was broken a couple of times during our stay. Only 1 very small pool, and this is used by children and adults alike, so not a hotel if you like to swim in a pool, beach is right outside the hotel though. At first there was now communication from the hotel on the impending Hurricane which was a but disconcerting, we found out on TV and not from the hotel that there was hurricane on the way, communication later was much better.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved our stay at the Moana Surfrider! This hotel has the WOW factor! Staff was wonderful - right on the beach - pool small but very nice. Beach Bar and the Veranda Restaurant were fantastic, good food and drinks. Location of the Surfride was the best, close to everything and view of the ocean was unforgettable..

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a great time at this hotel. Its location is perfect on Waikiki beach, regular room was great, and service was really great. We stayed here through part of hurricane lane, and the hotel was very informative and kept us in the loop. They also offered a buffet for 3 meals per day when most/all restaurants and shops closed down in the area. Shout out to Lee at the pool - he took great care of us!! Get a cabana one day!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was built in 1901 and shows the elegance and architectural detail of a bygone era. However, with all that beauty comes the issues of an old hotel. When we walked in it had a musty smell, even though the halls and lobby are left open air. The bathrooms had been remodeled, but our toilet water lines made a high whistling noise when flushed and eventually stopped up, so we had to call maintenance. The hotel is located right on the main drag of Waikiki, so there is a LOT of noise - live bands, dragsters, garbage & delivery trucks, and the crowds. On the positive side, our bed was very comfortable and we had a balcony. Our tour included breakfast in the Beach Club, which is definitely the way to go. They have a large space overlooking the ocean with a variety of hot and cold foods. We ate on its porch looking at the surf on a couple of days. They have a large banyan tree in the courtyard and a pool next to the beach. People at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Wifi was spotty especially on busy nights.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Friendly, Helpful Staff.Great Location for Waikiki Beach.Very Good location for Bars, Restaurants and Shops. If you want to explore the island a very good choice of excursions within easy reach.Great food, Lovely room if you wish to stay in. Vibrant without been too noisy or busy and would love to comeback soon!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’ve just completed my first trip to Hawaii - ticked it off the bucket list.The hotel is located in a prime spot, within seconds you are on Waikiki Beach.The staff I encountered we friendly and professional. We had a issue trying to enter our room when we checked in, but this was quickly rectified. The room was located in the diamond wing, room 3309. Our Toto toilet wasn’t fully functional which a little annoying. The rooms we clean, with daily room service which you would expect.Beach bar with the massive Banyan tree was very impressive. Live singing most days, it was very nice entertaining area.Let’s not talk about the prices of the rooms or drinks - my pockets are not that deep.I love the rocking chairs out the front of the hotel. A great place to people watch. The free professional photos we were also a nice point of difference for this hotel.Free Wifi within the hotel, free water too.Overall it was a great place to stay very central.I would recommend this hotel based on my experience I had just a few days ago.Thanks.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A busy hotel in a great location if you want to be in the middle of the tourist area. Staff were extremely helpful but the room we had in the old part of the hotel was not great. After the first week we upgraded and it was better but the price went sky high!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the worst hotels we have ever stayed at. The staff are extremely unhelpful and rude. Not just one or two; this poor service is consistent throughout. Their attitude is dreadful which does not encourage a good holiday. It is very expensive which sticks in your throat when your server doesn’t even want to be there. The rooms are dated but if you are lucky enough to have a sea view you will be able to watch the tramps directly in front of you who LIVE on that part of beach with their umbrellas, beds, towels and chairs. One woman showed everything she had when drying herself after swimming. Relayed this to management and their response was “ yes, we know, but it’s a public beach”.The pool was closed for a day because it was so dirty, when they did reopen it my kids eyes were so sore, I guess too much chlorine was added I had to give them some pain killers and wash them in the shower. I did mention this to the pool staff who weren’t bothered.The hotel is extremely busy, also lots and lots of wedding on on a daily basis so you are trying to avoid photographers within the hotel. Therefore they have the market and obviously believe they don’t need to try.We had a 7 night stay here and the end couldn’t come sooner!We were expecting better. Don’t waste your money on this hotel, do your research and go else where.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The view from our room was beautiful, overlooking the beach. The location is absoulutly the best. The staff were very attentive and friendly. I had 2 bookings each for 5 days because I couldn't get the same room for the entire time. When we arrived Steve from the front managed to join my bookings, which ended up in an upgrade for the second 5 day stay. The room was nice and roomy for 2 people. The only problem with the hotel and its with most of them in Honolulu is the daily surcharge. Its $36US daily. I think that you should have a choice about it. For my $51AUD a day all I got was 2 bottles of water per day and a couple of phone calls. Having said that if I get back to Honolulu I would stay here again despite of the fact its quite expensive.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you are looking for a deluxe ocean front property, avoid this hotel classic. Rooms are outdated, poorly furnished at not that big for over 500$ per night. The view however is a 2000$ View. Note my pictures. This hotel as near as I can see offers a restaurant and beach bar. No other options. No air conditioned bar, no quick eats, just that. Room service ends at 9:30 so do not depend on that for food. Don’t plan on getting a drink either other than a few options. It was very hot and humid when I was there. No place to get away. Lots of history, gorgeous views, Motel 8 quality of carpet, bathroom and furnishings.The staff is wonderful and very classy.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a historic hotel and the setting of the beach bar under huge, ancient banyan trees, and the collonade lobby has its charm. The charm, however, is considerably diminished by the constant throngs that crowd these settings from morning to evening, giving it more the vibe of convention center than a luxury beach resort. The word "luxury" is in general misplaced in regard to this hotel, as it is for virtually all Waikiki properties, regardless of price-- with one very notable exception that shows it is possible to have a refuge of beauty, peace, and luxury in the midst of the concrete jungle of Waikiki. While that exception, the Halekulani, is considerably more expensive than the Moana Surfrider, you get quite a lot for the price differential. After all, paying $500 per night for a partial ocean view room at the Moana Surfrider is not cheap. What is cheap,however, is the way the rooms are furnished, the amenities provided, and the breakfast buffet. My room was large, to be sure, but apart from size just outfitted for mass tourism ready to pay to be on the beach at massively overcrowded Waikiki and ready to settle for service and treatment no better than at one of the much cheaper Outrigger hotels. One would expect more from a Westin beach resort property, but this is sadly a characteristic of Waikiki that most hotels seem to assume they don't need to do much for their guests to achieve high occupancy rates. All in all, this hotel is fine if you don't mind the overcrowded lobby and facilities, and if you want to be in the vibrant heart of Waikiki shopping, restaurants, bars and crowds. The location is also ideal for going to surf or take surf lessons at the most popular Waikiki breaks, like Canoes and Queens. If what you are looking for is the real beauty, relaxation, and experience of the most these wonderful islands have to offer, then neither Waikiki nor the Moana Surfrider are for you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the minute we entered the premises the staff have been extremely friendly and attentive.We arrived earlier than checkin time and were offered a courtesy room in which we could shower and change and were notified when our room was available.Our room was as described and everything was in working condition. Bathroom amenities are not plentiful, only shampoo, conditioner, bath wash and soap supplied..no shower cap, although supplied when requested.Servicing of room was done in a timely manner and cleaned thoroughily.The hotel is beautiful, our room was in the tower block and it is right on the beach. However the pool area is totally inadequate for the size of hotel. There were never any beds available when we came to the pool area and we ended up buying some beach chairs and sitting on the beach which ended up being our preferred option.The gym had the required equipment and the supply of gym gear and shoes was an impressive option which my partner used.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great location, nice rooms. Honolulu Coffee Company store just off the lobby, ABC store across the street, and Duke's/Hula Grill right next door. Only reason I didn't rate "Excellent" was it was expensive. However, you do get what you pay for.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: So far so good! Will update throughout our week. Irene at the desk was wonderful and gracious and lovely. As we are celebrating my birthday and our anniversary we received an upgrade from partial ocean view to deluxe ocean which was very kind - but to be honest the “deluxe ocean” is what I was expecting the partial ocean view would be. It is on the west side of hotel and mostly a view of the outrigger hotel next door which is a little sad. The staff we have encountered in the hotel have all been welcoming and helpfuland lovely. The club level food and drink is really good and a big money saver for breakfast and snacks and I would highly recommend that. I will update my review as the week progresses. Cheers!!! ***UPDATEThe hotel staff here are amazing and really went above and beyond to make sure we had an incredible vacation.The wonderful guest managers moved us to a room on the Diamond head side of hotel on our second day and OMG what a view just breathtaking! If you can definitely request Diamond head side of the tower.We had the most relaxing fun family vacation ever!You do have to get up early to get lounges at the pool but that was no problem with the time change. I woke up early everyday happy to wander down to the club room for some coffee and fresh croissant with fresh made pineapple or grave jam then grab a spot by the pool.The beach out front is just great and the kids spent endless hours playing in the surf.You can buy fun inflatables and anything you might need at the ABC store across the street. The hotel has a air compressor set up by the pool so you can inflate your floaters.(Careful very powerful compressor heard one or two pop daily).I do think having gold or platinum SPG status makes a big difference at these types of resorts. Even the front desk experience with a special line for gold and platinum members is a big deal (no waiting). So if you can bump up that status before you go.Mahalo Moana Surfrider!!!Special shout out to Michael and Chris, Tehani and Irene. We will be back!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had ready many reviews before staying in this hotel and have to agree with many of them. I expected a beautiful lobby, the graceful banyan tree with beach bar and convenient location and the Moana did not disappoint. Yes, it took a while to get the car each time but since we expected this, we just planned accordingly and relaxed in the rocking chairs and watched the Honolulu life as we waited. The room, as many mentioned, was small for a family of four especially, the bathroom. We could not keep our suitcases open in the room as there was no spot to accommodate all of them plus walk in the room. The view of the ocean from our room was beautiful and we also enjoyed our time on the beach. The breakfasts that were included in the club level were average. We ate at the fine dining restaurant and also the beach bar. Both restaurants were good but expensive as most things are in Hawaii.We had quite a long wait for check-in but as we were standing in line some of the employees brought out leis to all who were waiting and apologized. The rooms were clean and otherwise the service was good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my go-to place for Honolulu and it continues to be the one! Always dependable, solid, and hospitable. + Shoutout Juria K. for being totally amazing+ People working here seem to be way happier and engaged than those at Royal Hawaiian+ Beach Club's breakfast is still of decent quality+ The property seems to try its best with SPG Plat upgrades Now I dont have major cons for this place, but if i have to really be picky... - Still not sure how to feel about the-day-of Plat 4pm late check out policy.. Is this really necessary? Wonder how this could be operationalized without causing customer inconvenience- GM could be a bit more engaged with customers for feedback and empathy purposes..but then again there probably are lots of self-entitled customers so I dunno These are negligible cons though -- overall I'm a very very happy customer. Looking forward to coming back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a very beautiful hotel and it is very convenient you have the street and shopping on one side and the beautiful Waikiki Beach the other side. But it is very expensive hotel and the size of our room was very small and I don’t think it was worth the price we had to pay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am torn about this property. It is at best a schizophrenic experience at this hotel. First, the location is perfect — right in the thick of things. The service is all over the place at this hotel — some of the staff is over-the-top amazing and others are mediocre at best. The banyan rooms are small but quaint and have character while the tower rooms are much bigger but are definitely showing their age and in a dire need of an update. The bathroom is old and small with a horrible tub with a shower attachment wand that is horribly placed making you literally rub your naked body against the shower wall to stand under the water. Painfully small bathrooms to boot.The service was what was very disappointing. It started with the breathy whispering Asian operator whose voice was laughably quiet and incomprehensible. No one ever answered the phones with 10-15 rings and often you got no answer at all on the phones. Housekeeping was atrocious. During our five days there they came every day around 8:15-8:30 - a tad early for a resort property. They rarely replaced all of the shampoo and body wash but unexplainably left two-three new conditioners every day and I am bald! Even though my profile asks for extra towels and I reminded them again at check in — they were never brought without having to call and then Housekeeping tried to insist that dropping off towels would consist of our housekeeping service and they would not return to clean the room or make the beds. Every time towels were delivered, they were covered with long black hairs.When I checked in they informed me my welcome amenity would be some Hawaiian shortbread or I could get 500 extra points and I asked gift the shortbread. It never came nor did I receive the points. No upgrade was available for my checkin as a platinum member. I had to literally plead for a late check out which after a 15 min hold was finally granted. There is a nice sized lounge for platinum members which was nice. The breakfast was just mediocre and very limited. Often the food was ice cold and it is the first buffet in Hawaii that I have been told they do not serve pineapple on the weekends! What????The beach is lovely but staff was not helpful at all. No umbrellas or assistance. No beach equipment or toys. (We had to run to Ross for discount beach toys!). Staff did not leave the towel stand. The pool is dreadfully small and overcrowded mostly with young screaming children. Another overpriced money grab by the hotel by charging an exorbitant resort fee with no benefit in return. This seems to be the norm at resorts now and they seem to give you less and less in return for the price and really makes the hotel stay less than ideal. An additional $150 in fees for nothing in return is uncalled for during this stay.The hospitality rooms to freshen up in before the flight were a very nice touch and earns them an extra star!There was NO place on property to get food at 9:30 pm on the Sunday. The pool bar and hotel restaurant were both closed and the room service was not available after 9:30. Ended up ordering a pizza. The hotel which was once grand is now a money-grubbing, fading star of a property that doesn’t seem to care about their property or their customers.I probably will not return.
user_name:
chgotrvlr71
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: this was our 3rd stay here and we see no reason to ever stay anywhere else.the staff are excellent and always smilingour room was delightfuland there is no better way to spend an afternoon than to sit under the banyan tree sipping cocktails and listening to live music

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you want to be right in the heart of it all...stay here! We got an ocean view room and it was very large. The room is up to the Westin standards and the property is small enough where you don’t feel you are at a huge resort. Beach is a bit small and gets crowded but that is Waikiki Beach. We also went to the restaurant for dinner and a few breakfasts and it was wonderful. There is a Kona coffee shop attached to the hotel as well. My only reason for giving it 4 Stars is the valet...it takes forever, so plan accordingly! We were waiting for over 30 minutes every time we needed our car.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent stay beautiful rooms, great location, the staff were fantastic and welcoming. Ocean view was stunning pool and hot tub great to relax.. All round lovely stay Will recommend to friends and family. Thanks for the great stay

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is located is a central and strategic position to walk everywhere. Excellent and very well trained staff. A very welcoming lobby and veranda. It's a good location for a family vacation. Plenty of activities.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent service and a nice ocean view room in the ocean tower...however, they need more chairs at the pool, and a hot tub. They also could use a bigger pool. Definitely not for families. More suitable for older couples. The restaurants on the property were great!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The last time we stayed at the First Lady was 2001. Have always wanted to return. We stayed in a banyan room in 2001 which was beautiful but this time we opted for more room. We had a beautiful room and were able to use the club for breakfast and snacks. The Moana Surfrider still has it! It was a wonderful stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wow, from the moment you walk in, to the times you get to see the Banyan Tree lit at night with the beautiful colors, and all times in between were heavenly. Staff was so friendly every time I walked in or left for the day, offered excellent directions, just amazing experience.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was the the first hotel built in Waikiki in 1901 and has the best location on the beach. I'm sure commercial pressures over the years have forced the various owners to sell the property to the highest bidder but I just feel that the commercialism of the Westin group has taken from the charm of the place and probably not lived up to what Mr Peacock had in mind all those years ago.Now the Westin is all about making money and they are very successful at it and I get that but in my opinion they have overstepped the commerciality line to the detriment of this grand old lady (others may argue that they saved it but isn't that the beauty of free speech in this magnificent country of yours)To the specifics of my issues. Last February we booked two rooms for myself and my family for a July vacation. It was for our 25th Wedding Anniversary which my travel agent advised the hotel of! Upon arrival they separated the family on floors 12 and 5! They had 5 months notice that we were coming and still could not hold two rooms on the same floor (commerciality but not family centric!). Not even a little hand written card to congratulate us on our anniversary and to thank us for choosing the grand old lady of Waikiki to celebrate it.(commerciality but not terribly Hawaiian of them).No bell hop on arrival, 23 hour flight from Ireland and you can take your own bags up to the 12th floor stopping off on the 5th floor to dump off your kids (renowned Hawaiian hospitality I don't think so!) I wrote to the GM while staying there to express my annoyance at the family separation but of course this was ignored. Why would the GM want to engage we me? Sent a second email to a "champion" at the Westin group and got a reply saying someone would be back to me within 5 business days (commerciality at its best but not customer focussed). Anyhow got some diatribe email about no "guarantee of connecting rooms blah blah blah.. and basically it was my travel agents fault to which I responded with a few more observations but that was completely ignored which seems now to be the policy of the Moran's Surfrider a Westin Resort management team... just ignore and it will go away. I say be careful of what you wish for! Anyhow that my review over, people can make up their own minds but I don't think I'd return until the Westin group change their attitude.Ps I did have an excellent experience with the lost and found department who located my missing iPad and posted it to my next destination.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel has one of the most welcoming lobbies I have ever seen. It is very open and airy. I loved the back area with the beach bar, tree and beach views. The beach access is amazing and you can swim well into the night with a full moon. Other positive things about this hotel are in a great location close to a lot of places to eat, shop and see. It is about 3 miles from Diamond Head. The spa is amazing though small and pricey. It is overall a relaxing experience.The only negatives for some would be that the regular room size is small. The rooms are modern and clean but they are smaller than what you would expect. If your room has an ocean view you may hear the music from the beach bar until midnight each night. This was not a problem for me but if you go to bed early or are a light sleeper get a room without a window towards the bar. And finally, there are a lot of weddings at this hotel. I am talking like 5 a day. So some areas may be closed off from time to time during these events.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is an amazing building although if you examine it it's about 3 buildings tacked onto one. We stayed in the more basic building - whilst the room was comfy it was pretty basic and had one of the smallest bathrooms I've been in.You're paying for the location here which is unbeatable - metres away from the beach and on the main strip in Waikiki.Breakfasts were very enjoyable sitting on the verandah overlooking the beach.The pool is tiny and obviously full of kids but the sea is less than 20 metres away and generally very flat so ideal for swimming.Would stay here again if visiting so would recommend.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Westin was great. It’s location right on the beach was fabulous and we loved being right in the heart of the action. We stayed in the old historic Banyan wing and loved the character of the historic touches. The room was still throughly modern though, a great mix. The laid back setting and history made this a hotel that totally stands out on Waikiki. Relaxing on the front porch in beautiful rocking chairs while the chaos of the city bustled by was one of our favorite activities. If we come back to Honolulu, we will certainly be staying here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My sisters and I were leaving on a cruise and came to Honolulu a day early and chose the beautiful Moana Surfrider We had a beautiful corner room with windows looking out to Waikiki and Diamond Head - couldn't have been better. The room was large and the beds were wonderful. We had lunch right there on the beach and then shopping right at the front door. The rocking chairs on the front and back of the hotel were so relaxing and the staff was very friendly. Wish we could have stayed longer! Aloha until next time.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For our first trip to Oahu, we wanted to experience something we couldn’t get anywhere else we’ve been. Just by the brochure we could tell this would be different! Seeing all the rocking chairs on the front porch and stepping into the lobby felt like you were walking into a palace. The fresh breeze flowing through the lobby was almost instantly relaxing and we felt right at home. Staff were very attentive and accommodating and so kind! The rooms, at least the ones we were in (Diamond Ocean Front View) was breathtaking! Hotels rooms weren’t “huge” but they are spacious enough to spread out a bit, even having a balcony you can step out onto and really enjoy the unobstructed view of Waikiki Beach. In this area, the sandy bottom of the ocean is rarely deeper than 6 feet deep for quite a ways out (I think I was about 200 yards out from the beach and still able to touch bottom).  I could go on and on about this experience but just take my word for it - you want to stay here! We will not ever stay anywhere else each time we come back! Well done Moana Surfrider! We will think of you often!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Staff was amazing from the time we pulled in the kids were excited to get the fresh flower leis they placed around our necks before we even walked inside. I cant say enough about check in. We had requested 3 rooms on the same floor (family trip) and for some reason that request didnt go thru but with the managers help he juggled rooms and got us all together. I highly suggest the Tower city rooms. Mainly because there are 4 quest elevators and its very close to the beach and pool side. Rooms are clean, updated and beds very comfortable .Even when we failed to answer the wake up call they sent security up to check on us. One of the kids had unplugged the phone !! Pool towel staff learned our grandkids names in just days (maybe there too much LOL) Breakfast room service amazing, Fresh fruit and veggie omelet was the best.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Original Waikiki hotel. The banyan tree in the courtyard is an icon of Waikiki - a not to miss spot with enormous character, charm and sense of history. As one of the original hotels on Waikiki the surf rider has an strong sense of tradition. It’s central location directly on waikiki draws visitors from around the world with the promise of experiencing a strong sense of place - a quaint character and fabulous service.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here and the rooms were excellent . I had a sea ocean room and the views were fantastic. the restaurants were full of lovely treats and the menu is amazing. I will definitely go back. , Great location to lots of things right on the beach it was fantastic. The staff were always obliging

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana recently and I couldn’t give enough praise for the pool staff and spa staff! In the pool/beach area, Lee, Mo and Gloria are terrific! Lee remembered us from a prior trip (and imagine the thousands of patrons he sees in a given year)! Each of the pool/beach staff were fabulous and made our time there wonderful! Also, Ceronda, in the spa, is AMAZING! This lady LOVES her work! She gave me the LomiLomi massage! Ahhh...Heavenly hands combined with abundant knowledge!! I can’t wait to go back!I’m grateful for the time we spent here and look forward to going back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The view in their relaxation lounge can’t be beat. A little pricey for a 50 min Massage and they tell you that 21% gratuity is automatically added to your bill. If you know that up front and able to use the amenities in the spa then it softens the cost a little bit more. But with the beach view right outside it’s tough to stay indoors

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a few days while in Oahu. We stayed in the diamond wing in a oceanfront king bed room. It was a really small room and smaller bathroom. It is the older wing but its nicely renovated/modern. Lucky for us we don’t need much space. But two of us couldn’t be in the bathroom at the same time and they had no counter to put your toiletries on. The view we had was great but it was on the 2nd floor so we can hear everyone outside. We witnessed two weddings outside our room and couldnt sleep one night from the loud music they were playing. The restaurants on site were great and the location was really convenient for shopping and walking around town. The beach is right out front, BUT, we went to beach services at 9am and they were already sold out of beach chairs and cabanas for the day. Their pool is too tiny to even use... so we had to walk to the hotel next door and luckily they had beach chairs and umbrellas we count rent for 50 bucks from 12-5pm. It was a bummer to see Moana couldn’t accomodate even a third of their hotel guests when it came to lounging on the beach. Also you cant take any food or drinks out onto the beach which kinda sucks. I got too spoiled in Mexico having pina coladas right on the sand. Also they are supposed to give you leis when you arrive. We never got any and only recieved some when we mentioned it as we were leaving :/ Kind of a bummer. If I stay here again, I would prefer the bigger modern rooms in the tower wing, and now i know to reserve beach cabanas like a week in advance. They should mention something about that when you’re checking in.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed recently.Overall my partner and I were left disappointed with overall service and transparency of extra daily fee's at this resort. The bar service was slow at best, and staff were unwilling to get things moving faster unless it concerned the bill. Front desk staff assured me all costs were covered when I checked in, and quickly went back on this when money began coming from my account for "resort usage" (Wifi, basic amenities like water and a gym). Random lump sums of money were also coming from my account, which the resort had "no record of" and is to this day unexplained. Wouldn't stay again or recommend to anyone. As I said to the resort upon leaving, had a known just how expensive and average this place was, I would've booked an AirBnb.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed five nights while in Honolulu for business and would stay again for pleasure. My first night was spent in Banyan as requested. Lovely room but facing the street which was noisy. I moved to the tower for the remainder of my stay and very much enjoyed it. Kudos to Steve at the front desk for making the early morning change in a timely and professional manner. Hotel location is perfect for a quintessential Waikiki experience. Friendly staff and great service. Enjoyed the breakfast buffet with delicious American and Japanese offerings. I have travelled Japan and appreciated the opportunity to indulge in a traditional Japanese breakfast. Lunch also outstanding. Thank you Moana Surfrider team!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I were lucky enough to stay here for 4 days after previously booking the Sheraton Princess Kaiulani across the road for our 25th anniversary but when we arrived there the pool was under construction and was closed ( they made an impromptu decision to renovate the day before ).They kindly moved us to The Moana Surfrider and we couldnt belive our luck.We have visited many times and loved it but never stayed.Always walked through pretending we were staying there :)I think because I was a Starwood Member we were given a very high floor in a Preferred Starwood Guest section.Talk about service.Loved it.From both hotels.The lovely Chivastine told us they were agreeing to our deal at the SPK and we could have a partial ocean view with breakfast.We were given the 3rd floor in the Tower but Chivastine offered an upgrade for 50USD per night to an ocean view when she knew it was a special occasion and I think we got the 23rd floor.We said yes please.I recommend it.The views to Diamond Head were spectacular.We always try for a nice view and got exactly that.I love my view and verandah:)We have nothing negative to say at all.The room was very spacious and super clean.Along with the bathroom.The bath products were a lovely bonus.The bed was very comfy and always made when we had arrived back from the beach.The maid service was spot on.And very friendly.The breakfast was soooo nice.Seriously had everything you could wish for.I think we sat there until lunch time :) and the service from the staff was also very friendly.Loved sitting on that deck every morning.The pool was very nice but as a few people said a little small.There arent many chairs early on and people do lay their towels on them to reserve them but you are right on the lovely part of Waikiki Beach anyway so wasnt a problem to us.The beach out the front is perfect.You can hire chairs and umbrellas to watch the world go by.And rent surfboards ect.We had drinks at the Beach Bar a few times before dinner.They have music playing in the background.Super relaxed with a perfect view.Right on the water.Loved it.I did use the laundry and the gym.Great gym with up to date equipment.Definately a central part of Waikiki.Every thing close by-shops,restaraunts,the beach.Just walking through The Moana makes you relaxed.Ive done it plenty of times and this time I got to stay.I will always remember my stay here and how lucky we got.We thank Chivastine and all the staff.And the SPK as well.We have stayed there before too.Hopefully I can return again to The Moana Surfrider but until then I will always think back on a wonderful 4 days.Everyone should experience a stay here.:)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Omg this resort is amazing. From the rocking chairs out front, to the amazing views on the 6th floor this property is nothing short of spectacular. Upon checking in, the wait was minimal. I was given the room I reserved with no issues. There is also an elixir that is made of guava for you to have while you wait for check in. Upon arriving to my room, I smiled immensely. The room was nicely decorated and met all of our needs. The view was of the street but I’m glad. I was able to see when the action was happening. There was WiFi throughout the property. The resort fee also came with 2 free bottles of water replenished each day. Make sure you take full advantage of all that the resort fee has to offer. Throughout our stay I never had any issues. We went to the beach each day and it was always crowded. But that’s too be expected. Regarding the pool, it’s small. And don’t think you’re going to get a lounge chair unless you are there at the crack of dawn to get a chair. The restaurants are plentiful and the food is tasty. I would definitely recommend this property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently had a 2-night stay (family of 4) at the Moana Surfrider, and was absolutely impressed with the hotel, the staff, the room, and overall experience. The hotel itself is beautiful, from it's open, clean lobby area, and front porch with rocking chairs, to the rooms themselves. The check-in experience was amazing, and while I consider myself a 'standard' guest, they really made me and my family feel special at check-in, and took great care in ensuring we'd have a great stay and experience at their hotel. Special shout-out to Stephen at the front desk, who really went above and beyond in helping us get checked-in. Our room had 2 beds, and was even large enough to have a 3rd roll-away brought in, and we still never felt crowded. It was quiet and we never heard our neighbors on either side. The hotel's location is perfect....right on the beach, and we really felt like we were centrally located to everything in Waikiki, easily walking to all the great shops and restaurants.We would absolutely stay here again, and consider this hotel and the overall experience one of the best we've had in our travels.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Whilst its at the higher end of accommodation cost in Waikiki - this hotel is the best I have ever stayed. The charm of the old section, the relaxation under the Banyan Tree, the friendliness of the team - and the exceptional view of Waikiki Bay & Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were here for 3 nights and had a room in the 15th floor facing the beach. The diamond tower looking a little tired. The room was spacious but bathroom is old with shower in bathtub and a curtain. You have no chance of getting a chair by the pool as people place towels there at 6am. Upon enquiring were told you can’t reserve chairs but I never saw this being policed. The only other option is to pay for a beach chair or sit on the sand. Buffet breakfast was ample with lots to choose but you can’t get a poached egg. A little disappointed with this hotel as I don’t feel it’s rating is justified .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Third stay, but never again.  It all started to go pear-shaped at check-in.  This took 30 minutes, with one clerk packing up at 1pm (shift over presumably), and leaving without a replacement despite the long line of guests waiting for service.Afternoon tea on the Veranda was nice, but we had almost finished the tea by the time the food arrived, 20 minutes later!Getting a coffee from the little stand near in the Banyan Tree Courtyard was like extracting teeth.  They were obviously having problems with the computer system because two of them couldn't work out how to use it.  One walked away exasperated and left the other poor sod to deal with the guests.  20 minutes to get coffee, oh dear, oh dear.The final straw was breakfast on the Veranda.  Lovely location, but 45 minutes for a couple of poached eggs on toast, particularly when the place is not full, was a first world problem we would not put up with when the eggs finally arrived under-cooked & swimming in cold water.  Bacon & toast cold of course.  A complaint to the restaurant manager got us a few " sorry sir" comments, but he was so non-plussed it was obvious he has heard it all before.  We walked out to the cheers of a table of 8 who had waited an hour for their meals.  A sad excuse for a 5 Star hotel.  Staff training needs a lot of work, and perhaps more kitchen & front office staff might be a good idea.  At check-out they tried to charge us an additional USD33 "daily resort fee".  Not a chance mate!  This was a pre-paid booking and given our experiences we would not countenance a fee for just sitting on the rocking chairs!  The clerk heard my complaint about all of the above and, thankfully, removed this fee from our account.We had no contact from the GM of course.I never did get a call from the GM

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The old building of hotel is historic and classic. The building is beautiful. The hotel is located at great place by the beach and the heart of tourist area. The beach is just outside the hotel. It is convenient. The hotel lobby is classic and comfortable. That is why I stayed in this hotel.However, it is very expensive. The room I stayed is spacious but the bathroom is real small. It only has a shower and cannot accommodate a bathtub. The room decoration is modern. The only historic feeling is the wooden curtain. The hotel charged a high resort facility fee per day over the hotel room rates we paid. The hotel gave us a long list of facilities we can use based on the facility fee. However, unless I stay in the hotel for many days, otherwise I am unable to enjoy the facilities properly. It is because some functions only organized one or two times a week. Or, I needed to reserve in advance. What I have enjoyed in the list was two bottles of water.The staff tried to be helpful. I have asked for a pin to change my mobile phone sim card. They said that they will call the engineer to help. I was scared and stopped them.I tried to have an early check in but I failed. I booked through ExpXXXX. The hotel cannot find my reservation. When I checked in, I found that they treated my first name as surname. The car park of the hotel is located at the Prince Sheraton Hotel. That was at the opposite of street. The self parking charges were USD 35 per day. The car park was full of cars.There is a small swimming pool at the hotel. We need to be aware that the deepest area is over 5 feet. I am unlikely to stay in this hotel again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a pleasant stay at the Moana. Great central location. Reasonably sized rooms with a view of the ocean depending where you're located. Customer service is very good. Big long foyer, veranda with rocking chairs and access to the beach. The worst part is the lifts in this hotel Expect to wait a a lot getting down from your floor. No stair access to the ground level if you did decide to work. Grand piano which gets played at night. Acoustic guitar sessions outside later in the week. Breakfast could be better. We enjoyed our stay but may consider different options next time. Not because we didn't like our stay but just to see if there's an even better option..

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at the Moana Surf Rider many times when I go to Waikiki for work. The best thing about it is the location! It’s in the heart of Waikiki and the out door patio puts you right into the beach with some amazing views of Diamond Head and great sunsets. The historical value of the hotel also makes it a great place to stay! Why the 4 stars... the “newer” part the tower needs an update those rooms have the best views but they are you garden variety Westin rooms. When I do stay there I prefer the banyon side because they have been updated and a bit nicer the only draw back about these rooms is that they are smaller and no balcony. So it really depends what you are going for. Overall, it’s a great hotel with an ideal location! Also, the staff is super friendly I have always found the people very nice and remembered me because I visited frequently!! Another plus is there is a Honolulu Coffee company attached to the front! Everything you’ll ever need!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Save your money and stay somewhere else for the same price or cheaper. This hotel had one thing going for it, it's historical value, and that is all. Rundown exterior in back, rooms are tiny, sink is the size of something you'd expect to see on a fishing boat. Music in the courtyard plays pretty much from 5pm-1030pm every night. This is fine, except those nights you are exhausted and just want to go to bed early and get a good nights rest. Floors and walls are thin. Was kept up every night by the people above us moving around. Not crazy moving around either to warrant us calling front desk. Pool is tiny and beach is over crowded with people that aren't even staying at the hotel. Hotel seems to cater to weddings when we were there. Hotel staff could have been friendlier and more welcoming upon arrival. Housekeeping and maintenance guys were very friendly. My biggest disappointment was getting food poisoning from the Beach Bar chicken wings, which I'm 100% certain about. Had them at 830pm by 1am I was vomiting uncontrollably for several hours as well as on and off the following day. I stayed in my room all day long, which was a bummer bc my girlfriend and I paid to rent an umbrella and 2 lawn chairs $55 by beach. She went out for a couple hours bc I made her, so she didn't need to take care of me. Upon check out I explained to management what had happened and simply asked if they could just remove the $55 charge(umbrella chair rental) for me, seeing as their food caused me to lose a whole day of my vacation(and wasn't fully recovered for about 48hrs) Not a crazy request, right? I didn't want to make a big deal out of it and thought that was a reasonable ask. Managements response was I needed to talk to security and file a claim and have them investigate it! Said, "my health was of their upmost importance and this is why I needed to go that route." Basically, we don't believe you. Needless to say, I was checking out and didn't have time for all that. I wish I did, bc I was extremely insulted by the way I was treated. You're a 4 star hotel and I'm paying 400 plus a night, not trying to rip you off, just simply asking the $55 charge be removed from my bill out of the principle of the matter and show of respect and sincere apologies for your kitchens screw up. Extremely disappointed and ruined my day how it was handled. Finished off our vacation at Westin in Maui and it was 10x's better in all aspects and was run like a top notch hotel. If the property management is reading this you should really start taking more pride in this hotel, it shows you don't.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider is the first hotel in Waikiki and that adds a lot of character to it but fear not, it is not outdated because it has been renovated really well.The lobby is beautiful & has rocking chairs at the front where you could relax while people watching or while waiting for valet. They provide guava elixir which is very refreshing and the lobby smells so good all the time.On our week of stay there, we love walking into our room after a long day of excursion since it is very neat & the housekeeping are doing a great job on tidying it up, making it smell fresh & replenishing toiletries.The bathroom is on the smaller side, but providing comfy bathrobes, ample of towels and a cool bidet make up for it size.For travellers that love to work out, you can pack light because they offer work out attire & shoes for rent. They have a huge gym, yoga at 7am & yoga in the afternoon too.The prime location is hard to beat, it is right there! Beach front, a walk away from restaurants, highend shops, malls & night market. Everything is right there!Lastly, every staff deserves a kudos, the smiles, the service & the hospitality was amazing. :)We’ll definitely be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
