review_body: The Moana Surfrider Waikiki is the most wonderful place to stay when visiting the island of Ohau. Located beachside on the main beach and easy walking distance (across the road) from the heart of some of the best shopping in Hawaii. The Moana Surfrider is the perfect mix of retaining the best of the historic and adding new modern facilities. The staff were wonderful and met every request. Thank you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A lovely spot to get away. Right on the beach. A hotel with character. The rooms are good and clean not as fancy as some mainland hotels. Staff very friendly. Great view for drinks or breakfast. Close to everything.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My partner and I stayed at the Moana Surfrider for 10 days to celebrate 2 birthdays with a group of friends (some staying at other SPG hotels in Waikiki). The hotel location on Waikiki beachfront and its history were the deciding factors in booking this resort. At our late night check in after midnight, the front desk staff were great and had us checked in quickly. We booked a Tower Wing ocean view room with a lanai, and the room was exactly what we had expected, with an awesome full ocean view along Waikiki Beach to Diamond Head. One lunchtime we enjoyed an elegant Afternoon Tea at the Verandah at The Beachhouse, and a special mention to the hotel F&B manager who arranged for my friend (also celebrating a birthday) and his partner to have the same Afternoon Tea seated at the best table overlooking Waikiki Beach, as a birthday treat from me with all charges back to my room without any problems. We found the Vintage 1901 alfresco terrace bar at the historic Banyan Tree courtyard to be better than the Beach Bar as it served a wider range of food and cocktails (and without the plastic cups that are used at the Beach Bar).We had all-day daily access to the Beachclub “club” lounge (with a view over the pool and beach) which served a simple but good continental breakfast with a few hot dishes, and free flow of house wine and beer in the evening. Beachside, there are 4 private beach cabanas which can be booked the day before, at USD 110 for a full day with towels, water and waiter service which we booked on a few days as they have great views and easy beach and pool access. Also worth a mention is the free WiFi hotspot which is included in the daily resort fee and gives unlimited WiFi access on Oahu. This saved on our expensive Australian telco roaming rates and was useful to post photos of our awesome vacation activities while on the move.On our last day as our Tower Wing room was unavailable for a late checkout, reception were great and gave us use of a Cody but charming city view room for the day.We can’t thank the friendly and helpful hotel staff enough for making this our most memorable and relaxing holiday ever and we look forward to a return visit. MAHALO!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome beach bar @ the Moana. Great service. Laid back relaxed beach vibe. Food and drinks are delicious! Open seating so it can be at a premium. Live music and dancer was a nice touch. Even if you aren’t staying @ the Moana, it’s worth a stop in!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at Moana Surfrider before ,maybe about 5yrs ago ,back then it was an amazing hotel .This time I was so disappointed,we had a tower room with Beach view.The room was so ordinary looking olive green &brown , very basic .Bed and a console table with TV one end , with you kettle and desk area the other .No small table in the room only chair .No little shampoo 's ,conditioner,body lotion's or vanity item's you had to ask for these .I was really looking forward to my sweet sleeper bed , as I've stayed at SPG hotels before and always found the beds amazing,unfortunately the bed in our room needed replacing.The lift's needed some mantanance as I got stuck between floors for 40 min one day .The room was very clean as was the bathroom and the old Hawaiian charm of its lobby and outdoor arear's are lovely .But I must say in my opinion it's not worth the money ,especially as it's about $100 extra per day on top of room charge .The staff are lovely , and very helpful,breakfast was good .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Have stayed there before and dined many times. This time though it was completely different. CRAZY BUSY. Extremely young crowd wandering around in g strings. Travelling with a little boy made it awkward to be amongst. Very loud (I found that last stay too). It's like a pub not a luxury hotel. Restaurant had really gone down in my estimation. Had to take a number and go away. We did....we went far away - down the road in fact. Not on my radar to return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Lee and the beach team are outstanding!! We stay here at least once/twice a year and they are always so welcoming - best service in the world.. would definitely recommend staying at the Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel! It is right on the beach. We had a room in the tower it was quite large, with a balcony and an ocean view. Many amenities are offer and you actually get something for the resort fee! Bottled water daily, discounts, use of beach towels, reusable shopping bags. I was originally in a less expensive hotel but checked out after one night and moved to this hotel. I was not disappointed because it helped make the trip more special.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best location! Tons of restaurants and shops walking distance. The architecture of this place is awesome, the beach is beautiful and the bar is awesome with live music every day! The hotel room is what’s expected of a Westin, modern and clean and comfortable. The only downside is the pool is too small, we never lounged around it nor got in it but honestly you can grab some towels and sunbathe on the beach and swim in the clear water. Also you have to pay for beach chairs. The staff is superb, and service was great. They can hold your luggage on checkout day and let you use a guest room to shower and change (if you have a late flight out) so you can use the beach and facilities for the rest of the day.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed here twice and its our favourite hotel in Honolulu. The minute you walk into this hotel, the beautiful smell hits you and you know you are in paradise. The staff, service, restaurants, food, drinks, super clean rooms, beach, pool, view from room, literally everything is perfect! Beds are so comfortable, location is the best. Worth every penny.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We can't thank Harry, Craig, Robert and all the staff from the beach bar enough. Every time we visit, you guys make our trip all the more memorable and this time is no different even with our 2 little kids, we have so many amazing memories with you guys and your hospitality is second to noneThank youClint and Mel

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel looks beautiful, the rooms in the tower are large and attractive, and the location is perfect. It is a pity that their systems are so poor. We specifically booked a room with two single beds, confirmed, to be told on arrival only a king size room was available. No thank you. We finally asked to speak to the manager when miraculously, a room meeting our booking requirements was found. The concierge staff were unable to tell us where we could get a martini, when the perfect bar on the verandah was able to be seen from their desk! Every morning there was a long queue for breakfast, made slower by the lack of staff and their strolling to the tables.
user_name:
LilibetMelbourne
Hamilton & Waikato Region, New Zealand

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I don't really want to write this review because I don't want this hotel to get any more popular then it already is. I've stayed at this hotel about four times and I've never been disappointed. I like the rooms in the Tower facing the ocean because I enjoy spending time in my room. If that's not important to you, the other rooms are good too. The main attraction to this hotel is the beautiful old banyan tree in the court yard, the pool, the beach and the staff. I really like seeing the same valet from year to year. It makes me think they must treat their employees well. The location of the hotel is perfect as well. I always enjoy my stay here and look forward to returning soon.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Poor service, expensive, and over rated. The beach club where you pay another $200 a night for access has no variety of food, poor drink and food selection, fun police limiting your drinks (a selection of one chardonnay, one red wine, and one beer) and is limited to 5pm to 8pm. Its over expensive for such weak and limited selections. First night steamed dim sims, rice, green beans. Second night some hot pastry rubbish, rice, green beans. Of course you can have salad. The bistro in the beach house is better but you pay for it. When ideally for $200 usd extra a night more variety of food and drinks should be provided. The bar measures each drink when poured. I have never seen that in the USA before. Tiny pool and you have to pay for an umbrella area by the beach. The moana spa are incompetent. Cant even properly book appointments. When you get there. Its just sorry. I stayed in the penthouse suite. For $700 usd a night including the rubbish food and drink package of $200 a night i would not recommend this place to anyone. Have to give 1 star for post. Zero star is more appropriate.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel with access to the beach right outside. Right on the strip and quick access to many restaurants and shops. We used a conference room in the third floor for some business meetings while our teenage kids had access to the rest of the amenities. Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a lovely hotel, but they recently restructured their concierge service (in that they got rid of it) both times we have checked in recently we have had to wait for ages - photos attached - for a beautiful first class hotel they really need to work on this process

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hotel is right on the beach (small beach portion) of Waikiki. The hotel is large and accommodates many, many people. It has onsite restaurant that is alright. Just a short walk to some great places to eat like Agu Ramen, Cheesecake Factory (great brunch) and many shops and small malls. It's a city experience with beach right there. I was there for the Regatta canoe races which were nice to see. They also had a breakfast buffet you can get for just $10 with sausage, rice, eggs quickly. I personally prefer less hustle and bustle. Parking is not advisable as it is expensive. There is parking near Cheesecake factory if you want to rent a car for the day and on the street, but Valet is pricey.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the perfect property and the room was upgraded for us. We went this last April. 3 of us in the room, it was so perfect and all the water sports are just right there for the taking! My kids ages 13 and 17 learned to surf for the first time. Don't forget to go to the hotel next door, The Outrigger for their Hula Pie which we found on the travel channel. It is over the top for sure and they make it daily and it takes 24 hours ahead for them to prep it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel certainly has a very central and literally beachside location but its popularity meant it felt crowded and not relaxing as the grounds are quite small and the beach very crowded. The hotel is quite self-contained with all you need (pool, restaurants, beach access) but you have to pay for pretty much every facility (reserving cabanas) and few $ free sitting areas (sitting at tables only allowed with a purchase at the on-site cafe). The additional resort fee was $37 per night for which we only really used wi-fi and phone calls. We had a room in the tower with a partial sea view that was quite large and pleasant. As one of the most expensive places to stay I don't think it gives much value for your money.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is an excellent location with direct beach access from the pool. (No crossing streets.) The room was good, except we were on the street and is was very loud at night. The bathrooms could use a bit of updating. We had access to the Beach Club (for certain SPG members and those willing to pay)--very worth it for breakfast, heavy appetizers for dinner with wine, and snacks/drinks throughout the day. Pool could use a facelift.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had another wonderful stay at the Moana Surfrider. With a special mention to Lee from the Beach and Pool Deck who always provides exceptional service and informative insights about island, all with a friendly smile and great sense of humor. Recommend the cabanas, perfect way to spend your day.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is one of the best, prime location hotels on Oahu! We have visited the islands several times in the past and this is the one that we have enjoyed the most. The staff is terrific and the location is right in the heart of the "action." The beach bar has great live entertainment every night and the food/drinks are top-shelf. Just a few minutes walk from some of the best shops on the island and other great hotels/eating establishments. The view (see photos) are iconic - Diamond Head and the North Beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We initially stayed at the Surfrider 27 years ago on our honeymoon and decided to return to celebrate our anniversary there this year with a two week stay. The hotel hasn't changed much.The lobby is open and airy and the staff are informative, courteous and helpful. We had a Tower Premier Ocean Room with a view of Diamond Head, beach and ocean. I strongly advise getting a room with an ocean view. It has to be much better than the City view.Our room was spacious and well appointed. The lanai was great for sitting with a cup of coffee before going to breakfast or to listen to the music from the beach bar at night. The bathroom was bit tight, especially when my wife and I were in there at the same time.The pool is nice but something has to be done about the chair situation. The number of seats is grossly inadequate for the size of the hotel. Every day there would be no more than a dozen people in the pool but every chair had a towel on it. Your choice would be to put your towels on the ground until a chair hopefully opened up or to spend $55 for beach chair and umbrella or $110 for one of the four cabanas. So much for the resort fee. We did spring for the cabana on one day and it was a great experience. The hotel needs to find a way to increase the number of free chairs and/or decrease the fees for beach chairs and cabanas.A nice touch are the rocking chairs on the front and rear porches which give you a chance to relax and watch the world go by.A very good hotel to sat at. It would be better if they remedied the pool chair situation.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Visited the Beach bar back in May this year with my wife. As usual we were looked after by the two legend bar men Harry and Craig. These boys are the best and always make us feel welcome everytime we visit Waikiki as do everyone that work there. Mahalo

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our last 4 days in Hawaii were spent at the Grand Dame, the oldest hotel in Waikiki. It didn’t disappoint. The front of building is a bit Southern plantation painted white with rocking chairs on the verandah & Hamptons. As you walk in you get the view uyou want, Waikiki beach through the doors opening out to an old Banyan tree. You sit under the tree during the day sipping on coffee and in the evening with a cocktail & light snacks all day, whilst listening to a guitarist. The back of the building has a veranda as well reserved for breakfast and restaurant dining, but make sure to reserve the verandah for breakfast otherwise you don’t get the lovely elevated view over the sea, but still nice on the ground level.The beach is only a few steps from the hotel with crystal clear water. The surf breaks much further out, lovely to see the long boards.Our room was perfect, on the 6th floor with Diamond Head volcano view. I always find it useful to call the hotel reception to discuss which room. It was always going to be in the Ocean Tower, a long building jutting out towards the sea and the tallest of the 3 accommodation wings. But if you look closely every second balcony has a grill which you can see through to the glistening surf & Diamond Head. The other rooms though have a solid concrete balcony approx 3 feet high with small grill. This impedes the view if sitting in your suite or lying in bed. I definitely wanted the grill balcony and the Diamond head view and it was fabulous. The Westin quality was there with divine beds, pillow requests, etc.The other wings include the original building called Banyan rooms. No balconies but views out to the sea I assume from most rooms. The Diamond wing is a building on the other side of the original hotel and all balconies face directly out to the ocean. Views to Diamond head but you need to look out over the balcony to the left. The charm is in the lobby, restaurant and outdoor areas. We met a couple staying at the Royal Hawaiian, the pink palace. They told us the Moana had a lot more charm & next time they would stay there. There are reciprocal rights to charge back to Moana Surfrider from the other Starwood properties, Royal Hawaiian & Sheraton.Located in the lovely area of Kalakaua Ave with designer stores, I still managed to find the Nordstrom Rack outlets. All types of food catered for in the surrounding area.Highly recommend and can’t wait to return.A little late in reviewing, the hotel just sparkled as it was Thanksgiving week 2017. There were two magnificent Christmas trees, decorations inside & out exquisite.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Oldest but decent hotel in the best location. Check-in and concierge staff are excellent. Cleaning room staff great and Pool staff of a high level. Beach club staff also very service oriented. Also the photographer people are super cool. Thanks for the memories.Which brings us to the bar staff - who I guess with one exception - COREY - are basically very far from either being professional or enjoying their job. The night Corey was off on the 28th June - the "main" bar guy who sat by the bar entrance just chatting and doing nothing was just rude and obviously LAZY as. it was our problem we were not served for over 10 minutes while sitting at a dirty table at a time when there were few people there. It beggars belief that even though they are unionized and therefore I guess get some livable wage they expect 20% service for the poorest service. This guy was awful and to be fair most of the bar staff are. Would have thought be a bar person at a famous hotel in the middle of Wakiki would be one of the best bar people jobs. Well done Corey for your polite, speedy service. You save that place.Service is down to 3 but only because of the bar-staff - everyone else was at or close to 5.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We are staying here for 10 days at $450 per night which includes room, tax and a resort fee of $35 per day. The pool was built for the original hotel which did not include the huge towers added on. Clearly not big enough for the # of guests. When the chairs fill up ( by 6:30 AM), you must pay $15 per day per person rental fee for for a low to the ground beach chair. If you prefer, you may pay $55.00 for a regular chair on the beach (mind you this is AFTER the $35 per day “resort fee”). I’m writing this as a matter of increasing your awareness about it. I’ve stayed at The Grand Wailea on Maui and the chairs are plentiful and ate included in the resort fee. The rooms are very and comfortable and the grounds are lovely. It’s in a very central location in the Honolulu beach scene.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel and location (Waikiki beach, Honolulu) exceeded our expectations. The hotel was amazing and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Upon checkin we had some confusion with linking my Starwood and Marriott rewards accounts. Noy at the front desk was extremely patient, understanding and helpful. Instead of this corporate merger between Starwood and Marriott because a huge issue, Noy guided us through it and got us taken care of. We loved spending time at the Beach Bar, the beach in front of the hotel, as well as renting an umbrella. We also took advantage of the complimentary morning yoga class and we had breakfast every morning at the outdoor restaurant buffet. It was a wonderful experience overall. If we go back to Waikiki we will definitely stay at this hotel again. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best location in Waikiki. Beach and pool area is very beautiful. Best sunset view. It's expensive but you get what you pay for. We didn't have any meal in the hotel so can't comment on food and service.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As we would have had a long wait for our room we accepted and paid for a suite with inmediat3 entry, plus Executive Lounge entry. For the price we paid we felt it was worth it. The rooms were very spacious, a big bedroom with its own furnished balcony, and a sitting/living area with chairs,table and a small kitchen area. There was a huge fully furnished balcony leading off from this.The view was expansive from both balconies, right out over the sea, beach area ,city. Must be one of the best views in Waikiki.The Executive Lounge was well worth the price paid. Good breakfasts with plenty of choice, plenty of tables and cheerful service. Open all day for coffee and basic snacks, and then pre dinner drinks and canapés in the evening for a couple of hours. Outside area too. We found the restaurant expensive, but with very good food, enjoyed everything we ate there. A much busier hotel and location that we would normally choose, but a great situation, good views and a bit of history too.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Opted to stay in the historical portion of the hotel (early 20th century). There are also two tower buildings added in the 1960s that have balconies. Older portion had a smaller room, but we were looking out on the side opposite the Banyan Tree (hotel is in a "U" shape with the ends facing Waikiki Beach and a Banyan Tree in the middle. Our view was a little quieter.Arrival included a lei greeting and help from bell staff. Parking at the Sheraton Princess Hotel for $35 daily self park and $45 daily for valet. Just a block walk away. Very comfortable bed and the room was clean. Very busy with guests and several weddings per day. Evening had live music in the lobby (pianist). Highly recommend the sunrise greeting activity on Wednesday mornings at 5:15am. Yes, that is like WAY early especially for vacation, but DO IT! We didn't get up for it, but met the staff member who does it during the historical tour of the Moana Surfrider Hotel (Monday and Wednesday at 11am) and decided that we wanted to do it. We participated in the same ceremony on Friday morning at the Royal Hawaiian Hotel (next door) and it was AMAZING, even though it almost made us late for our flight!Waikiki Beach is beautiful and quite famous, but it is narrower than I thought it would be but still nice. Warm and clear water, beautiful view of Diamond Head. Towels for beach provided. Pool is very small with no deep end. Outside bar area, snack bar, and live music, too.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We wanted to stay here after a previous visit for brunch as it is a gracious and elegant building with history and charm. Sadly this is not reflected in the services.We got off to a poor start when we were told we had been given a king bed. As we are sisters we are well past sharing a bed but were told adamantly and repeatedly there was nothing else available. I asked to see the manager and, miraculously, the desk clerk reappeared to say the manager had found a room with two beds!Our room was spacious and comfortable but the only place to hang clothes was in the bathroom close to the toilet, a strange arrangement we have not encountered before.We asked the concierge where the best bar was to get a martini and he indicated the beach bar which was outside and more casual and noisy than we wanted. He was then at a loss despite two bars being visible from his desk. So we wandered round until a restaurant staff member showed us where we could sit and order a martini. However that was our last one as the prices are eye-watering and with the daily charge (a disgraceful add-on after you have paid for your accommodation) and the exorbitant prices throughout the hotel, we found cheaper alternatives in the nearby International Market and nearby.The beach is busy but it's a great place for a swim and beats the small pool. My advanced age meant the only way I could get in was at the end with the steps which was roped off for kids so I had to swim under the barrier to get to the deeper end, not a satisfactory set-up. We were pleased breakfast was included but avoided the chafing dishes as the food in them was either unappealingly cold or dangerously tepid. But there were a good selection of lovely fresh fruit, an excellent miso soup, plenty of salad stuff and thick slices of smoked salmon. The coffee was awful and we had to ask for hot coffee or else it was cold as well as tasteless. Some days water glasses arrived and some days they did not, emblematic of the generally slapdash service.The worst aspect of breakfast was having to queue. One morning I counted over 60 people waiting and most days there were more than 20. Staff dealt with the queue very slowly and it is an annoying start to the day.We were also disappointed with the general cleanliness and atmosphere. While our rooms were kept clean and the room staff were polite and cheerful, we were never greeted by any other staff and there was a level of grubbiness I have never seen in a good hotel before, like a large ice-cream splodge that stayed on the lift door all day,I think this hotel needs a good shake-up. It's fine to charge high prices but then you have to deliver to match the cost and this place is run more like the average motel than a first-rate hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider for 9 nights My wife has always wanted to stay in this beautiful hotel . Checkin was interesting, we arrived early 7.30am , waited until after 3.30pm to finally get checked into our room . They did offer a 1 hour family room to get changed etc . First impression was beautiful open foyer which leads out onto the veranda .Directly in front is a old Banyan tree which covers the Beach Bar area .Pool is small but when you have the beach at your door step - it doesn’t matter . Our room is in the old building overlooking the city . Did ask for a ocean view but no such luck .Room is a little small , we have a balcony overlooking the main shopping street . Beds are very comfortable, one of the best I have slept in for a hotel . Bathroom is tiny , not much room . Shower pressure is good , 2 different shower heads . There is a walk in closet for you to hang your clothes and put your suitcase . There is a safe ( sits on the floor ) . There is ample power sockets to charge your devices . We had water bottles replaced every day , this is included in the price . Pool area is so busy , be quick if you want to get a lounge chair . We have had to get to the pool area around 7.30/8am in the morning to get the Lounges . Many guests were leaving there towels / bags etc on the lounges and going to have breakfast. This was not policed enough by pool staff . The pool side cafe was expensive and the staff member lacked charisma. The older lady working behind the counter did not smile or show any enthusiasm towards guests . A real lack of customer service , this has been a general theme throughout the hotel . The activities desk / tour desk was the same , no genuine interest to help . The beach bar is overpriced and the menu is dated and tired . Very little to choose from .I had a interesting moment at the beach bar where a staff member was rude and offensive, not only to me but to my 12 year old daughter . Management were notified , I hope it wasn’t just lip service they gave to me . This is a very busy hotel , lots of Japanese weddings .Perfect location , beach is fantastic.Staff need a lesson in basic customer service .You also pay a daily resort fee of $37 US , I’m not sure what this is for . Generally we loved the location, Beach etc . Our visit was soured by the rude Bar person .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is a very beautiful place to stay right on the beach. The rooms were cleaned everyday . The staff were very professional and always helpful. The location is perfect to walk to shops or restaurants.The beach bar and music was always great atmosphere. Would definitely stay again !

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As far as SPG/Marriott hotels go I understand Asian hotel outclass American hotels 100:1. This hotel is expensive, old, smells like an old people’s home and has small rooms. Very little platinum status consideration. The evening lounge food is basic, only one of two items plus salad. Wine is red or white and a beer. Breakfast is limited to the most basic items, eggs, bread, cereal. No sparkling water available. The beach bar staff are ignorant ie they will not open pre bought bottles to drink on the beach and if questioned why their response is ‘as if I care it’s company policy’. I’d have no consideration to stay here again unless the rates were significantly cheaper than another hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My room was great and the service to my room was an issue. They will not provide you with a bath cap, cotton buds, shower gel or lotion unless you contact reception and request this! They give you the bear minimum unless you ask.Do not pay extra to have breakfast at this hotel, the service is the worst I have ever had. I ordered gluten free bread and poached eggs and they brought out the eggs in 15 minutes and brought the bread in 30 minutes (of course the eggs were cold by this time). I cannot say enough about how bad the service was for breakfast.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I walked from the street through the lobby and I was greeted by an awesome beachfront view. Crowded area but fantastic waterfront area. Live music and great view. Nice place to hang out for a drink or two.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I can see some being disappointed if they do not have a room with a great view. My wife and I visited June 2018 for a few days before a cruise. We had a room with a view of the pool, veranda, and the ocean right next to the finance office. We thought that might be a problem but it wasn't. The buffet breakfast and one evening meal was out-of-this-world. This hotel is in a great location to experience the area, eat, drink, shop and take in the local beach community which we did on our anniversary. We would go again. The only slightly negative was there was always someone shooting wedding photos or something on the stairs blocking us from leaving or entering our second floor room unless we took the elevator.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: So we actually stayed here in May of 2013 for our honeymoon, and we just came back in December of 2017. This hotel smells AMAZING. Its right on the beach and you can hear the ocean almost anywhere in the building. The doors are always open so you can walk right through and hear someone playing the piano or get a fresh fruit drink and enjoy it in the dining area overlooking the ocean. Our stay in 2013 was fantastic. The room was clean, fresh water always restocked, and incredibly friendly staff. We came back to Hawaii this past December and stopped by the hotel just to reminisce (out of our price range to stay here this time!) It was just as we remembered. The smell and all. So clean and fresh! it is definitely on the pricey side, but it was once in a lifetime. Stay here and you won't be sorry.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had the best of both worlds staying at Moana with our 3 children. We had relaxing times by the gorgeous pool environment and a few meters away enjoyed the craziness of Waikiki Beach floating on our tubes and surfing. Mixed up with some shopping and day trips to swim with turtles it’s been an amazing holiday. We really want to mention a huge thanks to Lee who was at the pool desk for his absolutely amazing friendly attitude and welcoming manner, his great sense of humor and hospitality. He is an exceptional asset to Moana and one of a kind. We would highly recommend staying here!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in 657 and 1886. This was my second time here at the hotel. It is beautiful and the staff are very helpful. You can't get a better location. the pool is great and the beach is great. Lots of things to do. Kids 5,8,9 enjoyed the holiday

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This truly was the worst place I have stayed. The nicest staff were cleaner and car park people. I gave them a tip. The other staff were rude and lazy. The room was 800 USD ++ We could not get even get a spoon. Checkin was horrible. We paid for club. Went there no one worked there. Could not even get a cup to make tea. And then there was no stuff to make with anyway. Felt like a real outsider was insulted by staff. Told me I was not good members so would not even talk about check in problem. I finally got in 5 hours after got there. Even though they say check in at 3 pm we got in 430. The thing was I am gold member so had to sit on a lap top to prove it. The check in staff never even looked at us after that day. Could not ask anything the normal staff are good but they are working people. Asked to see manager then found out he could not give a rats. Staff never even said they spoke to him. I truly had the worst time. We cut our stay by 4 days and stayed at outrigger was much better. Out of ten would give the Surfrider 2. Too dear no service. Nothing nice at all

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Tea and food was great but there are no fans on the veranda and there were no trade winds so it made the afternoon uncomfortable. Not the Westin’s fault.Loved the teas and food selection but because of the heat some breads were dry

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Currently enjoying my 4th stay here. I always worry it won’t be as good as last time, but it is! There is just something magical about it. I love the sense of history, the elegance, and the superb service. And of course, there is not a better location in Waikiki. We chose a city view room in the historic banyan wing. I worried a bit about street noise but it has not been an issue at all. The room is clean and beautiful. Love the plantation shutters, the heavenly bed, and the rain shower. Each evening we’ve had cocktails at the Beach Bar and enjoyed simply outstanding service. Yes, this place is expensive, and yes, the resort fee is almost criminal, but my advice is just accept all that and enjoy the very best!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in the newer tower of one the oldest hotel on Oahu. The room was surprsiningly spacious for Waikiki beach. In addition, much quieter than I would have expected.service was quite good and the Spa experience was top notch.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for a week at this beautiful Historical property we had Valet service which we used up a storm and they were fantastic. Check in was amazing the room ready early and it was smooth treated like a vip we had an partial Ocean in the newer wing amazing the room was great nice size bathroom nice They have a small Museum floor with all the history of the Hotel I found the only thing missing was a bigger Pool but truly who needs that with the beach access right there ..everything about this property is amazing you walk in and an ancient Banyan tree is visible thru the doors with the ocean behind it the Lobby is spacious and elegant..we ate at the Pool/beach bar great service and food and then had breakfast in the main area both outstanding service I highly recommend this property they must have had 20 Wedding a day with Asian couples loving this property..beautiful settings everything is just awesome

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moan Surfrider has a wonderful cocktail tapas bar right on the waterfront, best cocktails and tapas dishes you can drink your cocktails and just jump into the ocean my favourite place in Hawaii for afternoon cocktails

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Superb position and rooms were ok. Food in pool bar was very average. We were supposed to have an upgrade as part of the hotel club but told no when we arrived was a bit crap We will go back tho family loved holiday

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had fish and chips in the beach bar, reasonably priced wondered why there was not more people eating while listening to the music. Then the food arrived and I understood, it was dry and truly a big disappointment. Lift your game Moana,your exec chef needs to kick a few butts.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Dropped in for few drinks and tuna pokes. Seaview was nice and the place offered nice live music (skilful singer/guitarist). My tuna poke caused me a stomach ache, so there might have been something wrong in the tunas handling process. No problem with another portion with tuna poke. Expensive place of course.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Hotel is the oldest Hotel on the Waikiki Beach area. But, the hotel has been keep up nice over the years. They have parking for your car across the street in another Hotel parking lot. They have lovely rocking chairs to sit on to watch the public walk by in front of the hotel. They have a really small pool where it is hard to get a chair since they don't have many chairs near the pool. They do have a nice workout room overlooking the front of the hotel and you can watch the public drive by the front of the hotel. They have a Spa on the second floor. The hotel has many floors if my memory is correct 21 floors. The Hotel is right on the beach.where you can go surfing. The surfing is one of the nicest areas on the island to go surfing. The water is not deep and you can go out many yards before the water gets deep. The Hotel does I think about 40 weddings a day on the property. They have a nice grassy area for weddings overlooking the ocean. They have a nice Restaurant over looking the ocean and pool area. They have a large lobby to listen to a gentleman play music nightly on the piano. The have washers and dryers downstairs in the basement where you pay to do the washing and drying of your clothes. They have meeting rooms for large groups. We where there in the second week of June and that week each year they have parades on the street right in front of the hotel. You can rent umbrellas and chairs for the beach. You are in walking distance to all the stores in the area for shopping. Many Restaurants in walking distance from the Hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited #Beachhousemoana briefly to enjoy a beachfront cocktail and got the best customer service experience of our stay in Waikiki. Our waitress Kat was welcoming, friendly, attentive and also a wee bit fun! Just what we needed for our day in the sun. Thanks Kat for showing us how American hospitality should be!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome hotel! We always stay here, when we come to Oahu. The breakfast buffet is by far the best in the area. The Victorian style hotel is historic and unbelievably Gorgeous. If you want to stay at the very best hotel, this is definitely it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. It is everything that was described on our brochure... and more... it reminded me of a beautiful elegant old hawaiian plantation. This theme was carried throughout. There is a huge porch out front with serveral unique comfy rocking chairs in keeping with the theme of a plantation... if you were lucky,you would enjoy that breeze that came across in the afternoon. Walking thru the patio/pool/beach bar/snack bar you will step right onto the sand. Every meal delicious with the friendly servers adding to our awesome dining experience. Every room with balcony and ocean View. All in all we highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The pictures online before booking were charming, what an original looking hotel. You might picture this place in the Southern Belt of the U.S.Upon arriving the first thing you notice is the traffic. This hotel is located in the middle of all the action on Waikiki beach. This could be good or bad for others. It's very loud and you hear the street noise from your room, even if you are ocean facing as we were. Upon arrival the bell staff and front desk were terrific. Upon receiving our room key, we found the rooms to be average at best, but certainly not for the price we paid.The hotel is very pricey. Rooms, drinks and food. The pool area is small and old, something you would never expect in a fancy hotel. For others that don't care, you have a beautiful ocean at your doorstep, however it is very crowded with people, surf boards and catamarans landing on the beach front. Watch your children closely. In the afternoon there is live music which was nice and again the service all around was terrific.After paying $28 dollars for bacon and eggs the first day, we explored this hotel chains sister resort two doors down. You can charge food and drinks to your original hotel when visiting sister properties. Here I paid $18 for the same meal. Multiple pools, same great beach and afternoon entertainment. We will be back to the second resort.At night there are hundreds of places to eat and the shopping nearby is a mix of casual to the worlds most expensive brand stores. Pro's: Location, hotel staffCon's: Expensive food and drinks, average room decor, very loud property, small outdated pool, difficult to get a lounge chairOverall we were disappointed for the price we paid for this trip. The pictures all look nice, but my recommendation would be the neighbor property "The Sheraton", both SPG properties.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed in a Diamond ocean front room with balcony. The views were stunning. Shawn, a Concierge, was great to deal with; helpful and kind. Janet in the breakfast restaurant was lovely; a consummate professional. Cocktails served by the pool were very good, and Eric was a friendly and cheery server. We had a good room service dinner on our first night at Moana. Housekeeping was excellent.However, considering we were paying $760 a night (without breakfast) there were a few areas of service that could be improved upon. I spoke with a manager called Shane about them, who said they’d be discussed at the next day’s management meeting. I once again ran into one issue I’d raised with him a few days later. There is an escalator leading to the day spa. Whilst there’s a lift that can take guests up there and they can be let in via the back door, a bizarre atttude among some staff of wheelchair bound guests use only seemed to prevail! On my second visit to the spa on Saturday (the afternoon before our leaving) I took the lift to the spa and buzzed the Phone to be let in the back way. All was well. A pleasant employee admitted me. Upon leaving when I said I’d be taking the lift, a recalcitrant staff member told me I’d have to take the escalator. I repeated that I would like to take the lift. She stared me down and said that I couldn’t! I told her I had left via the lift on the last occasion and all she had to do was to open the back door. She gave me a filthy look and grudgingly opened the back doorway for me. Frustrating and poor customer service given that I already raised the issue with a Manager a few days earlier.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After five days at the Westin Hapuna Beach Prince Hotel on the Big Island , as the locals call the island actually named Hawaii but referred to as the Big Island to get around the fact that the whole group of islands is termed “ Hawaii “ and tourists get confused by that , the group moved back to Honolulu on the Oahu island to be near the HNL airport to allow movement by some to San Francisco , or the workers back to Australia .The oldest hotel in Waikiki, the Moana Surfrider, 1901 , was chosen as the last venue .It is situated literally right on the beach of famous Waikiki with a fabulous view along the beach to the bluff of a hill , Diamond Head . The hotel , it’s garden for drinking and eating , and it’s new next door modern tower , have a sort of low dividing wall along the sand , then sand for 15-20 metres and then the Pacific Ocean till Australia . Lookout for tsunamis, as our Hawaiian hosts said . The nature of the old hotel has been preserved beautifully with stained wood , Venetian windows and deck chairs along the balconies .A seamless joint to the newer tower provides service desks , escalators , a shopping arcade and lifts , ballrooms etc .The reservations desk appears to have a max of 6 positions so how they cope for a Jumbo load of Asian guests escapes me .Our little party of 20 late afternoon mid week was handled easily . Signs at the lifts of the tower advise against use if there was a fire . You nearly die of old age waiting for one in normal times . Somehow the guests manage to fit into the beer garden but the trick is to send a scout in advance to secure a table .The queue for breakfast , at any hour , allows you to stand there and finish the local paper . It is handled electronically by a screen that guides the receptionist to source a waiter to escort you to your table ., ONCE one becomes vacant .The forward scout trick works again as you can secure a large table even you present alone . Due to the popularity of the hotel with Asian guests , very little of the breakfast caters for Anglo Saxons but I am sure that the hotel can adapt at a second’s notice to it’s coming patronage . The staff are efficient and helpful but nowhere as laid back as our first stop . Twenty times busier too though . After Westin Hapuna the tower room was a come down, half the size and with a bathroom the size of my wife’s shoe box , as she scornfully informed me . Toilet tucked in a tight corner , shower over a tiny bath , no good if you are arthritic , and with a basin top big enough for 3 glasses , two lipsticks , some deodorant and a small soap . My wife , whom I spoil , gives it a 3 out of 10 compared to Hapuna .However , we are talking PRIME real estate here and every inch counts .It certainly is situated on the main drag , with a Tesla shop over the road , Rolex , top fashion shops , etc. all top dollar .How you fit a Tesla car in your duty free carry on I am not sure .The other great shop over the road is the ABC supermarket and gift shop . Alcohol at prices to make an Aussie cry , and every sort of souvenir you may wish .Also , if you feel like a cut sandwich with cheese and ham , egg salad or turkey etc to eat on your balcony , they have little cheap plastic packs of them .The hotel also has an ice machine near the lifts , something every hotel should have to cool your cheap drinks . I forgot to mention that the Hapuna does NOT have machines , just an ice bucket in each room filled by the housemaid , usually midday or later . Melts away quickly in this climate anyway .I carry a plastic ice tray cut down in length to fit in the usual small bar fridge in most rooms , if the fridge has an ice compartment . Meals in the garden were fine in choice and price over the few days we stayed there . My wife gives 10 to the garden and bar atmosphere , and a 10 to the weather , compared to our freezing back home .All the hotels seem to fit into a strip of four streets parallel to the beach , with a canal running behind . Local houses start the other side . Not sure if the long wide canal is there to drain away inland water or protect the locals from the tourists .Maybe vice versa . Anyway , if you are being picked up to go to the airport , expect a long tour around 5 to ten hotels if your lift turns up in a twenty seater mini bus .Allow plenty of time also for getting THROUGH check in , security and the 5 kilometres walk , so it seemed , to the boarding gate if you are flying Qantas. Right at the end of the buildings . A 7.30am hotel departure just makes 10.30 am flight .The locals are genuinely scared of tsunamis and one Government official lecturing us raised the possibility of a giant tsunami coming over from the Big Island in about an hour if the fault line along the front of the currently erupting Kilauea volcano , with it’s line of 23 or so crevices along it’s front , decided to let a 20 kilometres or so long part of the mountain slip down into the ocean facing Honolulu.No more Honolulu , but unlikely .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The guest services at this hotel were exceptional and particularly noteworthy. Throughout our 40+ years of travel we have stayed at many high-end, famous resorts. However, it was the exceptionally polite and accommodating services of the front desk staff—especially a gentleman named Noy that made this resort stand out above the rest. When we asked to be moved to a room with a better ocean view, Noy took the time to look through many room options to find the one that suited our desires best. Additionally, when I informed him of my husband’s passion for a particular amenity they offer he gave us an extra special treat that made our vacation especially memorable. All the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were very clean. The Toto toilet seats were a nice surprise. The fact that the resort sits right on the beach was especially delightful. Live music in the oceanfront bar was enjoyable. Dining while watching the activities on the beach and taking morning walks in the sand was absolute bliss. One of the best vacations we ever had. Hope to return next summer!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment that we arrived, we were made to feel welcome. Al and Frank were super helpful and kind. All of the staff was great throughout our stay. The guys at the towel stand, wish I remembered their names, were super helpful and friendly. The building itself is beautiful. There are ample places to sit and enjoy the breezes, to people watch or read. There is a historic banyan tree in the courtyard that is gorgeous. The room was very comfortable and up to date. This place has it all, great location, beautiful surroundings and people like Al and Frank who made our stay special.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pros:LocationMaid StaffCons:Pool deck is slippery No lifeguard but they have two towel peopleTowel Lady screamed at my 1 year old for playing with a ball in the pool Note: He is 1 so don't say" can't you see the sign" . Maybe she should have come out of the towel shed and said " Hi sir can you do me a favor" . SPG Elite Desk staff lost our postcards they said they would mail to our family and friends for usDated decor for the price

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Sometimes called The Old Lady of Waikiki, this historic property operated by Westin is well located and very welcoming. Booked Diamond Wing Oceanfront and we weren't disappointed. Room on the smaller side, bathroom small but functional, but hey with a view like this, who cares! Especially like the rocking chairs throughout the resort, especially in the Diamond rooms. Normally I don't like resort fee add on, but I think this is one of the better packages I have come across. You pay a little more to stay here, but in my opinion one of the best places to experience the Aloha spirit.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: First of all- let me start off by saying that this place is not cheap, but the location is probably one of the best in Honolulu!We arrived for a 1-night stay after a 1-week cruise of the islands. We were early to check-in and our room wasn’t ready yet. To add onto that, they were claiming they didn’t have any double bed rooms available, so my mom and I were going to have to stay together in a king bed (even though we had requested two beds weeks prior). We were not impressed so asked to speak with the manager. He conveniently found us a room with two beds thank goodness. The room itself was huge and had both a city view and a side beach view which was amazing.The property itself was lovely. The Beach Bar in the middle of the grounds was beautiful at night and the food there was pretty good (albeit pricey). In fact, everything was pricey. The cocktails, a regular American breakfast, even ice cream, was way overpriced, but hey, that’s Hawaii I guess. Like others, I didn’t like the system for the limited number of pool and beach chairs. I tried to book the beach chairs in advance of our stay because we only had one night there, but no such luck. When I arrived, they were already booked. One morning, I woke up early and waited in a line to get two lounges by the pool. Not how I want to be spending my vacation to be honest. Also, the chairs weren’t particularly luxurious or clean.Back to our room- while it was huge and lovely, it was incredibly noisy. You could absolutely hear the street noise, including the early morning garbage truck visits. If you are sensitive to sound, I would stay way from city view rooms! The most hilarious thing about the room was the remote-controlled toilet. My mom and I had a good laugh about it!Final things to say- you can’t beat the location. I stayed at a hotel a little bit further away from the beach and I didn’t enjoy it as much. Waikiki Beach gets incredibly crowded but its beautiful. As for things to do other than suntanning, there were a bunch of restaurants in the area including the usual Cheesecake Factory etc. but I personally had a hard time finding good breakfast food options. I ended up visiting the Maui Brewing Company across the street and had an excellent eggs benny. The hotel is situated right on the main strip so lots of shopping as well.Despite some the negatives, I would likely still stay here again but now I know what to expect and can plan accordingly. Enjoy!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a great place to stay. Beach in the back and downtown shopping in the front. Love the history and the style of the property. Staff was first class. Will definitely be back. Coffee in the porch was nice. Pool area had nice views of the ocean.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We used to stay at Sheraton Waikiki during our last stays in Honolulu and wanted to try something new this time. We were very happy at Moana Surfrider with our partial ocean view room, although it was a rather dark room. Maybe you should invest some extra dollars for an ocean view room (the hotel is already quite expensive also in comparison to the Sheraton). The outside area with bar, restaurants and pool is very beautiful. But the pool is a bit small. The Moana Surfrider is a very relaxing place we can recommend!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic place to have lunch and drinks and dinner and drinks right on the beach and the food is fantastic excellent staff very pleasant and helpful once you go there you will definitely go back.Every day they have one or more wedding there just magical beautiful to see and not expensive

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It begins with the moment you get out of your taxi and are greeted with a tropical scented lei. The warm and friendly way everyone welcomes you is truly special. Everyone from the front desk, to waiters at the Beachouse and Beachbar to the housekeeping to the pool staff care about your stay being a happy one. They all make the extra effort so your stay will be enjoyable. A good example of this was on our last day, the staff managed to give us a late check out so we didn’t have to sit around at the airport and could enjoy the beach and tropical weather. Another example is the staff who do the tour, morning sunrise greeting, lei making, bracelet weaving and yoga instructor - each and everyone of them is welcoming, friendly and helpful.Yes, of course the hotel is beautiful, well maintained and takes you back to a simpler time of afternoon tea and relaxed dining under the beloved banyan tree while listening to musicians who relax you to the tunes of Hawaiian medleys but it is the true aloha spirit that makes your stay magical and unforgettable.The Moana Surfrider is everything you want your vacation to be; fun, relaxing and memorable. I am already counting the days till our next stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed here twice & both experiences were fantastic. I will not stay anywhere else, A little expensive but hey money well spent. The staff were great & very friendly. Walk straight out the door onto the strip & I was in heaven. Shop, shop,shop. We have stayed in both the Diamond & Banyan rooms, both were great. Banyan room was a little small but well maintained & modern. We ended our evening on the rocking chairs watching the world go by......

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Pros:- Beautiful, historic hotel, like the Coronado Hotel in San Diego- Convenient location- Helpful and friendly staffCons:- No hot tub*- Room was small (to be expected in a historic building, however—we stayed in the central part of the building, not one of the newer towers)- No fax machine or scanner in the "business center" for guests and the printer was out of order (probably not a problem for most)- Lounge chairs facing the ocean had to be reserved. This is not uncommon at Hawaiian resort hotels; however it was frustrating that there were no instructions (from a staff person or from a sign or handout) that could explain how to reserve, or the price, etc.Resort fees were around $35, and parking is $45 per night. In that neighborhood, I'm not sure how someone would park their car on their own.In general, this was a beautiful hotel, and it's very nice to be in Hawaii. If I were planning to visit a Hawaiian resort again, I'd go to one of the hotels in Maui's Kaanapali area. Whether you have kids or not, if you want to go to the beach / pool / beachside restaurants, Kaanapali is a more laid back area with a lot more space. Waikiki was like Las Vegas—tons of extremely high end shopping.*There was one upstairs, in the spa, that you could use if you paid extra to visit the spa

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: One of the nicest hotels on the main strip of the beach, great all round with a good family atmosphere, close to everything on the main beach. Old style that reminds me of the Peninsula Hotel in Hong Kong, breakfast was not great but everything else was.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice staff- beautiful ocean front room- beautiful hotel, but....too crowded to enjoy! Beach is very narrow, pool is very tight. Food is expensive and resort & parking fee makes it a costly added cost to an already very expensive hotel room.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We were there for four nights with another couple the place was wonderful. The staff was great. The food in the buffet was fantastic. The hotel was immaculate!!! The only negative thing I could say is that the rooms were very small.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic beachfront hotel in the centre of Waikiki. Staff were very attentive, rooms clean and spacious. Views were great, even from ‘partial ocean view’ rooms. Would definitely stay here again. Close to shopping and transport. Breakfasts were great.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We went over Easter and it was a disaster. Over crowded, no place to sit at pool or beach. They had an Easter egg hunt and during the hunt my 8 year old daughter was shoved to the ground by some other guests kid because the property thought it would be a good idea to hold it in a 10x10 area. Never again..

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at both the Sheratons this week. I really like the Westin property. Staff is very polite and professional. The rooms are a very nice size. The hotel room we stayed in was the 2nd floor historic building. It was suprising quiet. Actually I was suprised, because we were located central hotel. The beds were very comfortable. Great AC unit. Our bathroom did not have a tub. That was a bummer. But I thought the vibe of this hotel was more laid back. Which i like on Hawaii. The pool is small, but you have a nice beach in front. The location is central for Waikiki. It doesn't get better. What was even better we did the hotwire even though I have status at the Marriott, and only paid $167 plus resort fee. Mahalo!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: First time staying in Waikiki after spending a few days on the North end. The location of the hotel really couldn’t be better. Right in the hub of all the action from shopping, to restaurants, to the beach front. The rooms are on the small side since it is an old building but they are very nice and there’s always suites if you require more space. I’d suggest getting the breakfast included package as meals in general can be quite expensive and will add up. The buffet included was well more than you would ever need and was delicious.Beds were comfortable, service was friendly and we had a small balcony overlooking Waikiki Beach. A little extra $ for that but if you’re making the trek to Hawaii I imagine you’re going because you want to see the ocean. All in all, definitely an expensive place to stay but I’d have no problem doing it again. We’ll be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After comments stating this was "the place" to be for cocktails we went along. What is a plus is that the tables in the outside courtyard / beach bar are open, so you can turn up and get one. That said, the service was slow, the cocktails were poor and very overpriced for what they were. Over all a very under whelming experience and we did not go back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Could not fault this place. Fantastic location and the staff where incredible. Service was second to none. Room great - we got a partial view of the ocean and was just lovely and spacious. Staff were brilliant - we had breakfast included in our package - this was also fantastic. Concierge were extremely helpful too. Highly recommend. My father is 80 and struggles to walk and the location of this property to beach and near by shops/restaurants was great

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is my first visit to Hawaii, so we let a travel agent guide us in selecting which island(s) to go to and which hotels to stay at. The Moana is awesome! Right on the ocean with a perfect view of Diamond Head. The service was great from all the staff. You could hear the entertainment at the outside bar, but it always stopped early enough so it didn’t interrupt sleeping. Go! You won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awful service. Our server was super grumpy, he shared that he was on meds due to a stomach virus... But working. There was a termite in my mother's food. When telling the said server, he was not surprised and brushed it off! We also had to shout for the server several times as he was talking to Co workers. Service was abhorable. Not pleasant whatsoever.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is awesome. Aside from a great location, the staff is on point. Everyone was so pleasant to interact with and made an effort to take care of us while we were there. Our room was beautiful, spacious and offered a fantastic view of the beach. Sampson at the front desk was great! You can't beat the location as it is positioned perfectly on the beautiful beach of Waikiki and also right in the heart of all the amazing shopping and restaurants. You get the beach vibe and the busy city experience all in one. The outdoor setting is spectacular and I loved the live music daily. My favorite thing to do was just sit at one of the tables outside at sunset while listening to the live music and sipping a cocktail. Truly what I want in a beach vacation. It's also a great place to take a surf lesson or catamaran cruise because they are right in front of the resort. I would recommend it more for couples and adults. It is not geared towards children, which I liked. However, others may wish there was a larger pool and more children's activities. My only complaint was no hot tub available outside of the spa.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful hotel, if you like the Hotel Del on Coronado island you will love this hotel! Wonderful location if you like to dine and shop as well as beaching it! You have a gorgeous beach on one side and high end shopping and dining on the other!
user_name:
Kristi K
Wildwood Crest, New Jersey

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: we have stayed here and the staff are fantastic the place is amazing. only thing is they have a production line of Asian weddings.we had a ocean view and it was fantastic the buffet breakfast is awesome and the rocking chairs out the front are great to relax. they had a band play and it was a great atmosphere and everyone enjoyed the performance .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Visited on 20th April 2018. Got a free upgrade to an Ocean View Suite. All I will say is wow! Magnificent suite, view to die for. Friendly and helpful staff. Can honestly say it could not have been improved in any way. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The staff was very friendly, very professional, very efficient. The scent in the air was heavenly, very welcoming. Wonderful to return to after a day of touring. The BEACH BAR!!!! The drinks are pricey, yet, very very good! I loved the kal-bi appetizers. It's sometimes hard to get a table, yet, great once you get one. The musicians are very accommodating & they take requests. The room we stayed in was 2083. It was large, had a great view, a college dorm size refridgerator......the bathroom had a pleasant surprise! I'll let you find it for yourself. :)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying in the historic and beautiful hotel for 2 days. The staff, including the front desk and housekeeping staff were helpful, responsive and friendly. The food, the amazing view from my 5th Floor ocean view room was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was beautiful and we had the best stay. Clean, tidy, amazing views from ocean view rooms. Staff were friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. The room was spacious and the shower was great. The location is ideal and the hotel facilities are excellent.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great view of beach from our balcony! Located close to restaurants and shops but on the beach. Relaxing stay. Good food on site. Self parking lot is not on site but not far away. Check in can be crowded.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We didn't stay here but had breakfast and a dinner here. Food was absolutely delicious but sizes were way too big. Should have asked for a smaller serve but a lot of places in Oahu serve gigantic servings. Wait staff weren't as friendly as other places, but staff in the foyer were excellent. we booked all our tours here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider offers the best of both worlds as it puts you right on the beach but also steps from the city and great restaurants and shops. The Westin heavenly beds were wonderful and we enjoyed listening to the waves on our balcony. Service at the Beachhouse and the Beach Bar was impeccable. We also enjoyed the perfect surf conditions and the warm encouragement of our instructor, Sean and his crew. Honolulu coffee offered an amazing "Hawaiian latte" and protein bites that powered us for Koko Head and Diamond Head trail hiking - recommendations from our concierge with stunning views of the island. Lots of weddings and we can see why - a gem.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very nice support from friendly people, the room in a good condition, clean, unfortunately there is no staircase from the 3rd to the lobby, so always wait for the elevator. Windows not really good noise-insulated, like usually in old hotels. Breakfast is really good, I did not checked the buffet (36$), but the menu is quite good, the service also.In fact, if your looking for a charming hotel with historic flair and with high standart, this is the right place.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for three nights at the end of our honeymoon last week. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and we love old hotels with character. However that's where the good things end. The rooms are so tiny - bathroom especially. It's so tiny that you have to put your make-up bag on the toilet seat while doing your make-up as there is nowhere else to put it! Rooms are noisy & this shouldn't happen in a modern hotel. The people in the room next door got home at 1 am & we could hear all of their conversation! The furnishing isn't great and our head board had lumps all through it. This hotel isn't cheap! At home we could've got a five star hotel for half of what we paid at the moana. Also our fridge kept making this banging noise every 20 mins so we ended up switching it off so we could sleep... never again.
user_name:
Jessica V
Auckland Central, New Zealand

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this place. Whenever I come to Oahu, I stay at either (in this order): 1. Royal Hawaiian 2. Sheraton Waikiki3. Westin Moana4. Outrigger Waikiki BeachThese are all nearly equally awesome hotels that out-rival just about every other hotel on this island. Westin has a relaxed air about it with the world famous banyan bar, rocking chairs outside, beachfront, central location, huge gym, and ocean front balconies. I love this place. Cons: Holy hell it's expensive. And there's no Hot Tub. I highly recommend this hotel. I will stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had my wedding at the Moana Surfrider and from start to finish the staff at the Moana Surfrider was amazing.Our catering manager was so quick to respond to my many, many questions/emails and she took the time out of her busy day to take us around the property and show us the venue options available for weddings. The Diamond Lawn is so beautiful facing the ocean, but with hedges that were high enough to block out the many people lying down and walking on the beach. The ballroom was the perfect for our guest count, and is a beautiful intimate location away from the daily hotel foot traffic, with a foyer area to host cocktail hour. We knew this was the place where we wanted to get married!We stayed at the Moana Surfrider for the weekend of the wedding and the staff was always so friendly and helpful. As soon as we arrived, the valets and hotel staff offered to help us carry all of our stuff up to our suite in the tower wing. We were even greeted with chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne upon our arrival to the room. The suite was clean, spacious, and had a fantastic view of the ocean from the balcony. It was the perfect space for me and my bridesmaids to get ready in.The day of the wedding couldn't have been more perfect. Our catering manager was around on the day of the wedding to make sure everything was progressing smoothly and that the catering staff was taking care of us. She made sure to introduce us to our banquet captain aoih s well so if we had any questions we knew who to contact. There were a couple mix-ups with the number of seats at a table but those issues were resolved immediately once the staff was notified. No biggie. The banquet captain also came to find me a couple times throughout to night to make sure that everything was going okay. The food for our buffet was delicious; I still get compliments from family and friends on how delicious the food was! The staff was so efficient on making sure that all the guests were having a great time and that the tables were cleared and drinks refilled/replenished in a timely manner.Overall it was a really great experience having our wedding with the Moana Surfrider! It truly is a beautiful and historic piece in the heart of Waikiki!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We attended a private function, lunch buffet at the Moana Surfrider last week. Absolutely the best tasting food for a large group: beef, chicken, fish with side dishes , including a unique pineapple cole slaw. The dessert tray offered an array of options. Our server, Constansa ( sorry if I mispelled her name) was amazing: our ice tea glasses and coffee cups were constantly refilled. The servers’ smiles and upbeat personalities kept everyone happy.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful resort; open and breezy feel with a warm and attentive staff. Breakfast views on the veranda made me feel like I was in Paradise; thank you Alissa and Stanley for making us feel so welcome. Yoga by the beach with Crystal was an amazing experience. Daily entertainment by the bar was brilliant. Best nights sleeps listening to the the surf on comfy beds. A minor suggestion for the management: switch to recyclable cups please for the lovely refreshments that are offered throughout the resort. Otherwise, big Thank you, Moana Surfrider for helping us celebrate our 25th anniversary and making our first trip to Hawaii so memorable. We’re keeping you on our bucket list because we hope to return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent the past 7 nights at this Hotel and this was our 2nd stay.Based on our previous visit a few years back we were really looking forward to our return.Our memories of our stay are a distant memory as the Hotel has lost its way.Let’s talk service - or lack of;The entire hotel seems to be very understaffed. At reception you wait for ages to get served and once you end up getting to the front of the line the lack of friendly service awaits you, the reception staff are very transactional and at no time did any of the staff ask how our stay was gong and and check out no mention of how was your stay or any thing nice - just would you like the charges to be charged to the credit card on file - what a lasting memory!!Pool SideThe lack of staff around the pool made it very difficult to order food or drinks - so many times we just had to go and order at the bar but in the end it was just easier to go outside and bring back a nice salad or sandwich from the many options outside the hotel at a much higher quality. Another frustrating element of the pool food and beverage is that very time your food order arrived ended up with no cutlery and napkins and then had to wait again whilst your food goes cold. The pool side area is never cleaned in the evening with sand everywhere - one would expect the entire pool area is cleaned nightly - it is not.The pool attendants looking after the towels and cabana bookings were the only friendly team throughout the entire hotel - the rest need to go to service training or retire!!Food and Beverage Overall food and beverage quality very poor. Poolside food lacked quality and consistency and always delivered without cutlery and napkins - food better described as something you would get from a cheap takeaway like IHOP but at a premium price.We had dinner at the Beachhouse - what a disappointment.
