The hotel talks up the chefs and the food, whilst the food was OK not worth it for what you pay by any means to to be honest the dinner we had the previous evening at the Yard House was far superior and the service far far friendlier and more efficient. Again another example of a lack of staff in this outlet and then the male staff member who served us was very transactional - not sincere and gruff! We expected much more but it is clear this hotel restaurant survives on tourists who dine 1 night only - they would not survive in a normal competitive environment. The beach front garden bar is filthy - I encourage the management to take a close look at the bar , the Mould under the beer taps as a start. Look at the ceiling in the bar with the dirt and cobwebs. All drinks are served in cheap plastic take away cups and cheap cocktail mixers are used - Similar to those used on cruise ships.Whilst the location is wonderful sitting under the big tree looking to the ocean surrounded by the historic building - again similar to the Beachhouse restaurant , the bar only survives due to its location and not because of great service and quality innovative beverages. Very unfriendly bar staff.The leased out cafe at the front of the Hotel served great coffee and breakfast items - nice staff and great coffee - can highly recommend.RoomsRooms are getting tired and old and need a refurbishment. Our room was not particularly clean - for the premium price and being a Westin we expect better.Housekeeping go though the motions of the bare minimum. Soaps, body wash and cups not always replenished daily - another example of inconsistent service.Cleanliness The place is not clean - whilst I get it that this place is busy very day there is no round the clock cleaning and maintenance program in place. This place falls very short of the expectations of a brand such as Westin.In summary this Hotel survives because of its location and the historic wing of the building, the poor service levels and lack of cleanliness and maintenance would not be accepted in other parts of the world. You never see any senior management present around the hotel and maybe this is part of the problem.Would we come back - probably not and during our stay we visited a number of other hotels in the same area that we will consider for our next stay.This place deserves better and let’s hope our feedback is taken constructively and improvements can be made to the benefit of future guests.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an amazing hotel. It is right on the ocean in the best location on Waikiki Beach. We were given leis upon arrival and the wonderful staff could not have been more accommodating. Our room was beautiful and the food was delicious. I am gluten free and their restaurants are knowledgeable and had lots of options including gluten free bread. I miss our mornings there drinking coffee and eating breakfast on the Veranda watching the early morning surfers. They had daily live entertainment by the pool and beautiful banyan tree. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Oceanfront. Sounds great. But newer part is set back so not much is visible. An ADA room is great if you need one but not if you don't. A lot of floor space and no place to put anything. $16 for a cocktail with very little liquor and $50 for 2 breakfasts - 1 yogurt and 1 oatmeal. And we can't' leave yet.f

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We love old, well maintained hotels! There is just something about the attention to detail and the old fashioned customer service attitude that cannot be beat. Our daughter was married at the Mount Washington in New Hampshire primarily because of the ambience and service. We have found its equal in this hotel. Simply wonderful!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall not a great way to spend a week. Exceptionally poor and arrogant service from the concierge desk to the check in staff. Breakfast was boring. The pool is the size of a bathtub overrun with noisy children. Not enough umbrellas, cabana rental up at 7??? On a holiday no less. This may be a premier hotel with lots of history but the Westin should not be happy this property. I would never go back to this property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Everything you’d expect at a hotel owned by Westin Group! Ideally situated in the central Waikiki area, and right on the beach for instant access to what Waikiki is all about. Rooms are well appointed offering all a 5 star hotel has to offer. The bed - unreal and just what you look forward to after a long day either on the beach, shopping or sightseeing. Very comfortable indeed. Old world charm has been maintained beautifully but equally and well blended with all the mod cons.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Room not assigned even after 4 hour wait. Found dirty underwear in drawer, no toiletries in bathroom. Supposedly an upgrade from Banyan room.Beach bar was unpleasant as waiter was very rude, apparently we were supposed to know that only 5+ guests could sit on the only free seating available. He said the sign had been taken in the morning, would think by 4pm he could have got another sign. Management said this was there policy, so I presume only 3+ guests can sit on tables of four. We were given free drinks and food, but even this was spoilt by the rude waiter pointing us out to his colleagues. Shame the service did not match the beautiful surroundings.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Apart from the location and setting with the history of the hotel and the banyan tree centerpiece, we were disappointed knowing how it was 15 years ago. Although we had some great encounters with staff, overall, we felt there is a need for significant employee training starting with the guest services operators and front desk. Simple courtesy, smiles, and clear response over the phone seem to have gone away. While the Banyan tree provides great shade on the really hot days, the pool is too small for the size of the hotel, and needs to have more space for those who want to lay out either in the shade or the sun. When it does rain, lines for breakfast can be at least 30 minutes. Our floor and the floor our friends stayed on smelled awful, the entire stay-like wet or moldy carpeting in the halls. Could be and should be much better, please

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I attended a luncheon for Waikiki Aquarium volunteers at the Sheraton Moana on Sunday, April 15th. The service was attentive, polite and friendly. The buffet included meat, chicken and fish dishes. All very tasty. Even the beef was tender. The salad choices were plentiful and varied. Desserts including mango cheesecake and carrot cake were most delicious.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surf Rider Hotel is a special hotel in Oahu . There really is no other place to stay on the island . The historical hotel has so much character and has an open & welcoming vibe . The staff is increbible at any angle you need . When I travel to Honolulu I always stay at the Moana because I know it will be a wonderful experience & my stay never disappoints ! The staff at the pool are so polite,. Lee , Mo , Gloria, Colin are always so happy and kind . Every time I visit the hotel they are there with their smiles and I always feel so welcomed and greeted like family . There is something to be said , when you have this unique experience on a vacation . I do want to mention Chris at the beach bar , she is so friendly and makes delicious beach cocktails Did I mention the location ? Location, location , location is perfect for shopping & dining and it is close to Diamond Head , which is a must to hike while on your vacation .Thank you Moana !!!you are the best of the best , until next time .The Hisatomi Family

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Every time Ive been to Hawaii I've stayed at the Moana. Some people like the old parts of the hotel...but not me. I always book a suite beach side high as possible... You can't take a picture from these rooms without it looking like a post card.There us always a Japanese wedding going on in the hotel gardens. And it so fun to watch the Japanese tourists paying for something with US currency... I saw one lady with at least $2000 in cash paying for breakfast for two...Enough? Enough?? Anyway, you go to the big island stay in the new part of the Moanna you'll be glad you're not in the old 1940's rooms!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was a one night stay for our family on the way to Maui. The hotel is located on a great sandy part of Waikiki Beach. There is an area on the second floor with a small Museum documenting local and hotel history. There are limited hours that presentations are given. Hotel guests can enjoy comfy chairs on the second floor balcony that provides fresh air to watch the street below unnoticed. Shopping at the larger chain stores and a variety of restaurants are within easy walking distance. We booked a Historic Banyon Room, Street View. However, a private balcony was very important to us and they are not available for many of the Banyon rooms. You cannot book one, you can only request it. After phoning a couple times to make sure my request was noted on my reservation, I did receive one with an Ocean View. There are VERY few in the historic section, and I think they might all have Ocean Views. The Historic rooms are small but we were still able to have a roll-away although it did leave us kinda cramped and would not be an option for a lengthy stay. Very clean property. A local coffee company is on site with early morning hours.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We loved our room’s view. It was great to have a small balcony to use. The hotel was lovely. We had a big problem with housekeeping. I left out a pair of David Yurman earrings and they went missing after the cleaning of the room. We left for the day and when we returned they were not on the piece of furniture where I had left them. I filed a report with the hotel and they quickly stated they were not found and marked it case closed. I didn’t even get a phone call or an apology from management. I cannot say I would trust staying here again. Also, the valet was extremely slow even though we called down ahead of time. Staff fell short of excellence, I feel real bad about posting this review because the hotel was so lovely. I feel it is my duty to warn guests to lock up belongings or take them with you. Thanks

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our full family has stayed at Surfrider numerous times together each for a week or more, with four rooms. Clearly despite the price we love the hotel it’s like a second home. Now you would think that regular repeat guests(11 of us) would have no problem getting the rooms we wanted when booking many months ahead?Well we discover that because we book through an Australian travel agent we don’t get the same benefit as people who book direct with the hotel. We wanted all rooms on same floor with at least two adjoining in diamond deluxe oceanfront. This has been the same on each occasion we have stayed. These were the requests given to our travel agent and reception. Reception advised no instructions had been acted on by them as they only preferenced direct bookings and gave no value to ‘third party bookings’. (Thru travel agents) WE WERE SHOCKED. The hotel did organise adjoining rooms on a different floor the next day but we had to move out early and the new rooms were unavailable for 5 hours later. Hotel didn’t bend over to help. Oh btw we are spg members but that was not recorded with the booking or after checkin when our number was provided. So we missed out on those benefits. We have given this hotel five stars many times but thought this was poor business management. It is annoying when a provider you like let’s you down. Ps. The rooms are a bit shabby and the food & breakfast has not changed for years.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My spouse and I attended a luncheon on the 3rd floor ballroom on Sunday as guests for the Waikiki Aquarium Volunteer Appreciation Luncheon. The meal consisted of delicious steak, fish, chicken, roasted veggies, rice, roasted potatoes, salad, rolls,and assorted pastries. The staff were friendly and attentive. The ballroom was a perfect venue for this event. We look forward to returning next year. Thank you so much.Phil and Paulette Thomas

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I generally review very few of the places we stay. And I always strive to find exceptional properties wherever we go. We stayed in a Tower Premier Oceanfront suite. Wow! First, the hotel entry is absolutely charming & seems to be in impeccable condition. Steps to the pool. Steps to the beach (without crossing the street). Steps to shopping. Excellent location. The restaurant was very good with a terrific view. We stayed in Waikiki for a week and tried it once each for all three meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner). Our suite was, at least for us, a possible all-time favorite. Two balconies, with beautiful views of the beach & Diamond Head. Comfortable furniture. Great bathroom. A mini-fridge that kept things cold! Excellent maid service. Actually, the service everywhere was exceptional. We had dinner & shopped in & near a variety of other hotels in Waikiki. If I go back to Oahu, this is simply where I'd stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Absolut perfect service at arrival, nice upgrade as a SPG Member, perfectly ckean room, central location. Directly on Waikiki Beach. Perfect Bars with a lovely very flexible service. Next time in Honolulu means next time at Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed in an Ocean view Banyan room. The room was small, but beautiful. The high ceilings made it feel bigger than it was. The rom was absolutely fantastic. The bed was possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in at a hotel. Others have complained that the grounds were too crowded. We did not experience that. True, the lobby was always busy, but not really a problem. Remember, you are staying in Waikiki. Go elsewhere if you want complete isolation. The pool area was nice, but small. I think the hotel could develop some stricter guidelines to ensure as many customers get to enjoy the lounge chairs as possible. Sadly, we did see lounge chairs with towels on them without people for looooong periods of time. The price was high for us, but we are so glad we were able to experience the beautiful Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Right in the heart of Waikiki, beautiful charming and elegant hotel. Mostly everything here is pricey, but worth it. Enjoying live music in the evening with couple glasses of cocktails before heading out into the night. Perfect spot to unwind.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and i were embarking on a 2 week tour of Hawaii. Our agent selected this location for 5 nights to begin our adventure before joining the cruise and we were delighted with the ocean view room chosen. The location was ideal where we were right on the beach and close to nearby shopping/restaurants. The service was great and the food delightful

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When the time came to leave this wonderful place, I wanted to lock myself in the hotel room and live there forever! My husband and I spent 6 nights at The Moana Surfrider but it felt much longer as time just seemed to slowed down as we enjoyed every minute there. The staff are amazing, very warm and friendly. The other people staying at the hotel are very friendly too, we always spoke to people in the lift, asking each other where they were from and comparing flight times. I purposely chose this hotel to celebrate my 50th birthday and will have amazing memories to cherish. I have already started saving for my next trip back there.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The banyan tree is amazing to sit under. The rooms were small but nice. The breakfast buffet was fabulous! Everyday we stepped out of the hotel onto Waikiki beach. Worth every penny. I would recommend that you eat one night at Duke's and ride on the outrigger canoe right in front of the hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel property is beautiful and has a lovely historic feel to it. Waikiki Beach is a few steps away and the property backs onto it. We stayed there 4 days. My beef with the Moana Surfrider is the service. We received either no information or incorrect information from the concierge and the reception desk on what I would consider to be basic information. They offer a 35% discount on some meals but NOBODY could explain the exceptions - not even the front desk supervisor. The biggest complaint I have is that after our supposed "final" bill was settled and I received verbal confirmation that this was the final total, additional charges were added to my Visa. I called the hotel when I returned home to get an explanation. I left my name and telephone number and all relevant information. Guess what? My phone call was never returned. They may be completely legitimate charges, but all I asked for was an explanation which I did not receive. For this reason, I would NEVER stay there again. Very disappointing and not what I have come to expect from a Westin.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have longed to stay at the Surfrider since my first trip to Waikiki in 2011. This year we decided to splash out and treat ourselves to a stay here. Sadly I was disappointed, it didn’t live up to my expectations. Although I am still glad we stayed I would look elsewhere in future. The good: the hotel is beautiful and all the public areas are well maintained and timelessly elegant. The location is probably the best in Waikiki but you have to pay extra for those views...worth upgrading to oceanfront room if that’s what you’re after. Rooms are clean and modern in the newer tower blocks. The bad: rooms are small and walls are paper thin, we could hear our neighbors conversations. Bathrooms are very small. Paper cups for your in room coffee (which leak!). No friendly traditional Hawaiian welcome on arrival which I’ve experienced at other more reasonably priced hotels. Tiny pool area - though forgivable seeing as you are literally on Waikiki beach. Very busy with non guests enjoying the public areas. Pricey ‘resort fee’ (though a standard thing on the islands it still annoys me to pay for things that should just be included as standard as you can’t ‘opt out’) This hotel still has enough charm to keep me loving it but the owners could be doing so much more for their guests. all the good points about this hotel - the banyan tree, rocking chairs on the veranda, the beach front bar, the lovely restaurant...are all public areas so why on earth would you pay the prices to stay here for a simply average experience... I love the surfrider for the old Hawaii it represents but perhaps Westin need to up their game in offering a service that matches this beautiful hotels charm.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful place to say for spring break. Nice historical hotel. Nice staff, great Coffee shop attached to the property. We never had a meal at the hotel so i cant rate the food. Its in a great location on the beach and in the city where there are plenty of places to eat. DUKES at the outgiger next door had hood food. One night we eat at the "on top of wikikee" revolving restaurant. Good food but $$$. Like most of Hawaii don't come here on a budget, stress about the credit card bill when you get home. Enjoy the time your here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We found the service staff in the Beach Club brutal. We asked a question and the server told us to “read the sign”, instead of politely answering the question. Do not waste a penny on that added feature. Use your money at the restaurants. Much better customer care. I found their candour so poor. I requested a refund and got one without question. The hotel is pretty, but the pool is tiny, the rooms are average at best, and the beach is packed. 30 years of going to Maui. No contest. Wouldn’t come back. Definitely not to this hotel. Must be a top down issue in management. The employees are not customer centric. I’ve never had a bad experience at a Westin. This one needs major work.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently returned from Hawaii where we stayed at the Moana Surfrider in Waikiki. The location was superb and we were expecting something special.The cost was in excess of AU$450.00 per night after the compulsory nightly room tax. (This did not include breakfast.) Now for this you’d think the room would be pretty good...... It was disappointing. Small room, one chair , no table , no view, cardboard cups for tea and coffee, Cheap and Nasty Toilet Paper. I have experienced better equipped rooms in 2 star hotels out in the bush. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower worked , but that was all that can be said. For the positive, good location and the common areas looked good and the beach access superb, but this was available to anyone, not just the Hotel guests. In a nutshell, a rather ordinary Hotel and we will probably look elsewhere on our next trip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for a week and had the most incredible time. The hotel was gorgeous and had a really nice and relaxed feel to it. They have rocking chairs on the deck and this was a fabulous touch as you just watch the world go buy and people watch!We stayed on the 19th floor and our view was just incredible. We sat out on our balcony and watched the surfers every morning and afternoon before we got ready to go out.The room we had was big and comfortable and the bed was really comfy.The pool area is quite small and not that many sun loungers by the pool so if you want to sunbathe I would go there quick! The cocktails were delicious and nothing was ever too much for the wait staff or bartenders around the pool side.We hired a car for a couple of days and drove around the island of Oahu.. we would highly recommend doing this as it was a great way to see the beautiful scenery and the best look out points! We had a convertible Ford Mustang and it was just great fun!We had booked to go on a chefs luau and this was lots of fun, drinks, buffet, music and dancing. It was a really nice way to understand a bit more about Hawaii and the Polynesian culture and people.We had a scuba diving trip booked and we went out to a turtle cleaning station.. this was incredible and we got so close to the turtles too! Definitely worth doing!All in all a fabulous holiday and we would go back again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location of this hotel is perfect, right on the beach, but the hotel beachfront is quite small so beach beds are in short supply, they are also $50 a day (as at March 2018). You can sit by the pool for no charge, but the pool is small and chairs again are limited. However, the hotel itself is lovely and the rooms were comfortable and clean. We had a room in the tower overlooking the beach, with its balcony we were able to sit and watch people surf all day long if we wanted.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Suppose to spend 9 nights in total and checked out on the 3rd night, everything about this hotel results in a long queue, being on hold for an eternity with excuse after excuse , bar some of the breakfast staff it’s obvious hotel staff aren’t trained properly.Breakfast plates were dirty on more than one occasion , went and raised three times Food options for kids terrible , no variety and asked to heat food for our 2yr old bought from outside and to no avail.Pool is tiny again not for kids and pool bar leaves a lot be desired and what is worse is being told to line up from 7am to “attempt”’to get a pool chair and worse still for the beach which is a tiny amount allocated to hotel and again an impossible task to get , never experienced such a system in all the SPG hotels I’ve stayed as a platinum guest.Not sure how they get their category 6 rating but if they had a look at some of their European properties they would be highly embarrassed.Would never stay there again and advise for families with young kids you have better options elsewhere.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It is gorgeous, inside and out. It has a wonderful outdoor cafe in back, right at the beach. Steeped in history, this hotel offers an interesting tour. It was every Thursday when we were there. If you appreciate old world charm ask for a room in the original building. They have a more modern tower, I think built in the 1960's. The rooms in the tower are VERY nice, but they lack that old world charm. The rooms in the original building will take you back in time.
user_location: Long Island, a sister island to the Hawaiian chain
user_name:
maikai-guy
Long Island, a sister island to the Hawaiian chain

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel is very colonial style and very comfortable. Only criticism would be that for a hotel of this size there were very few sun beds which would always have towels on them by 7am. Other beds on the beach were chargeable which seemed unfair.The safe in our room did not work and inspite of an engineer visiting and promising to come back to fix it whilst we were out, or leave a message as to the progress, no more was heard! We did comment on this on checking out and to be fair, they were very apologetic and removed the breakfast from our bill. Food and drink were very good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an oceanside room and enjoyed hearing the surf at night. Our package includes breakfast and happy hour in the beach club. Self parking is fairly easy, though expensive. The one down side is the small pool that closes at 6 pm.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am pleased to take the time to write this review of the Moana Surfrider Resort & Spa. You should know I am a frequent traveler staying in hotels upwards of 15 weeks a year. This trip was significant for myself and my wife as it was our first 7+ day trip in twenty-four (24) years with out our children. Let me first state that I cannot express enough how well run this Westin property is. Every (and I mean every) interaction we had with the staff from the bell staff, concierge, front desk, spa, wait-staff, pool staff, phone operators, cleaning staff, and bartenders was simply topnotch professional and courteous! It seemed every time we required assistance or guidance the staff at the Moana had the solution. More impressive yet was this hotel was extremely busy and sold-out during our entire stay. Yet you would have never known given the quick cheerful responses. We stayed in the Historical Wing, which was stunningly beautiful and well maintained. It is the perfect balance between early Victorian architecture and modern amenities. Our room was spacious and the view spectacular. Somehow our room was always cleaned without ever seeing the maid service. We would simply come back from going out to breakfast or spending time at the beach and the room was clean and replenished. The bell staff helped in many ways throughout the week. The pool staff was also very helpful and the bartenders were very pleasant. As an example, my wife and I had made a local reservation outside the hotel although missed it due to traffic driving back from the North Shore. I called the concierge desk and spoke with "Shawn". I explained this was supposed to be our anniversary dinner. Rather than connect me to the restaurant (Beachhouse) hostess, Shawn took the initiative to personally walk over and arrange a table for us. He was successful at getting us a table for two at sunset. Again the food and service was excellent and each server congratulated us on our anniversary. Throughout the days and evenings there was always wonderful live Hawaiian musicians playing under the banyan tree. This was soooo very soothing. We took some time to walk along the shoreline visiting a several other properties and I can tell you they all pale in comparison to the atmosphere you get underneath that amazing banyan tree at the Moana. On our last day we requested a late checkout as our flight did not leave until 8PM. The hotel was only able to give us an extra 2 hours as they were very busy. However, they offered us free 1 hour "hospitatality room" to shower and get ready. That way we were able to fully enjoy the hotel and beach for the lion share of the day and still freshen up prior to our departure. My sincere appreciation to the management and the staff for operating such a fine property. You should be all very proud of how well run the Moana Surfrider is. We cannot wait to return!Sincerely,Todd Mackey

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you wish to travel to the busy Waikiki area, you must stay here. The Moana Surfrider is old style elegance at its best. The view, service and style are unparalleled and not to be missed. Blow the budget, if necessary, and do not miss this opportunity.
user_name:
Intrepidtravelerny
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Visited here to eat dinner and was told when we booked, we wouldn't be near the beach as they were booked in that area. Arrived to receive and amazing table on the beach and the most awesome service from Brandon, along with amazing views and hawaiian music. The food was nice and the cocktails awesome!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: BEST LOCATION! GREAT ENTERTAINMENT TOO! Glad to be back and hope to go again soon. We love this beautiful hotel. The location is fantastic. The best beach is directly in front of you and there is great food all around you! The hotel itself has wonderful food, but Dukes is right nest door and Michelle's is an easy walk through the park. The biggest drawback is the pool and the lack of loungers!!! Get up early to save a seat!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I chose this hotel for our seven night stay due to the location (beach frontage and main street access). Overall we had a comfortable and enjoyable stay, complete with friendly staff and a pleasant vibe in all areas of the hotel, including the downstairs lobby and rocking chairs on the veranda, where we sat to read and watch the world go by a few times due to rainy weather! The only thing stopping me giving this hotel a five star “excellent” rating is the price per room, for what you get. Although the rooms were clean and with exceptionally comfortable beds, they were on the small side, and when paying $500 plus a night, you do expect higher standard of room. For example our room overlooked a roof top and the street, and was very small, and although it must have been renovated at some point in recent years, it still felt a little tired. You definitely pay for hotel location in Waikiki! That being said, location it does have and we were pleased with our choice of hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I are staying at the Moana Surfrider for a couple of nights before heading to Maui. The hotel is beautiful, and his storage. We like it very much. However, this review concerns one of the managers at the Moana, Brandon Claypool.Mr. Claypool is the kind of person who feels like an old friend, even if you have only met recently. He is warm and welcoming and an excellent ambassador for the hotel. Not only is he friendly and engaging, he understands customer service and personal relationships and is superlative at both. He is a credit to the institution and invaluable for customer satisfaction. The Moana is lucky to have him and hopefully his superiors understand this. People like him create repeat business and sparkling referrals.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I had wanted to stay here for years and we finally booked for March. It exceeded all expectations and we couldn't have loved it more. Our room had a balcony and the view was spectacular. We added the beach club access, which was well worth it. Delicious breakfast options (we loved the oatmeal) and nice to go down for happy hour too. The location can't be beat. We are already planning out next trip and can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed for 6 nights, during a trip to the Hawaiian Islands.The staff are exceptional and we where treated exceptionally on all occasions.The banyan tree and its bar and food area are so relaxing.Entertainment was great and rooms really comfortable and well serviced.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My daughter and I booked a package holiday at the Surfrider (including a discount Jetstar fare which was not the best part). Upon arrival we found our budget room was in the older part of the hotel, so we upgraded, for a small cost, to the tower. This was a good move! Our ‘city view’ room ended up having a wonderful view of the sea. Our beds were so comfortable and we had the most wonderful stay. Just to be able to rock on the front verandah and eat under the Banyan Tree was a joy. Waking up early and going to the pool at 7 am to snag a sun lounge was a bit of a bummer but this is what happens in beach resorts. The daily resort charge seems like a rort but all of the major beachfront hotels charge this now. The character and beauty of the Surfrider is unparalleled in Waikiki. Not sure if we will be willing to pay the high price to stay here on a regular basis but it was certainly a lovely experience to be here. If you can afford to stay here I definitely recommend it as a beautiful and comfortable place to be.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Since our last visit, we wanted to experience old Hawaii by staying at the Moana Surfrider. We were not disappointed. Everything from the magnificent Banyan tree to the rocking chairs on the many beautiful verandas, and the live evening music met our expectations. There was a laid back feeling to the Moana that we appreciated - truly felt like stepping back in time. However, as you might expect, you definitely pay for the elegance and history.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A little over a year ago, when we were exploring wedding venue options, we had an opportunity to stay at the Moana Surfrider, and right off the bat, we fell in love with the hotel, and it’s old world charm. My wife’s parents accompanied us on that trip, and despite having visited a number of wedding venues on Oahu, our conversations kept circling back to the Moana Surfrider. It’s such a beautiful hotel, right on Waikiki Beach and centrally located to virtually anything you could want to do in Honolulu, including high-end shopping and access to restaurants that fit almost any budget. My wife’s parents, and (later on) our guests, just loved being able to walk out of the hotel, go window shopping, find someplace to eat, come back to the hotel and then just lay on the beach or right beside the pool. In fact, we’ve had some guests who have been to Hawaii numerous times, on several different islands, and upon staying at the hotel, tell us afterward that the Moana Surfrider is their new go-to hotel of choice on Honolulu.Our event sales manager, Kelli Kajiwara, was the consummate professional. In planning the wedding from the mainland, there were a lot of phone calls and emails. Kelli's responses were prompt, well-thought-out, and extremely polite, warm and friendly. Naturally, in planning a big event such as a wedding, there’s a lot of back and forth in terms of balancing what we envisioned for our wedding versus what the hotel has established in terms of policies and procedures, but Kelli did a fantastic job navigating us through all of the considerations, and the concessions made on either side, felt like a win-win. On the day of our wedding, it just poured and poured. (We’ve been told this is considered an enormous blessing in Hawaiian culture.) Our ceremony was initially supposed to be outside on the Diamond Lawn & Terrace, but on account of the rain, the ceremony was moved upstairs to the Rooftop Garden room, which my wife and I were completely pleased with as a backup option. We had 88 guests, and while space was limited, it did not feel, at all, too cramped. Kelli and her team did an excellent job ensuring our guests made it to the right spot. Everything looked beautiful. Our reception was held in the Beachhouse, and with 88 guests, a full buffet, DJ table, cake table and photo booth, the space felt spacious, high-class, and certainly made a positive impression with our guests. Immediately following our wedding, and the days after that, we’ve had so guests tell us it’s one of the best weddings they’ve been to. Sure, some of our guests might just be flattering us. However, many of the comments came from individuals that we’ve known to be very blunt and tended not to sugarcoat their views. Some common themes that came up in discussions, post-wedding, were how everything felt, “beautiful,” “classy,” “magical,” and how “the attention to detail was phenomenal.” Guests told us how much they enjoyed the food. A few commented how, in their opinions, the food was, “the best wedding food they’ve ever had.” Others loved the flow and pacing of the ceremony and reception. Everything seemed to flow naturally from one thing to the next. We did not receive any comments regarding the staff from our guests, which I suppose is a good thing, but from what we observed, the staff appeared to be so warm and hospitable. My wife and I sincerely appreciated how attentive the hotel employees were to us and we loved being showered with so many congratulatory comments by the staff… it made our day feel extra special. All-in-all, Kelli and the entire Moana Surfrider staff were just fantastic. Even beyond our wedding day, the service at the hotel is impeccable. We’ve had so many great interactions, whether it be minute or substantial, the customer service at the hotel is top-notch. We look forward to coming back to the Moana Surfrider for many years to come.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great hotel perfectly located on Waikiki beachfront. Restaurants serve great quality food Walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants Staff are very friendly and helpful.Very difficult to get a sunbed around the pool as insufficient beds for number of guests Are able to book a sunbed for $50 a day on the beach the day before with option to cancel prior to 9am. Was handy to cancel with poor weather one day Only downside is unable to be served alcohol on the beach but I believe it’s government policy

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Hasn’t changed a lot in 17 years we were glad to find, well except everything is pricier! Oceanfront room was good, no complaints. Cleaning staff very efficient and beach bar was good. Enjoy that yoga is offered every day and liked the beach umbrella rental. Very pretty views and plenty to do.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our one week stay with the Moana Surfrider started off poorly due to our travel agents errors, the front desk check in girl was very helpful and assisted us greatly to get our ocean front room at a great rate (better than booking from home). The room was more comfortable than we expected. The location is unbeatable for access to the beach and all the local attractions.The Banyan Tree courtyard and bar is an excellent place to relax at the end of the day with a cool drink and a variety of bar foods available.The pool is too small for such a large facililty but with beach only a few steps away that is forgivable and a much better option.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the money you pay to stay at the Surfrider the location is amazing buy our room looked straight at other rooms and a concrete slab with no balcony. When we asked about an upgrade which we where happy to pay a reasonable price for we where told $150 extra per night!!!! See pic of the outlook from our window. Also watch the prices you are charged for tours.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our third time having dinner at the Moana Surfrider. First the hotel is simply gorgeous. Drinks by the banyan tree are a must. We had dinner on the porch. The dinner and drinks were exquisite but the setting on the porch is unbelievable. I would go there on any trip to Oahu.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Right in the heart of Waikiki, 5 stars all around.Excelent Service if i ever needed anything they were there and super friendly. Part ocean view room was great very nicely updated. Room and Bathroom were very clean.. Beach bar is great..

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is a classic beauty. Beautiful lobby, with live, easy listening piano (Thursday to Saturday), and a nice outdoor lounge area just outside the lobby (Vintage 1911). Went on a 2-week Vacation Package. Room was in the Diamond Wing. View was awesome, but lanai was too narrow to fit the chairs outside the sliding doors. Soundproofing is poor Early risers on one side (5:30 am), and late nighters on the other (2 or 3 am). Small bathroom counter, limited storage. Hotel staff went on strike on day, so no beach bar, no restaurant and no cleaning services except by special request. Elevator was broken down on four different days, had to use service elevator. All in all, the hotel didn't live up to our expectations based on the cost. Big resort fee, limited value.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Hotel has class and history combined. We stayed for a week prior to Christmas 2017. Room, service and location could not be bettered. Service from the staff on the beach gets special mention (towel hire and wait staff). They attend to your every need at the cabanas. Ditto the expert bar staff under the trees. Would go back in a minute.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is situated right in the heart of Waikiki so it is your choice to shop til you drop, hang out by Waikiki beach or walk around to explore! Love the room ocean view room with spacious lanai where you can just watch the sunrise or sunset. This is a great hotel if you want to combine business and leisure in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Returned from our 14th. Stay at historic elegant luxury hotel-the rooms in the Tower are good sized, well furnished, room with fantastic view of the historic courtyard ,the Banyan tree towering over, view of the beach and the Diamond Head .The customer service of this hotel is the best-I am comparing it with Westin Maui Resort, Royal Hawaiian-the Guest Services, Concierges, the pool staff are absolutely superb-friendly, pleasant, helpful! Special thanks to Roxanne Hashim and I Steven Yim.Beach House, Veranda have really become fine dining establishments.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I literally can't say enough amazing things about this hotel! I am a frequent visitor and the entire staff (management, front desk, valet, servers, etc.) seems to go above and beyond to make my stay as wonderful as possible. Michael is an incredible manager and has made me as well as my family and friends that have visited with me feel like a million bucks. The special treatment is priceless, then there's the beauty of the hotel, which is unlike anything I've ever experienced. The outdoor patio with the historic banyan tree is my "happy place" and the Beach Club lounge is frankly luxurious and covers my various vacation needs... food, drinks and a view. There is a reason (or many reasons) I keep going back to this same hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Overall, great place to stay! Spent 4 nights here. Hard to beat a hotel built around a banyan tree. Beautiful patio, great ambiance, really enjoyed drinking mai tai's in the rocking chairs watching the wave roll in. Staying at the Moana Surfrider has now been scratched from our bucket list!The room was "cozy", not large, in the historical section (415). Had a sliver of view of the ocean, great view of patio, but didn't spend alot of time in it, so no problem. The pool is adequate, and the chair and umbrella all day rental was good at $55. Food service was very good, very attentive. No alcohol tho as the lounge chairs were on the beach and not the hotel property. Really enjoyed the round bar by pool. Good bartenders, good mai tai's. Can't beat the view of Diamond Head and ocean. I can't speak of the food as we ate somewhere else every day. Too many restaurants on the island to stay at hotel restaurant. Front desk and maid service staff was excellent. I highly recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved this elegant hotel. Stayed for 8 days and I must say it was an awesome experience.We stayed in the Tower Suite room 395. For the price the room was average in amenities and size. We had a room overlooking the beach and a partial Diamond Head view. The room had a balcony in the bedroom and living room and was nice to look out and see the water. Being on the third floor it was a bit noisy as the Outrigger Hotel was next door and had plenty of evening activities which we heard until 10pm. Our room came with access to the beach club which served its purpose. The Beach Club breakfast did not have an omelette station or eggs to order but there were other items to compensate for this. The pool is indeed quite small, but with the ocean just a few feet away, I felt there was no need for a gigantic pool. We did splurge and rented a cabana which was wonderful (albeit expensive). Tours: My wife and I enjoyed three excursions. We did Pearl Harbor, Polynesian Cultural Center Luau, and an ATV tour on Kualoa Ranch. They were all wonderful, but we highly recommend the luau, and Kualoa Ranch. We rented a car and drove to Dole Plantation. The ice cream was fabulous! We took the train ride and was quite surprised how much we enjoyed it. This was our first time to Hawaii and we will return. Will more than likely visit another Island as Oahu/Honolulu really does not give one a sense of Hawaiian culture. It is very commercial, and seems like anywhere USA. If shopping is your thing, then you will love Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This beautiful, grand hotel has a great location on the sand, charm, elegance and a huge banyon tree in the courtyard. I enjoyed the big, wood rocking chairs, both in the courtyard, and at the front. A very simple thing, but I found it extraordinarily rewarding to relax and watch the people come and go. Wonderful staff and spacious and very comfortable room (in the tower.)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place we came across one night whilst out for dinnerin Waikiki. The atmospher was great. The entertainer was amazing. The service was exceptional along with the food and drinks. We were a table of 6 and just walked in the outside area and sat down. There are massive trees which were lit up at night and the entertainer sang all the latest songs.Will def be back on our next visit to Hawaii.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited the iconic BeachBar for cocktails, hawaiin ambience and sunsets on several occasions. This casual bar thrives with many international patrons. The cocktails are interesting and you can ask for one that is not on the menu. Only one gin based which was good and refreshing, the spirit aliquoits are very generous. TheHawaiin musicand perfoemers wee great, very professional and explained the origins of the songs whichnwas great. The Banyan tree is very impressive and full of geckos on close inspection.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I feel like I have just waken up from a dream. 10 Days in Hawaii, 2 of those nights we spent at Moana Surfrider. Fantastic setting, wonderful service, right on the main street on one side and the beach on the other. Would love to go back sometime. The only down side we found with Moana was the corridors had a musky smell, but I think that is just the climate, humidity and wet patrons walking through to their rooms.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel however it has its fair share of problems-Pool area- Some guests get looked after far better than others- pool lounges are reserved for them, towels are replenished, lounges are reserved all day for them- has money changed hands?? For the rest of us it means getting up with the birds, hoping that we can at least nab one lounge and not leaving the lounge for an hour cause your towel will be whipped away and your lounge will be reallocated. Drinks round pool- Very poor service- Every time I wanted a drink I had to go find someone. Pool Drinks Staff were usually attending to other more important guests- see previous note on VIPs or were having a good old yarn to another member of Staff.Pool furniture- grubby, grubby, grubby- needs a good old fashioned wipe down. Tables were sticky and during my entire stay were never cleaned.Lounge- Extra money spent accessing this facility was not good money well spent. The fare on offer was very ordinary. Lacking in variety, taste and abundance. The poorest value for money of any Starwood Property Lounge we have accessed.Checkin, Checkout, Front Desk- woeful service, a long long wait for everything- its not rocket science- put more staff on! On two occasions where I had questions regarding facilities etc I was given incorrect information.Weddings- a real nuisance, always in the way, we had to make our way to our room via an alternative route cause we were in the way of a bridal party and its professional photographer. Its all very well to sympathise and apologise that our expectations were not met. Most reviews complain about these very same things- this hotel is very expensive to stay at- do something about it- clean the pool furniture, inservice the staff and train them to be hospitable, alert and to provide excellent customer service, employ additional staff on the front desk and dont ever make guests feel second rate.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed in Honolulu multiple times and tried the other SPG properties so thought we would try Moana this time. I booked on points and put in request with my upgrade certificates which didn’t come through. I specifically picked the tower section since I like more modern accommodations. Upon check- in we were told we were upgraded. Well were we shocked when we walked into our room and literally banged the door on another piece of furniture when opening it. The room was a box. The smallest room I have ever been in and I travel all over Europe and NYC where I expect that. The bathroom even worse. You couldn’t keep door open and open shower door at same time. Seriously claustrophobic! They said ocean view. It’s a big window - no deck or patio like the room I booked and the windows are so dirty it seriously is best to keep shutters closed. And room was horribly hot even when on lowest temp. And the hallway smell - oh my. Hold your nostrils the minute you get off elevator. The resort lobby area and shops nice. Beach club access is nice for platinum but leaves a lot to be desired. One kind of white wine and beer. And very little variety all week for breakfast and evening snacks. What I will say is the staff in beach lounge was nicest on property. Especially Sheldon. Just wonderful. Remembered our names and orders. Not very sanitary though to allow birds in beach club to be picking at breads. Then the pool area. Very small. You can rent chairs for $55 a day but can’t order alcohol drinks from them. (Pretty ridiculous) and service was horrible. We had to find our server for everything except when she wanted us to pay check \ then she stood over you. Not really service. Photography service was very good. Restaurants overpriced and not worth it. Go outside hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This Historic Resort is beautiful. Despite some people's complaints about the Banyan Wing rooms I found them to be charming. The bed was extremely comfortable and while the rooms are small they have all the amenities you could need. We were on the 4th floor facing the city and despite others complained about the noise we had no issues and im a light sleeper. The staff on the other hand is not accommodating. At check and I had to spend 40 minutes bartering on whether or not I could get the two double beds that i had requested. After being offered a $517 upgrade to a tower room or a king with a rollaway (that i refused), they finally made the exception and gave me the two doubles I had requested. Completely unnecessary hassle after a long flight. My other major complaint was that one afternoon while waiting for the staff elevator (since the regular elevator was out of service) my poor mother with dementia was pushed past by an executive who was showing off the property to a couple. When I brought it to her attention in the elevator, she didn't even acknowledge that I was speaking to her. Clearly we didn't matter because we were not high priority like the guests they were showing around.While I would visit this hotel again because of its historic charm, I would not stay there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Came back to the Moana Surfrider on my most recent trip and I wasn't disappointed! Located in the heart of Waikīkī everything is at your fingertips. The staff was phenomenal, really helpful and did everything I could dream of to make the stay fantastic. I would like to especially mention Dina from the Beach Bar who was not only great in making food and drink recommendations for the evening but also provided great insider recommendations of where to go and what to see.Thanks Moana Surfrider for a fabulous vacation!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is a lovely, classic hotel that takes you back to another, more gracious time. The public areas are beautiful, especially the Banyan Courtyard with its glorious tree. It’s busy and crowded; you will trip over the many wedding couples being photographed in the lobby, but it’s so much fun to see them. Service is outstanding; everyone seems to take enormous pride in their work, and they are so friendly and helpful. The pool is small and closes early in the evening, but, as the pool attendant told me, “The big pool is open 24 hours”—meaning the lovely beach and ocean just steps away. For those who like to do their exercising inside, there is a sizable and well equipped fitness center, open all day and night. We had a cozy corner room on the third floor of the historic section, overlooking Kalakaua Avenue. The two large windows made the room sunny and bright in the daytime, and there was lots of activity to watch on the street below. But, at night, the street performers sounded like they were in our room, and the pretty plantation shutters were quite ineffective at darkening the room. If we had known what it would be like before we unpacked everything, we would have asked to be moved—it was a lesson for the next time! It is a lovely resort, and we hope to return, but definitely to a different room.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have spent holiday in Honolulu january in Hawaii , and this hotel was the best choice, becouse of legendary story, and it is the first hotel in Honolulu, Lady of Waikiki. The beach is very nice, hotel is just at the beach, swimming pool little but we were swimming in the Ocean, that was warm and just you need to take care about the corals , while swimming, mean while the atmosphere in the hotel and around its like beeing in paradise , and the dream come true :), We reccomend breakfast included if not it is very expensive, btw. everything there is expensive, this is something to worry but if you are organise then it can be fine. Worth visiting other places, rooms are nice, we were in older building, where we do missed place for things , but others staying in new building, can enjoy more big room spaciuos. Anyhow, we would love to come again, this is magnificent hotel, with history and hospitaity. We highly reccomend, and looking forward to be able to come again, becouse we miss so much Hawaii :) Paradise !

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Located in the heart of Waikiki area (next to the infamous Duke statue), the Moana Surfrider is the ideal place whether it be for a family vacation, business or weddings. Yes, weddings are a big deal there and every time I visit, there are numerous wedding events going on. The hotel is located right on the beach and therefore accessible to all water activities. If you are a SPG member, you have free access to the "Beach Club" which is their version of the Concierge Lounge. There, you can enjoy breakfast (the papaya wedges are always available and amazing!) with patio seating over looking the beach and ocean. In the afternoon (around 5pm), the food selection is more of an appetizer selection with beer and wines available. Since this hotel is located in Waikiki, you are super close to so many places to visit ( zoo, aquarium, Diamond head crater, Pearl Harbor). The service is touch and go. Depending on how busy it is, it can be a bit hectic. The rooms in the new tower are more modern than the old building, however, the older building does have historical charm. The rooms are clean and if fortunate, the views from the balcony are amazing!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: First of all, I wanted to thank Irene at the front desk for her above and beyond service. She was friendly and helpful, and totally made our honeymoon perfect.The property itself is beautiful. It is in a central location with easy access to different parts of the island. it is literally right next to the sand, so you can walk down and enjoy the beach. The beach bar is phenomenal, the best pina colada and mai tais! Also, the live entertainment is stellar. As an amenity, the hotel provides rental services, so you can enjoy the beach to its fullest. Waikiki Bay at this location is so beautiful, you can walk pretty far out and the water is still clear (I advise bringing water shoes because it can get rocky out in the water).I would definitely return, what an amazing experience!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I came to the Moana with a few friends and I've had the most incredible stay. Not only has the staff been beyond accommodating but Michael has gone above and beyond to make our stay one to remember. He has bent over backwards to make sure we were happy! This has been one of the best vacations I have ever been on and I so appreciate everybody's role in that. We stayed in such a gorgeous room overlooking the water with incredible service! I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family. I do want to give a shout not only to Micheal, but Lee and Gloria were INCREDIBLE! They helped us every day at the pool and were so sweet and accommodating!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider Resort is quaint and absolutely lovely. Wonderful customer service; everyone is friendly and helpful. Their pool is rather small but with direct beach access the pool size doesn't matter. The resort is situated in the hustle and bustle of Waikiki so there is plenty of shopping and restaurants to chose from. I would definitely stay at Moana Surfrider again!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I read lots of reviews and many people recommended the Sheridan over the Moana.. I would have to disagree. We were very impressed with the staff and the quality of the facility.My only negative- is anyone from off the street can walk into shops concourse and jump on the elevator up to tower rooms... not very secure.The pool was a little small but it was meant for a smaller hotel back in the day. You have a large beach right in front of you. You had a lot of options for drinks and food. The staff was very caring and did everything you needed to make sure you had a great stay. The area is very very busy but I felt like it was at the end of it.. most of the chaos was further down the road... if you want the hustle bustle. ONLY STAY HERE

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family and I stayed here from December 1 - December 8, 2017, our first trip ever to Honolulu. Our experiences while at the hotel were average at best and echo what many other reviewers have said: overpriced everything, elevator out of service, very small pool area, expensive beach chair rentals, etc. My review focuses, however, on what happed after we checked out on the morning of December 8th. We went straight to the airport for our flight to Maui, then proceeded directly to our hotel there. While unpacking, I realized that I had left some clothing items behind in a drawer at the Moana Surfrider, and immediately phoned to get assistance with getting them back. No more than five hours had passed.Without getting into all the details, suffice it to say that no one would take my calls, return my calls, or cared in any way about my situation or about helping me. After repeated calls over several days demanding to speak to a manager, I finally received a call on December 11th from Stephen H., who, instead of offering help or an apology, exacerbated the situation by displaying an extremely defensive attitude and suggesting that perhaps (1) I actually still had my items and just didn't realize it or (2) that TSA had removed those exact belongings (the ones I had left in the drawer) from my bag on my flight to Maui. Basically he considered anything and everything, no matter how far-fetched, as a possible explanation, while dismissing the most obvious explanation, that the person who accessed the room after we departed took them. When I insisted on filing an official report, the Moana Surfrider basically just passed me off to their insurance company and wiped their hands of the situation. Needless to say, their insurance company, First Insurance Company of Hawaii, denied my claim. Now, unless I file a police report (which in hindsight I should have done) and hire a lawyer, I have no recourse.I NEVER would have expected to be treated so poorly by any hotel, let alone one that portrays itself as a 4-star resort. Do NOT be fooled - while you will be paying luxury hotel prices, you, your belongings, and your experience during your stay are meaningless to them.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Westin SurfriderBeautiful and fresh, this hotel is stately with its colonial ish lobby . The front porch of the hotel has large rocking chairs if one wants to people watch on the city side; and there are a few rocking chairs on the beach viewing side.On the one city side there is luxury shopping and a luxury mall across the street, with a Tesla dealer. On the beach side there’s table clothed restaurant; and a more casual dining spot; and a small bar. There’s also a stunning banyan tree that with changing colored lights for drama. Next to this there’s also a small pool, too small to accommodate the trove of guests staying at the hotel. Immediately after those eating venues is a small strip of beach, which is a common negative to most all of those grand Honolulu hotels set right on the beach. They do offer towels to guests for the beach, but the beach chairs cost $30/$35 a day to rent. The lounge chairs by the pool are free, and open up at 7:00 AM but for the 5 nights I stayed at this hotel, I was never lucky enough to get one, as they snapped up at 7:00 AM by people who left their towels on the chairs and went off to breakfast. The beautiful lobby Attracts many with its piano playing, singing musician who can take requests. He’s talented and can perform many Sinatra, Cole Porter tunes. The casual beach side restaurant ( nice place to watch the sunset) also has nightly singing entertainment with a hula Dancer.The rooms :I’ve stayed here twice and experienced both kinds of rooms in this hotel that seem to be 2 kinds. On the older side with side hallways, are the older remodeled historic rooms that can be cozy and seashore like in decor, but our room even tho it had a side balcony, was small, and the bathroom was very small ( shower on an angle, and not room for 2 people). The newer Tower side rooms were much larger, more space for 2 to walk around, had balconies, and the bathrooms were more generous sized.There was a hair dryer, safe, 2 water bottles a day, bathrobes..

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana has a touch of nostalgia with all the mod cons. A beautiful old world hotel that is ideally located in the heart of Waikiki. Shops and busy night life one side and a beach paradise the other.Can be pricey but well worth the cost. Stay on the higher floors to take advantage of the magnificent views.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel has newer rooms and older rooms. I would ask to stay in the new wing. Starwood Platinum breakfast room was nice and open most of the day for drinks, etc. The pool is very small for this size resort and was packed all the time, granted the beach is great but some folks prefer the pool. They don’t have a hot tub. I prefer to swim in the ocean then jump in a jacuzzi then a lounge chair to doze off. If your trying to really relax...Waikiki is not the place. The hotel is a classic but their outdoor pool space is inadequate.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The old section of the Moana Westin is gorgeous. However, the modern additions have turned what should be an old school luxury hotel into a resort factory. The entire hotel is overrun both by guests and the public walking off the street. The excellent veranda restaurant can feel like a cafeteria because of the breakfast buffet that otherwise takes away from the dining experience. The pool is pointless because it is too small. There aren't nearly enough chairs, by the pool or the beach, for guests.I was upgraded into an ocean front room in the modern tower. The room was huge and comfortable. It was very clean, but the decor was tired and in need of a renovation. In particular, the bathroom was very dated. I expected a better bathroom. It was also weird to have the closet in the bathroom. The TV had a good selection of channels, but I would have liked a bigger screen. Wireless internet was very slow. There was no enhanced, premium speed for SPG platinum guests.Staff were cordial and professional, but the service wasn't personal given the hundreds if not thousands of guests staying at the hotel. At times, I felt lost in the shuffle.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is the number one best in Hawaii! The view from our room was spectacular!!! We stay here every time we come to Oahu. If you want a great hotel right in the heart of shopping on Oahu and right on the beach look no further that the Moana Surfrider, Westin!!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a wonderful time at the Moana Surfrider Westin. All staff were friendly and helpful. They keep the place spotless. We opted to stay in the Tower instead of the original hotel only because we wanted a balcony. The Beach House/Veranda/ Beach Bar restaurants all have wonderful food and service. Spa was wonderful. We look forward to returning again for sure.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family of 4 had a few nights at the Moana before Christmas. A few nights was enough, as we found the hotel, and all its spaces, busy and bustling, and definitely not peaceful and tranquil. I don't mind some bustle and activity - the problem at the Moana was you couldn't escape it except in the room. The lobby opens on to the heart of the Waikiki shopping area so everyone drops in to have a look, and then there are the Japanese bridal parties being photographed all over the hotel.The breakfast room had queues, the pool was tiny and jammed and the Banyan tree café was generally full.Fortunately we got upgraded to a beachfront room, with a nice view. We were in the Diamond Wing which we liked, because it was the quieter end of the hotel. Overall we were glad we weren't staying longer, it wasn't restful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel. Would give it 4.5 stars. The staff were nice and they were helpful. Quite polite really. I did call to hospitality once from the room because they forgot something and the hospitality person showed up and probably two minutes so the service was very fast. I thought all the staff was extremely courteous. The bed was comfortable and the shower was nice in the room. The only thing I would fault this hotel for is the fact that the windows in the room must be from the year the hotel was built LOL I literally checked three times to see if the windows were open. That's how loud it is in the room. You can hear everything that goes on outside and I was on the third floor. However it does quiet and down and the area by about 11 p.m. so it's not bad for sleeping. I really don't love hotels that charge a resort fee I feel like it's just a bit of a nickel-and-diming that they do to their guests. The resort fee is just over $37 a day here. My problem with that is that you really don't get much for it. There aren't enough loungers the pool (pool is very small) and all the lounge chairs are taken by about 7 a.m. which is easy to.imagine because there are not a lot of them. Then if you want to go to the beach there are no chairs from the hotel on the beach. So if you want to sit on the beach you have to sit on your towel on the super crowded beach with the other millions of people. Not really my idea of a relaxing holiday. (there is no zen here). I saw some.other reviewers saying it is a great place to unwind...lol.....I'd really go looking for a quieter area to truly unwind! The Westin does have some chairs behind a little picket fence with sand under them and I was shocked to find out that they rent them to the guests. I find that kind of ridiculous when you pay a resort fee that you would then have to pay them to rent a chair with sand under the bottom of the chair ( kind of like you'd be on the beach). That's just wrong. I'm fairly well travelled and honestly....that's not right to do that to guests. What thought comes to mind = 'money grab '. It is my opinion that if you pay to stay at a decent hotel, and I think this hotel wants to feel like it is fairly decent place, then the least they can do when the hotel is on a beach it's provide every guest with a lounge chair for sitting on the beach. Because after all, that's why people are at the hotel, isn't it?However I did like the hotel...just pointing out some oddities. P.s. when it rains the (beach-bar) bar by the big tree is closed. Why don't they cover the area a bit better so guests have something to do besides hanging out in their rooms or in the lobby?

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beach front elegance, perfect place to unwind- drink a cocktail, have delicious tuna bar snacks and take in the ambiance and live music. central to everything, you really don't want to leave this hotel unless ofcourse you want to dhop till you drop!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel twice, both instances for business and I enjoy it very much.1) Customer service is great. I held a meeting in one of their parlor rooms and everything went off without a hitch. Aki and Bob were so friendly and professional. 2) I rented a car and used valet parking, which is by far the easier option and worth the extra money. The staff working the valet stand were consumate professionals; they remembered who I was in no time (I never had to give them my name when returning to the hotel), which was quite amazing since it's constantly busy there. For that, I bought them malasadas from Leonard's as a token of my appreciation. 3) The location cannot be beat. You walk out of the hotel grounds and you have everything right there in front of you.Cons: 1) I had a room facing the courtyard in the historic wing. I had a bit of an ocean view, but what I didn't anticipate was a live band on a Monday night. I understand very well that many of the hotel guests are there on vacation, but it was surprising to hear a live band on a weeknight. It ended around 10:30pm. 2) This one is more funny than a con, but my room had these very tall windows with a wood bench in front of it. There were these massive, male handprints on the very top of the window. I mean, what is any man doing to leave handprints like that very high up??? 3) My iron died, but Concierge replaced it with a new one. 4) Sometimes it was hard to get someone from Concierge to pick up the phone. Summary: I thoroughly enjoy staying at the Moana Surfrider. I loved doing some work on the lanai, and everyone is in a great mood. The noise was my biggest concern for this stay, but it won't stop me from staying there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After much deliberation, we decided to stay at the Moana for our return trip to Hawaii. We won't be back. First off, we had reserved a non-ocean room. When we arrived, we were upgraded to one of the Banyan rooms in the old wing. It is very cute - ocean front, rocking chairs overlooking a Juliet balcony, and a great view of the wedding grounds. It is also very small, especially with two double beds. And don't get me started on the bathroom. My dorm bathroom was larger in college. Plus, it was definitely showing signs of wear and tear. To top it all off, the a/c was set not to go below a certain temperature, which meant the room was always a little warm. Combine that with the double bed and we didn't sleep well for three nights. And, if that wasn't enough, I think every bridal party traipsed through the hotel to have their photos taken, so you were always trying to sidestep brides, grooms, attendants and families. And because of the size of the hotel (and wedding parties) you couldn't get past them. This started at 6 am and went all day. And it isn't like there were a lot of weddings at the hotel - we only saw one wedding in three days and about 87 brides. Overall too busy, too crowded and too run down. Stay somewhere else for the money. I'm giving it three stars because the room was nice and the service at the bar was good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are really big, clean and comfortable with great views. We had an interleading room. Pool is small but on the beach and we never had a problem getting chairs at the pool or the beach. Beautiful sunsets to be seen from the bar and delicious cocktails and menu. Excellent location opposite the International shopping centre.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Really enjoyed this hotel. Wonderful guest services, reasonably priced considering it is in the heart of Waikiki. Upgraded to beach club where a nice breakfast and happy hour with beer and wine included. Nicely appointed rooms. Worth getting an ocean view. Housekeeping staff helpful with good service and clean rooms. Welcomed and appreciated by staff at check in. Staff made us feel welcomed and voiced appreciation for being SPG members. Only planned to stay one night but extended our stay because we were so impressed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Such a great place, service is amazing, views are outstanding. The beach is right there, literally when you walk out. The rooms are always clean, and comfortable. Best place to be when looking for accommodation in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had the pleasure of staying at Moana Surfrider for 7 nights. This was our 3rd trip to Hawai'i. We were attracted to the beautiful historical building and the fact we always ended up spending most nights having dinner and enjoying the ambience and beautiful live music in their courtyard on our previous trips, it made sense to stay here on our next trip. We will never stay anywhere else in Waikiki again. We absolutely love this hotel - unbeatable location and great facilities. A big shout out to Pierre - instead of accepting our tip for bringing us to our room, he suggested we keep the money to buy our son some ice cream. Bless him! We can't wait to stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: eaven!!! Had read some mixed reviews on trip advisor so was a little apprehensive about what to expect. Checkin was a breeze. We were upgraded, with SPG gold did not expect that at such a busy hotel.
