We stayed in the historic wing, and while the room is smaller than the average hotel, we had a view of the courtyard and a slice of the ocean. The room was comfortable, well appointed and the water bottles and beach bag were an added bonus. The shower amenities were missing which was quickly remedied by the front desk. The first morning we ate breakfast at nearby local restaurant - and then immediately returned to the hotel and down to the beach. The hotel's courtyard overlooks the ocean and there are loungers owned by the hotel that can be rented. We discovered the Cabanas and ended up reserving one for the following day. Upon returning to our room we discovered an apology note and a box of chocolate ("sorry for the missing amenities) a pleasant surprise and a very nice touch. We had access to the lounge, the breakfast had a nice variety of choices, dinner was ok - would be nice to have a larger spread and less starchy or fried foods. This hotel gets a lot of foreigners and this lounge is lacking in spread diversity and options. Mid day snacks consisted of pretzels, nuts and popcorn, ok but Westin could improve in this area. We also noticed that a soda fountain was installed and plenty of water bottles were available. We did enjoy the fact that there is a terrace that faces the ocean a stones throw from where we sat. My favorite part is being SO close to the beach. On our 3rd day we were upgraded to an ocean view in the historic wing. WOW. The view was awesome, we slept with the window open so we could hear the ocean. Yes hotel windows that open. On our 4th morning we ate breakfast at the buffet. Food was fresh, there was something for everyone. The service at this hotel was attentive, friendly and the location is perfect for enjoying the beach. Can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Amazing touch of calm and elegance in busy Waikiki Beach. Beautiful view from tower room. So enjoyed the rocking chairs at front of hotel and by back porch. Pool small but never over crowded. Breakfast choices good and attentive staff. Location perfect. Compared to Sheraton Waikiki this hotel is so relaxed and better qualitty. Nice outdoor reataurant under huge banyan tree for snacks and drinks. Only trouble was the scramble to find a seat — be nice if they organized that better. Only place in Waikiki we would return to.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very disappointed. Have spent 30 nights in this hotel. Never again!  If your like me and pay extra for more quality this is not the place. 1.They "do not honor bookings.com". The manager reluctantly resolved that problem only because I did have the print out the original booking. There relationships with there agents are not the customers problem. Never fun to travel 12 hours to find out your not getting what you paid for.2. Ocean front suite Stained curtains, stained furniture.3. I am not sure why but every one seemed like they were doing us a favor.4. On the plus side Kristin at the front desk is very professional and helpful. She should be the manager5. One more complaint. Resort fee! If its not optional put it in your room charge.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I booked this trip last minute, as I was living in LA at the time and took it as an opportunity to escape to Hawaii, a place I've never been for a quick weekend getaway. I'm glad I came and stayed at this hotel. They made my whole experience incredible. The room was spacious and clean and although I didn't have much a view, I didn't care as I spent every waking minute outdoors. At night after dinner, I would sit on their patio, front or back wherever there was availability order a drink and take in the night sky and the chill vibes.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had an absolutely amazing stay at this property. Highly recommended!!Room: The view was amazing! The room wasn't huge - just a standard hotel room with two queen beds I believe. Balcony had two chairs as well. It was perfect for myself, my 13yo and my parents. No one had any issues at all. CLUB LOUNGE: Access to the beach club lounge saved me a TON of money. My family had breakfast there every morning and there was a great selection. Coffee and espresso, bottled water and pop was always available. There were several nights we didn't even go out to dinner as the food they had in the lounge was more then enough. The free wine was excellent. The ladies working in the lounge would constantly come around topping off your glass. All of them would strike up a conversation and provided excellent service. Was the highlight of our trip. I had a bunch of SPG Platinum employee thank-you certificates and gave all 10 of them to the ladies in the lounge. They made our stay. Loyalty Recognition: I booked an ocean view room because it was important to me to have a view. I see a lot of reviews of Platinum members complaining they didn't get an ocean view upgrade. If it's that important to you - pay for it. It's not guaranteed otherwise. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a higher floor as well which i was very thankful for. There a ton of benefits for Platinum members which they tell you about (and give you a paper about) when you check-in. Discounts, lounge access, breakfast, etc. Overall: I can't say enough about this hotel. Perfect location right on the beach, treated Platinum SPG member with upgrade, beach club lounge access, free breakfast and the hotel itself is beautiful. Almost everyone I interacted with was excellent.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here for half of a one week stay. We booked a King Room and were given a room in the Banyan building. After reading online that the tower rooms were better, we asked to be located in here, but there were none available. Rooms were nice, very comfortableAnd well equipped. Checkin staff were very friendly and pleasant. We used the on site photographer to shoot someEngagement pictures during our stay, and we were very impressed with his level of professionalism. Our only complaint was the poor service of pool staff. We wanted to order some drinks and had to go looking for someone on more than one occasion. We spent ten minutes trying to find a server who could help us pay our bill!Location is one of the best parts of this hotel - right on the beach and central on Kalakaua Ave. I loved how historic the property is, it really has a special feel to it. I would stay here again, and recommend it if you’re looking for a memorable and luxurious stay in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment we arrived at this glorious lady, we fell in love with the Moana Surfrider. Waikiki’s oldest hotel, opened in 1901. Even though the hotel is well maintained and fresh, I felt as though we had stepped back in time. We loved the old world feel, the decor, the sense of history. It really is a grand old lady. Sitting on the front verandah in the morning, watching Waikiki wake up is an experience we will never forget. Likewise, spending the evenings under the magnificent banyan tree, sipping mai tais and listening to great music made for some fond memories. It’s testament to how aesthetically beautiful the hotel is that we spent most of our time staring at it, all the while, the beautiful Waikiki beach was just behind us. The staff were efficient, but I wouldn’t say they were particularly personable, except for the breakfast waiters who were very attentive and kind. Our room was clean and well appointed, a little on the small side (compared to others we have stayed in). We only ate breakfast here, opting to utilise the many dining options in Waikiki. Breakfast was quite expensive, but then the servings were massive. Our only gripe was the daily “resort fee”. We found this a little hard to stomach given we paid a very high price to stay at the Moana. This $37.70 a day charge added a fair slug to an already expensive holiday, and then of course, the gratuities were on top of that. On balance, staying at the Moana was an unforgettable experience, and one we’re glad we can add to our adventures. Just beautiful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is a very nice hotel. Unfortunately, my first impression was not a good one andI will not be staying here again when there are so many other choices.  We arrived at the Moana Surfrider during a one day strike by staff at the hotel. Limited hotel services and restaurants were closed. Okay, things like this happen. Checked in and went to room. Time to shower before dinner and find there are no bath towels, only bath mats, and the bathroom had a sewer smell, not there when we arrived in room. Called housekeeping and were told that because of short staffing, it would be awhile. Housekeeping came with bath towels and sanitized bathroom. The smell came back, called down to front desk, no answer, called again and was told a manager would call us back, never received call back from manager. Solved bathroom smell myself. Toilets have a bidet type attachment that also warms seat and turns on a fan in toilet when you sit. Figured out how to turn the power off and the smell went away. The rest of the stay went well. Nice location close to beach. Had dinner at the Beach house which was very nice and service was great.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is in a great spot in the heart of Waikiki beach. Great rooms, very comfortable beds and helpful staff. Can rent cabanas and umbrellas with loungers on the edge of the beach if you like. Ocean view rooms won’t have full views of the ocean but still get a glimpse. Resort fees are expensive but no different than the other hotels on the Waikiki strip. Would stay here again if in Waikiki for sure.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I do enjoy this hotel very much. It is at the center of everything and has a great setting too. There is an older more regal center section and now two towers on both ends which are part of the hotel as well. Something always going on, lobby music many nights, patio music daily, wine tastings and more. Something for everyone.I stayed there during two recent visits to HNL. One time I stayed in the newer wing and the second time, in the historic wing. I prefer the historic wing personally.They will accommodate your late checkout needs if they can and they do have a day room to change in before your flight back to the States or where ever.Front desk staff great, bell staff great, and concierge staff also great. A great setting for sunsets too.I ate at both restaurants reviewed elsewhere. The coffee place just out the front door tops also. I would not stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I should have written this review a long time ago. I have been a guest at the Westin Moana Surfrider for many years. It is my favorite hotel in Waikiki for business and pleasure. One of the many reasons I love this hotel as my home away from home is the Beach Club and the lovely attendants. Noelani Among is one of the lovely attendants in the Beach Club that makes me feel special and at home. She is so helpful, welcoming, and all around awesome. I look forward to every visit and look forward to relaxing in the Beach Club and seeing “my girls.” Noelani has that special knack of making each guest feel special and welcome. Noelani is truly special and a huge asset to the Westin family. I hope she gets recognition for all that she does to make each guest feel special and welcome I highly recommend the Beach Club at the Westin Moana Surfrider as the best club lounge among all of the Westin hotels I have visited and most of the praise is a credit to Noelani’s aloha spirit.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After years of staying at a neighboring hotel, decided to try the Surfrider. Have nothing but accolades to say. The restaurant is nice, and Beach Club a nice amenity. Especially enjoy the ambience beneath the Banyan Tree. Everything,and everyone, has been super! FMG

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Absolutely stunning property set directly on the beach! Rooms were very large with beautiful views of the ocean, immaculate. The in room Ipad was nice for researching things in Honolulu. The elevators were a little slow but not a big deal. The lobby is breathtaking with all the history. We walked around just admiring all the details in the structure. This is a very historical hotel and well kept! The staff from the front desk to bell hops to cleaners to bartenders were all fabulous! The Banyan court was simply amazing! Highly recommend! We will be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For the price, not impressed:- it was my mum's birthday. I asked for 6 small plates and forks for the room for cake - they wanted to charge- yes they have a private beach but to sit on it you need to reserve and pay for space- the gym is no where near big enough for the volume of guests likewise with pool area- restaurants are average- check in were unable to give me an eta on whether I could check in earlier than 3pm- room and floor smell musty- generally maintenance and cleaning needed - on check out I left my laptop. It took multiple phone calls and emails to confirm they had it. Surely they would have contacted me as soon as they saw it left in the room?- they process room charges every day Lots of little petty processes I wouldn't expect in a high end hotel. It felt like a cheap, tacky club med. For the money, not impressed

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been to many hotel and I have to say that this hotel is pretty incredible, with the beautiful rooms. The incredible Banyan Tree in the middle of the back area and the great restaurant. The only thing (that seems like a first world problem), is the size of the washroom. It's quite small, and it's difficult to move around in there. The rocking chairs on the front porch is a nicely added touch and this place is very central on the strip.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We planned holiday with the family 8 months ahead through Flight Centre at Pacific Fair for a partial view paying US$500.00 plus $33 service charge. The room overlooked other apartments! Reception unhelpful.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family thoroughly enjoyed staying at the moana surfrider in hawaii the resort is so elegant and stylish, with high ceilings and perfectly appointed armchairs and artwork. Thrre are cute boutique shops and a lovely outdoor area that leads straight onto the beach. The staff were extremely friendly amd go out of their way to chat and make guests comfortable. Our room had an amazing view of the beach where we could enjoy sitting on our balcony listening to the musicians below. It was a very active resort, but you never felt crowded due to the vaulted ceilings and oversized rooms. We would definately stay there again. We absolutely loved it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana is a grand hotel with the rocking chairs on the verandah and the amazing tree setting a pretty picture with the ocean back drop Service at check in and housekeeping service excellent I think a lot of tourists that aren’t staying come to the resort and spend time so it is very busy Also there is only 1 pool and it’s a battle to get a deck chair on the beach unless you book at least the day before

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We've stayed here many times .... And the consistency each time is outstanding... With 2 young kids... The location is perfect....straight in the middle ... right on the beach.. literally stroll out of your hotel room.. on the beach... So easy... Can watch the kids from the beautiful tables by the pool and the extremely attentive staff are all over it... Mai Tai's .... great food ... Great staff.... Just couldn't ask for more.... The old lady delivers on every level time and time again... Thank you Moana Surfrider!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Congratulations to the Westin chair for restoring Waikiki's first hotel back to the Classic Luxury of the turn of the century. The public spaces in this hotel are like being in a museum. Nice just to sit, enjoy the ambience and watch people. The location on the beach strip can't be beat. Had some great meals in several of the restaurants and the club lounge. Room was in the old wing. Tiny, but efficient and we wanted to taste some of the history of the place. We were lucky to be there on a day when they offered a historic tour. That was a real bonus and the guide (wish I could remember her name) was a fountain of history for the hotel and the city. She enjoyed challenging questions and helped bring some of the history alive. Do check out the small museum on the second floor of the old building.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I did not like all hidden fees which u are required to pay on top of listed prices . Rooms fully paid but still pay 33 us dollars a day for hotel fee whatever that is. Spa was just horrible . Tax plus 47 dollars another service fee on top of marked price . I read description of deluxe hydrofacial - it said -includes massage . The therapist was not aware of this . The use of spa hours were advertised as extended to till 10pm . Total lie - was till 8 . Unless u are up at 6.am - no beach facing chair for u . And if u slept till 9.30- forger any beach chairs at all- they will all be taken for the rest of the day . Beach umbrella is 30$ a day . A chezlong on a beach 100us $.Breakfast -long wait before u get seated. Like at the airport customs. Room are small. Ocean view does not mean u get a sunset view . Could be just a bit of water .Location is good. Buffet b fast ok.Stuff friendly except that horrible moana spa.We made an effort not to have b fast dinner or a drink at that hotel . Wont come back .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you like hustle and bustle the hotel location is perfect.The staff is quite nice and of course the beds are "heavenly." If you get a street facing room in the historic wing prepare to be up late.The noise is awful.The o,dear but renovated rooms are very comfortable and the tower rooms are also quite nice.The back courtyard during the day is crowded and bustling but after about 8pm it becomes a serene beautiful spot to sit and dream of old Hawaii.The beautiful Banyon tree is incredible.Once daylight comes it's back to Waikiki insanity!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is incredibly nice -- has so much character, and is right on Waikiki Beach. Definitely should be at the top of your list for hotel choices when visiting Honolulu. Would recommend a room with an ocean view. On this trip we opted for the less expensive city view in the "tower" -- however also had a small patio with views of the water. Room was well appointed, comfortable and quiet (which is hard to do in Waikiki -- it's definitely a city). Staff is top-notch -- friendly and helpful. Waiting for check-in, check-out took longer than I'm used to -- but hey, it was a busy time of year.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Rooms are VERY SMALL with micro bathrooms. The bathroom was a joke. No counters to place ANYTHING! You had a choice to shove your belonging in a tiny cabinet with who knows what's been in there. Your other choice is put your toiletries on a toilet lid or the floor. Eww! Not that you spend that much time in a bathroom but it was real HASSLE to get ready. The West tower is very worn and needs a remodel. Ask for the East tower, it's new! The food in the outside patio restaurant was HORRIBLE. Great view and good vibe tho. We gave it 3 times, gross food. The restaurant on the porch is a lot better. The Spa was fabulous, reasonable and very nice. The hotel Location is PERFECT! Of course the Banyon tree is historic.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Excellent service! The check in personnel gave us a pretty black seed pod necklace and carry bag. Beautiful rooms and a view to die for! Had drinks and lunch under Banyon Tree! You can walk to all kinds of shops and restaurants. Expensive but You well worth it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is well situated in terms of location to Waikiki, but the pool is small, there are a lot of kids (generally) and one happened to "drop a snickers bar" in the pool which caused the pool to shut down for 24hrs. The rooms all have pretty good views given the way the hotel was built and situated on the property. It's just very busy, and not very relaxing.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: great location, friendly staffthe elevators sometimes took 10 or more minutes. it was awful. all the guests were highly disappointed and for the price point at this hotel they should have fixed the elevator in days but it took over a month

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I ve stayed at Moana several times and have noticed that the quality and experiences have diminished with each visits. I m definitely disappointed with the service . At check in, I was offered a double twin size when I have always had queen or king . The inidividual insinuated that I had chosen that and I had to show them my reservations on my spg app. I didn’t like the fact that I had to defend myself.We had to queue up for breakfast at 630 am. The dishes were not clean; I had two dirty caked on dish and silverware. The pool attendant was rude (Gloria); she was friendly and accommodating with other patrons but was abrupt when it was my turn. She had to remind me that I will loose my place if I m gone in an hour . I told her that I m aware of it and why didn’t she tell the other patrons in front of me. When I asked for her name, did she change her deameanor.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you want a beautiful, relaxing & well appointed hotel DO NOT STAY HERE. We have been here for almost a week & it’s been like living on a building site. They drag trolleys around from 4.30am setting up for conferences & weddings, which is a daily occurrence. The house keeping staff make sure you are up bright and early, just what you want on a holiday. By 7.30am they are knocking on your door & vacuuming outside your room. The rooms are dirty & on several occasions they didn’t even attended to our sons room. Who knows what they are vacuuming! I must admit the sheer lack of service started from the moment we arrived. It was almost midnight when we pulled up outside, a family of 4 with 7 bags (been skiing first!) No help from the bell desk, in fact they just watched us drag our bags up the stairs until they eventually came when I fell down a step with a bag. On check in there wasn’t any “holiday” welcome. Didn’t get a lay, apparently you have to be a different nationality here to get any form of service. When we got to our room we were happy. Nice big bed, rooms are small but we could manage. Then on closer inspection there was dust & dirt over every surface. The toilet smelt like it hadn’t been cleaned in a very long time. Close to an hour later we still hadn’t gotten our bags. My youngest son is 12 & we were all in need of a shower & some sleep after traveling all day. In the end my husband had to go & track down our bags & literally beg to get them to our rooms. The beach chair arrangement is a joke, as well as a so called private beach which as guests you have to pay for. One pool attendant spent a morning chasing my sons around constantly telling them off. Accusing them of running & diving, which is completely untrue as we were watching them. I’m disgusted that they treated them in this way, they are paying guests after all, just because they are young westerners. We chose to sit on the free unattended beach after which is a much better option! We aren’t usually people who complain but we did bring these matters to the front desk to get absolutely nothing in response. They just looked through us, did not care at all.I would never recommend this hotel. Yes it’s very pretty from the outside & the lobby is quaint but that’s truly where it ends. Terrible service, unfriendly staff & extremely poor quality. Certainly not worth anywhere near the money we paid.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Like queuing for breakfast? Come here.Like queuing for a scarce sun-bed around the pool? Come here.Like surly staff with zero effort to meet your expectations? Come hereWant to feel you’ve paid a lot? Come here.Want to feel you have had value for money? Stay away!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I come every other month for business but take a few extra days for a vacation for us. We only stay at the Moana Surfrider. Best location on the beach, historical hotel, amazing spa & gym. If you’re spg platinum you can use the spa everyday for free (minus services). Staff is exceptional & they always remember our names. They also have a great restaurant on site. Prime location on Waikiki to all the shops & restaurants.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visit Hawaii a couple times of year and always when we are on Waikiki stay at The Westin. I use points just love the SPG program. So I don't expect a lot in my room location. But every time we stay there they give us just amazing rooms. But this time the lady at the desk her name was Kristen gave me the best room I've ever had in 40 years of staying in the Waikiki. Also very professional combined with outstanding customer service We were so appreciative and really made our trip enjoyable. Thank you Kristen and the Moana Surfrider will be back in July.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a great experience at the Moana Surfrider since the moment we stepped into the hotel. There was a booking screw-up (100% my fault) and the reception agent (Irene) went out of her way to fix things where she could. Our room was spacious and we had a great view of Diamond Head and the ocean. The property location provides easy access to the beach, shopping, and dining. Between walking and Uber/Lyft, it was easy to get everywhere that we wanted to go. If you have Starwood status (or whatever else can get you access), the Beach Club is a great perk. The daily breakfast, snacks, and happy hour in a comfortably large indoor/outdoor area gave us a great staging area for breaks from the sun and between activities. A hearty thank you to the entire staff for such a great experience!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is literally one of the most appealing sites when viewed from the front. Waikiki is not for relaxing and don’t expect it here. On the plus side go to the Veranda/Beach House restaurant. The food is very good as is the service. Ask for PATRICIA for breakfast service. She’s a 6 star but generally this is a great dining spot. Worth itBut the hotel is just average. They’ve had an elevator out of service for 6 plus months. Since I will never return TAKE THE SERVICE ELEVATOR if you’re in the Tower The ocean view rooms have a view. That’s the highlight The room At $500 plus is beyond bland. The bathroom is the antithesis of what I’d expect at this price point. Thus is not 4 star SPG property Service is so inconsistent. Left stupid everyday Sr It. . Honestly they are like motel rooms. One sink for a $500 plus plus room bathtub on the floor closet in the bathroom. Boring cheap oldDon’t stay here unless you don’t mind a hotel with a gorgeous outside and a holiday inn inside. Oh and the poolvery small and if you want a good chair be down at the thin beach desk pool by 7 am. And if you were think king about paying mucho bucks for a front row chair?? Forget about it! Those are for the peeps who’ve been coming for 10 plus years!!! I’m shocked that anyone in their right mind would go backDid I mention the Tower elevator has been down for 6 months?Don’t stay here

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We spent a week at the Moana Surfrider from 5 -12 Jan 18. Before I booked the hotel I made the mistake of reading the most recent reviews here. You actually need to read reviews for the same time of year you are staying. A week before our stay I read some reviews that were mostly negative - complaints about the complete lack of free chairs around the pool and even lack of those you can hire on the beach. So I'd prepared myself for this headache on arrival. Only on our first morning did we have to queue at 7am to hire beach chairs at the hotel. (I believe this was much worse over the xmas-new year period) In fact, we found the public beach chairs you can hire next door to be much better - closer to the ocean and easier to find shade and they were available throughout the morning - no early rising to book them which kind of defeats the sleep-in enjoyment of a holiday. But I will say this: Australians have a pathological hatred for hidden fees. And whatever price the hotel quotes for the room (ours was pretty reasonable as we're SPG members) you must add on at least another $120 to include the mandatory resort fee, occupancy tax, room tax and beach chairs ($50). Then decide if you are prepared to pay this overall cost.The fact is, this hotel is the oldest in Waikiki. The pool was built many years later. The hotel capacity is about 1300 guests and I'm advised it's at capacity over the new year's period. 40 free pool chairs and another 26 pairs to hire ain't gonna cut it. So if you can avoid coming at this peak time - do!Otherwise, it's in a terrific position. We stayed in the Tower wing and the rooms were large, well-appointed and comfortable. We loved sitting in the rocking chairs on the front verandah and by the pool. We'd definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After a few weeks travelling around USA mainland and Hawaii Islands it was time to veg out for a few days and this hotel was the ideal place to do this as well as allow time to souvenir shop. We had an issue with Stephen when trying to check in because we wanted to pay for the room with our debit card up front and not allow them to ream our credit card without authority as SPG hotels are prone to do. You usually find that they use the credit card and take full payment on the last night of your stay and then email you a fully paid invoice. We had already experienced this at another SPG hotel and now have to try and get our money back as we have paid 2 times for our stay. Stephen made all the right noises and soon took our money from the debit card only to want to give it back soon after as he could not work out the method to display the monies already paid. After nearly 1 hour another back room person fixed the issue. We found our room very comfortable and we were lucky to have a Seaview room with balcony. The room was well appointed and had very good wifi service both in the room and throughout the hotel. We had a kingside bed and the bathroom was also well appointed. The shower is in the bath but has a non slip surface in the bath tub. Plenty of power points in the room and our room was cleaned very well each day. Staff, in general, were very friendly and helpful and happy to make sure you enjoyed your stay. We did not dine in the hotel as pricing seemed a little high and there were plenty of close by eateries that offered in our view better value for money. Close to all modes of transport so easy to get around Honolulu from here. The beach area was not one we also participated as you had to book your chair and beach spot the previous day to be assured of getting a position. Such a great place and should have easily received 5 stars but for the check in issue that left a bad taste in my mouth. We didn't ask for much and did explain our reasoning BEFOREHAND so this should not have happened but it did and cost the hotel the opportunity of us giving them the 5 stars. Overall we would stay here again But I will pay online before we arrive.After a few weeks travelling around USA mainland and Hawaii Islands it was time to veg out for a few days and this hotel was the ideal place to do this as well as allow time to souvenir shop. We had an issue with Stephen when trying to check in because we wanted to pay for the room with our debit card up front and not allow them to ream our credit card without authority as SPG hotels are prone to do. You usually find that they use the credit card and take full payment on the last night of your stay (even though they tell you the credit card is only for incidentals) and then email you a fully paid invoice. We had already experienced this at another SPG hotel and are still trying to get our money back on the credit card as we have now paid 2 times for our stay. They somehow forgot to cancel the credit card charge but gladly took further payment on our debit card. Stephen made all the right noises and soon took our money from the debit card only to want to give it back soon after as he could not work out the method to display the monies already paid. After nearly 1 hour another back room person fixed the issue. We found our room very comfortable and we were lucky to have a Seaview room with balcony. The room was well appointed and had very good wifi service both in the room and throughout the hotel. We had a kingsize bed and the bathroom was also well appointed. The shower is in the bath but has a non slip surface in the bath tub. Plenty of power points in the room and our room was cleaned very well each day. Staff, in general, were very friendly and helpful and happy to make sure you enjoyed your stay. We did not dine in the hotel as pricing seemed a little high and there were plenty of close by eateries that offered in our view better value for money. Close to all modes of transport so easy to get around Honolulu from here. The beach area was not one we also participated as you had to book your chair and beach spot the previous day to be assured of getting a position. Such a great place and should have easily received 5 stars but for the check in issue that left a bad taste in my mouth. We didn't ask for much and did explain our reasoning BEFOREHAND so this should not have happened but it did and cost the hotel the opportunity of us giving them the 5 stars. Overall we would stay here again But I will pay online before we arrive.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a nice stay here over New Years. The hotel was sold out, and yet still was functional. The hotels location is optimal for Waikiki - directly on the beach on one side and in the midst of shopping on the other. Room was consistent with Westin standards, though the bathroom was small and the partial-view was limited. We were not successful finding a place to eat at the poolside restaurant. Overall, we had a very nice time and we would stay here again, though Honolulu and Waikiki are not the best that Hawaii has to offer.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As soon as you set eyes on the giant columns gracing the entrance at Moana Surfrider you know you are in for a magical stay. Stunning is an understatement. Once you've settled into one of their elegant amd functional rooms I highly recommend nibbles or lunch and a few cocktails from the Beach Bar which overlooks stunning Waikiki beach which is physcally a few steps from the bar and a perfect place to spend a few hours forgetting about the rest of the world. The Moana Surfrider looks, feels and smells amazing but above all the staff are my number one reason to recommend a stay here. To experience such genuine friendliness and hospitality has made an already phenomenal stay even better. Thanks to the wonderful management and all staff members for making our stay a truly memorable one ✌

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My excitement on seeing our hotel in its magnificence that it imposes on the streetscape dissolved a little with each transaction and exchange. Reception was nonchalant, venue is not especially clean or well maintained. I stayed in the old part of the hotel so my room had great proportions. The bathroom was adequate but taps and plug hole not properly cleaned. Paintwork throughout the building was inept with no attempt to properly prepare spots for touch up. Carpets seemed tired and in need of refreshing. Services at bar were sporadic and at times completely unhelpful. We were charged a hefty resort fee but got absolutely zip for it. The breakfast is very good but you have to queue at $ 35 US before extras it seems overpriced. In summary I left completely underwhelmed.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had read so much about this hotel but now wish that we had never stayed there. Upon arrival, after 10 hours of flying, we were told that room service finished at 10.30 p.m. The bars and restaurants were also closed so we had to go elsewhere. There is no mini bar and the coffee cups provided in the room were paper. During our stay, we could not get a seat in any of the bars because apart from the restaurants, all the facilities in the hotel have open seating and we were told that it was 'first in, first served'. There are no facilities for guests only, anyone can use the pool. There is also a hefty resort fee that is mandatory for guests Iwhich the visiting public do not have to pay The buffet breakfast was good value and the staff present at breakfast were lovely. But apart from the cleaning staff who were very helpful, all other staff were extremely rude, especially in the bars. The front desk was useless and sometimes there was no one there and you had to queue and wait .... We would not recommend this hotel to anyone ... choose another hotel. What is the management's thinking. Guests should be their first priority!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best location on Waikiki. Beautifully maintained hotel and excellent check in service. The breakfast was lovely too. The pool area is looking a little tired and impossible to get a lounge chair only if you want to get up before 7am to grab one.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I went to the restaurant and all the keiki menu is only salads or salmon with vegetables and mash potatoes. I think that a child should have something meaty or pasta. The hotel would be great if you are an adult as the adult menu is great but if you are a child who hates veggies and salad have breakfast lunch and dinner somewhere outside of the hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a historical, beautiful hotel just on the legendary Waikiki beach, but is not quite what I wanted. Part of it was my mistake. Having read other travellers mention very small rooms in the historical wing, I booked one in the tower; I should never have. Yes, the room is of good size and has a balcony, but apart of that has totally no charm or style, floor covered with hideous carpets and boring furniture. The worst part, however, is that you can only access rooms it the Tower Wing with a lift - rather uninviting fire stairs aside – and it takes ages for one to come. As we visited during peak holiday season, the problem was probably bigger than usually; a fact that one out of three lifts was not working did not help. Whenever you want to get up or down – prepare to wait.Then there is the breakfast queue. Starts forming already from 8 o’clock. It is not only lack of tables, but the system is designed for queuing. First you wait in line to register at the desk, then are moved to the next line waiting to be taken to the table. The problem is that to the historical hotel two huge wings have been added; now its lobby, courtyard an restaurant designed for the original wing must serve – 3? 5? – times as many guests and we could feel it all along. On the plus side: the breakfast buffet is very good, a nice beach just in the front (rather pricey sunbed rental). There is a good looking gym, but was too crowded when I checked, so ended up running along the waterfront instead. “Beachhouse” restaurant is pretty good, if you are lucky to get a table.This is a nice classic place turned a crowded resort – but I am not sure if there are better options on Waikiki beach. In any case, stay away during Christmas peak season.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Husband and I stayed for five nights, in the diamond head view room (newer tower). We arrived mid-morning after an overnight flight from Australia. There was only one person on the front desk and we waited in line for 30 minutes before being served. Even after discussing options for storing luggage and getting changed etc, the front desk person failed to tell us there is actually a “hospitality room” guests can use for 45minutes to shower and change / refresh. We found this out from the bell boy and then had to line up again to request to use the hospitality room. When we arrived at the hospitality room, the previous guests luggage was still inside, so I would strongly recommend taking your own luggage back to reception rather than relying on the hotel to keep luggage secure. Despite already pre-paying all costs (including the ‘resort fee’) the hotel still charged us the resort fee again, without first notifying us, we simply noticed the charge ourselves. The hotel charged us instantly, but took 3 days to refund the charge, and only after constant enquiries with front desk staff who were confused about the situation and dismissed us, stating they would “pass on the message to finance”. Although the hotel is beautiful and well located, it was not worth the cost and the service was very poor. We would not stay here again. Good points - Location on the main strip and also beachfront Great views from the room / balconyReliable wifi in the room Bad points - Really poor service from the front deskSmall pool and all pool chairs taken by 7amBeach bar had good food and service however it was always impossible to find a table. You simply have to stalk other guests and jump on the table when they leave.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Beautiful Hotel - Very clean - Extremely friendly service. Walk out on th the terrace and your on Waikiki. Best view in HonoluluI would suggest walking down towards Dukes and getting surfing lessons. Wave are perfect for beginners

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved this hotel and the history that goes with it. Our room was small, in the historic wing, but clean and had everything we needed. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The concierge booked all our trips and answered our questions. We didn't eat at the hotel instead sampled some of plentiful restaurants around Waikiki. The cocktails though were great! We used the valet parking which was hassle free. Beware parking is not cheap! Definitely recommend and would stay here again no problem.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed at the moana surf rider 5 years ago and decided to stay again for christmas and new year 2017 / 18, for the high price you pay the hotel is tired looking, nothing has changed in 5 years only more worn out. One lift was broken from the day we arrived and was promised by staff this would be fix by the next day....11 days later i have left and lift still not working. What made it worse was there are only 2 other lifts that we had to wait and all squash into then when more than 4 levels were push all levels would turn off. We had cleaners knocking on the door at 8am? we would dial concierge and find the person could not speak proper English, having to repeat myself. Talking to other people staying at the hotel(while squashed in the lift) all mentioned to check your bill they as they double charge. I will not stay at the moana surf rider again there are many other newer hotels and cheaper i would suggest to do your research you will find a better hotel.
user_name:
Maurice N
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Westin Surfrider from Dec 24th thru the 29th. We had excellent customer service from Porter..... he pretty much saved the day. We got there late afternoon after checking out of another hotel just to have the full Hawaiian vacation...,,when we arrived our room was not ready and was informed that the room typed we requested was not available .....needless to say we were disappointed, but not for too long. Mr. Porter brought joy to my family with his outstanding service. He went above and beyond to make us happy.... he checked on us to make sure we were in need of nothing. The hotel lobby is beautiful, smiling faces at the front desk. The room was clean and spacious. The pool is small..... but the beach is lovely..... you have to get out early to get a chair. Would I recommend this hotel...AbSOLUTELY!!!! I will be back in May. Oh.....the lounge is a great spot to hang out and snack.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had nine days before Christmas in a premier oceanfront suite with full view of Diamond Head. First thing I saw from the balcony on day one was a turtle in the shallows on the beach below (Waikiki Beach!!) and this set the tone for the whole stay; great ambience in the hotel; rocking chairs, Banyan Tree, friendly staff. The million dollar question of course is was the extra cost of the suite (over US$1000 a night) over a room worth it? My answer is a guarded yes; in our case there were three adults and the alternative would have been two rooms; these would have cost about the same if you go ocean front; the view from the suites is fantastic and you do feel like you have he best spot in the whole of Waikiki as it sticks right out into the water. The other thing with the suites is you get Beach Club access; as other reviewers have noted this is fairly average in the morning (though staff very good), but comes alive in the evening with a nice vibe.Other than the view, the suites are not that special in terms of bathrooms etc but a good size and the day bed is great.Overall when we go back ( and we will, soon), as a couple I'd go for an oceanfront premium room rather than a suite and use the money saved in the Verandah bar and restaurant.Overall a great stay

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This review is solely for the New Years Eve 2017 party at the Moana. My wife and I had a great time. It’s well worth the price of admission. There were plenty of New Years party favors. 2 photo booths, kids tattoo station and the best of it all is the entertainment provided. Live DJ’s, Ukulele performers. Hula dancers and the fire dancer was amazing. It starts at 8pm and before you know it, New Year has arrived. For sure will do this again if we’re back in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the first hotel built on Waikiki Beach. While it has been completely updated, it retains much of it’s “old world” charm. The 100 year old Banion Tree in the center court is a great place for a relaxing cocktail. Ane the front porch has a row of rocking chairs for relaxing. Rooms are modern. It is right on Waikiki Beach, so you don’t have to cross the road to get to the beach like many other hotels. Staff is VERY friendly. The only drawback we see, is the small pool. You have to get to the pool by 7:30 AM to get a lounge chair. If you can go for the money, get an Oceanfront room. The views are fantastic.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Surfrider is a landmark hotel on Waikiki - the rooms all have great charm and many have views. The best aspect of this hotel is the atmosphere of the central courtyard with its focal banyan tree. The location which is directly on the beach is unique in Waikiki with immediate access to some of the greatest surfing in the world and at the some time, a vibrant night life along the central artery of Honolulu.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a great time here - very expensive for what you get - $500 per night for a standard Westin room - I guess it is all about the location (Waikiki Beach). Breakfast Buffet was excellent with lots of hot and cold options. Nice pool and beach. The rooms facing the main road are pretty noisy - lots of steel drums out on the street until late at night.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Since this restaurant isn’t on Open Table nor searchable on Trip Advisor, let me let you on a super place to dine. The Beach House is a fantastic place for a special occasion or any other reason to enjoy this gem on Waikiki. Our waiter Ricky and his assistants were spot on with perfect timing and attention. The food was to die for and the porch was a great place to relax and enjoy a fine dining experience. Call (Hawaii time in the Kate afternoon) for reservations. Mahalo Westin!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A fine old school establishment serviced by excellent food, bar & staff. Well worth the stay. Room was not large but the view was priceless. A tip, pool side lounger or beach umbrellas need to be booked in advance maybe 24/48 hours. The Beach Bar is very popular but it's a prime Honolulu hangout. A lot of history attached to this hotel so check it out. If you're in no particular hurry grab a rocker at the entrance and watch literally, the world pass by. Enjoy this Queen of Honolulu, too few of it's kind in existence.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The best place to have a traditional afternoon tea right by the beach at a beautiful hotel. Original hotel is from 1901, and the afternoon tea is held on a beautiful large veranda facing the ocean. Served on a traditional 3 tier tray. The sandwiches are delightful and the tea is delicious but the dessert is just the highlight of the afternoon tea.Friendly staff and great traditional ambiance. Nice quiet afternoon tea !

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here December 23-January 2nd. Overall our experience at the Surfrider was poor. Although the hotel needs some work, the biggest problem is their service:-One of the elevators for the tower rooms broke down the first day of our stay and it is still broken as of today. We did not see anyone working on it the entire time. This often resulted in long waits.-Pool drink/food service was lacking if you were not in a cabana. Most days we didn’t see any servers for the general pool area. We did luck out and had a young gentleman serve us one day. He was excellent (did not get his name). The other time that we got service we had to track down one of the ladies serving the cabanas. -The Beach Bar was also lacking service. On the night of the 24th I ended up having to clear off the table from the previous group. I brought the dirty dishes to the bar’s staging area and wiped off the table with a napkin from the washroom. We tried to go one other day for lunch but the waitress, after us waiting for 15 minutes for anyone to come by, told us the food would take an hour or more. We left the hotel to go for lunch elsewhere.-THE POOL!! This is an absolute joke. I know how the towel game works at these hotels so I am always up early to hold some chairs. The pool opens up at 7:00am. The first few days I came down around 6:30-6:45am. Most of the chairs were reserved by the hotel and what was leftover was mostly taken. Today I came down at 5:30am. The pool attendant had already started reserving chairs. I grabbed 4 chairs facing the ocean and he came over to tell me I couldn’t sit there as they were reserved. I showed him there was no reserved sign but he still asked me to leave. He put his reserved banner across the two chairs after I got up. He also told me if I wanted to hold other chairs I could not leave them until the pool opens at 7:00am! Here is the crazy part. I started looking around and the hotel had about 20/60 chairs reserved. These are the ideal spots that get most of the sun. Allegedly these chairs are reserved for those guests that have came back 10 years in a row (or more). Although I don’t agree with this special treatment, I can live with it. The issue is that these reserved chairs stayed unoccupied until about 8:45am (you can see the clock in my pictures). That is 1.75 after the pool opened. The hotel policy is that chairs can’t be left for more than an hour. Most of these reserved chairs ended up going to those guests that also complained about the special treatment. If you want to sit by the pool during your stay then look elsewhere. The pool is really small and the fact that the hotel is reserving 25-30% for special guests means you are likely not going to get a spot. This hotel is way too expensive for this type of service!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This place is divine... From the second you arrive you are relaxed. From the gorgeous rocking chairs on the front porch, then banyan tree shading the back bar and pool area between the hotel and beach, you feel like your 1000 miles away from normal life. Staff were great. Rooms were beautiful. High tea on the balcony was an experience that will be remembered for many years to come

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Get ready to be transported a hundred years ago to another time and place when the only way to get to Hawai‘i was by boat and the only way to get to the hotel was by horse & buggy. Then all of a sudden you remember that that was then and this is now. Modern amenities and luxury abound in a genteel atmosphere of afternoon tea, front porch with rocking chairs and a big back porch with more rocking chairs for an afternoon nap. Right past the back porch is the hotel’s outside restaurant and bar for beachside dining. Friendly servers take your order as you sit back and take in the great view of Waikiki Beach along with the throngs of people on the beach. There is the original part of the hotel with rooms and a new building with more rooms. Either way, you can’t go wrong with either choice giving you Westin style standards of Heavenly beds, excellent service and amenities. An excellent choice for your stay on Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was my fifth stay at this property and overall it is falling behind. The rooms are sparsely furnished, the closet was in the bathroom (weird) and the hotel overall was in need of upkeep. I hope SPG invests in this hotel to bring it back up to the standard that is worthy of both the location and history of the property

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel does not have the instalations nor the capacity for the hight amount of people they receive in new year. We had to wait half an hour to get seated for breakfast, no tables at all for lunch. Only 2 elevators functioning for a wing of thousands of people, we had to do lines to get up and down.The pool is smaller than my bath tub... they charge for the beach benches and they only have around 25 pool chairs for the hole hotel... it was soooo crouded you had to push people to get throught the lobby.Do NOT come here in high season, you would regred it. Maybe its better in low season but we are defenetly not coming back. Too bad beacuse its a beautiful place but with the worst service in the world.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We found this really nice bar by accident while walking around the Moana Surfrider Hotel. The bar is located in the back of the hotel. The hotel is located in the center of the strip of Waikiki beach. The drinks here are a bit expensive but are very good. This is a fun place to meet people from all over the world. We ended up coming back here several times during our 16-day stay in Waikiki. It is too bad they close so early.Ideally situated on Waikiki Beach, the Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, is one of Honolulu, Oahu's most legendary luxury hotels.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Caution: avoid this hotel during peak season. It is ill-equipped to deal with the crowds that should have been expected but clearly were not. Upon arrival told no upgrades available despite Elite status because hotel was oversold by 4%. Could have lived with the small room but the low floor, thin walls, proximity to the elevator and deafening HVAC meant sleep was impossible. Requests to relocate were denied. Other special features: a rusty tea kettle, poor to non existent WiFi (reported and not resolved), lack of storage and a bathroom the size of a small closet. Fine, we were in Waikiki, not going to spend a lot of time in the room. There’s the beach, the pool...yeah, not really. To get a chance at the too few pool chairs, you either have to have been identified as some frequent and valued guest of the hotel (per the pool attendant) and they pre reserve prime spots for you OR you get to the pool at 6 am and try to grab what’s left. I watched one man reserve 10 chairs and no one said a thing. They went unoccupied for over 2 hours save for the same guy walking between them and moving possessions around. Beach chairs? Forget it. Those are gone 24 hours in advance - reserved by people willing to line up at 6 am. Nothing is available same day. Attendants help only if tipped (so much for my daily resort fee) and then only reluctantly. Restaurant and bar service was slow and not enough help for the number of guests. I expected it would be busy over the holiday but management clearly didn’t. Or they did but only care about ensuring their “frequent and valued” guests were taken care of. A disappointing stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Always stay here for work. Thankfully the Shorebird has been replaced, essentially the same with new paint. The suites on the roof are exceptional. Spend a day at the beach and walk up to the bar. You can go wrong with an Outrigger.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The worst hotel experience I’ve ever had. The elevators were broken the entire span of 5 days with no effort to fix them during that time so you had to account for up to 20 minute wait time to get up or down. We waited 1.5 hours to get chips and dip at the bar. The staff were clearly being stretched thin and management had no interest in resolving any issues with anyone. Everyone we spoke to staying at the hotel shared similar sentiments and there seemed to be a unanimous agreement that the hotel did not care about customer satisfaction or service. We were also repeatedly billed incorrectly and treated poorly in our attempts to resolve billing problems. The staff were doing their best, but were clearly unhappy and overworked. There was one person responsible for poolside service for a hundred people. We paid $50 to rent chairs on the beach and by 4:00pm staff had come by and put them away. The pool closed at 6pm regardless of the great weather. Management put forth no effort to resolve any issues, treated customers poorly, and clearly did not care about customer satisfaction. We can confidentially say that we would never stay here again. I would not recommend this hotel and was really disappointed with the entire experience.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Ideal location, great space, landmark property, solid service, and the decor (especially during the holidays) is gorgeous. While the unique architecture has been well-preserved, all is well kept, and earns its reputation as 1 of the 2 original (the other being the pink Royal Hawaiian resort) resort properties here on the South Shore, established before 1920. Beautiful experience, complete with a stunning Banyan tree in the makai oceanfront courtyard, and hula shows in the evenings. Lovely, comfortable (rather than ostentatious), yet entirely special and elegant. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed 3 nights over the Christmas holiday in a premier ocean front suite. Room was extremely spacious with a great balcony directly overlooking the center of Waikiki beach, plus a separate balcony off the bedroom facing Diamond Head, and the hotel pool. Service was mixed overall – friendly and welcoming at the Beach House for dinner; helpful and prompt at the Beach Bar; surly and apathetic at the Verandah for breakfast. One of the 3 Tower Wing elevators was out of order for the duration of our stay, leading to long waits, and crowds of disgruntled guests. Still, its difficult to beat the central location – convenient for both beach fun, and Waikiki shopping.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If location is your thing then this is the place for you-right in the middle of Waikiki and all it has to offer! The hotel itself is beautiful and has history at every turn. The on site museum and memorabilia really takes you back to the glory days of early Honolulu. Staff were all pleasant and helpful, especially housekeeping and front desk. Our corner room was beautiful but on a scale we’ve only previously seen in Paris-it was tiny. The view however was spectacular facing the beach and Diamond Head. The pool area was v nice and relatively easy to get a lounger for the day with towels readily available. Food and beverage was also of a good standard. During the day the hotel is extremely busy with a never ending parade of tourists and weddings passing through. Also there is a very commercial side to the hotel with an unavoidable array of upsell opportunities from photos to cabanas to beach loungers etc. There’s a steep resort fee which includes an array of things but most of these are things I would expect to be provided anyway at this star rating and price point. All that said, we thoroughly enjoyed the people watching, the rockers on the porch and the coffee at the adjoining coffee shop and would stay again but would probably ask to see the room first as the size was off putting.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 4 adults and 3 kids 5,6,6 for last dinner in Hawaii before heading back to Sydney next day awesome service under the Banyan tree excellent food and outstanding wine list made for a great night nothing too much trouble and made everyone’s night

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I like be this hotel so much. The veranda was like a dream. I had the fruits. Rooms were amazing! The bed were so comfortable I could stay there all day. Across the street was the market place. The hotel was on the beach and a hop from dukes. Around the corner was a publicity c access and a little store they made amazing sandwiches. This hotel was all me. I loved the porch and the rocking chairs. But seriously the Veranda for brunch was incredible and seemed like a dream. Hands down my favorite hotel in Hawaii. I think it's the charm of old Hawaii

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location of the Moana Surfrider is great, and the beach bar has some good Mai Tai's, but that's about it. Tiny rooms, the pool and beach are heavily overcrowded, it's next to impossible to score a chair at either of them. The ridiculous resort fee should cover that but you end up without having any of it. Internet did not work during my stay for any other device than one phone (we tried several laptops and phones). Some staff like at the bar and concierge/beach club are friendly but some like express services or front desk need CS training.Would not stay here again given the $400++ rates and the non-existent access to pool/beach during busy periods.SPG Platinum recognition was barely existent either, beach club was offered but no preferred room, breakfast option other than club, or access to beach/pool chairs.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Best location next to the Waikiki beach and in the heart of Honolulu. Great facilities, amazing staff and food Christmas entertainment both for children and adults. Worth being here for a drink, or dinner or a stay!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If your reviewing hotels, don’t bother looking anywhere else. The Surf Rider was an amazing experience and totally worth it. The lobby area is modern with a classic styling, the rooms are modern but it has that timeless feel about the place. Right on the beach means you fall out of the resort onto the beach and into the water. Breakfast was included in our room which was above average but the view and salty air made the experience that much better!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana is the original Waikiki Beach hotel. It has gone through some changes over the last 100 years but the elegance and timelessness remains. The colonial columns of the portico and the porch that runs along the full length of the entrance immediately transports you back to the early 1900's. You can still sit in one of the classic rockers on the porch and watch the world go by. The hotel lobby is just as impressive and you'll be hard pressed to find a time when a bride isn't gracing the spectacular stairs while posing for pictures. The rooms in the original building are mixed in terms of size ...ours was a corner room overlooking the beach with an abundance of light and space while a family members was smallish with a courtyard view. The pool is basically for kids and to splash in and cool down...don't expect laps ... the ocean has lots of space for that. The location is also excellent with quick access to many choices of restaurants and shops close by. A walk down the beach to the Barefoot Cafe for breakfast will not disappoint you.The service is also impeccable. The young woman who was on the night desk when we arrived could not have been friendlier. She got us checked in efficiently and made us feel like we were long time regulars returning for a visit. From the bartenders to the maids to the pool attendants, all of the staff provided excellent service with warmth and smiles. Highly recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first time staying at the Moana Surfrider, we usually stay at the Marriott Waikiki Resort, but decided to try this hotel now that it is part of the Marriott group. We were completely blown away by the experience this hotel provides. Entering the hotel is like stepping back in time and isolates one from the crazy pace of Waikiki, but at the same time that crazy pace is right outside the front door. We received an upgraded room and the view was fantastic. It literally felt like we were over the ocean. The bar staff was excellent and we really enjoyed our evening sitting outside watching the sunset and having some great drinks. We will definitely be staying at this hotel from now on when visiting Oahu.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Myself husband and friend came for dinner expecting a first class meal. How disappointing-I ordered the Korean chicken which should have been served with garlicky mash. It came with cold roast potatoes and when I spoke to the waiter he said I could have mashed potatoes if I wanted (they were in the description). He took my plate away and brought it back with the cold potatoes removed and ordinary mash instead. My husband had cold roast potatoes which then had to be replaced with warm ones. Our two requests for wine were met with “sorry we have run out of that one”. Is this five star I don’t think so. My next visit to Waikiki won’t include a visit to this restaurant

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at the Moana Surfrider after leaving a different hotel that was not what it advertised and was ruining our trip. So we were pleased when we drove up to the Moana and walked into the beautiful entry way and finally felt some of the romance that we had been hoping for on our honeymoon. The hotel itself is beautiful, so much character! We had nothing but great experiences with the staff, and were very impressed with the room. The hotel was very clean and decorated so nicely for Christmas! Our favourite part was actually the location. So central to all the shopping, restaurants, and of course the beach so you can walk to anything you might need or want. The only tips I give future guests is always call for your car at least 20 mins before you need it from valet. They pick it up from another location so it takes a few mins but I recommend just waiting for it while you sit in the rocking chairs out front. Always a good spot to sit and people watch. Also as beautiful as this hotel is it is very busy and the very small pool is always full of kids and pool chairs are all full of towels people have left to save seats that apparently didn’t seem to be a problem with the hotel as it didn’t look like they made an effort to keep people from doing it. But Waikiki is such a busy place itself I guess we should have assumed it would be as busy as it was. After our trip we realized Hawaii is not a place we wish to return to. We enjoyed our time but it just wasn’t for us. We might try another island one day but for anyone visiting Waikiki be prepared it kinda feels a lot like the Vegas strip but instead of casinos it’s high end shopping everywhere you look. Be sure to rent a car so you can go explore other parts of the island some really good little places to eat towards the North Shore. With all that said if I ever end up in Waikiki again I would happily stay at the Moana.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've been home a week now after my trip to Waikiki with my friend for a girls getaway break and some shopping. We normally stay at the Modern however decided on the Moana Surfrider for a change. What a huge disappointment this hotel stay was. The location and a pretty tree is the only thing going for this hotel. The rudeness of the staff and the complete lack of service as disgusting. There is no consistency in the service - that's when you actually get it - and generally the staff are just rude. They are just hanging around and are complacent. Around the pool, which was full of screaming kids so I highly don't recommend you stay at this hotel if you want to relax. In addition there is absolutely no service around the pool whatsoever. Guests generally go down to the pool at 6am and leave their towels on a chair all day to reserve it - most of the time not being on the chair themselves. It's really badly managed - actually it's not managed at all. If we needed staff to assist with a spilt drink from someone elses doing we had to go looking for one. The staff manning the beach hut just stood around all day chatting to themselves. They could be way more useful. I feel they have been there way to long and it's time for a change of guard. The menus are ordinary, and too heavy for outdoor dining in the sun. Time to modernise and lighten things up. The arrogance of the concierge is mind blowing. The fact the staff are wearing badges to stop the outsourcing is hilarious. I'd get rid of them all straight away. We provided a $10 tip for bringing our bags down and watch the porter roll his eyes at the other porter as if to say this is all I got. Seriously, this hotel is order taking on location and taking everyone for a ride. Really think twice before you spend your money. I would not go back there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was amazing! My son and I stayed here right after he returned from military deployment. It was very comfortable, convenient, friendly, and worth every dollar. I used the spa services while I was there and they did a great job getting me in with little notice and the service was outstanding! I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was an amazing hotel, right on the beach beautiful views and very clean , excellent staff very friendly, food was great but we spent most of our time near the beach bar and in pool. The Banyan restaurant was great for breakfast buffet but we also ate our trying other restaurants , Yard house was good steak. We will definitely go back.Fiellissa and Tony.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My review is not so much on the hotel but the beach staff themselves. I cannot describe how wonderful they are. this was my second stay at the hotel in 13 months, and i would return, just because of them . if you are like me, you spend most of your time by the pool or beach, so these are the people you interact with most!They went above and beyond their scope of work to make me feel comfortable, as they knew i was alone for the first half of my trip. They gave me a wonderful surprise on my birthday, which brought me to tears - i would not in a million years have expected hotel staff to surprise me with gifts!! conversation was great, every day - not only with me, but with all the guests that took a few minutes to engage in conversation with them. they all had a great sense of humour and had restaurant and donut ( yes, donut ) recommendations on a daily basis! They really did make my vacation memorable, in the most positive way!I cannot wait to retire - my new post retirement dream job is to work at the Towel station at Moana with them! Amazing staffMichael, one of the hotel managers was also very helpful and a pleasure to deal with, as were the Bell staff and my house keeping room attendant Penny! she had a very pleasant personality and was always smiling!they have some great employees there

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Dinner on the terrace was spectacular, the food was faultless and the service excellent. The Moana is lovely hotel to visit even if it's just to pop in for a drink either on terrace or down at the beach bar.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice holiday in Hawai'i. First went to Maui then spent last 5 days in Waikiki. Moana surfrider has a great location. On the beach one side and the main street the other side. Real nice colonial feel to the hotel. Great restaurant and bar garden backing on to the beach with a magical "avatar Pandora tree" right in the middle. Wife loved the free morning yoga classes. Great service and friendly people for the Waikiki strip. Modest size pool on beach side....but hey...Waikiki is about the beach and the rolling surf. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed at Surfrider now 3 times and just love the hotel the service is excellent.The Beach Bar is fantastic to meet up with friends the the Bar staff are very friendly the beach is just a few foot steps away. Terrance restaurant food is amazing. Molana Surfrider is central to everything in Waikiki with near by restaurants Dukes and the Cheesecake Factory and many more close by. Highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I returned to this hotel for a short business trip and had another good visit. The hotel has classic styling and a great central courtyard area with a small pool and great beach access. I love breakfast on the veranda and the French toast is the best around. The bedding is the usual great Westin standard. Service is always friendly and attentive and I appreciate being able to walk out the front door into the heart of Kalakawa shopping district and a bounty of restaurants. The only things keeping it from getting all 5 starts is the noise if you get one of the rooms on the Aveneue side, relatively small standard rooms and slower internet than you expect when included int the resort fee. Enjoy your stay in the heart of the action.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: OMG! I have stayed at the Royal Hawaiian (Pink Palace), Sheraton Waikiki, and the Halekalani, but the Moana Surfrider is dearest to my heart!At Christmas it turns into a winter wonderland of displays of trains, gingerbread houses, all covered in glittering sugar. Towering spruces decorated in silver and gold ribbons and crystal ornaments. Oldest hotel in Waikiki its renovation is magical. The back courtyard facing the ocean (Moana means Ocean--kai means sea) surrounds an ancient spreading Banyan tree 70 feet tall with a spreading canopy 150 feet across. Perfect to sit in shade on one of the curved wooden and iron benches.It was renovated in 1989 at $50 million. The front of the hotel is a sweeping veranda with large maple and oak wood rocking chairs. They are wonderful for relaxing and watching the SLOW traffic on Kalakaua Avenue and seeing the guests pull up in private taxis (stretch limousines are everyday taxis in Waikiki) or rented Lamborghinis to be valet parked all under an arch.The lobby as with most large Waikiki hotels is an open lobby filled with incredible floral arrangements of Birds of Paradise, orchids, hibiscus, ginger, and ti leaves. The latter are glossy green leaves that make up the “grass skirts” of the hula dancers. You can learn to make a braided ti leaf lei.The back surround around veranda offers a sweeping view of the Pacific Ocean and white beaches. There are three freshwater swimming pools but I love the salt water of the Pacific. Just Diamond head (direction) of the hotel is the Waikiki Aquarium. The HIGH ceilings, beautiful sand beige and sky blue tasteful paint and art deco is relaxing--you are as one with the beach and ocean.
