Here on this back veranda is 4 pm high tea each day with delicate tea cakes and finger sandwiches. Sunday champagne brunch is a must with the ballroom off the veranda open with food. Sashimi, sushi rolls, bagels, cream cheese, lox (smoked salmon) capers, onions, and bagels...along with traditional breakfast fare of made to order omelets, fresh squeezed orange or grapefruit juice. Papaya, mango, starfruit. Dinner can be right on the beach under strings of light bulbs. The chef came out personally to see if we had enjoyed his lobster bisque made with real whipping cream.The service is impeccable and ALWAYS friendly with aloha spirit. Some might complain that the rooms are smaller than on the mainland. Space is a problem on a limited island (275,000 people LIVE as residents in Waikiki not counting the tourists.) But who stays in a room when Hawai’i is outside. Enjoy the most wonderful vacation of your life here among all the oak, maple, and teak panels, staircases, steps, and banisters. Remember that all has been transported by boat 2,000 miles for renovation. Step into 1914 when the world was filled with the Vanderbilts, Astors, and Rockefellers...you will be treated like the .01%.No ka oi---the BEST.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for three nights. This is a grand hotel. A piece of time/history restored and maintained to the highest standards. The historic section is just that! The history of the hotel is very interesting. Take the tour. Centrally located with great convenience to the beach, shops and other restaurants. If you looking for a cheap bargain...not here. If you're looking for a sophisticated and historically significant hotel...this is it.
user_name:
Grouper1951
Isle of Palms, South Carolina

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice enough hotel although the rooms are quite small. We went on a cruise after visiting here and our cabin was bigger tbh. Also, they charged me twice on my credit card and even though I have called them 3 times... being hung up on once...! And, emailed them nobody has come back to me to discuss this and arrange a refund!!! Not very good when I am a member of their SPG club as well! I will be taking this matter further but certainly won’t be wasting my time by trying to contact the hotel again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’m a lifelong Marriott guy - and when greeted with the Marriott property options in Waikiki - I wasn’t too sure where to stay. So I started looking at SPG properties and found the Moana Surfrider. I was reluctant to book a non-Marriott property, but my status transferred over during the merger, so I had nothing to lose. Plus, the hotel sits right on the beach and when in Hawaii - that’s what you expect!We arrived via a private car and once we got out, there were no bellman or valets to assist us with our luggage. Our driver had to remove the bags and call for someone. At that point, two gentlemen came over, one for bags and the other with leis. Even our driver seemed shocked at the lackadaisical staff. And this wasn’t the only negative thing we encountered with the guys at the valet stand, but I’ll get into all of the negative things we noticed during our stay towards the end.Upon check-in, the gentlemen who greeted us was very welcoming. He informed us about the hotel and the items our status afforded us, to include a room upgrade. He offered us to rooms, which we decided upon a smaller room in the historic wing because of the ocean view. Overall, check-in was quick and easy!Our room was small, but like mentioned above, had an amazing view. It was a very cozy room and we overlooked both the beach and the courtyard, so every night we had the pleasure of listening to the live music wafting throughout the property as well as the waves crashing against the shore! The bathroom was also on the small side, but that wasn’t an issue for my wife or I. Housekeeping was great and prompt every day, as well super-friendly!The beach and pool areas were very nice and well maintained. For the most part, the staff in those areas were helpful and friendly. I’d recommend renting the beach chairs instead of the cabanas! Because when at the beach, your toes must be buried in the sand!We ate at the Veranda at the Beach House and the Beach Bar during our stay and both were good in both service and food. The buffet breakfast option was underwhelming for the price, but their açaí bowl was amazing. Try the poke nachos at the bar. My wife had a few treatments at the spa, and we also spent a few days just enjoying the spa facilities. Although on the small side, the spa facility was nice, as were the staff. The men’s side had two lounges, one with leather chairs and a TV, which is rare for spas, but cool nonetheless. The rear lounge had a great balcony to hang out on and watch the people and sunset. My wife said the women’s side was similar, but without a TV lounge. Each side also had showers, steam rooms (wet and dry), as well as jacuzzis.The Beach Club Lounge, which is for SPG members and those who pay - which is something I wouldn’t recommend doing - was horribly underwhelming. The options for breakfast are sparse and not really that good. The same goes for the evening snacks/food. It seems the only good thing about the Lounge is the outdoor seating areas- beach facing. If you don’t receive this benefit as part of your SPG status, don’t waste your money. There are better breakfast options at the numerous coffee shops within walking distance. We only used the Lounge for the cold bottles of water.OK, so the negatives...The staff, save for a few, didn’t welcome or greet us daily. They were all lost in their own worlds. At first, we thought maybe this was just how things are on the Island, but after visiting a few other hotels for dinner and drinks, we soon discovered this seemed to be a Westin Moana problem. The valet guys were always laughing and joking and were indifferent to the people coming and going. I watched many people come and go with bags - us included - and never once did the gentlemen in the front offer to assist. I’ve mentioned the underwhelming Club Lounge, and I can’t stress enough that if you’re paying, it’s not worth it unless is like $10 or something similar. Any more than that is a rip-off.On the morning of checkout, we called down for a bellman. After 20 minutes we gave up and lugged our luggage down to the front desk. At that point, I was asked if we needed assistance with our bags. Of course, I told them no and explained that I had requested assistance but no one ever showed up. I received an apology, but it didn’t seem sincere. At the very least, he should have called the bellman over immediately to take our items out for us. But alas, that didn’t occur. That’s all of the bad things! And in the long run, nothing too horrendous. But we were expecting a better welcoming atmosphere. Or at least friendlier staff! And I know I used the word, “underwhelming” a lot, but honesty, that’s exactly what this property was - a little underwhelming. But honestly, the room, location and views were hard to beat!So if you’re a Marriott or SPG member, this hotel offers a lot for your loyalty. And even if you’re not, this property is really nice and has tons of history. As long as you don’t expect friendly or helpful staff, or are least indifferent to that type of service, you won’t be disappointed at the Westin Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed for 8 nights from 16 November 2017 with a room in the Banyon Wing with a Juliet balcony. Not disappointed at all. Everything about the room and hotel is 5 star class. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff. We will definitely be staying here again. Fabulous. Live music finishes at 2130. Air con in rooms very quiet

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Recently we stayed at Moana Surfrider and absolutely loved it. Its right on the beach close to a lot of restaurants.I left my phone while getting off the Shuttle bus from the airport and i thought I had lost it for ever but the staff at the hotel had taken down the rego of the bus and called him back and go my phone delivered to me.Staff are really friendly. They is a beach club with limited breakfast options but it was very convientient. we did love sitting and enjoying a few drinks there before heading out to dinner.Definitely staying back there

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is the very first hotel built in Waikiki and is one of the highest rated. My wife travels a lot for work so we were able to get free upgrades to a beach view room. Nice modern room with balcony overlooking waikik beach and view of Diamond Head. Also had free access to the beach club that allowed free wine and bear and snacks as well as free breakfast. The upgrades also gave us free parking, a $35 a day value. Nice relaxing trip in a top class hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a resident of Hawaii and someone who has worked in the spa & health industry for several years, my search for the best spa on Oahu has finally landed on the Moana Surfrider. My husband (who isn't typically a fan of spas) and I visited a few months ago, and were simply blown away by the incredible experience we had. The level of hospitality, professionalism, facility upkeep (as well as beauty), and talent of my therapist was extraordinary (as was my husbands). I was so impressed after leaving, I reached out to the director of the spa to thank him for facilitating such an incredible experience. He promptly responded to with the warm gratitude I felt during my visit - from the top down - this spa's team has greatly impressed me. If you are traveling to Oahu or live on the south shore - this is an experience you won't want to miss.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have stayed here 4 times in the past. Each time the service or lack there of had become evident to us. However me and my wife always had a special feeling about this hotel so we wanted to give it one last chance.We stayed three nights on the end leg of our honeymoon trip. The service was welcoming. Especially the staff at the beach bar.. where usually we got fairly routine service and no engagement. Craig and the staff this time were friendly and remembered us. Was a pleasure finishing off our nights at the beach bar. To top it off our last night we were delivered champagne to our room courtesy of the beach bar. We felt so appreciated. They won back our loyalty and we will come back again as Waikiki is a special place for me and my wife .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 40 of us went over and Harry and Marnie organised a tailgate party for us . It was a terrific day good food and good times . Thanks Harry and Marnie and the rest of the crew . Would recommend going to see Harry and the boys any day

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I made the mistake of staying in the Sheraton Princess although it was nice the Moana Surfrider was much nicer. Since they are directly opposite I spent more time in the surfrider (since its right on the beach) then my own hotel. The Bar on the beach is the best, Kat served us at the table most days and she is awesome. The boy's behind the bar, Harry and Marnie are sensational. Nothing is to hard for these people. I highly recommend this Bar and grill for a day, night or both on the beach. Thanks again to Harry, Marnie and Kat for making me relax and enjoy my holiday.5 stars from me!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have always liked the ocean front bar with a spectacular Banyan tree and a nice ocean view. Unfortunately, the view of the tree is now blocked by umbrellas, and at night the ocean is obscured by cheap looking lights on the wall separating the bar from the public beach.Please furl the umbrellas at night when rain is not expected; and possibly do something to allow people to look out at the ocean without having their view obstructed by the lights on the wall.I’ll be back, but please close the umbrellas at night!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was my first visit to this property - Oahu has so many luxury resorts to choose from. The bottom line for me is that I genuinely loved the the hotel. I was captured by its architecture, its beachfront setting and the soft breezes that flowed through the lobby every day. Our room in the tower was absolutely wonderful and spacious and we spent virtually all our time on the balcony. The bathrooms were small but adequate and the shower had good pressure and was a great temperature. I also appreciated the electric toilet apparatus. Ate at the Beachhouse Restaurant every day of our stay. The staff there was very, very friendly and had excellent name recognition with us, though I found them to be overwhelmed and a bit unfocused. "We'd like a table for two - room 1374...' Staff response, 'Did you say 1810?' This lack of genuine listening was a common problem in many areas of the resort - valet, concierge, front desk, laundry and housekeeping. We had small hiccups with all six areas of the resort. But overall, they did not dampen our pleasure at being at this wonderful location and enjoying our beautiful setting and guestroom. And I will say that the food at the Beachhouse was excellent. And when ever we were struggling with the staff, they were ALL very kind and though it took a LOT of extra communication, we were able to get all of our needs met. It is not the Four Seasons Ko Olina in terms of polished service (where I last stayed on Oahu), but we truly enjoyed the property and would not hesitate to return. We just won't expect a genuinely polished level of service, because the hotel has trouble delivering this in any department. I will say that I believe they very much mean well. Location on the luxury strip cannot be surpassed and the views of Diamond Head from many hotel rooms are well worth the additional money to achieve. I plan to return here the same time next year, as I believe this is the kind of place that warrants an annual tradition and Thanksgiving is a wonderful holiday on property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have been here half a dozen times. Every time this hotel surprises me and makes me want to return again and again.Concierge- Roxanne is just awesome. Just very knowledgeable and knows her staff.The Beach bar... it is the bar to be as it's near the beach BUT the best part are the bar tenders... Peter, Craig, Marni, Rean, Joey, James and few others.Great bar food but the drinks are just awesome.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Decided to try this hotel after admiring it on previous visits. It is a great location.Room, city view with 2 double beds,was extremely small as was the bathroom, could barely walk around after placing our bags down. Room service was prompt but not that thorough. We enjoyed the bar and breakfast restaurant.Did not rebook after our trip to Kauai, I believe there are better options.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've book 3 rooms with them staying 3 nights. As I'm a Platinum member, they give me a WARM COZY ROOM with trees view no upgrade, the corridor with big smell third floor of the classic building. Breakfast lack choices. Waiting a long time for check in and check out.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am speechless. Every time I visit this hotel it gets better.Dinner last night to celebrate my daughters 17th birthday was divine. Beautiful table on the balcony with impeccable service by Kelvin we could not fault it.The beautiful staff are always ready to assist in any way possible.Lunch times also spent in the Beach Bar are lunch times to remember.Thank you Moana Surfrider and your amazing staff.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The front of the Moana is on Kalakaua Ave with all the restaurants and shopping. The rear of the hotel is on Waikiki Beach. So convenient. We stayed in the Tower with a partial ocean view. The lanai faced the Outrigger lanais which was not very private. But we had a fantastic view of the sunset from our lanai which made up for it. We got balloons from Housekeeping and wine and chocolates from the hotel for our anniversary. Be sure to take the hotel history tour. Great staff.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: On holidays in Waikiki from Melbourne, Australia and staying at the Moana Surfrider on the 6th floor in a Historic Banyan Room with a queen bed. Things we are enjoying - Buffet Breakfast on the verandah with beautiful views of the magnificent Banyan Tree and Waikiki Beach and sitting in the rocking chairs reading or watching the world go by. Things we are not enjoying - We are really disappointed in our room which has such a small bathroom and vanity that we could barely fit anything on the vanity. To be honest the room is so small we have barely unpacked. This is our second trip to Waikiki and the Moana Surfrider and last time we loved our room which had ocean views and felt very special staying here however, this time our views are of the main street which we is so noisy of an evening with loud music, cars revving etc... Sadly, we are not feeling special staying where we are staying this time as apart from our room being very small and unimpressive which we could tolerate we are not feeling very special staying on the 6th Floor as the last 2 evenings there have been private functions on this floor and we feel as though we shouldn’t even be there! When we come out of the lift to go back to our room we step into into the middle of the function with everyone dressed in their finery and looking at us like “what are you do here” and then we don’t even have a clear path to our room having to go around the “private function” signs and tall plants blocking the middle of the corridors which make you feel like you are trespassing even though this is the only way back to your room!My Recommendations - I would still recommend staying at the Moana Surfrider Resort just for the experience of staying in one of the oldest hotels in Waikiki but only stay in a King Room, request an ocean or partial ocean views & do not stay on the 6th Floor.Jan & Steve Chapple

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel's location is hard to beat. We have stayed at this venue on three occasions now. The staff are very polite, very efficient and the facilities are first class. The one issue that spoilt our most recent stay was the noise made by housekeeping staff. Every morning of our stay we were woken by the housekeeping staff preparing to start their work. They talked loudly to each other, thumped and banged as they loaded up their trolleys, and despite their friendliness, were a real nuisance. I reported this to the front desk a couple of days into our stay, but the problem persisted for the duration of our holiday. I do not know the full extent of the extra taxes and fees levied by Hawaiian hotels, but it seems excessive. Their "resort fee" of $33 USD per room per day on top of other statutory taxes seems a bit rich. Yes, you get free phone calls, free bottled water and a few other minor concessions, but it sure adds to your room cost. I believe it is at the discretion of each hotel as to whether the charge is applied or not. Despite my criticisms, this is a grand hotel in the heart of Waikiki and if within your budget is well worth a stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first visit to to the Moana Surf Rider in Waikiki. what a great place it was, and what a great stay it was. From arriving, until our departure we had a staff dedicated to making our stay a good one.we had a minor problem with one Valet, but Jan, and Frank's graciousness more than made up for it. Our car was always there at exactly the time when we asked for it. This is some mean feat for a place that only has Valet parking, and usually has up to six weddings a day.The place is full of weddings all day long. some might find this a distraction, but we loved seeing all the young couple and their finery as the posed for the post wedding photos. ( We actually took some of the poses in our beach out fits and got laughs from both the bride, groom and photographers)The restaurants are first class, the beach access perfect, and the water there is why folks come to Hawaii. Staying right on the beach you can lock up everything valuable in your rooms' safe and head to the beach worry free( save for the occasional rogue wave.)Our ten days was exactly the quality of stay we wanted. It's not a cheap stay, but go ahead and splurge. it's worth it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is an outstanding resort in Waikiki. Easy access to shopping and dining and of course the beach. A good surf break is just to the left of the hotel facing the beach, you can rent boards and learn how to surf in the perfect waves. The staff is very friendly day and night - I was able to upgrade my room to an ocean view and it is a spectacular view. The room is great and quiet and the maid service was perfect. If you are looking for a hotel/resort in Waikiki this is the best I’ve stayed in!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights over labour day weekend (then went to Maui and returned for 1 more night before departing). I stayed in the Banyan original part of the hotel. For my first stay I was in a corner room overlooking the street, which was a bit noisy, but as a seasoned traveller I popped some ear plugs in and was fine. When I returned I was in a room overlooking the beach and courtyard which was much quieter! I didn’t go into the new section, but the lobby feels like stepping time complete with rocking chairs on the porch. My only criticism is the hotel was very busy, many weddings, the pool is very small and packed early, I headed straight to the beach in order to find somewhere to sit/enjoy the sunshine. I ate in most of the outlets and the food was fine and what you would expect. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to other hotels, shopping and restaurants and a short cab ride from everywhere else. I would definately stay again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I love this hotel because it is situated in the heart of Waikiki and it's an easy walk to absolutely everything. The ocean view rooms are wonderful -- with fantasitc views of the entire beach. It's the oldest hotel in Waikiki, so it definitley has a historical feel. Staff was super-friendly and helpful. Keep in mind that it is a busy resort -- there were always lines at the front desk, and it's not easy to get a seat at the bar. The pool is really nice, but it is best to go early to get a lounge chair. Our only issue was that the elevators were being renovated during our stay so it was always a slow process getting to / from our room.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: So close to the beach could literally throw a beach ball and hit it. Our room was in the Diamond section. Absolutely wonderful. Hotel is located in the middle of Waikiki. Steps from shopping and numerous restaurants. Cabs, Uber, Trolleys to almost everything available on the island. If possible join the Beach Club, best value and includes wifi, light food including salads and drinks including beer and wine in the evening plus bottled water all day. Breakfast everyday.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Very Central location and right on Waikiki beach. The rooms were not too big but not pricey. Good value for money compared to other hotels in the area I suppose. Beautiful lights on the banyan tree in the garden.The room we had was on the first floor and was facing the street which made it very noisy. When I say very noisy, I mean we couldn't sleep in it. So we asked to change rooms and after a little hassle, a quick 30 minutes later we were moved to another room that wasn't noisy

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Located in the best shopping area of Honolulu, the Moana Surfrider has the class of the “First Lady of Honolulu “. First hotel to open (1901) in Honolulu, it has kept the prestige and the style of a classy hotel of the early XX century. We enjoyed staying there and we would come back on a future visit. The room was nice so it was the restaurant. Unfortunately, the bar outside was not up to par with the rest of the hotel. The beach has without a doubt one of the best views of Waikiki and the Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Can’t say enough good things about the staff at The Moana. A former Hawaii resident, the front desk welcomed me back with open arms and lots of aloha. My room, though tiny, had the most spectacular views. I spent a couple of nights and days being pampered at the Moana - looking forward to my next visit.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked here because it was the last night of our holiday and thank goodness we did this was one of the first hotels built in Waikiki and the quality of the hotel the food the staff and the hospitality is still at the forefront and is not commercial like the other hotels we saw it's a beautiful old historic Hotel kept in the highest level check in is easy the rooms are large and the bars and restaurants provide the highest premium food and quality in Waikiki it's directly opposite the international shopping mall and only a short ride down to the Ala Moana shopping centre we were able to enjoy the hospitality here and relax especially in the evening where there are numerous bars and places to enjoy a drink and something to eat we had our own car which is parked across the street in the Sheraton car park so if you are self driving go to the hotel take your bags to check in and then park the valet guys can park for you or you can self park which is what we did it's very simple the voucher for self parking is $30 but that is unlimited parking and also provides Unlimited entrance and exit throughout your stay the beach bar has great drinks as does the house bar which normally also has entertainment at night time if you want to go to old world quality and style Moana surfrider is the place we would only come here for holidays in Honolulu. The private beach in front of the hotel is really large and it has easy access from the hotel itself as does other destinations around Honolulu this hotel is in the centre of everything.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a wonderful place to enjoy paradise! Customer service was beyond exceptional! All of the staff is super friendly!!!! The hotel was extremely clean and well taken care of! Loved the rocking chairs in front and having everything so close. We've been to Hawaii several times and this by far is one of the best places we've stayed! We will be staying here for now on!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We ate at the beach house at Moana Surfrider. There was lovely live music in the courtyard, the ambience was fantastic. We had a very enthusiastic waiter who was pushing for us to try the ahi but we'd already known what we wanted to order (not the ahi) which made it a little awkward. The food and cocktails were good. We shared all the food and the waiter was quite thoughtful in helping to divide up the portions.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've visited the beach bar at the Moana Surfrider many times over the years. You can't beat the location, the view & the history of the place, but the service at the bar is slipping. At times, it seems they can't be bothered & feel as though they're doing me a favor when they finally get around to taking my order. I'm afraid the Surfrider is coasting on it's reputation from 30 years ago. I hope they work hard to keep the place special.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Let me say upfront, that the property is a nice property and being one of the first hotels in Waikiki, it is also a historic property. I have wanted to stay there for a long time and I am glad I did, I did not have a bad stay but it was a mixed bag. I doubt I will stay there again. The good:The accommodations were great, the room was nice and clean, the bed was comfortable and my room was quiet. The property is located in the heart of Waikiki. Although service in the restaurants and at the desk was extremely slow, the staff was extremely friendly. The Bad:I arrived, I was asked if I needed help with luggage, I said we didn’t. I noticed that the people before me and after me (who asked for luggage assistance) were given a lei, I guess no luggage assistance and tip, no lei. We approached the lobby and saw that there were over 25 people in line. I found the gold check-in line and noticed when we got in it, people in the other line started rolling their eyes giving us looks. About 15 minutes later, I realized the reason for those looks, neither of the lines moving and there were only two people at the desk. Employee after employee kept coming out to the desk to get something but none of them waited on customers. I finally got to the desk and while checking in was told about resort fees. I knew that there was a resort fee, and I know a lot of hotels in Hawaii charge a resort fee – that doesn’t mean that I have to like it or agree with it. Like any hidden fee, it is a bad business practice and it meant to deceive customers while limiting the amount of commissions the resorts paid to travel agents. Most countries have outlawed this deceptive practice but it is alive and well in Hawaii. Personally, I love it when the front desk clerk with a straight hands me a piece of paper trying to justify the resort fee. It includes two bottles of water per day, a shopping bad, a surfing lesson on the sand (not making this up), a sunrise ceremony that involves the blowing of a conch shell and towels at the pool. I can do without all of that, is the $33 optional? No, it is not and if you wanted a beach umbrella or chair, that was not included in the resort fee. In fact, when I got to the room and read what was included in the resort fee, it mentioned the shopping bag and when I went back down to the desk to say I hadn’t received my bag, I was told that I should have when I checked in and they didn’t want to give me one. As a Marriott Gold member, I was told that I don’t get free breakfast as I do in other Marriott hotels but they would give me 10 percent discount in the restaurants. I later found out that it is not automatic, I had to ask for it. I was also told that the 10 percent off was only on the food, it didn’t include water, sodas and drinks. The service at the beach bar was extremely slow. It didn’t matter if we went down for drinks at the end of the night or went there for lunch – we typically waited 15 minutes before someone approached the table and there were at least two occasions where I had to ask if there was a waiter/waitress for that table. Although the hours of operation posted indicated the bar was open until midnight, we were told at 9:30 on a Friday evening (after waiting 15 minutes to be approached) that it was last call.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Location:The hotel is centrally located on the main strip which makes shopping and getting to restaurants convenient. The new shopping mall is directly across from the hotel.Room:We stayed in the tower (5th floor) and had a great view of the beach, ocean and Diamond head from our room. The cleaning staff was also very nice and provided us with extra bottles of lotion/soap. The room was big but it seemed empty. We had a bare wall that was awkward - needed decor. The bathroom was on the smaller side with only one sink. We could hear faint music from the pool/restaurant area but nothing that was disturbing. I actually enjoyed hearing it.Concierge:They were very helpful in recommending places to eat and gave us a magazine to read through to help us decide.Pool:The pool is VERY small considering the number of guests in the hotel. Seats are first come first serve and people occupy them by 7 am. We like to work out in the morning first so by the time we get downstairs, there are people lurking and waiting for people to leave their chairs. Guests have the option to book chairs and cabanas for a fee, but it should not be stressful trying to find a place to relax by the pool. Perhaps a time limit and online booking would help with the flow.Afternoon tea:My husband and I signed up for afternoon tea, which was a fun experience. The desserts were okay and we really enjoyed the tea options. The waiter seemed to be in a hurry because the kitchen was closing and did not take the time to explain the process (we had never had afternoon tea before). We ended up ordering another dish, but would have opted not to had the waiter explained how much food was already involved in afternoon tea. It also took a while to get our check.Breakfast:We had breakfast there a few times during our stay and really enjoyed the acai bowl with granola and fresh fruit. We were seated by the ocean one time and were able to get some good pictures. It was a relaxing experience.Gym:They have a spacious gym and yoga in the mornings. We used the gym almost every morning and it had all the equipment we needed. There were a few people there in the mornings, but never crowded.Spa:We booked a couples massage one of the nights. We had had a massage there a few years ago and wanted to go back. The treatment was not how I remembered it. It was more relaxing and laid back last time, where as I felt that the masseuse was rushing during our most recent treatment. It was still a good experience and we felt relaxed afterwards.Hotel overall:One of the elevators was down for a few days. There was a line of guests waiting to get up and down the tower, where our room was located, which sometimes took up to 10 minutes. In general, there were groups of people going in and out of the hotel, which was a little overwhelming at times. If you enjoy the action and being in a great location, then this is the hotel for you!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice place,on the beach.the pool was surprisingly small if u want to sit in a loungchair by the pool u cant theres just too many people,,,good luck.TheRooms are the size of a broom closet,their nice but not good for more than 2 persons,i think there are better places

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel was one of the most well presented and located hotels. The pool bar is a great place to relax with music and entertainment, breakfasts were great and on verandah over looking the beach. The rooms are nice. Would love to visit again

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: So many weddings. Sometimes 4, 5, 6 wedding parties with photographers waiting with all their equipment to take pics on the stairway. Itstays so busy you can hardly navigate around on the lobby floor. Also, these parties are very rude and act as if you shouldn't be there. It's great for a good location on the Waikiki shopping area with everything just s walk away but other than location the banyan wing is old and tired, and really the beach sucks and the food is only mediocre. Not recommended other than location.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a wonderful, luxury property in the middle of Waikiki. We've loved it for years and decided to stay there for my husband's big birthday. What we didn't know was that the hotel has transformed itself into a wedding factory, having sublet part of its first floor to a Japanese wedding company that has 3 chapels just off the lobby and has cordoned off part of the main level and outside gardens exclusively for its Japanese wedding guests. It was charming for the first few bridal parties. But practically speaking, waiting to board elevators while 3 brides and their entourages are in line became a pain. If you want to eat dinner in the hotel, (if you can get a reservation!) you'll likely be sitting among large wedding tables where photographers trip over you for cake cutting, etc. A photographer told me that the hotel is promoted in Japan as the destination for weddings and the company runs dozens of weddings through the hotel every single day. After awhile, we felt like wedding crashers. Otherwise, the staff of the hotel was great and we were very glad we upgraded to a room overlooking the beach so we could sit on our balcony. Unfortunately, we hadn't been warned that about the workers next to and dangling over our balcony for 3 days. When we called to ask how long they would be working no one seemed to know. The guest services person promised to call back but never did. I called again and was assured they would be done that day but they showed up again. We just gave up and put in earphones to keep the noise down. For the entire week we had workers dropping ropes onto us, popping their heads over our balcony, etc. We just did our best to ignore them. There was also an elevator out of service for 4 days which created a tremendous backup at times. Once again, we called and no one seemed to know how long it would be out or they promised it would be fixed the next day but wasn't. There seems to be a huge communication gap between the workers and the guest services folks. Note to management: You need to do a better job communicating with guest about all the repairs that seem to be going on.A few tips: If you need room for a crib or rollaway, only Tower rooms and some other rooms are large enough. Good to know this before you book a room that is too small. If you want one of the free pool lounge chairs, the line for towels & chairs forms at 6:45am. By 8 you won't find any chairs left unless you want to pay for a cabana or a beach umbrella/lounge combo. The pool is small and often dominated by loud, unruly children. There are simply not enough lounge chairs. Not the best hotel feature. The beach is great but gets pretty hot by midday.Room service: To me, the point of room service is to be available when you don't want to go out. But strangely, the room service at this hotel has very restricted hours. Lunch ends at 2:30; dinner runs 5:30-9:30 and then you're on your own. No all day dining. We arrived early afternoon and were told the only dining option was the pool bar. We sat at a table for half an hour and were told they had decided to close because it had started to rain. So we went back to the room and learned there was no room service until 5:30. True, you're in the middle of Waikiki but we ended up giving up on eating at the hotel after that except for one evening meal I'd booked ahead (you'll need to do that to get a table) and then discovered we were wedged between two wedding parties.One nice advantage of this hotel is that you can eat & charge your room at 3 other properties. We loved breakfast at the Royal Hawaiian (2 doors down). We also loved eating at the restaurants across the street at the International Marketplace (3rd floor). Be sure to make reservations wherever you want to go. Nice restaurants book up quickly even mid-week.One other tip: If you are ordering one of the hotel cakes for a special occasion, save your money. For $35 (with taxes & fees) you get a 3x3" cake. (Like a brownie.) We laughed when we saw it. Cut it in quarters and had 4 bites.... Yes they throw some berries on it and write "Happy Birthday" in frosting on the plate, but it is truly ridiculous for the price. The cheese selection was nice, though. (Apparently once again, the company providing the cakes is a subcontract so the hotel promotes them but doesn't take any responsibility.)All in all, I'm not sure we'll stay there again. It's a lovely hotel and I'm sure it makes a ton of money catering to Japanese weddings, but it has really lost its appeal to those of us who want a quiet, hassle free vacation.
user_name:
dhbourke
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I stayed here occasionally with my parents as a young girl and I was very excited to take my grand-daughter for this visit. Everything about this property is great. ALL the staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The location, the history, the beach and the activities close by make it such a wonderful place to stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I have been to Hawaii many times using a family members timeshare. We would always walk by this hotel and said one day we would stay there. This time we did and it was absolutely amazing! From the moment we drove up, we experienced impeccable customer service. Check-in was smooth and easy. We stayed in the Diamond Wing which I believe is one of the newer sections. When we got to our room, I was greeted with a plate containing dessert and "Happy Birthday" written in chocolate. I was slightly disappointed with the view outside our room as it was literally the rooftop. I went back downstairs to see if we could change. I was told she couldn't do anything that night but she had another room I could switch to the next day. I have had other hotels tell me that and they didn't deliver. I was pleasantly surprised when we were given a new room key after returning from Diamond Head! We packed up everything the night before like the told us to and our items were already in the new room. We had a late departure so we kept our stuff at the concierge while we strolled for the day. When we came back, they gave us a key to the hospitality room to freshen up before the flight.The location of this hotel is the best! Right on the main strip and walking distance to a lot of shops and restaurants. The beach is right outside the hotel or you can walk a block or two to where some of the locals swim. We also walked to the malls but you need a good walking shoe. Oh, and if you like to workout, you can borrow exercise clothes/shoes for $5.00/day. I thought that was a nice feature.If I had some negatives, it would be the cost of parking ($35 per day). You can't really find cheaper anywhere else. I was also disappointed by the $30 resort fee. I think for what you get it should be included in the price. If I go back to Hawaii, I will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Dream trip to Hawaii so spent many hours mulling over hotels to get it just right, and that we did! We stayed in the Banyan wing and whilst the room was a little tight with a rollaway for my son it still worked very well. And to be honest, if you come here to spend time in the room then pick somewhere else because the Moana is all about location. A beautiful classic beachfront property with oodles of history and amazing outside space. The stunning Banyan tree in a gorgeous courtyard with rocking chairs to take in the view and just steps away from the beach is all you could wish for. We had access to the Beach Club where at 5pm we would retreat to the private Verandah for a few glasses of chilled white wine and wait for the sun to set. I would struggle to stay anywhere else now, with the exception of the Royal Hawaiian just a few doors down which was also fabulous. (Couldn’t decide so did both!!)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the moment I arrived until I departed, my experience at the Moana Surfrider was excellent. Every employee went out of their way to make me comfortable and see to my needs. Loved the rocking chairs on the front and back verandas! In the evening there were many places to sit and listen to music. The hotel is located in the heart of the best shopping and dining! I opted for a small room in the historic section of the hotel. My room was small but well appointed and comfortable and always clean. I thought about upgrading to a room with a view but decided to spend the extra money instead on a private cabana on the beach. I rented a cabana on two of my five days and it was well worth the money. Besides having some shade and privacy and a comfortable place to spend the day, it came with lots of towels, a small tote that was perfect for a wet swim suit when I got ready to pack for home, bottles of cold water, and fresh cold pineapple later in the day. During the day waitresses came by for drink and food orders. If there was anything that needed improvement, it was the sparseness of the cabana waitresses. The cabana/pool staff was fabulous, but the waitresses were few and far between, even non-existent my first day, and only showed up on the second day after the cabana staff requested one for me. I hate chasing down waitresses for a cocktail! That, however, was not the case anywhere else on the property.Note: This is not a good property for families looking for things for their kids to do, or for groups of young adults looking to party. This is an excellent property for couples of any age as it's quite romantic, or for older singles. I traveled alone and never felt out of place for a minute.
user_name:
Sue J
Los Angeles, California, United States

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am really shocked to read so many great reviews of this hotel, our experience was so far from good. Maybe it's different expectations, or maybe we were unlucky, but we paid a lot of money to stay at this hotel and this is a very accurate description of our experience.Hawaii is a long way from the UK and we arrived at 11pm. We had booked one twin and one double, next to each other. Check-in took over 20 minutes. We were given 2 twin rooms, on the same floor, but not next to each other. When we questioned this we were told there was nothing they could do as they were overbooked. We were then hit with this "resort charge" which is an extra $37 per room for internet access and bottled water. In my experience, these things normally come included with the high prices you pay to stay in a 4 star hotel, and surely, that's part of the facilities they say they offer in order to get their 4 star rating?We went to our rooms and were immediately hit by the strong smell of smoke. Clearly these were smoking rooms - although Westin has a "breathe well" policy which states that you will be fined over $300 if there is evidence you have smoked in your room (this was on display on the in-room iPad used for promoting the hotel). We went back to reception and asked to speak to a manager. Nobody was available to speak to us. We were told that all they could do was spray the rooms. Nobody ever turned up to spray the rooms.Being jet lagged and fed up, and not having received the advertised friendly welcome and welcome elixir, we went to the bar to get a drink. The bar closed at 11, so they would not serve us. I know of no other hotel which would not serve a guest a drink. When we asked where we might get a drink, we were directed to the hotel next-door.We were in Deluxe Ocean Diamond rooms which were functional, cramped and clean, except for those difficult to get to places like air vents and door vents. These were thick with dust, hairs and what can only be described as toilet waste. I would liken the room and the tiny bathroom to a Premier Inn, but without their level of cleanliness.In the morning, we waited for 20 minutes in the breakfast queue. We again tried to speak to a manager about our rooms, but again nobody was available. Our travel agent also tried to contact management, and we resorted to emailing them, but we still have received no response. We received a standard "we are experiencing high volumes of emails and will reply to yours in the order in which it was received". That was a week and a half ago and we are now home. That must have been some level of emails they were receiving.The pool is tiny and you can't get anywhere near it. We stayed in a Villaplus villa in Corfu last year and the pool with that villa for 12 people was bigger than this hotel's pool.The gym was well equipped and spacious. The downside was that entry was by room key, so although the rules stated that children under the age of 16 couldn't use it, there were often kids, around 9/10 years of age in there. Their parents were also there, but ignoring them as they were too busy working out, so kids would be hogging the workout machines and running around trying out all the free standing equipment and leaving it all over the place.In our part of the hotel, there were about 80-100 room all being served by one lift, so there was lots of waiting around for lifts. We did try using the stairs (the ones we found seemed to be a fire escape route) but couldn't find how to get to lobby level using the stairs. One day the lift was out of service so we had to use the service lift, along with all the luggage and laundry, so that took even longer.Other reviews have mentioned the weddings. They do impact on your stay. On two of our five days there, we saw the first bride arrive at 7am (don't know about the other days as we were still in bed at that time!) our peak count was 13 in one day - and we weren't spending all our time at the hotel. Part of the hotel is permanently out of bounds to guests as it is reserved for weddings. The entry hall, from dawn to dusk, has brides and grooms and their families either posing for photos or waiting for the previous party to finish photos so they can begin their photos. Most of all, in an hotel already bursting to the seams, they add significantly to the number of people in the public areas. Not all couples get married in the chapel there, or take up the bookings in the restaurant for their "wedding breakfast", but loads come to have their photos taken.We were so disgruntled with the hotel we didn't eat there, apart from breakfast. We found some fabulous restaurants in the town. Roy's stands out as one of the best restaurants we have ever eaten at.The two best things about the hotel were that it was situated directly opposite the Haagen Dazs shop and that it was in a brilliant place to watch the amazing Honolulu Pride March go by.Maybe the guest services team will take the time to reply to this review and say how sorry they are and they will try to make other guests' experiences better. We tried very hard to get our issues sorted while we were there so we could have a better holiday, but nobody was interested. Far better to pretend on TripAdvisor that you care about your guests' experiences than actually try to improve their holiday while they are there?!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic service and pretty hotel, just directly at the beach. Great bar and Restaurant on the beach side. Good for brunch, a lot of different stuff. Brunch is 38$ - not the cheapest but ok for that place.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I am an SPG Platinum member and I’ve stayed in hundreds of SPG properties over the years, but The Moana Surfrider is by far my favorite. The hotel is in great shape and the staff was friendly and very attentive. It’s centrally located, so it’s easy to get around to shops, restaurants and bars. The beach is absolutely stunning... Can’t wait to come back and visit in a few months.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I’ve never been to Hawaii and this hotel makes me want to live here!! The food is fantastic! They offer lunch/brunch buffet on the veranda or you can order off the regular menu. The beach bar is casual and fun, the bartenders are fantastic, and if you’re lucky enough to have Harry take care of you... you’re lucky enough !!! He’s fun, a local born and raised, and knows how to make a terrific cocktail all while keeping you entertained and informed! A real bartenders bartender!! The rooms are modern and efficient with out of this world views! The staff is pleasant and accommodating while knowing when to give privacy or if you need something. My companion is a repeat guest, and that has its perks as well. They remember your name, your preferences, and the GM even left a message on our room phone welcoming us back. Everything is clean and comfortable... just a really pleasant experience. I can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is beautiful and the staff is great.This is my second favorite hotel on the entire island...The problem, this time, is that we didn't get a room with a view. We stayed on the 3rd floor, street side. What they don't tell you is how loud it is. It was hard to get to sleep And it's an early wake up. It would be okay to stay on the street side, just get a room higher up. @westin should let people know.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Charming hotel, perfect location with the beach one one side and shopping on the other. Some points to note:Tower rooms are decent size, super comfy bed and view straight onto another huge tower block making early morning coffee on the balcony an interesting neighborly event. Look to the left at sunset and our room was perfectly lined up to watch the sun disappear. No slippers so I was glad to have taken my own. The pool is small and I went looking for the real one. That’s it... but with the ocean on its doorstep that’s not too serious. Be prepared to reserve your pool seats well before breakfast, and to pay a fairly hefty umbrella and deck chair fee if you prefer to lounge on the beach. Also be prepared for a very child friendly pool with loads of splashes as parents happily dunk their kids in the water all morning.Be prepared to line up waiting for your turn for breakfast, tho it is managed well and runs efficiently. Despite the crowds we were mentioned by name on several occasions, and a very tasty breakfast.Evening entertainment in the lounge was very nice, especially the musician on Monday eve and super helpful Ryan K happy to suggest excellent snack and cocktail choices off the menu. Try the cheese and mushroom toasties and Brussels sprouts.Hotel is perfectly located for the Pink Line bus that will take you to further away shopping malls or the Hilton Hawaiian village if you are taking a boat activity from there. Two dollars each (no change given) and just a few steps away at Dukes statue.Lovely charming hotel, with an incredible tree in the courtyard that I’m sure could tell many stories. Oh, and at least two brides a day to catch a glimpse of.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is the very best. We have been to this hotel on numerous occasions, and it gets better each time. The location is perfect, the hotel is a classic beauty.The staff makes you truly feel like Ohana. Whether going with family or a couples retreat, you can’t beat this place.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Have always aspired to stay at this hotel and finally achieved my wish with a 7 night sojourn. Check-in was a breeze, even though I arrived @ 1000. Staff were helpful, room was ready and I was allocated a great room on the 12th floor of the Tower Wing with a spectacular beach view. Every staff member I came into contact with was courteous and accomodating. The spa was relaxing and the therapist very good. There is definitely something super charming about the Moana Surfrider and I would not hesitate to stay here again. The location and ambience are second to none. Thank you to the staff and management for your beautiful hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I spent the weekend here and had a great time. It is directly on the beach in a very nice area for swimming or light surfing. You can rent an umbrella and chairs, just to make sure you do it the day before or early in the morning to make sure you get a spot. The fitness center is excellent and probably the best we've ever seen at a hotel. The only downside was the inroom dining did not have a lot of food that we could eat, however there were tons of restaurants adjacent our hotel or across the street that we could easily walk today.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Centrally located, this hotel is one of the most comfortable and luxurious that I've ever stayed in. The room was huge, overlooking the beach, and very well-presented. The only downside was that I could hear the band playing rather loudly in the evening whilst I was trying to get an early night - not too much of an issue coz they were pretty good at what they did! The staff were helpful and very courteous. I'd definitely stay here again if given the chance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My two best friends came to visit me in Waikiki where I live and we spent 3 nights at this hotel on a staycation instead of at my house down the street. We checked in & got a room that smelled like mildew/mold. (Reason #1 for only 4 stars) We tried to ignore it, but it was pretty bad, so after an hour & a shower (which leaked on the floor) we all had a headache from the smell so we called the front desk. We spoke with Michael who was AWESOME! He told us he’d call us back and got us a new room with no smell and no leaky shower. We hated to complain, but after walking in the new room, we all said how MUCH BETTER it was!!!!! Michael gave us a drink coupon for having to wait for his call back and move rooms (way to go Michael!) so we enjoyed late night wine at the Beach Bar.....where the bartenders were obviously tired and had a long day. Whatever, the wine was free and we were on vacation (kind of). ❤️The next morning after a night out at Duke’s, we decided to take a pool aqua aerobics class with instructor Crystal. Crystal was GREAT! We loved that class! I wish I could come from my house every time she teaches. I’d pay money to come join her & hear her laugh. That class was FUN! ‍♀️Before class started at 9am, the three of us tried to score chairs at the pool. Well, we didn’t realize you had to be up at 3a.m. to get a lounge chair! Literally....it was like 8:30 and NO seats were open because people threw towels on them (reason #2 for only 4 stars). I went to get towels from the pool and beach desk. There was a cabana rental sign with prices. I was a “little” hungover so I couldn’t understand the $55/$110 price differences on the sign and I asked Gloria. Gloria is definitely not a fan of hungover blondes asking questions at 8:30 in the morning. She was annoyed and avoided me with an eye roll. She TOTALLY redeemed herself the next few days so I’ll get to that later. After the aqua aerobics class, I decided I was GOING TO throw someone’s towels off a chair being it had been 90 minutes ....but I went to the desk again and praise God I met Isaac who completely made our entire weekend!!!! He was awesome too! You should def keep this guy around. He may need to be promoted. Isaac explained the cabana and umbrella situation at the pool and on the beach. One includes alcohol orders and one does not. Duh....obviously we reserved the cabana with alcohol options for the next day. Isaac had it all set up and ready for us at 9am when we arrived at the pool. What a treat! He was so nice to us! He must’ve teamed up with Gloria since yesterday because she brought us water, pineapple, a cooler, some dinner suggestions, AND sent the waitress over ASAP for us! Gloria was our new best friend with Isaac. My favorite waitresses at our cabana were Hays & Chantal. Those girls are on it! Cocktails, food, and water or ice - they are always smiling and FAST! We spent three days at the pool and the cabanas thanks to Isaac. The only other person worth mentioning in my review of this beautiful hotel on the beach is Pascual (like rascal) that works breakfast at the buffet. He’s super cute and friendly. I just wished I could’ve had a Bloody Mary with breakfast but he said that was not allowed in the rules at breakfast. Mimosas only Breakfast Cheeseburgers at the pool Housekeeping Checkout Concierge room Valet Live music at the beach bar

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Living here in Hawaii, we try to get away once a month and play tourist (staycation). The Moana is one of our favorite places to stay. Ocean front I mean right on Waikiki beach. The resort has everything you want. The restaurant is amazing get access to the lounge for complimentary breakfast or evening beer, wine, and pupus. The staff here are fantastic and really treat everyone so well. The picture is from our room

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our 2nd visit to the Moana and this time we booked a room in the tower, instead of a historic room. The tower rooms all have balconies and we could see the sea, even though we booked a city view. Loved the room -spacious and modern. Thanks to the staff for the birthday cake and balloons they left in our room - my husband was celebrating his 7Oth birthday!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: When I lived in Hawaii, I would visit the Surfrider for events, and it was great. Since I no longer live there, I have stayed several times, and the most recent stay was the best. The hotel itself is classic - old Hawaii feel, open, breezy, lots of places to hang out. The rooms in the older part of the hotel might be small for some, but we loved them, and they are all updated. The staff is great, always trying to help. The location is great for getting around Waikiki, Honolulu, and the rest of the island. Beach is right there and awesome. Spa was great, very accomodating. The Club is in a great location and is a great benefit. There are lots of options in Waikiki, and this one should be at the top of your list. No hassles, very relaxing, and fun.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I was slightly disappointed in the Moana Surfrider. It just felt cramped. I don't mean the room. The entire property. There was barely any beach and the beach lounge had tables jammed all over. The staff was hit and miss. One wonderful waitress pointed us to some wonderful local fare...Side Street, but another one just went through the motions, barely. One night the kids were loud and security came up and told us to quiet down or " things would get ugly." I was stunned. Reported to management and she apologized and comped us two days at the Beach Club which gave us complementary breakfast and a nice room to chill. The last day my daughter cut her foot on broken glass when packing to leave. The thing is...we didn't break any glass during our stay. I assume housekeeping did but it was weird since we were in the room for 5 days. Management got her a band-aid and neosporin but still. You are a housekeeper and broke something, clean it up thoroughly.We travelled with a family of five, kids 17,15,11.I would not return again. I think this motel would be better suited for couples than families. We did have an enjoyable time but for the money I will stay elsewhere next time.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: As a 'preferred' guest for the last 20 years, we were assigned a room in the historic wing. I'm do not consider myself a person that's interested in a lot of historic things and do not care for the accompanying 'historic' smell (musty). I was very much looking forward to sitting on the lanai and looking out at the ocean. When I entered my "preferred" room I had no lanai, just a square window in the corner of the room. If I want to look out the window I would have to squeeze by the desk and lean over a built-in shelf. When I inquired for a room in the tower, I was told they were sold out, except for OF penthouse rooms and I do not have an extra $300/night in my budget to swing this luxury. This seems kind of ridiculous since I booked so long ago (6 months ago!). Unless all "tower" rooms were completely booked at the time I made my reservation; it would seem that I should have been given a better room. Booking in advance with a "preferred" status didn't seem to have gotten me much compared to any other guest off the street. Please note I made this reservations 6 months ago!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is the oldest hotel in the city. It is updated and very comfortable. It has a grand staircase in the entrance and we have seen brides being photographed on it several times daily. Apparently this is a destination wedding venue. The outside of the hotel has porches with comfortable rocking chairs overlooking the street. It is great to sit there and people watch. The back of the hotel is also beautiful with big, old trees framing the entrance to the hotel decks on one side and the pool and ocean on the outside. It is a truly beautiful hotel both inside and out. When we arrived and checked our vehicle, we received leis and felt welcomed to Hawaii. The bed in our room is comfortable. The food in the restaurant is very good.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first visit to Hawaii so we thought we would stay here especially regarding its history and position. The room we had was in the original part of the Hotel and at the front of the hotel so if you are a light sleeper I’d ask for a different room, otherwise it was a great room, it was a good size with plenty of space to have cases out with enough room to walk around. It was nicely fitted out and very clean. The beds were comfortable and amenities in the room were great, they have normal coffee and filter coffee in room but there was also a coffee shop on site which was handy if you get up early and need one before you go to breakfast! The rocking chairs on the verandas were nice to sit and have a drink and the restaurants and cafes on site offered great food and drink at varying prices dependant on where you went.For a busy hotel the staff were genuinely happy to help you out which was nice. As first time visitors it was enjoyable in a great position and we wouldn’t hesitate in going back.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked 8 nights at the Moana Surfrider - tower block , suite with Diamond head views - fantastic. 2 balcony's with great view of sunset and sun rise - perfect for relaxing and sun bathing- we used the facilities of the Beach Club which were really good and convenient -very central to everything you need it to be- good in the beach bar not great but the restaurant was perfect and food very good - house keeping excellent - would definitely recommend and would definitely go back - The Beautiful Moana lives up to its name

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for 2 nights in the Oceanfront Diamond tower room! Highly recommend for ocean view (if you can afford it!) and the sound of ocean breezes! Me, my husband and 13 year old son shared 2 double beds comfortably (son in the second bed). Room is clean and updated. Bathroom was small (reminds me of euro style hotel bathrooms) but totally efficient with all the amenities. Bed was comfy, robes in the closet, mini fridge to keep our bevs cold, big tv we never turned on and an interesting juliette style balcony with double glass sliding doors that open wide and wood floors at about 4’ deep with two rocking chairs and end table. Beautiful banyan tree in the back courtyard which leads you to their nice outdoor beach bar and small pool area...and steps to Waikiki Beach.Saw several weddings at the hotel in 48 hours. Very cute!We did self park across the street for $35/day. Not a fan of Waikiki because it’s like Vegas on the beach heavily catered to Japanese tourists. We stayed there to do surfing and eat good food but spent most of our time in the North Shore to do shark cage diving (highly recommend!), snorkel at Sharks Cove and eat our around town there. I like Moana Surfrider for what it is there in Waikiki but will not come back to Oahu in the future. Maui is my favorite of all the islands!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed at this hotel as the final part of our Hawaiian holiday. The hotel is all class and its close proximity to the sand makes it very convenient to the beach goer. Service was excellent and check in and out very professional and swift. We had a room with a view towards Diamond Head looking down Waikiki Beach. Excellent.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have just stayed at Westin Moana Surfrider and we loved it!!! The hotel is located at the center of Waikiki Beach, next to everything!!! We could go walking to great restaurants, to go shopping, and, of course, to the beach!!!!When we arrived, they gave us a beautiful hawaiian flower necklace!!! It was a great experience!!!!We stayed at the Tower Rooms, eith an ocean front view. There as a terrace with 2 chais, beautiful view. The room has 2 double beds, a comfortable armchair, and was very spacious and comfortable. Great linens, soft towels. The bathroom was good but the weird thing was that the safe box was located in the bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a lot of people from Japan, and lot of marriages going on at the hotel. We stayed for 2 days, and saw at least 6 beatiful brides.We had lunch at the Beach Bar and it was very good, very tasteful. And we also had dinner at the Beach House restaurant. It was very good, also delicious dinner.The hotel has a pool, but there was only one, and it was too small for such a big hotel. That was the only but of this hotel. I would recommend this hotel for sure, and I am already looking forward to coming back soon to Honolulu!!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was an all round great experience.the room and view of the beach - wonderfulthe beach - beautifulthe bar on the beach - best on the stripthe staff - helpful and friendlySpecial mention to the staff on the tours and activities front desk who went above and beyond for us - thank you so much

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We always enjoyed just walking up and sitting in the rocking chairs out front. So I booked a 6 day 5 night vacation for my wife's birthday. We got there and found out we got an old banyan room. The room was a little worn but quite nice. The television had a lot of channels that didn't work, that was a big problem especially if you wanted to catch some football. Those channels didn't work. Also we had a wonderful view of the building next to us but if you squeezed up close to the window and looked left there was the main drag, and to the right was the beach and ocean. This hotel offers many things for you. It is in a great location right on the beach. All in All it was quite the nice stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Literally across the beach and in the main drag. So central! The hotel itself is very clean and modern. Housekeeping though is a hit and miss but reception will sort it out for you. The pool was a bit too small but you can go across to the the Sheraton to use their pool. If you are after a View then don’t expect for it if you are not willing to pay for it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel is marvellously situated in the heart of Waikiki Beach with terrific shopping near by. The rooms are very comfortable offering very nice amenities. The Banyan Tree Café is enjoyable for drinks and a light snack and there is also a Honolulu coffee shop on site. We didn't have an opportunity to try the restaurant but it looked lovely and seemed to be very busy. One thing I will say - I have never seen so many bridal parties at one hotel. They seemed to be non-stop. It was fun just watching each and every one of them. I will definitely be back to this hotel. It offered everything I wanted plus more.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have just spent 3 amazing nights staying in one of the Banyan Rooms in this historic hotel. The hotel is a jewel set amongst the very busy surroundings of Waikiki. Not your typical chain hotel at all. Staying at The Moana Surfrider is like staying in a well maintained historic mansion (with small museum, very ornate traditional entrance hall and rocking chairs) located right on Waikiki beach. The room we stayed in was in the historic wing and had views of both the City and the beach, it was a fair size and was very well maintained. We would also recommend the Beach Bar for informal dining, as it is situated right by the beach so perfect for watching the sunset under the Banyan Tree. While the hotel does charge an additional resort fee, this includes parking - which is very reasonable given the location.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Initially friends recommended the hotel so we booked back in 2014 and loved it. We returned in 2017 and we enjoyed it all the more! Having the LA Clippers staying at the hotel was a real blast for my kids. The players were the most down to earth friendly people that were only too happy to stop and have a photo taken with the kids. the location of this hotel is second to none!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The best thing about this hotel is its location, right on the beach with great shopping nearby. Our room on the 10th floor had a stunning view looking back to Diamond Head. The room itself was large but in need of a bit of an upgrade. The housekeeping was good. Be ready for a long wait for a table at breakfast. The pool is small but that doesn't matter because the beach is right there and the sea is divine!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: If you dream of Hawaii all your dreams come true in this hotel. If you stay at the historical part of the hotel in a historical banyan tree room you cannot choose better and you don't see anything of the other huge hotels on Waikiki beach. The Maona is a world of it's own. Maybe the rooms in the adjusting tower are bigger but probably less charming. We had a room with a window to the beautiful patio with the huge banyan tree and a window to the ocean. Breakfast and dinner at the hotel are superbe but expensive. Never mind you don't go to Hawaii every day ...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had a wonderful time. The staff is excellent and the ambiance is amazing. My husband was celebrating his birthday. Thank you Harry, Craig and Chris at the Beach Bar. We had a wonderful time. Aloha and we can't wait to return next year.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A beautiful hotel but the service has always been lacking. This is my 2nd time here - 1st 6 years ago with my now husband and this week for a work trip. I selected this hotel because the Sheraton was booked. This hotel does have good qualities but it is old, overrun by weddings, and the interior service (room service, concierge, etc) is awful. The staff at the restaurants and Beach Club lounge, however, have been very pleasant and capable.The pool is also the size of a typical plain rectangular shaped pool found in the backyards of any suburban home in the US. The Sheraton definitely has the better pool areas and the Royal Hawaiian next door gets access - stay there. No hot tub.I am here for work. There are worse places to be but this happens to be my anniversary weekend. My husband attempted to surprise me with bubbly, flowers, and cheese and arranged this thru the hotel. Note that I am staying in a suite (paid for, not upgraded) and with a platinum member. This treat was supposed to arrive while I was at work. Total fail. The Westin did not deliver until after a few angry phone calls from my husband and some follow up calls by me. Since they didn't deliver as scheduled, my day was completely screwed because I had to cancel business events so make time for the 'surprise'. For a hotel that hosts hundreds of weddings weekly, one would think that the simple exercise of delivering wine and cheese to a room would be a no brainer; yet, sadly not the case. The $300 surcharge and late delivery prove that this hotel is incompetent and overpriced. The same cheese tray was available FOR FREE in the lounge, by the way. And no overnight room service. Stay somewhere else and visit during the day like most people. This hotel is overrun by people staying at neighboring hotels without beach access. The breakfast buffet is completely not worth the expense even if comes with room or status. Takes forever to get a table and the food is underwhelming - too many places nearby to settle for this hot mess of a buffet.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This property is truly a jewel of Waikiki, after a terrible experience with one of its competitors I feel the Westin Moana Surfrider came to the rescue.From the moment we called their in house reservations team to amend our reservation, through to check in, using the various services, spa, various restaurants, and concierge team etc. it was non-stop top class customer service.Room was clean, extremely comfortable bed and pillows, good amenities with modern equipment. As expected everything along Waikiki is within walking distance of this property, don’t forget this property is right on the beach so you have direct beach access, if you stay here you will not be disappointed.Looking forward to come back here for our wedding ceremony in 2019!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This resort hotel has a really colonial feel.It's one of the upmarket hotels on the beech and is really nice.Dining on the veranda is a lovely experience and i'd recommend it as a treat.We stayed in the older part of the hotel and that is worth doing if booking a room. A very nice hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
