review_body: What a magical spot to celebrate our daughter's 21st. Liz the hula girl was absolutely wonderful to watch, and the band made us cry for our memories she was of "beautiful Kaua'i". The food was outstanding and we loved the dessert tree at the end. Of the many wonderful places to eat this would be our favourite. Mahalo surf rider. Next time we would love to stay in this gracious lady. The museum upstairs is worth a look too.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel multiple times and absolutely love it. Beautiful location right on Waikiki Beach. The beach bar and the Veranda restaurant have beautiful views. Come a little earlier late in the day if you want to catch the sunset from the beach bar. It fills up quickly.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an expensive hotel, however it is really lovely, as were the staff. It was beautifully decorated for christmas. We had a partial ocean view room, but when we were sitting on our balcony it is a full view, we could see ocean, sand and palm trees. I loved our room, it was huge, very clean and the beds were so comfortable.The pool is really tiny, but with the beach directly in front I didn't use it anyway. But if having a big pool is a deal breaker for you, this is not the hotel for you. As far as food/drinks go, we had a couple of nice evening cocktails at the bar under the trees which is a really beautiful place to sit in the afternoon and they serve the most amazing Truffle Fries!! We also has delicious waffles and pancakes in the restaurant for breakfast.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This historic hotel is very busy and, understandably, is a favourite for weddings . . . there seemed to be two or three each day throughout our ten-day stay. However, the hotel's friendly and highly proficient teams ensure that each event is seamlessly organised to avoid any disruption in service for other hotel guests.The hotel is in the centre of downtown Waikiki, adjacent to a diverse array of fashionable shops, restaurants, clubs and other tourist attractions. Yet it also backs onto its prime position on the marvellous Waikiki beach, with sea, sun and sand in abundance. We enjoyed the Surfrider Cafe for informal breakfasts, and Sheri's excellent customer service. The Banyan Court offers a serene ending to the evening, with hula and music, in the light of the setting sun.Although somewhat smaller than in more modern top hotels, the rooms are clean, comfortable and well equipped. The dailyresort charge is substantial, but the overall experience is to a high standard.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed a week at the end of September 2017 and enjoyed our time at Moana Surfrider.Our initial room was not ideal - no view and low level so after the first night we asked if it was possible to change at some stage during our stay (they were busy and heavily booked). They accommodated our request so we ended up in a higher room more toward the beach which made a signififcant difference to our holiday.Room was spacious and had all we needed in terms of amenities, wifi and daily bottled water (SPG members). Well serviced every day and unlike other places the room attendants did leave the air con on for us after servicing which was very much appreciated.Beach bar is in a nice location and surroundings - plenty of people. Service was good as was the food (note it was bar food not restauarant food). We did not try the restaurants at the hotel as we ate out due to good central location.We liked the fact we could enjoy the bars at adjacent SPG properties and still charge to our room at this property.People and service were all good and easy to deal with which always makes a difference. Things to consider:Key I think is to ensure you understand what room you have and what your room type may mean for your stay. The rooms nearer the street (hotel is between beach and street) and on lower levels are not great and changing when you arrive may not be easy due to other bookings.In hindsight as first time visitors to Hawaii we arrived at 8am and should have booked our room for the night before so as to enable access - Hawaii is hot and we were tired from the flight so while it involves a cost, it would have been nicer to head straight to a room for the early flight arrival time.We will ask for a "grill" balcony next time around - looks like 50% have a grill at the front you can see through and 50% have a concrete panel you look over to see the view - we are not that tall so harder to see when sitting on the balcony.The pool was pretty small but our firends 10 year old enjoyed it. We swam at the beach instead but would have enjoyed a larger pool area. However I am not sure there are large pool options if you also want a beachside location.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The First hotel built in Oahu. Reminds me of a Grand southern mansion. The service is outstanding. We were greeted with big smiles and a necklace. The location is pretty much on the beach. The pool is nice but why would you use it when the beach is 100 feet away. Lots of room to kick back n chill with friends and family. One night we gathered up all the fruit we bought and had a fruit party in the lobby. The rooms were nice but a bit small. The costs are little high, but its a Westin resort, it is to be expected. It is really busy all day and night so except it to be a little noisy. I had a good time.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We experienced only great service from the friendly staff at the Moana Surfrider and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived early in the morning at even though our check-in wasn't until the afternoon we were provided a room to shower and change, then we were able to explore Honolulu while the they looked after our luggage. The rooms were very comfortable, historic charm with modern comforts. Walk out the back to the amazing Banyan tree, beach bar, pool and Waikiki beach. It's not cheap to stay here, but very good value from our perspective.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I live on Oahu and I came here for a romantic getaway with my husband. We were given a room on the second floor facing the street. I got no sleep because it was so noisy. Every time I fell asleep, I was woken up a little bit later from cars or people yelling.Other than that, we were unable to get a spot at the pool. There just are not enough chairs for the amount of people that were there. This hotel is beautiful and while overall I enjoyed my stay here, make sure you get a room away from the street. I have stayed at three other properties in Waikiki and I have never had a problem with noise like I did at the Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider will cost you about $550 per day for an ocean front room. A city view will cost less. That doesn't include a $45 valet or $35 self park fee. My wife and I were really looking forward to staying here, but we left somewhat disappointed. The standard rooms are very small. They were half the size of other hotel rooms where I've stayed in the area that had the same price point. The staff was friendly, but they do not go above and beyond. The common areas of the hotel are very nice, however the area surrounding the hotel (both street side and beach side) are very crowded. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have a quiet and relaxing stay. If you insist on a hotel with beachfront property and money is not a consideration, this hotel may be worth looking into. If you do not need a beachfront property, I experienced a far superior stay & value to include room size, huge ocean view windows, free parking, and absolutely wonderful service at the Prince Hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for 3 night in an ocean room in the original wing, stunning! From reception to the room it was beautifully furnished and the room seemed to have been refurbished in the last few years. The view was spectacular from our room looking out over the beach and water and to Diamond Head. Service was good. Luckily able to check in early as room wax ready. Swam in the pool which had steps for the 2 yr old to play on and 8 yr old to swim, deepest point 6ft ish. Towels readily available. Loungers by pool free but beach $55 ish for the whole day (think this is for 2) Banyan tree has great shade over pool in morning. Beach is nice. Waves break close to shore but calm beyond. Kids club arranged through nearby hotel. Location is fantastic. Contact the hotel by email for questions. We didn't eat at the hotel, great food court next block down. Shops on the door step. Husband used gym said it was good. Yoga available in the mornings. Used über to get around. Would love to be able to go back and stay again in my lifetime!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: There's a beach bar at Moana Surfrider hotel that is my number 1 favourite place in Waikiki. Under the Banyan Tree at the Moana is superb in every way. Great sea frontage, fast and friendly service, scrumptious food and delicious alcoholic concoctions. In the evenings they have a rolling procession of entertainment - normally a couple of guys with guitars waxing lyrical as well as a hula lady. If you can't find a table, just wait patiently and you'll get one as there's normally a quick turnover of tables, particularly if it's well before sunset or just after sunset. I highly recommend the ribs and the Koloa Paradise cocktail. Delish!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have always wanted to stay here since I came across a webcam that is in the famous Banyan Tree Courtyard. I have been "stalking" this hotel for a long time and decided that I wanted to spend a few days here in Waikiki before heading to the west coast to Aulani. It was worth the wait!The hotel is right n the middle of everything. It is the oldest hotel in Waikiki, built in 1901 and has that old world charm. Eating breakfast on the Verandah is a real treat and enjoying drinks under the banyan tree in the evening is enchanting. Of course, the prices at the bar and the restaurants are high, but so are they everywhere here in Hawaii, especially Waikiki. The spa is lovely with relaxation rooms overlooking the beach. The pool, though, is too small for such a hotel. And it is almost impossible to get a seat since it, like so many resort pools, suffers from people "reserving" places for the whole day, but only using them for an hour or two. But this is a small quibble.Can't wait to return and perhaps stay longer!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed at the Moana Surfrider for 10 days in a Diamond Wing Oceanfront room. I really liked this hotel, have walked past it many times on previous visits, it was a treat to stay here. The room was on a lower floor and although not having the juliette balcony pictured on the website when we booked, was pleasant, very quiet and with a beautiful outlook onto the beach. It's a busy hotel with numerous weddings and events but we expected that and found it added to the fun of being there. Staff were friendly and helpful and the food was great - Ahi Poke & Mai Tais at the Beach Bar, yum! It was difficult to get seating around the pool but we spent most of our time on the beach anyway so it didnt bother us too much. Great location for easy access to restaurants and shops and just people watching from the rocking chairs on the front balcony. Will stay here again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Having been to Maui first, Honolulu is a culture shock, it's SO busy. But the hotel is right by the beach and we got upgraded to the Penthouse floor in the tower, with amazing views of Waikiki beach. There is so much to do here and we loved being able to walk out of the hotel and visit other restaurants and see the sights. The hotel is not a 'sit by the pool' location as the pool is very small and, unfortunately, allows people to place towels on the sunbeds for an hour, so never had an opportunity to secure one :-( We did, however, hire a cabana for the day which came with nice touches such as water and fruit and personal service. The hotel has great entertainment in the beach bar at night, including Bruno Mars' uncle, who was amazing! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, it's a vibrant, buzzing hotel and location, but not for those that want peace and quite I have to say.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Lovely hotel - beautiful building and atmosphere that takes you back in time. Pool is average with limited loungers for the size of hotel but we didn't mind as got out in hire car (recommend Little Hawaii rent a car). Rooms are fairly spacious in the tower (partial ocean view). Beach bar food and service are good and ABC shop opposite great for basic supplies and inflatables for the beach!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It's seat yourself, so we got ourselves a table for 6 people with 2 x children aged 3 & 5 at around 530pm. That's when kids are hungry. I put 2 x tables together and packed up all the previous guests mess, plates etc, I have no problems with that.... BUT, No-one came over..... 10-15 mins later a guy walked past and said I'll be with you in a minute?? That was it... never came back over in the next 10-15 minutes, nor could we find him? So we left and went elsewhere!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Second time at Moana Surfrider, Westin Hotel. Outstanding location right on the beach. Rooms are on the smaller side as well as the pool. However the location is central and directly on the beach. Beach bar has live music most nights. Gym is good for a hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The architecture is beautiful. The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is closed to everything. Service was wonderful also. Bed is comfy.The amenities and rooms leave something to be desired. Small pool and old rooms. Our bathroom had water stains on the walls all around our toilet and our bedroom had eerie red smear marks on the wall. My parents room was noisy even though it's on the 8th floor. But that's what you get when you are right on the busy strip of waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The first impressions of this hotel are that it is spectacular. The architecture is beautiful and you can feel the history of place as soon as you walk in the grand entrance.The check in process was quick and easy but we did arrive early on a Sunday morning so I wouldnt expect anything less. Due to it being so early (approx 7:30am) our room was not ready so they offered us the use of a room to shower and freshen up. They then took our details so they could advise us (by text to our mobile) when our room would be ready. We enjoyed a breakfast buffet at Dukes (next door) and then killed sometime in the pool.Once in our room I was a little underwelmed. It does feel a little dated but we did have a decent partical view of the beach. We had 2 queen beds as we are a family of 3. The beds were comfortable and the quality of sleep was good.The hotel facilities were very good, we only tried the Beach Bar and the food was decent and atmosphere was great. The service was OK but a little inconsistent.I think the biggest issue I have is the value for money. The room price and resort fee combined meant that we were spending approx $400 USD per nigth on accommocation. While I realise that Waikiki is expensive I simply dont believe that we got decent value for money.The pool was decent and being there with my 5 year old we spent a lot of time there. The other reason for spending time in the pool rather than the beech was due to the $50 per day that the hotel wanted for an umbrella! This was a particularly frustrating policy when most of the umbrellas sat there unused as people had them for an entire day but never came back after an hour or 2 of use. I believe it would be in managements best interest to offer half day or even less hire as I believe they would end up with more people utilising them and most imprtantly more happy guests.In summary I would recommend Moana Surfrider as from what I could see this is the best on the beach (with guest private access to the beach) but it comes at a price.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a lovely hotel with lots of old world charm. On the occasion we ate at the Beach House Restaurant the food was amazing! Lots of places to eat nearby for variety. The very high end shops on the strip outside tell you that this is a place for the very wealthy. The beach is very busy, sunbeds available for hire at this hotel are very pricy at $55 per day but we did treat ourselves on the last day. Staff are very helpful and we had a lovely stay here. Would recommend this hotel - if you have lots of money then this could enhance your stay considerably.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is a beautiful hotel in a fantastice spot right on the beach. It's not modern and flashy so don't expect that. The Moana was the first hotel to be built in Waikiki and the decor reflects this. It has a relaxing opulent feel to it and we will always stay here as it always delivers on our expectaions. Yes they do have a lot of weddings here as it is so beautiful but I never found these encroaching on our holiday at all. The beach bar under the stunning banyan tree is fantastic, it's very busy so there is lots to see. Don't expect the drinks to be cheap...this is a prime spot...i did not how ever find them extortionate. The beds and bedding are devine, so good infact that I am going to go online and buy there pillows...they are awesome. We did not find the city view room to be too noisy, nothing really happens along the main street until after 10am any way. Staff are great and nothing is a problem. As an added bonus the best coffee in town is right on the premises at Honolulu Coffee. Over all the price of staying at the beautiful Moana is well worth it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've stayed twice this year at the Moana Surfrider. I've stayed here because someone else chose it and someone else was paying the bill. If was up to me, we would have stayed somewhere else, quite a bit cheaper and probably less busy and definitely quieter. The hotel is beautiful. There is no doubt that it is a lovely looking place to stay. But unfortunately, beauty is not everything.Check in is quite slow, our rooms both times were quite small and quite noisy. We had to turn the air con off at night as it was too loud, then after an hour, we had to turn the fan off too, as it was making a clicking noise which made it impossible to sleep. The good thing about having the air con on, is that it partically drowned out the noise from the people in the room next door. The walls where we were seem to be paper thin and we could hear a lot of noise from the room next door. We were woken up the first morning at 5 am, when the young children in the room next door woke up. I don't know why people take young kids into expensive hotels, but, if they do, you would think they would make a bit of an effort to keep them quiet??? Luckily the parents took the kids out at 6 am, but by then, I couldn't get back to sleep anyway. I also found the bed a little hard and really missed the classic Marriott-type mattress and bedding. I was expecting something more luxurious for the price. The lift is also very slow, and on one day, broken! (There is only one lift that serviced the area where we were staying so we chose to use the service elevator instead, ignoring the sign that said it was only for staff use). I think that a lot of the clientele that stay in this hotel are a bit more interested in status than comfort. It is also a very popular place to get married. You see bridal couples everywhere, all the time, which is sort of cute, but it can get annoying when you have to get around them (like physically walk around the huge gowns) a lot. The beach bar and pool area are fantastic and it is indeed a beautiful hotel. It is a pity that the rooms don't match up to the standard of the public areas. I would have been very disappointed if it were me paying the bill to be honest.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Moana Surfrider is a beautiful hotel with gracious employees and delicious restaurants in the heart of Waikiki. The daily parking fee and resort fees are unfortunate extra expenses but I believe most Waikiki beachfront hotels charge them.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was a last minute "change of plans" trip due to Irma taking our plans away from Key West. For Hawaii I would say this hotel was "Average", nothing spectacular that made it stand out. We booked a room in the historic part with a city view, but received an ocean view; which was a nice surprise. The room was old style, which we expected. It was larger than we figured it would be but with a very small bathroom. Beds were very comfortable, no complaints there. Rooms had large windows, that did not lock, but only opened approx. 8". We did enjoy the large windows to let the sun light in. The doors to the room do not seal very well and lets in plenty of light and noise. House keeping did a good job of keeping everything nice and neat, no complaints there.The water pressure was nice, but a very...I mean very small bathroom. Two people cannot fit in it at the same time.This is a very crowded hotel with, I'd say, 5-6 weddings every day. Beach was good size for Hawaii, but it is directly next to the public beach, being that this is the last hotel. Which isn't a problem, because all the beaches are public. The beach side bar was extremely expensive. $13 for a small tropical drink and it was so strong you couldn't drink it. Service was poor. I only went their once, but had to wait while the bartenders finished their conversation before they took the time to take my order. Service over all was "OK" at best. The staff pretty much just went through the motions. Everything was pretty expensive, which is expected in Hawaii, but we found other hotels with better drink deals and a friendlier atmosphere worth the money. We basically slept here and went elsewhere for fun and activities.Self parking is across the street behind another hotel. Not difficult to get to get in and out of, but I believe that is mainly because of the friendly Hawaiian drivers. Even though there is a lot of traffic, the Hawaiian drivers never feel rushed or pushy. Use your turn signals and they will let you in without any problems. So do not hesitate renting a car. Expect to add about $450 to your stay for hotel parking (self) and resort fees for a 6 night stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our six night stay has been our best in Hawaii, the layout of a very old hotel with modern features caters for all, allows for for it to be busy at all times but whether relaxing by the pool or private beach or sitting on a rocking chair watching Waikiki go by it is fun.It's location is unbeatable for beach, shops, its Banyan tree provides great shade over the beach bar area which is a welcome, all the staff throughout have been very helpful and courteous, we have never seen so many wedding couples!Have yet to eat in the restaurant so looking forward to the same standards. We are in the old part of the hotel which has small rooms, being English we are used to it so no problem but others may need to ask for the modern wing towers.Look forward to returning again sometime.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: No chairs at the pool at 10am. When I asked for a beach chair instead, I was informed I would have to pay $30 for the morning. After stating there were no other options I was then told they were all reserved, which clearly was a lie as I could purchase one a minute before. I was then provided a folding chair with holes that I could set up myself on the beach. After completing the hotels questionnaire I received a template email stating they were sorry that all of the chairs were reserved, not addressing the fact at all that there were not enough. At $400 per night one would have expected much better service.On a bright note, front desk and restaurant staff were nice and the food was good.
user_name:
GMY27
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: For a $250/night city view room be prepared to fall asleep to live music being played on the street and sewage pump servicing on Tuesday nights, and to be woken up by trash pick-up starting at 6 AM every morning. The room was quite small and just had enough space to fit a king size bed and the bathroom just had enough space for a shower. I do have to say that the bed is super comfy! Luckily it's a beachfront property (why we chose it in the first place) and we were up early each day to enjoy the amenities. Service is standard, staff aren't proactive in enhancing your stay unlike a lot of other resort properties we've stayed at. We came back to our room also unlocked after it was serviced by housekeeping. Unless you're with a travel group, you don't get much of welcome when you arrive. We were waiting in line to be checked in for about fifteen minutes while travel groups got lei'd and had seats while they were serviced. We stayed at the Surfjack after three nights at the Moana Surfrider and had an amazing experience with superior room quality and customer service for almost half the price; at the Surfjack you're welcomed with refreshments and an agent comes to you at a seating area when there's a wait but it's not beachfront. As long as you temper your expectations when booking a room without an ocean view and really want a beachfront hotel, the Moana Surfrider is a solid option but if you don't mind being a block inland I would definitely explore other properties.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We visited Oahu as honeymooners and loved our stay at the Moana Surfrider. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. We loved our ocean view. The location is prime and made it easy for walking or for public transportation. We did have a little trouble finding electrical outlets but other than that, we loved our stay!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We had high expectations for this resort. For context, we are mother and daughter, and we required an accessible room as my mother is in a wheelchair. We had booked an ocean view accessible room.We knew this was the oldest hotel in Waikiki, and the main area of the hotel itself is lovely. Unfortunately, the area they had put us in was not the nice section of the hotel. If you are booking a room in the Diamond section, be warned. This is an outdated, hot and stuffy, rundown part of the hotel. We had requested a room with two beds and were given a room with one double bed. For our expensive stay in this "four star resort" I had to sleep on a rollaway bed. The room was incredibly tiny. The furniture in the room blocks the path from the door to the very small balcony so a wheelchair cannot fit past. The furniture is old and outdated, the air conditioning in the room is loud, the decorating needs updating and the beds were uncomfortable. The bathroom was only okay. The only good thing about the room was the view.We stayed in this shoebox for one night and they then transferred us into an accessible room in the same section with two double beds, but due to the fact that it was hot, the room smelled and it was in the same rundown ancient section of the hotel, we decided not to stay. We booked a room at the Hilton Garden Inn and moved across.I found the staff rude, the wait times long and everything ridiculously overpriced. Breakfast for two people was nearly $100. The resort fees are over $40.00. Yes, the hotel is in a prime location, but it is a total rip-off. If you are staying in the Diamond section of the hotel you can see right into the windows of the older original section as well.No two people have ever hated a hotel as much as we hated the Moana Surfrider, and I would never recommend it to anyone. There are better hotels in Waikiki that don't cost a small fortune. Just wander in and look at the building - you don't need to stay there. I would give it zero stars but I've given it two due to the fact that they tried to help us, and that the room itself was clean and tidy. It was just really old, and they charge a fortune for it, and it's just not worth it.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was our first time in Hawaii and we have thoroughly enjoyed it. When we arrived we found out that even with an upgrade to a Diamond oceanfront room ww/Juliette balcony when we booked our package that this room was very small. It had a king bed with the balcony chairs & table all in the same room-the balcony is too small to put the chairs and table on it. We upgraded to a tower suite - management was very helpful and discounted the rate for us. Everyone here has been so friendly and ready to assist you. Housekeeping service is great they come in the morning same time. Restaurant staff are very friendly and welcoming. We booked tours here and the young lady that assisted us was very good. Great beachfront access only drawback I can see is the pool is small but you always have the ocean which is beautiful. Very nice hotel with good food especially the breakfast buffet. We loved sitting on the balcony watching the surfers in the morning. Great hotel and very friendly staff. We would recommend this hotel to others.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Fantastic hotel on Waikiki beach - the hotel being 110 years old gives great atmosphere. The rooms are very clean, spacious and well decorated. We had a sea view and small balcony, the room had two rocking chairs so can relax and see the beach and activities on the sea.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We stayed here on two separate occasions over a 2 week trip to Hawaii, and loved staying here both times. For both stays we were in the Tower Wing in a 2x double bed room, and had great views to the beach and pool area. The hotel itself is very grand, with lots of food and drink options, and if you want to venture out, there are many places to go within a 5 minute walk in either direction. The hotel gym has lots of space and is well equipped with everything other than plate loaded machines, It also looks over Kalakaua Ave.Only downsides would be that the pool is quite small for the size of the hotel and closes early in the evening, having said that it never seemed to busy, although the sun lounges were always a challenge to get later in the day. Also the Surfrider Cafe closes quite early at 430.All the staff were very friendly and helpful and we would definitely stay here again. Just sitting on the rocking chairs watching the world go by is something we look forward to doing again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Loved the style of this hotel and the room was well appointed with a nice beach views. We loved sitting on the balcony in the rocking chairs watching the world go by. The hotel is in a great location.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Drenched in history this beautiful 110 year old wing of the Moana has a feeling all its own. We stayed in the Tower which is relatively new and does not have the same ambience. The foyer and verandah are delightful. Wonderful location right on Waikiki Beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We booked our first 3 nights elsewhere so we could check around firsthand before deciding on the last 4 nights as reviews can be deceiving. SO HAPPY with the second choice of Moana Surfrider! We loved it upon walking by and spoke to a nice gentleman at the front desk who actually told us we would get a better price online. We Did! Yet at check in he still made sure we got the best room possible for that rate. Top floor, ocean view! Food at the Beachhouse was phenomenal (and my husband is a chef). Service from the bartenders there Wednesday night was superb. We are so looking forward to the rest of our week! The ONLY downside was this morning when people put towels on every pool chair at 7am for HOURS and don't come back. The sign says they will be removed after 60 minutes if unattended, but that is unfortunately not enforced. We finally "stole" chairs. Please make that better and everything will be perfect until Sunday!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Awesome location, lots of great restaurants around here and everyone you meet is happy. Make sure you get a room on high floor with an ocean view. You can watch people surf or surf all day.Their Beach Club next to the ocean is great. Pool is a little small but why swim in a pool when the protected beach is like a huge swimming pool.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband and I have stayed here three times, and are booked for our fourth.This perfect piece of Waikiki history is like a dream, you will feel special, and like your in an exclusive club. It is elegant, friendly, in a perfect location.The amazing breakfast on the beautiful balcony is not to be missed.The Banya tree is the perfect place to watch the world go by, enjoy a casual meal, and drink cocktails as the sun goes down. I found it to be super social and friendly.Be careful going to the spa, can be $$$$

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is the second year in a row that my husband and I have stayed at this hotel, and we absolutely love it! It is by far my favorite hotel on this island. My only complaint is that both times we have come, we didn't get our lei's upon arrival. It's a small thing, but I feel like it's kind of tradition when you go to Hawaii. We will definitely be back next year and stay here again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a stunning hotel. I loved the old world charm of it. We were lucky to have a new room and although it was small, it was lovely. It was certainly a step up from the previous lacklustre Starwood hotel we stayed at on the Big Island - to our relief! The only disappointing thing was the restaurant. The choice of food for dinner (and more importantly the kids menu) was unusual and not at all to my child's liking. It was good to see a menu that wasn't just burgers and fries but my daughter couldn't find anything to eat, so we left. The menu seems more targeted to an Asian market! The breakfast menu however was fantastic, whether it was the buffet or al la carte.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location of this property is just absolutely perfect for beach, shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff are of the highest standard in all areas starting at the lobby continuing out to the pool and at every restaurant and bar we attended.The rooms are of a great size and very clean with amazing views and this is definitely a location that you do not want to leave.The hotel was the first built on the strip so it has a great history so I highly recommend the hotel history tour, it is very well worth it.A definite must to stay at and the sunsets are pretty amazing along with the blue ocean waters, a great and unforgettable holiday and property.
user_name:
Shelley V
Adelaide, South Australia, Australia

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 20 of our friends flew in from various parts of the world for a special birthday celebration. We could not possible complain about the ideal location, idyllic and picturesque. Blending the old with the new, this Westin property is very different to other resorts I have enjoyed in other parts of the world, so a word of warning, things you would normally expect to be inclusive are chargeable. Service was a tad compromised but always professional and attentive. That's the price you pay during the summer peak season. We stayed in the old wing with direct beach views and our room was very small compared to those in the new wing but easily compensated by the location and the perfect weather experienced during our stay. Thoroughly enjoyable! A reunion is on the cards and we would return in a heartbeat!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Perfect beach location! The rooms are spacious and it's lovely to have both a pool and direct beach access. Just off the beach is a nice wave break area. Run across to the ABC store to get a few beach inner tubes and the towel concierge will inflate them for you. Showers readily available to rinse off.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The general manager and his team made a trip that did not start in the proper way...unforgettable....The room, the view, the restaurant, the smiles...and no matter if you are having breakfast or just relaxing at the pool, you will always find a "friend" and somebody there to make it unique.The hotel location right on the beach and few steps from the main stores.Start at the Moana your magic, unique and mystic vacation in Hawaii.Aloha...Aloha...and Aloha again...Thank you Moana, and thank you Westin...

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The beach bar is the best during the day. All the staff are amazing!!!! Marty, Chris, clayton....best staff EVA!!!!! Even if u don't stay at the hotel, hang at the bar!!!!!! Evening beautiful but not as great as the bar staff during the day. KUDOS!!!! We come back to Honolulu and will never miss our Freinds.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Found the accommodation to be in a perfect location. Walk out one side and you are on the beach and then walk the other side to the wonderful selection of shops. Staff were all lovely and really helpful. Everything was very clean. Beds and pillows very comfortable. Definitely will stay there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Perfect location, directly on beautiful Waikiki beach. Grand, elegant early 20C building. Nice, confortable, clean rooms. Very good breakfast. But the hotel is constantly overcrowded, congested and noisy and guests have to wait for everything: check-in, consierge, table for breakfast, table for dinner, car from valet parking, etc. and the rooms suffer from the noises coming from the street. We also had a problem with the reservation: I had requested two adjoining rooms, one for my husband and me, the other for our two children, aged 15 and 6, but on arrival we were given two rooms very far apart. As the hotel was fully booked, we were given adjoining rooms only on the following day and the room change was obviously a nuisance.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Great place, very fancy. It was very nice with a great view. If you've every stayed at the Grand Floridian in Disney World, you'll like this. Please go see my boy at the snack bar! The service was a little poor, but they were very nice. The cleaning ladies were great and always friendly. If you're looking for a nice view, go to the middle elevator that looks old when you first walk in and hit the sixth floor. There is a great balcony there that you should definitely check out!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My husband planned this trip all by himself for our anniversary. It is the oldest hotel in Honolulu but it is the prettiest and most incredible place on the island. It has a large porch with white rocking chairs looking at the beach. Our room was right next door to the Diamond Head Suite. It had an incredible view of Diamond Head, the beach and unforgettable sunsets. They greet you in with by the incredible staff with a lei and ice cold water and towels. Valet was a breeze every time we used it. It's a beautiful upscale resort but very inviting. The view was so beautiful that we slept on the balcony one night. There is a beach bar out on the beach and have some activities such as a luau. It's in the perfect spot for walking to shopping and nightlife. If you weren't in love when you got here you will be when by the time you leave.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family stayed at the Moana in June (which we just loved!). While on this trip, our daughter lost an expensive pair of sunglasses that had been a special birthday gift. She didn't realize she lost them until she got back home. We did not contact the Moana lost and found because we had no idea where on our trip she had lost them. Last week (August), we got an email from the Moana asking if we had lost sunglasses during our stay. After being asked to describe/identify them, the sunglasses were returned to us yesterday in perfect condition. WOW! We were floored by the effort it must have taken to find the owner and by the great honest values of Moana staff. They clearly went that extra mile (roughly 4,800 to be more exact) for their guests. Great moral of the story for our kids too. An amazing hotel with clearly amazing staff! Mahalo nui loa Moana.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon. The room was good size and we had an ocean front room and the view was amazing! The hotel is right on the beach which is great, and close to Waikiki and you can see Diamond Head. The staff was super friendly. The hotel is centrally located in the shopping area, so if you like to shop and have lots of food options outside of the hotel, then stay here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice facilities. However, my major complaint is that my daughter saw poop in the swimming pool. She was wearing goggles and had a good look at it. I was not wearing goggles, but I saw a few dark solid pieces at the bottom of the pool that looked like poop, and I took photos/videos with my GoPro. When I told the pool attendant, he gave me goggles and told me to verify for sure. I told him that it looked like poop, and my daughter said that she's pretty sure it's poop, and I was not interested in going back in the pool. So he shrugged it off and did nothing. No pool evacuation, no chlorination, no announcement to hotel guests, no interest in doing anything, didn't care. Aside from the poop, the pool was not well maintained. There was lots of sand in the shallow end of the pool, even in the morning hours, doesn't look like they ever cleaned it during our entire stay.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I were looking forward to staying at this property; based off of the pictures and the central location of the hotel we were expecting an amazing stay. Things didn't start off well - we found our room in the Diamond Wing of this hotel to be dated, smelly and small. There was the distinct smell of smoke in the room - the staff that came up to check verified the smell was in fact cigarette smoke. A complaint to the front desk resulted in us being moved the next day; my 5 yr old, 6 month old baby, wife and I were stuck smelling stale smoke until then. All we got for our inconvenience was an apology - no compensation or complimentary breakfast (by the way the hotel breakfast is $42 / adult daily). The room we moved to was also small and dated but thankfully not smelly. It was however dusty.Positives: the location is great, the staff were friendly and professional. The beach is a few steps away from the lobby. The hotel grounds are gorgeous and impeccably maintained.I would suggest that if you planning on booking this hotel either pay for a suite, wait for their standard room price to be heavily discounted or book elsewhere - its simply not worth paying the regular rate for one of their standard rooms plus their resort fee ($34/day) plus the fee for breakfast ($42/ adult per day - kids eat free)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: 3 couples stayed from the 9th of August for 8 days. It was amazing. Stayed in the Tower where the rooms all have balconies. Slept with the balcony door open and listened to the waves every night. Looked out over the ocean and woke up to a spectacular view every morning and the sunsets were beautiful. The staff at the hotel were great from housekeeping to reception to the pool area. Loved it

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The location is amazing, the beach is steps away, the building is old-world gorgeous. Staff was incredibly attentive and professional. In fact, I have never ever had a room cleaned and organized as thoughtfully as it was every day. She (the housecleaner) was amazing.The only reason it's not a 5 is that the 5th floor has some odor issues in the hallway. Smells a little musty or something. I believe they're going to remodel, so probably a short-term issue. Other than that, loved it and would definitely stay there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: There is just something special about the feel of this hotel. It could be the historical building or the peaceful courtyard covered by the banyan tree, whatever it is, this is my all-time favourite hotel in Hawaii. We stayed in the tower wing and the room was lovely with a balcony overlooking the beach, but it is the public areas which really shine. Somehow walking into this hotel is like a sudden departure from the hustle and bustle that is Waikiki into a tranquil escape. The pool is small but nice and never seemed too crowded during our stay, the location is unbeatable and the staff friendly and helpful. I'll be staying here again next time I come and would wholeheartedly recommend it to friends and family

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Its now been about 3 years since we were here last, (man how times fly) and if anything this place has just gotten even better this time around, the service, the view, the breakfast, the people, it's all just so wonderful and there is no way to beat to location, location, location , right in the heart of Waikiki in the middle of a beautiful beach, and the heart of the city, all there is to say is save up a little extra and stay here, it's way worth it, the history, the feel, man we love Hawaii and this is just all the goodness in one place. Can't wait to come back again. (Hopefully sooner then last time)

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We have visited this hotel several times before but never again. I can't deny the hotel is beautiful and position fabulous but this was our first time in the diamond wing. I am disabled and need an accessible room and my own bed. The room was booked for 3 adults and 3 Beds and we were given a room in the diamond wing, which I have to say is a bit shabby, and the room non too clean, filthy in places. We had to wait for the third bed to the brought to our room, despite it being late at night, the pillow and cover were smeared with blood. We had been travelling for nearly 30 hours, so we just made the best of it and turned in for the night. We were very conscious the following day that the insulation between the rooms was poor and a door connecting the next room had a large gap underneath, so we could clearly hear our neighbours. On the third night we were kept awake by a young baby in the next room, which cried a great deal. The following morning I spoke to reception, who apologised but told me they were checking out that day. Unfortunately they were followed by another family also with a very young baby. After 2 nights of no sleep and really suffering, I approached reception again. The family were staying for a further 3 nights, so the solution suggested by the receptionist, to our noise problem was get ear plugs. I was flabbergasted. This is not an inexpensive hotel, we had travelled a long way and we had to wear ear plugs because the insulation between the rooms was so poor. Shame on you Moana Surfrider.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed seven nights at the wonderful Surfrider. Rooms are good in size and a wonderful King Sized Mattress made for a comfortable stay. Being on level three, the rooms can get a little noisy, but this is a small criticism. The resort on a whole is magnificent. The 'natural a/c', as I heard it called made the degree days appear so comfortable. The sea water at the hotel edge is divine.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the minute we arrived at this fabulous hotel we were made to feel special and welcome. The decor is plush, grand and opulent. The pool is small and always full of young spalshy children but as the beach is 10 steps away that's not a problem! The pianist was fabulous in the foyer in the evenings and you can hire go pros for free (we had no memory card with us so didn't). The balcony is a great place to observe everyone in Honolulu with a drink in your hand and we had a room with a sea view! Definitely on my "go back to" list

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Whether grabbing a Rocking Chair on the Front patio to people watch.....Enjoying the shaded pool / bar area while listening to live music.....Watching the sunset....THIS is one of my Go To Places every time I'm in Honolulu ( once a year -19 years ) My Favorite Part - Mai Tais. Bartender CRAIG works the late afternoon shift and has been serving since 1984....He knows a good Mai Tai. I recommend the Original Mai Tai. Tell Craig that Roger sent you, and ask to make you a "hurt me" one....don't worry it won't hurt too much. Warning !! - Drinking these may cause a Good Time.And if you're there the Week of Jan 14-18, 2018....let's have a Mai Tai together !

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is one of my favorite hotels. It is absolutely stunning, has excellent service and the banyan tree on the back patio makes the hotel extra special. I could literally sit out on the back patio for hours while enjoying the soft, live music. On my last stay, the manager, Michael, made our stay extra special and made us feel like family. I can't say enough great things about my experiences there. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This was the third time we at the Moana Surfrider. It never fails to please. Every visit we have arrived early, due to flights or leaving a cruise ship. They suggest they'll text when a room becomes available, and that has always happened fairly promptly. We choose to stay in the tower, a more modern section, where the rooms are very large, with balconies. Each time I stay, I can hardly wait to return. There is a Resort charge, as is the case with most central hotels in Waikiki. It covers wi fi and some other things, but it seems extraordinary that this can't be part of the Tariff, and that would be the only fault I would find with this hotel.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: It was a beautiful hotel and the location could not be beat. It is dated I was expecting more luxury that I received for the price. The pool area is very small for the size of the establishment. The staff were not always friendly. There are an amazing selection of eateries outside the hotel that I would recommend.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We came here for business and pleasure both and being off season we got a great rate. The hotel is right on the beach but has a pool also. The moment you drive up to the front of the property you know you have made the right choice in places to stay. Check in is done in the most courteous manner and your wishes are granted on the spot. This hotel is one of the oldest in Honolulu and has that rich architecture that you cannot find in the modern chains. The rooms are not as big as others but you will love the views and amenities. It is located within walking distance of many fine restaurants and entertainment.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed for my forth time at Moana Surf Rider and loved it as much as the first time. Craig and Chris know you within an hour of arriving and don't forget your preference !Overall the staff is wonderful and we will be back !

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We actually visited in July. We absolutely lovedThis hotel. The rooms were nice but the view was outstanding. Staff was excellent! Thank you Shannon for helping to arrange our stay. The Moana's location was perfect for us. Everything is within walking distance the zoo, aquarium, restaurants, and entertainment.I would definitely stay there again. Overall it enhanced our vacation. I would love to stay there again.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Had a great time visiting the beach bar during my vacation. I especially liked Mr. Harry T who always remembered my name and my favorite cocktail the Moana mai tai. Very tasty my friend. I will definitely come back to this bar on my next visit.CJ Stone

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: A stunning place to stay. The location is superb right in the heart of shopping, restaurants and the gorgeous beach with the massive Ala Moana shopping centre a short bus or taxi ride away.We chose to stay in the Diamond wing as it was important for me to have a room with a balcony and view. If the room is important to you, study the different ones on offer through various sources on the internet. I would have been disappointed to travel all this way to have a view of the street or a tree.Check-in staff were lovely and welcoming and we found all the staff to be pleasant and professional.I was really impressed with the attention to detail with maintenance at the Surfrider, keeping the Hotel pristine. There were people quietly going around touching up paint, sticking down wallpaper tending the garden - well done to the staff and management for this attention to detail. There were loungers and umbrellas for hire in a roped off section of the beach that you can reserve for the day and come and go as you please. This was a great idea as you can read, swim and snack all day without losing your spot. I read another review that said they thought it was quite cheap, however, at around $70USD per day (incl gratuity) I thought this was expensive. Worth it as part of the experience, but expensive.Breakfast was nice and the staff very attentive.Totally recommend staying here.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: After working in Kona for almost a week, we started our vacation in Honolulu before heading to Canada. Being a SPG Platinum member, I chose one of its hotels in town so I could use the benefits since we were staying only one night and we could benefit from the 4 pm check-out and a potential upgrade to a suite. We didn't get the suite upgrade, but I understand since sometimes it is hard to accommodate, it is high season after all. To my surprise, since the Moana Surfrider is a resort, this benefit does not apply and they can only give you check out until 1 pm. The staff was incredibly helpful and we stayed at the lounge and could use the spa before our flight. Also we chose a historic room with sea view and it was probably the smallest room I stayed in the US for a long time. Maybe the bed was too big, but it did feel tight. Having said all of that, the location is perfect for shopping and enjoying the beach.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: What a fabulous hotel, a real colonial feel but mixing the old with the new. Right on a stunning area of the beach, white sand and clear blue sea. Surfing lessons and surf board hire very close. The hotel is perfect, lovely areas to sit and relax, beautiful trees and flowers all around. Fabulous breakfast, try to sit outside, amazing service and relaxed atmosphere. Bedrooms were very comfortable and stylish. The hotel is right in the centre of the main area of the City, so plenty to see and do. This was a fantastic stay for us a family of 2 adults and 4 children. Just perfect - thank you.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Arriving at 6am in the morning and knowing you wont have a room isn't a good feeling. Thankfully the front desk staff had our bags checks and we were given access to a suite to shower and refresh. We relaxed on the veranda and were checked in later that day. That's the price you pay when booking a tower room in SummerThe Moana has become our go-to hotel. Sure its not cheap but you pay for the atmosphere, service and that feeling that you are always welcome. Life revolves around memories and all my friends and family know about my fetish for a daily Mai Tai in the beach bar.Once again the staff were great and I have to mention the following staff as stand outs.Front Desk: IreneBeach Bar: Rob.Activity/tour desk: Roxanne.Looking forward to walking through the foyer again in November.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: All you would want at one location, located on the beach, shops, restaurants, in walking distance, rooms clean, awesome view of the ocean from the balcony. Bar features live music and great cocktails.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice place to stay! The oldest hotel in Waikiki, so I enjoy the setup and historical charm. The rocking chairs out front are great for people watching, and the restaurant is top notch! Comfy beds, friendly staff, and accommodating for tourists. You won't be disappointed!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wow once a breezy friendly elegant yet casual place now a forced closed off look with extremely high back out of place sofas. The decorator should be fired. How do you close off a lobby with overly high backed sofas that are unfortunately ugly and block the view of the lobby. The pics speak for themselves , yuck.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Nice hotel in great position, however the pool and beach area are too small for the size of this hotel. Japanese families put towels on 6 to 8 chairs and then disappear for hours. Staff make no attempt to monitor this. I sat at a table in an empty area as there was no where else to sit and was told I had to move unless I bought a cocktail. It was 11.00am. All beach and pool chairs "taken". I asked where I could sit and the staff member replied "not my problem"The staff are not particularly friendly and quite aggressive. Love the hotel but could not recommend due to the attitude of the staff .

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is close to everything. Best location. The beach is right there. All the restaurants and shopping as well. I like that its layout is open so you can walk straight from the street to the beach. The service was great. We had an issue with our booking through Expedia and the hotel staff were great. Everything was solved in no time. The rooms really are small. We are a family of 4 and it was a little crowded in the room but we barely spent any time in there. Bathrooms are pretty small too. But if you are on vacation, you spend most of your time outside so you don't really care about that. We would definitely stay there again, regardless of the size of the room. Food was great. At the beach bar and at the Veranda. We ate breakfast buffet one day and it was great, plenty of choices and our server was amazing. We also had "tea" at the Veranda. Pretty cool. All the desserts tasted great. Another great thing is that kids eat free with a paying adult. Spg members also get great benefits. All in all, a great hotel where we had a great time and will definitely come back again!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I have stayed at the Moana Surfrider at least 10 times. I changed to the Royal Hawaiian several years ago since the amount of children just seemed less.The Moana was my choice this trip since it is for business and the rate was almost half.....so begrudgingly I booked the Moana.Well!!I love the new lounge for Starwood members and the new menu at the restaurant. The fish was excellent! The check in service was much easier for the platinum members and everyone was smiling. The valets were fairly quick considering the amount of cars coming and going.The bartenders in the restaurant are entertaining and friendly....and I got upgraded to a great room overlooking the ocean and Diamond Head.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: More like 3.5 star rating!Pros: BEAUTIFUL hotel & property! Great location! Amazing beach with great shopping & restaurants nearby! Got upgraded to partial ocean view without askingCons: Check in & out process are lengthy, long slow lines to the desk. Even when you just have a question, you gotta stand in line to ask. Service is definitely lacking. My son's beach shoes were lost at the property. I had to call the security desk 3 times to get any answers (they handle lost & found items). First 2 times, I was told they are busy & can't do it. Third time the checked & didn't see them, referring me to pool stand outside. Basically I got the run around before I had the chance to even have coffee that morning. With hotel of that price range & class, I expected better. It was my son's favorite shoes, we never found them, which is fine, it's just the process was not handled well by the hotel. Nobody seemed to care. Spoke to manager Michael, who didn't seem much concerned either but did let us check out one hour late that day. Love the hotel & location, didn't care for service. Also, they didn't have a crib ready for us, I emailed them two weeks before arrival to request it be present in the room when we arrive. But this alone would have never bothered me, had it not been for other service issues.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The hotel and service, were wonderful. The beach is right there, all the amenities are easily accessible.The place is truly amazing from and aesthetic view as well as a historic view. The location is central.The main thing people people should be aware of is the amount of people in the Waikiki area. This place is more than packed. In order to eat dinner without having to wait 1 hour, be ready at 4:30.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Honolulu and the Moana Surfrider was a great place centrally located. The staff was great and the breakfast is really good. Will definitely be back next time we come to Hawaii. A friend recommended this place and it did not disappoint.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Just spent a week here in the Tower with adjoining rooms and a "partial ocean view" room. The rooms are spacious although not luxe, really comfortable beds and good bed linen. We're about half way along the side of the tower and the views of the Ocean are OK, although any further back and the view would be very partial indeed!!The staff here are great, welcoming and professional, took the time to remember our names which was a nice touch, the concierge seems a bit hit and miss, but may be just a reflection of Island life. The resort fee entitled us to "free" International calls, water in the room, a buffet breakfast and a mobile wifi dongle per room which were all good ( especially the wifi with teenagers and when we were out and about) The hotel itself is sandwiched between a thin strip (10m) of Waikiki beach and the main Waikiki strip on Kalakaua avenue. The original Victorian era hotel is a beautiful building with open verandas and Lanais front and back, the additions, including the bit we were staying in ( like most of Waikiki) are uninspiring concrete hi rise. The elevators were fine although the asian sense of personal body space is obviously different leading to us playing the "how many Japanese tourists can we cram in this lift" game a few times!!Where the hotel really lets itself down is the under-provision of common area facilities, especially for such a large hotel. There are about 50 free sun beds available - although there is generally a queue at 7am for them when the pool area opens, there are also a 3 or 4 cabanas for hire ($150 usd/ day, not sure what facilities ) or a limited number of sun beds on the beach itself ($55 usd/day... more for a parasol). The hotel isn't short of space, but they dont open it up to their guests it in an attempt to monetise it. There is a large lawn area ( largely unused) reserved for wedding parties, there's a "beach club" that again seemed largely unpopulated which you could join for a fee ( although it kind of looked like an airport departure lounge so we didn't ) and in the evening a big part of the terrace was reserved for Jalpak ( an Asian tour company) customers for a buffet. In the morning most seemed to have the buffet breakfast included but any time after 8.30 am resulted in a long (20 minute) queue to be seated, once there the breakfast was fineThe pool is really small and largely used by folks with toddlers, as the surf on the beach tends to be too rough to allow smaller children to play safely at the waters edge. The beach itself is great, white sand, but fairly narrow and due to the famous Waikiki surf, wear beach shoes as the seabed has a fair amount of sharp rock exposed - also you need to keep your wits about you as there are a fair few novice surfers who are concentrating more on staying on the board than where it is heading!!To compound the crowding the hotel is very open to both the beach and the strip with lots of non residents wandering in to use the facilities. In the evening I was glad we had inter- connecting rooms as there was no access control on the tower lifts and a separate entrance in to it off the strip so anyone could have been wandering in. The result was that we didn't really stay in an around the hotel during the day ( no real hardship as the beaches down the road are great, but you need a car) or in the evening ( again no hardship as the strip has a great selection of both international and local bars, eateries and shops literally in your door step) In my opinion if you want to enjoy the Moana Surfrider, save some money and book a hotel non beachside, then wander in with everyone else!!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This hotel is a amazing from customer service to the penthouse suite. Our view from our suite was beautiful! Nice perk was access to the Beach Club from morning until night. We had not stayed at the Surfrider in over 25 years and decided to return and stay in a penthouse suite. So glad we did. Room was very clean and beds were very comfortable. They have a nice restaurant which we had breakfast and a great buffet. Loved that the hotel is in the center of everything. After being out all day loved sitting in the rockers and watch people go by. Will definitely be returning soon and will again stay in the penthouse suite.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here last weekend, and needless to say, we will return every year and make it a tradition! Our trip was highlighted by 3 major parts, the service, the food, and the atmosphere. First and foremost, our server, Dylan, was friendly, knowledgeable, and gave us a lasting experience. He helped my wife find wine that perfectly paired with her food choices. He gave us information on dishes we were curious about and helped us pick the perfect meal. He was always checking on us, but not so much that we felt bothered. Exceptional 5 star service! Next, the food was phenomenal. The fish was fresh and perfectly seasoned, the sides were well balanced, and my steak was perfectly cooked. The dessert took things to another level as we ordered a sampler. Every piece was delectable. Finally, the atmosphere was perfect for our romantic evening. Between the Waikiki sunset, the cool breeze and the friendly service, we will definitely return. We thanked manager Justin for his well executed staff. Can't wait till next years anniversary, we will be back! Mahalo Moana!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Our family just spent a week in this classy hotel. Great history. Beautiful hotel. Upscale and classier than some of the other hotels in the area. Great location right on the beach. All staff were very friendly.
user_name:
Patrick M
Tampa, Florida, United States

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: I've been staying at the Moana ever since I was a child. (Now, in my 40s with my own family). It is so charming and elegant; every time I step into the lobby, I get so nostalgic. It really is a timeless place. We've stayed at other beach-front hotels in Waikiki because my husband thought that they had better pools for kids (I think the Moana pool is fine, albeit very small) but they don't have the same Hawaiian charm. I love history, architecture and antiques so this hotel is a great fit for me. Even if you don't stay here I recommend looking around the lobby or having a drink on the veranda.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Stayed here for a week in July - on arrival - the valet, suddenly realising we'd just arrived threw a couple of obligatory lei at us and ushered us through to reception. As the room wasn't ready, we had lunch and our first taste of Waikiki beach, the banyan tree and the colourful view. Ate at the The Beach Bar food is fairly standard with a small but good selection of both food and drinks. Our room was in the original part of the hotel which is full of character, the room was fairly small with a very small bathroom but had everything you might need, coffee making facilities, water regularly replenished and a good selection of toiletries. As our room faced the city there was some traffic noise especially when on the balcony but this is to be expected. If the hotel has a negative its that the addition of the tower and all of the subsequent rooms have overpowered the available facilities. There is often a long queue at reception, no chance whatsoever of getting near the small pool or on the beach beds and even finding a table at busy times is a challenge. One positive of this is that it ensures that you leave the hotel and see all of the highlights of Waikiki, Honolulu and Oahu.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: From the time you arrive at the resort, you know your booking of this resort was the right choice. Check in was a breeze bell staff on the ball rooms ready,clean stocked yet small very nice.After unpacking the first stop beach bar, Peter and all the bar staff make you feel as if you are a star or that you have been coming hear for years. The pool and surrounding area is small and to enjoy this you must arrive early in the day to get your place in the sun, no reservations for pool loungers, and don't think of being a chaise hog leaving a towel on the chaise leaving for hours and returning! It won't work if you leave for more than forty five minuets your gone as you should be! As of all beaches in Hawaii the beach is open to all the public though the resort has a area roped off for guest with a small charge for beach chaise, You must reserve the chaise a day in advance to obtain a chaise. I found the best time to reserve chaise lounge is to arrive by 6:30am be in line and be kind to the staff who are wonderful in helping you find just the right spot. The beach staff is AWSOME!! Gloria a 29 year veteran at the Moana, Lee also a long timer And MO who is all around great guy! Mo was so helpful in our great time at the beach. I can't say enough about Gloria,Lee and MO!! a super thanks to all. F&B is done to its finest at the Moana and all the service staff is spot on.As always take care of your servers and bartenders and they will take care of you.As for the rest of the Hotel its Beautiful built in 1901 the First lady of the beach shines like a beacon with charm and grace. The lobby front porch area and back patio area with a Banyon tree planted in 1901 is truly breath taking.I found this hotel and staff very special that takes pride in their employ at this Historic hotel. This is a must stop or stay at some point in your life.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: The Moana Surfrider is situated in my opinion in the perfect sport in Waikiki, it is the prime position for all aspects of Waikiki, you are literally in walking distance to everywhere you would want to be and in walking distance of transport to take you wherever you want to go. Our room was clean and we had a partial beach view, which is exactly what we got. There was one incident where a couple on our floor had an argument with the female being locked out of the room and us being woken up by her banging and yelling like a drunken lunatic. Security did arrive eventually and diffuse the situation but there was no apology from management which would have been appreciated. Sometimes it's not about getting a discount or something for free, but just management acknowledging a situation and apologising for it.The pool area does get overly crowded with people placing towels on chairs to save spots. The Management has signs up saying people's towels will be removed if they are in use for 60 minutes, however we did not see this to be the case. Being so close to the beach however, we did not use the pool at all due to the crowding so much preferred the beach. We did hire a beach umbrella and chairs for the day costing $55USD + gratuity - I didn't really understand the gratuity since no one actually done anything for me or provided me with a service.The Beach Bar - The drinks were amazing, especially the strawberry daiquiri with vodka, moana cooler and the blue Hawaii, highly recommend! The food is standard, but I would not recommend the Caesar Salad as it smelt funny and was practically inedible. The breakfast is decent, they are huge portion sizes but the costs match the sizing, it was also around 32 or so USD for a buffet breakfast. I found the wait staff did monitor their tips with one staff member not letting us leave without her full tip.. The bill with gratitude came to a total of something like $50.47 and we gave her $50, but she pushed the issue for the 47 cents. At the end of the day it is a boutique hotel, the lobby and rooms are great and the location is what you pay for.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Decided to write this review whilst still being at the property. The property itself is beautiful as it has preserved its history and is full of the wonderful original details. It opens on the stunning courtyard which features a majestic Banyan tree with the backdrop of the azure waters of Waikiki. That's what is going to keep me in this hotel... the rest, I could leave it behind right away. When we checked in last night we weren't greeted with any particular Hawaiian touch... might as well have checked in a hotel in Chicago! We were assigned a room which size wise was perfectly fine however the size of the bathroom is so small that not more than one person can fit in at the same time! I also noticed that the room had two very small windows which whilst adding to the charm of this old building when we woke up this morning Immediately showed that the room has virtually no natural light. Is a little bit like being in the loft of an old house with a bathroom the size of an airplane toilet. I complained and I was offered to move to a different room, same category on a different floor.... would need to pack up again.... then wait 3pm to get to the new room... not ideal. So I said "no, thank you".... and when I expressed my disappointment I was told "thanks for letting us know"!!! By the way, I did not ask or expected an upgrade.The next experience was the students canteen queue to get to breakfast! Never seen anything like this. We gave up after ten minutes and went somewhere else outside the property. When we asked what time is a good time to go for breakfast without having to stand there for ages we were told "6am"... hum.... seriously???? Is that what they expect guests to do? We are on holiday. Finally, the cherry on the cake. Despite getting to the pool at 7.30 am all sun beds (but two) were "occupied"... apparently the hotel is busy, so what do they expect guests to do? Sit on the floor? Usual story with the few, emphasis on few, sun beds at the beach. All booked and for a charge and squashed together in 10sqm! I thought I had booked a hotel on one of the most beautiful and famous stretch of beach in the world and we were left we having to make the most of our first day of relaxation by looking for a decent place to relax without using any of the amenities supposedly on offer in this kind of property.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Check in made easy by Haley as the twin bed room we asked for was not allocated to us. Haley sorted it wthout any problem. The room we were allocated was in the historic part of the hotel and was excellent. Haley did inform us that there may be some noise as it is on the city side. This did not prepare us however for the amount of noise generated by traffic, pedestrians and street musicians performing till after 0100. I'm sure that secondary double glazing would work wonders and not spoil the aesthetic exterion appearance of the hotel. A special mention too for the room cleaners who were superb. Our room was always immaculate after their visit.
