Breakfast buffet was in my opinion quite expensive at $85 including tax but I suppose eating it 2 yards from the beach and 20 yards fromthe surf offset it a little bit.The resort tax of $30 per day was a little hard to stomach when Haley informed me but part of it gives you free phone calls anytime to anywhere was a godsend as I have sick parents back home inthe UK.Overall i would reccomend this hotel but would rate it even higher if the noise issue could be sorted out. It is in my opinion the best situated hotel in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: This is an excellent hotel! The staff was very accommodating to the needs of our family. They went above and beyond to ensure our stay was the best that it could be. The rooms are spacious and have a decent sized balcony with furniture to enjoy the views. The hotel is conveniently located on the main strip, so it's close to food and shopping. If you get a chance, rent an umbrella and chairs and relax on the beach. You won't regret it!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Historic property , in a great ( busy) beach and street location. Tower rooms with Diamond head view are good size and have balcony's - location close to beach preferred . Higher isn't always better particularly when at least one elevator wasn't working . We were on the 5th floor - great view of pool/beach and ocean and allowed us to walk down to the 3rd floor and take the escalators to the lobby ( or walk up) thus avoiding the congestion around lobby elevators.Beach restaurant food was good ( flatbread pizza excellent) - service was terrific and beer /wine cold. There are not a lot of pool side lounge chairs and all beach chairs must be reserved/purchased. So spent considerably more on chairs and a couple splurge days on a cabana . Note chair/cabana staff are outstanding. Overall a fine property and the location and demand allows for top pricing just don't expect the Ritz/4 Seasons etc

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Wonderful place to stay for any occasion. Stayed in peak season and still very comfortable and spacious. Lovely, clean room with great amenities and comfortable bed. Friendly helpful staff throughout resort. Will stay at this beautiful hotel again. Elegant and classic beauty!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Spent 3 nights here with husband and two teen-aged daughters. Paid extra for a room in the tower with a view/balcony. Totally worth it. Envision the evenings, looking out at the beach, with pool below, and live music (think Jack Johnson or Hawaii Five O theme) drifting up to your room. Or mornings, watching the sun shimmer on the water. Pure heaven! There is this amazing Banyan tree right in the middle of the courtyard, and you can sit by it for breakfast, lunch, or dinner (and my 12 year old ate for free at the hotel). At night it is lit with purple lights--just incredible. They have a large front porch, and a back porch that they have placed rocking chairs on, and you can sit and listen to the sound of the surf, or the band. The place is very old school Hawaii, decked in white, with hardwood floors inside and flagstone outside. The room was nice, but other than sitting on the balcony at night, we weren't in it much. As far as anything on the negative side, the pool is small (it is an old hotel) and the beach is crowded (it is Waikiki so not sure what else you'd expect). Treat yourself to an outrigger ride ($20 per person) as this was so much fun (not scary at all, just pure fun paddling out and riding the waves in...) We will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: We recently stayed for one week at the Moana. We are a family of five, so we booked two rooms. The Moana is a Westin property, so I had originally booked it because Westin's are always pretty good. But some of the 1-star reviews made me really concerned and added stress before our trip. This review will, hopefully, go a long way towards reducing stress for other travelers. Room Size: The rooms are not super spacious but they are not small. Same with bathrooms. Beds: Very comfortable; we all slept very well.Food: There are two main restaurants - the beach bar and the Veranda. As you would expect, the food is not inexpensive. But it was good. There is a "beach club" which is really what frequent travelers like me think of as the lounge. The club is gorgeous, with expansive ocean views and steps from the beach. So you can keep going to the beach, come in for refreshments, go back .. just perfect. If you have SPG Platinum status, lounge access is free, otherwise it is $62.5/day for four people, $30 for every additional person. We had to pay $30/day for the fifth person. For us, the lounge was good value but each group will have to make its own decision. They have a good breakfast (scrambled eggs, breads and croissants, fresh cut fruit, miso soup, oatmeal, and sides - on weekend days they have either pancakes or waffles or french toast also added); snacks during the day are salted nuts and fresh popped corn. Evenings they offer one dish (either dumplings, fried rice, pasta, etc.), a good salad bar, steamed edamames. It is good enough for a quick dinner if you've had a long day and don't want to spend time waiting for service in the restaurants (which is slow, not very slow, but slow).Service: In recent years, I have become very pessimistic about service from US businesses - hotels, airlines, etc. Training is poor, staff are inexperienced - all likely a function of the focus on cost, cost, and cost. Against those declining expectations, service at the Moana was very good except for a couple of minor exceptions. For example, we had a minor maintenance issue. I called, waited 30 minutes, then had to call again to tell them we had some urgency. Once I explained the urgency, the guy was there in minutes. But the first round of communication was less than satisfactory. Check-in: Our check-in experience was very pleasant both in terms of the time it took and the interaction at the counter. Small nit: I have SPG Platinum status but I did not get an upgrade. The representative (a woman) said that they did not have an upgrade to offer until three days into the trip. I said fine, please put us on for the upgrade starting on the fourth day. She promised she would and that they would call us on the third day. No call. This is typical of US service business in recent years and probably a reflection of both evolving culture and corporate practice - no follow through, no training. Again, though, we had excellent rooms with partial but gorgeous ocean views. So I am not complaining about the rooms, only about the lack of follow through. I also suspect that they only offer upgrades to folks who stay 2-3 nights; they don't want to lock up the pricier rooms even for Platinums for longer. Perhaps consistent with mercenary corporate culture at today's "service" businesses. But be aware that almost every other time I walked by the check-in desk, the lines were at least 20-30 minutes long. Even at the elite check-in. One day I had to go get replacement keys because one of our keys was not working. There were two people ahead of me in the elite lane. It took over half an hour. I also experienced an uncomfortable event - one of the hotel personnel came out to with glasses of water to offer to the folks in the Platinum line. She offered the water to the couple in front of me and then to the folks behind me, and then offered it to me after the folks behind me declined. I did not need the water but the fact that the folks ahead of and behind me were white, and I was not white gave me a fleetingly uncomfortable sense. Having mentioned that, I feel compelled to say that every other interaction was extremely pleasant and we did not feel discriminated in any way at all. Location: Perfect; short drives to Diamond Head (you could even hike all the way to the top from the hotel), Manoa Falls, and Hanauma Bay. Busy shopping district. If you don't have beach/water ready shoes, go to the Crocs across and buy a pair on your first day. You won't regret spending the money - whether it is $20 or $80.Aloha Beach Service: One of our daughters took a surfing lesson. It was great and we bought the CD with the photos/videos. Not cheap, but the service was good. Don't rent beach floaties at $5/day. Like my enterprise spouse did, go across the street to the ABC store and buy the floaties for $4 + $1 for pumping air in them. Days 2 and beyond are free :-D. Plus you can pack them and bring them back home for use in your own pool or local aqua recreation area.Local restaurant tip: Waiting time can be hours (literally) at every place within walking distance, so call ahead and book a table well in advance. Other tips: Free group hula lessons (hour long) in the Royal Hawaiian area (excellent garden, by the way) every day. Check the schedule. For snorkeling, we did both Hanauma and Pupukea (75 minute drive to the North Shore). If you don't have time, you can safely skip Pupukea. As far as I could tell, the main advantage is the opportunity to see sea turtles. Other than that it is a much less enjoyable experience because it is rock, the rocks are slippery, access is harder, etc. etc.Moana has its own small strip of the Waikiki beach front. Enjoy it. It's great. What can the Moana do to improve its service: The resort fee feels like a complete scam, at least for elites. As a platinum guest, I already get free premium internet. The fee gets us nothing else. So why isn't it waived for Platinum elites? I have been a loyal elite for years and years. We also paid for two rooms for five people (including three children) without even trying to ask for a fifth person to be accommodated in our room. Still, the check-in representative did not offer to waive the $30 beach club fee for the fifth person. Granted, I did not ask. Many of us do not like asking, but we do notice when it is not offered. You are in the hospitality business. There is very little you can do to make us feel special. The fact that the hotel is in a great location is something we pay for, so that is not part of the "extra mile." $30/day is not a big deal but a small gesture like that would have left me feeling like posting a glowing review for the Moana. As it stands my summary is it is an excellent hotel, in a great location, with good service - definitely not exceptional service (I mean the hotel service staff actually ask you to hold the lift, come in with a huge cart while asking if it is OK, and request you to press the floor button for them :-D ... that is probably the one star between a four star and a five star).

hotel_name: Moana Surfrider, A Westin Resort & Spa, Waikiki Beach
review_body: Perfect location and excellent service starting with Michael, who checked us in. I absolutely loved our room in the new tower section and the awesome view of the beach. I would not hesitate to return here as the location cannot be beat and the hotel is kept immaculate. They provide an iron, ironing board, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, body lotion and soap so no need to carry those items. The best thing in the room was the electric dual purpose toilet/bidet with remote. Beds were very comfortable. They only clean the rooms once a day. There is ho turn down service.Waikiki is quite expensive but we pre-booked meals and tour packages in advance so we were extremely happy we did so.I highly recommend this resort.
